name: La Relève
description:
A board game in the world of the webserie "The Visitor from the future".

The players must find a way to save the Earth from future cataclysms.

They begin by using cards to built and modify the future. Each player must complete his own story by playing cards from his hand on his own board : locations, characters, events, consequences... These cards are drawn each turn but can also be traded or bought to other players using "batteries" - the currency that can be earned each turn on dice rolls.

Then, the first player to have a finished story with enough victory points wins and tells the whole story to others in an improvisation tour-de-force.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Acting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling

name: Tic Tac Toe Attack
description:
Tic Tac Toe Attack is yet another take on the traditional game.

Each player set aside a deck of 25 cards, containing two sets of number cards running from 1 to 12, plus a wild card (Each player plays with a different set, so the total number of cards in the box is 50). At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt a hand of six cards. Each player now takes turns, playing one card on the 3x3 grid on the table and replenishing back to six. The crucial thing is that you can play your card on top of your opponent's card on the grid as long as the number on your card is higher than the existing number on grid. The Wild card counts as the highest number when you play, the lowest when it is already on the table.

Whenever you make a three in a row with your played cards, you score 1. Anyone who scores 5 first wins the game.

name: Runicards: Dungeons – Os desafios do Deserto
description:
Runicards: Dungeons - Os desafios do Deserto (RDDD) is a board game of action, strategy and adventure that takes place in the same universe cardgame "Runicards: Batalha pela Terra do Fogo" (RBTF). New players do not need the original game to play, but veteran players will feel at ease with this new game.

This is a cooperative game, initially for 1-4 participants. This means that you and your friends are not trying to defeat one another, but will together meet the challenges of the board and try to win in each match group. Each player chooses a hero and every monster defeated and disarmed trap all earn points that can be used to enhance the powers of their characters. Also, you can find treasures to equip your hero with armor, weapons and magic accessories.

name: Dangan Ronpa Chou Koukyuu No Jinrou Maniax
description:
This is an expansion pack to Dangan Ronpa Chou Koukyuu No Jinrou aka Dangan Ronpa Super High School Werewolf.
This card adds 30 new cards to the base set. And it includes new characters with better powers from the feedback of players and also new item cards that creates vital clues to solve the mystery when playing and also to make the game more exciting.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Remember Memino
description: The goal of the Game is to add different coloured cards to rows on the table. You get points for every card placed during your turn. The game ends when one player places all his cards or no cards are left in the pool.

name: Shopping Queen
description:
Shop till you're top! Shopping Queen is a game based on the successful television show on the German TV channel VOX that features a group of girls, €500, and four hours of time for the perfect outfit!

In the game, the women go up and down the shopping mall from one store to the next in a pink shopping mobile. The time is running out, and only if the "candidates" answer the questions about the fashion world correctly and excel at various actions will the shop doors open.

Whoever thinks she has found the right style may enter the catwalk where each promising shopping queen has to face the judgment of the other players. Star designer Guido Maria Kretschmer also plays an important role in the game.

name: Army of Shadows
description:
This game depicts, in a very abstract way, the essence of insurgent warfare. The game is for two players, the State (representing the existing government or leadership of a country or organization) and the Insurgent (representing the opposition to that government or leadership). The State has powerful forces but little information; the Insurgent has complete information but little actual power. Whichever side overcomes its disadvantage wins (the State by gaining information on the Insurgents and killing them; the Insurgents by penetrating to the centre of State power).

The Insurgent wins by capturing the Capital. This is accomplished by having, at the end of any his player-turns, Insurgent pieces occupying either four connected spaces in the Inner Circle (that is, there are at least four Insurgent-occupied spaces in the Inner Circle that also share a border with one or two other Insurgent-occupied spaces in the Inner Circle), or occupying any six of the twelve spaces of the Inner Circle.

The State player wins by killing 12 Insurgent pieces (so making an Insurgent victory impossible).

Originally designed in 2011 for an online game site, from an idea by Michael Freeman.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order

name: The Edge
description:
The Edge is a skirmish scaled 35 mm wargame set in the post-apocalyptic world with medieval and steampunk aesthetic influences. It’s mechanic combines the traditional wargame approach and solutions from mana-based card games.

In a world destroyed by cataclysmic Judgement Day that left behind not only havoc and desolation, but also beneficial crystals and mysterious portals, remnants of humanity are unified under the authoritative rule of The Chapter, the priesthood of The One, a god of technology, defending humanity against Demons, conquerors of whole worlds, which one day came out of the portals. In the bloody war that followed, from the dead human bodies, broken machine parts and power of the crystals new entity was born by ominous and barely understood method – The Faceless, beings deprived of autonomic consciousness and emotions, devouring both metal and flesh, through which implementations every creature evolves on its own.

The humanity found a way to use the scattered crystals to create and empower mechanical blessings of The One, but the Demons have their own reasons to gather them and even The Faceless have their purpose to seek the crystals, as the power that dwells in them is fueling the hulks of their physical forms.

name: Triba Nation
description:
Triba Nation is a turn based card game where each player is required to construct a total of five buildings, with the palace as the final building. The first player who builds the palace is recognised as the king and wins the game.

Players start the game with 3 Tribesmen cards. A shared Building Option line of 4 Building cards and a Palace card is setup in the middle of the play area.
Each round then consists 4 phases:

Phase 1 (Draw) - The player draws 2 Tribesmen cards.
Phase 2 (Tribesmen) - The player gets to play Tribesmen cards. A max of 5 Tribesmen can be in the player's area. Players can also swap out Tribesmen during this phase (discarding the one they replaced). Tribesmen are required to build buildings and also activate Attack/Magic cards.
Phase 3 (Construction) - Players can build one Building from the Building Option line if their Tribesmen colors match the Building's requirements. Building special abilities also take place during this phase.
Phase 4 (Action) - Players can play any Attack or Magic cards in hand if they have more Warrior(Attack) or Shaman(Magic) cards than their target. These allow the player to destroy, steal from and generally muck with the targeted opponent.


At the end of the 4th phase, the player trims his hand down to 5 cards and play continues with the next player. The players try to build 4 building and 1 palace (which must be built last). The first player to build the palace wins.

name: Der Grüffelo: Das große Schattenspiel
description:
Der Grüffelo: Das große Schattenspiel is a cooperative game for 2-4 players, ages 5 and up. The game box is turned into a small shadow theater, where silhouettes are shown in the theater before each turn. Each player is going to be the "Shadow Master", who mustn't take part in the guessing then, however. The shadows have to be discovered (colored and lovingly illustrated) as quickly as possible on the board. Who discovered the correct one of the 48 different shades scenes will be rewarded with a nut and may continue to move the team to to the next space on the forest path field. If the guess was incorrect, it costs a nut-chip and the team stone also is not being moved.

You can only win together when the team reaches the finish. In addition, the player with the most nut chips is then also the team winner. The team can just as well lose together, because we know that the Gruffalo is sometimes a pretty bad guy, which is not to be trusted so completely. Therefore, there are also shadows in the game for which there is - how mean! - no matching scene on the board. As it is, be extra careful then and be not deceived by the Gruffalo. If the Gruffalo card was four times in the game, unfortunately, the whole team has lost.

name: A Game for Good Christians: Wisdom Decks
description:
The Wisdom Books Expansion Deck (with content taken from the books of Job, Psalms, Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, and Songs of Solomon) with sage words like:
You: an arrow from your father’s quiver (Psalm 127:4-5)
A virtuous woman as defined by old Jewish men (Proverbs 31)
Going down to the nut orchard (Song of Solomon 6:11)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Religious

name: B-Daman Crossfire Surge Strike Arena
description:
From the publisher’s website:

Ready...Aim...Crossfire! Can you handle your next mission in the Surge Strike Arena? Blast away with your B-Daman figure (figures sold separately) and try to lock three or more bars in the arena before your opponent does. Do you have what it takes for precision target blasting? Find out with the Surge Strike Arena. Surge Strike Arena includes a centerpiece with five Surge Strike bars. Fire at the centerpiece and lock 3 bars before your opponent does. Includes unassembled arena, 6 B-DA Marbles, collector card, label sheet, and instructions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Mitaines
description:
Mitaines is a French Canadian game: the French word 'mitaines' means mittens. The game is also known in English as Mitts. Cards are played to a common discard pile, which can be captured by matching its top card or playing a jack. Points are scored for sets of two or more equal ranked cards played to the common discard pile: two equal cards are a mitaine (mitten), three cards are a gant (glove), and four cards are a chausson (sock).

Each turn, a player plays one card to the discard pile. If he plays a Jack or a card matching the top card of the discard pile, he captures the pile, which may be worth points, if it contains the ten of diamonds.

Alternatively, a player may call a mitten, glove or sock. If he does so, he plays the first card of his combination. The next card is played on his next turn, etc. When he completes his combination, he scores points for that combination. When a combination has been called, the discard pile cannot be cleared. However, other players can steal the combination by calling a higher combination (which is either a larger combination or a combination with higher cards). If such a player completes their combination, they score both their own combination and any combinations they have stolen.

Multiple hands are played until a player (or team) reaches 500 points; that player (or team) wins the game.

name: テン呼！ (Ten Calls!)
description:
In テン呼！ (Ten Calls!), players want to empty their hands as quickly as possible, but they may not be able to play cards when they want to.

The deck consists of cards numbered 1-6 (bearing point values of -6 to -1) and a joker valued 1-6 (worth -18 points). Each player starts with ten cards in hand. The starting player chooses a single card from hand and plays it to the table. The next player must play one or more cards that sum to the next number in sequence. (For example, if the first player laid down a 4, the next player must play a 5, a 4 and 1, etc.) If a player can't play, they must draw from the deck and the the next player in clockwise order is obliged to play the required number.

When a player empties their hand, the round ends and everyone scores negative points equal to their cards still in hand. (One restriction: A player cannot lay down jokers as part of their final play.)

name: The Forest: The Manticore Legend
description:
The merciless battle between Powers of Light and Darkness started in the old times. Powers of darkness retreated, but it was just a temporary respite.

Be prepared for the full battle with the Manticore! Investigate the forest and construct roads to the magical armor and amulets. Monsters – servants of darkness – will hinder you. Time is limited: as soon as magical fetters are off, the monster will start his fire path to the Castle in order to become the Absolute Lord of the Forest. Don’t waste a minute: find the artifacts that are the only chance for a victory.

Two variants of the game: team-play against the Manticore (against the system) where the team either together wins or loose; and individual game face-to-face with the Monster.

The legend returns!

ESSENCE OF THE GAME:

Players begin their journey in the Forest world of the City which is soon to undergo an invasion of the awakened Manticore. At first the players should find their way into the abandoned workshops and places of power around the City – where they will be able to acquire weapons and artifacts that enhance certain characteristics of the hero. Pathfinding is carried out with laying on the board of tiles depicting the road. Each of the players paves the way for their own, but can also use the road paved by other players. Some tiles contain a monster - if a player has laid out such tile, then a monster token is placed. Player may try to circumvent a monster, but may also fight him.

After all the tiles are exhausted, the Manticore awakens and begins moving in the direction of the City. If the Manticore reaches the City - all the players loose the game, so the task of the Players is to defeat the Manticore before her arrival in the City.

Battle with monsters and with the Manticore is made with a die roll. However, in addition, there are also random battle cards that determine what type of attack (magic, melee, shooting) is used in this round of the fight (see ‘Conducting a fight’). Card is opened blindly, and can bring a pleasant surprise (attack with the most developed hero’s skill) or not pleasant. This encourages players to improve different abilities of their heroes.
AWARDS
Winner of the "Baby Expo Ukraine 2018" (best strategy game)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building

name: Italian Job
description:
Why working when others can do it for you?!?

Survive to you Boss’ fits of rages, inventing all kinds of bullshit your mind can conceive, just to convince the token boss to do the arduous job to another of the poor players at the table!
The aim of each worker will be to make their colleagues do what he should , taking a cue from what is written on the cards!
Players must survive to a bloody working day or a task that NO ONE wants to accept!
Cheat on your boss, by taking the commitment to do it and then leave it someone else!
Threaten your colleague, lest he appoints you as his substitute to do the tedious task!
Have a great time with your imagination pretending to be engage in other tasks with the events described on the cards in your hand!
Put off, put off, put off work! Sooner or later someone else will do it!
With the ability to play a different kind of "Boss" at each game (a politician, a gangster boss, an owner of a company, etc.), as well as to make this role interpret to more players during a single game, each session of Italian Job will be different from the previous one!!!
AIM:
Depending on the number of players, wins the player (or players) who has less Hassles when the second player is out. Once reached the third Hassle, a player is out. Whenever a player will receive a Hassle, he will become the Boss. When the first player is out, he will play the role of Boss until the end of the game (that is until second player will be out)

name: Monopoly: Servcorp
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Servcorp, a multinational organisation that sells serviced office space, virtual office products and IT services.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Seikkailu vuorilla
description:
From the publisher:

"Sniff has gotten into a trouble on the Lonely Mountains. He is stranded on a cliff after all the bridges have collapsed after him. Each player has to find 5 bridge steps among the tokens to build his or her own hanging bridge, and get over the gorge to help Sniff. A lot can happen on the way: one might get caught by the officious Constable, who wants to know who stepped on Hemulen's flowers, bridge steps might fall from a backpack, and the nimble Nibling eats them at once. Luckily Too-Ticky is enjoying the sunny day and if one is lucky he or she might get a lift from Too-Ticky on her hot air balloon. There are also some shortcuts along the way, but it takes a bit of luck to find them. The winner is the player who first completes his hanging bridge and gets to Sniff's rescue."

Seikkailu vuorilla ("Adventure in the Mountains") is a Moomin-themed roll-and-move game for 2-4 players.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Trivial Pursuit: Pop Culture – Quiz Night
description:
It's popular culture- in a box!
Trivial Pursuit Popular Culture Quiz Night edition is all about entertainment, gossip and trends of modern times. The all-new question cards include NZ popular culture and cover everything from sporting heroes to fashion icons and mainstream media.
publishers: Hasbro, Horn Abbot International, Parker Brothers

name: Freaky Becky
description: Freaky Becky is a drop dead fashion girl who has fallen apart! Players must put her back together before time runs out! Freaky Becky rotates on her base while players attempt to place her 13 body parts and accessories. When all of Becky’s parts have been placed, the player hits the “stop” button on the base to stop the rotation and the player WINS. If time runs out BEFORE player has finished, Becky will spin quickly and throw off all the pieces that have been placed, and player LOSES.

name: Scheffeln: Mafia Expansion
description: Additional black car that was exclusively given to those who backend the game through Spieleschmiede. The black car Moves when a player exchanges his character. If it is on top, it takes money and gives it to the player who received the lowest money token.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Transportation

name: Wieso? Weshalb? Warum? Unsere Welt: Das pfiffige Wissensspiel
description:
Why are bananas curved? Do children live in the desert ? Who lives in an igloo? With knowledge, luck and a good memory you collect the most chips. By the way you will learn interesting facts about our world.

To play the game, 30 image tokens need to be assign to the correct one of the 5 theme tables, with each player revealing two tokens on his turn and chosing one. If you manage to place your tokens on the marked spots, you earn victory points.

name: Jenga: Transformers – Rise of the Fallen
description:
From Publisher:

Are you ready for a new twist on Jenga? Bring home the classic game of falling bricks coupled with elements from the blockbuster Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen movie. For ages 6 and up, this family game for two or more players allows you to take control of Cybertron-- or family game night-- with your robot-like brick-removal skill. The tiles feature Autobot or Decepticon faction logos and are made from a tasteful, black material. Build and battle with the Transformers Revenge of the Fallen Jenga Battle Game!

How to Play:

Divide up into two teams Autobots and Decepticons. The Decepticons go first. Teams alternate turns, rotating so that each player gets chance to play.

on you turn, remove one block. Then see if the block shows a symbol:

if it does not show your TEAM´s symbol, stack the block on top of the tower
if it shows your TEAM´s symbol, pass it to a player of your choice on the other team. this player must stack the block before the team takes its turn.


Winning:

If the tower falls over on your team´s turn, your TEAM LOSES. The other TEAM WIN!.

name: The King's Armory: Rhette the Pirate
description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: I Know an Old Woman
description:
In this game, based on the children's song about the old woman who swallowed a fly, players choose from a selection of creatures, each trying to catch the one selected by the other player. Whoever catches the most of the opponent's creatures, or plays the most that don't get caught, will be the winner.

The game is played with two mini-decks of nine cards, one for each player. Each deck contains cards representing creatures from the song: the horse, cow, goat, dog, cat, bird, spider, fly, and the old woman herself.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: RINPA
description:
You are picture dealer of Japanese painting. You are being repaired the folding screen painting in cooperation with other picture dealer.
However, if it is possible to be repaired ahead of others, the painting can help you get.
Let's become a famous picture dealer by collecting more of the folding screen painting.

Rinpa is Rinpa theme of Japanese painting. And, it is a trick-taking game of the set collection.



Summary of How to play
Players, will do the trick-take by mast follow. All cards of trick-take have been used and arranged all in the center.
Cards, have been set for each 2 to 6 sheets - each set is folding screen picture - .
The player who draws one of the last in each set, gets its set.
Player to get the set is not a winner of each trick take. be careful!
To play all of the hand, The winner is player to get the most of the cards!

name: Kust Ma Seda Kuulsin?
description:
The objective of Kust Ma Seda Kuulsin? ("Where did I hear it?") is to guess the quote: which movie, song, novel etc. is it.
Player who guesses correctly moves forward on the game board.
Who finishes first is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Star Master
description:
Memory game played with dice.
Studied to be able to help the Alzheimer patients.

Content :
1 game board -9 coloured cubes -2 dice -54 coloured pegs (6 of each colour).

Object of the game :
Memorize the placement of nine coloured cubes, and after turning them face down, retrieve them. The winner is the first to get 6 coloured pegs in his scoring row.

Beginning of the game :
Place the nine cubes colour side up. You have one minutes to memorize each one’s location before turning them face down. The youngest player starts by rolling both dice, then play continue clockwise.

Rules of play :
The white die indicates the colour the player has to find, if it shows a star the player may choose the colour to find. He then turn over one of the cubes.

-If it is the right colour, the player puts one peg of the same colour in his scoring row, he then put back the cube but switching its location with another cube and without looking at the colour of the other cube. Then he gives the dice to the player to his left.

-If its not the right colour, he simply put the cube back in place and gives the dices to the player to his left.

Play continue until one plyer has filled the six spaces in his score row.

The black die :
If ithe black die shows a star and the white die shows a colour, all players may look for the corresponding cube. The fastest player to put his finger on a cube then turn it face up, if it is the right colour, he wins a coloured peg and play continues as normal. If it is not the right colour he loses a peg of that colour if he has one in his score raw, and play resumes as normal.

If a player wins a peg of a colour that is no longer available he may steal if from one of the other players scoring row.


The black die is not recommended when playing with children under the age of 7.

name: Tippeligaspillet
description:
You are manager for a norwegian top leage footballclub and traying to win the league, by playing matches and buy players.

Dice game, full of luck. You win matches by throwing dice against the game or the other player, the winner get money to buy players, the more value you're squad have, the lower dice you need to win the an football match an get money for new players.

The player who win the most matches wins the league and are the champion of the tippeliga.

name: Hjärnkoll
description:
A Swedish board game based on the popular long-running science TV show for children called Hjärnkontoret ("brain office").
You throw the dice and move around the outer ring of the board. The space you land on decide what kind of question you will get. The questions are about science, biology, physics and common knowledge, but there are also riddles. If you get the answer right you get pieces of paper that look like money, but they actually represent different amount of brain cells.
When you have enough brain cells you get to enter the paths that go into the middle of the board. On those paths you continue to get questions, but you also get to do challenges. The challenges are things you do with your body, for example you could get a card that says you have 30 seconds to try and wiggle your ears using only the muscles in your head. When you successfully do a challenge you get a star.
When you have gathered 3 stars you are allowed to try and reach the very center of the board. The first one to get there (with the right amount of brain cells AND stars) wins the game.
As a reward the winner of the game gets to perform an experiment from the experiment folder. As an example, the experiment can be to charge a comb with static electricity and then hold it agains a stream of water and see what happens.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Mortal Kombat: The Miniatures Game
description: Mortal Kombat X: The Miniatures Game is a tabletop miniatures combat game based on the popular fighting genre. The game features vs. modes (PVP) as well Boss modes. It can be played on its own, or characters from this game can face off against those in the Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game as both games use the same "Universal Tactics System," specifically developed to integrate multiple fighting worlds.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Great Glass Elevator
description:
From the box:
Crash! With the most tremendous noise of splintering wood and broken tiles Mr Willie Wonka's Great Glass Elevator has just torn through the roof of his Chocolate Factory! Through the glass elevator floor, charlie can see all the doors to all the rooms...but they are mixed up! Which room is which? Each of your cards shows three lift buttons that lead to different rooms. Race around the factory, opening and closing doors as you go. And see if you can find the rooms in the order shown on your cards! The more buttons you can match, the further you'll go!

Match your card to all the rooms in Wonka's Chocolate Factory to win!
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Find My Piglet!
description:
From the publisher:

Will every cub, pup or kitten find its parent? From seals to seahorses and camels to pandas, all kinds of happy animal families feature in this memory game, in which players reunite animal mothers and fathers with their babies.

Find My Piglet! makes learning fun, adding an educational element to the traditional memory game as players learn the names of animals and their offspring.

Containing 63 beautifully illustrated cards and a colourful poster that shows all the animals posing happily together.

name: Alphabet Woods
description:
From the publisher:

Build trees and collect forest animals by taking turns adding letter cards in alphabetical order. The letters don't have to be one after the other, as long as they are alphabetized. Every time you add a card you collect a forest animal. If you are good at alphabetizing you can even add branches to connect the trees. Once there is a tree seven letters tall you get to add the tree top. Once all the animals are collected the player with the most wins!

name: Soccer Nutz Dice Futball
description:
Soccer Nutz Dice Futball is a realistic fast-paced, simulation game played using dice and charts. Pro player's offensive and defensive abilities directly impact the action on each & every roll of the dice. Play head to head or solitaire and coach your favorite team to victory by maximizing your team's strengths while exploiting your opponent's weaknesses.
Soccer Nutz features everything that makes the "Beautiful Game" beautiful! Amazing crosses, incredible headers, unbelievable saves. Perfectly executed free kicks, corner kicks & goal kicks. Fouls, yellow cards, red cards and penalty kicks. Dribbling, breakaways, rebounds, offensive & defensive strategy...it's all in here!

name: Thrice Nice Mice
description: Thrice Nice Mice is a ten-card microgame in which players try to find a row of Three hidden mice in order to score points.

name: Greek Cinema Quiz
description: This is a quiz game regarding the Greek cinema. With this game you share beautiful moments with your friends by putting in test your memory and knowledge about famous greek old and modern movies. The game components: Board, 6 pawns, 484 cards, a die and the rules

name: Avalanche at Yeti Mountain: Inventions
description: A set of 15 invention cards players can use once during the game to perform an ability.

name: Urfin Jus
description:
A tower defense board game.

Urfin Jus is a children's brain-training game. You take command of the defenses of the Emerald City, which is being attacked on all sides by wooden soldiers. Your goal is to build special defensive towers that fire at various parts of the map according to certain rules. Each turn all the players reach into a bag full of tower parts, find the pieces of the structures they need by feel, and decide where to put the towers they construct. The wooden soldiers then take several steps.

Urfin Jus is an way to teach logical reasoning, develop motor skills (you try finding the right part in the bag!), and is just plain fun.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Set Collection

name: Kill Game
description:
This game is a chinese version of Mafia / Werewolf.

There are a judge and 8~16 players in this game.
The players consist of Civilians, Killers and Policemen.
The number of Policemen and Killers depends on the total number of players.
8~10 players: 2 Policemen and 2 Killers.
11~14 players: 3 Policemen and 3 Killers.
15~16 players: 4 Policemen and 4 Killers.

Game Goal Policemen: find out Killers and lead Civilians to vote Killers out of the game. Killers: find the Policemen and kill them when it's getting dark. Civilians: help Policemen to vote Killers out of the game. Never ever help Killers on purpose in the game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Rebels Unite!
description:
The nation is in a state of civil war: a secret group of rebels are growing fast in numbers and are determined to overthrow the government and start a revolution. Police forces are tasked to go undercover and identify the rebel leaders, before they have time to gather too many followers in the population.
Rebels Unite! is a party game for 8 to 20+ players, in which you play as a policeman, a rebel leader, or a civilian. Police officers have to arrest the rebel leaders, civilians try to help them in their task, unless they are turned into rebels themselves by a rebel leader. Rebel leaders have to turn as many civilians into rebels as possible without getting caught, and with their help overthrow the corrupt government and start a rebellion!

Rebels Unite! is a game of deception and hidden information. At the beginning of the game each player is given an identity that is unknown to everyone else. Players will try to convince each other that they are staying true to the government, but in the meantime a rebellion is growing behind the scenes. During the game, players will be able to find out and guess each other’s identities, so it will be harder and harder to get away with lying and playing both sides of the conflict.
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Weapons of the Hill
description: Just when you think you’ve got it all figured out, we throw a monkey wrench into the mix with this awesome expansion for either Queen of the Hill or Little Monsters! Replace existing cards with all-new weapon cards that totally change the meta of the game for veterans of the base set. This expansion features 8 uniquely delicious weapons created from actual legends! What would Excalibur look like if it was a gun? What would Thor’s hammer feel like if it was shaped like a ranged throwing projectile, or even the ultimate golden cudgel of the Monkey God turning into an orbital satellite cannon? Yes, that is how creative this expansion takes it.

name: Cats Abiding Horribly: Episode II – A New Low (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description: A Third party expansion to Cards against humanity
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: My Little Pony Poppin' Pinkie Pie Game
description: This game consists of a cake in which Pinkie Pie is hidden inside. Around the cake there are 12 little holes in which children will take turns decorating the cake with the 12 plastic balloons included in the game. If Pinkie Pie pony pops out on a player's turn, they win! Pinkie Pie pops out randomly.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Vauhtia ja vipinää
description:
Throw dice and go from water lily leaf to another and a frog shows how the body whirl. Stretching, balancing, jumping and various dynamic conditions are important for the development of the growing child.

Spinner surprise by accelerating or slowing down the going onwards on leaves.

Include: 18 track tiles, die, spinner and four frogs pawns.

name: Midori no Sabaku
description: In this tile-based board game, you are tasked with bringing life back to the countryside. Cut down trees to clear pathways through the forest, plant trees to entice animals back, and strike a balance between humanity and nature.
publishers: Product Arts LLC, イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)

name: Alice in Wonderland: A Curious Collection of Puzzles
description:
A trivia game where players earn points by answering themed questions on their turn.

On their turn a player picks a card from one of four difficulty piles. Scoring points for the difficulty of the card if they answer correctly. Play continues until a player accumulates an agreed upon number of points.

Each player has an "Eat Me" and "Drink Me" card which they may play to alter the score of a given card in accordance to the instructions on the "Eat Me"/"Drink Me" card.

name: Thailand (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also choice cards which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in the choice pack.

The 9 bonuses give you extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Chat Graf (チャットグラーフ)
description:
User summary
チャットグラーフ (Chat Graf) is a trick-taking game where players use the the art of conversation in response to the strange official declarations of the king, in order to split the rewards between themselves. A single card contains two numbers with two numerical values. Use the different numerical values for two consecutive tricks.

The game has Japanese rules in the box, but English and Taiwanese rules are available online.

※ The game includes no actual elements of communication. The “art of conversation” should be interpreted as the overall flavor of the game.

Publisher's summary
Chat Graf（チャットグラーフ）は王様の出したヘンなオフレにより、褒賞を話術で分け合うトリックテイキングゲームです。
一枚のカードの中に二つ数字があり数値が２つあり、それぞれの数値を使用し連続した２回のトリックを行います。

※コミュニケーション要素はありません。“話術で”はフレーバーです。
publishers: 758 Board Game Circle (758ボードゲーム会)

name: Chwedlau ac Arwyr Cymru
description:
Chwedlau Cymru / Legends of Wales is a card game featuring creatures and monsters from Welsh mythology such as the Twrch Trwyth or the Red Dragon itself. Each of the cards features a different creature along with a value attribute (up to 10) and a set of attribute scores: Strength, Skill, Magic and Fear, as well as a "size" attribute that can either be small, medium (i.e. man sized) or large.

On its simplest level, it can be played as a deck of Top Trumps cards for 2-4 players. The set however also comes with rules for playing a slightly more complex 2-player card game.

In this version of the game, players take it in turns to draft a hand of 5 cards from the deck, with a maximum total value of 30. Both players will be able to see which cards their opponent is drafting. The undrafted cards form a draw deck. One of the four main values is then drawn at random by drawing the top card of the deck a, and the players decide on an order for their cards; this order cannot then be changed. The cards will then face off against their opponents in order, comparing the values drawn. The players thus need to try and second-guess which cards they think their opponent will place in which order.

This initial first round is won by the player who won the most of the five faceoffs between the cards. The "defeated" cards are discarded and replacements are drawn randomly from the deck (back up to five cards) for the next round. The game is decided by a best-of-three of the three rounds.

This initial set focuses on monsters and creatures. The publisher claims that more game modes will be added with future card sets / expansions, which may feature more individual characters.

The most distinctive feature of the game is the unique artwork by cartoonist/designer Huw Aaron. The initial print run featured separate Welsh-language and English-language sets.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Fische Versenken
description:
Fische Versenken is a card based reaction game about helping fish to escape form the glass into the ocean.

Depending on the task determined by a card, players have to combine two cards (with holes in them) in a way that you can see a fish through the hole, or that the holes in both cards are in the same position.

The fastes player to fulfill this tasks shouts "Fisch Versenkt" and scores a point.
After the draw pile is exhausted, the player with the most points wins.

name: Exodus Trading Card Game: Galaxy Tides
description:
Galaxy Tides is the 1st booster pack and the 2nd overall set in the Exodus TCG.

Details
This set introduces Ability creatures and the Secret Rare card rarity for the first time. It also introduces the idea of rarity mechanics and solidifies them into core gameplay. After the initial Birth of Creation storyline, the themes get more epic with galaxy and nebula-infused creatures. Drama rises within the Skyborn Guild, and two-thirds of their members betray the Angels to form the Order Guild. Order creatures make their debut in this set, taking their inspiration from Angels in their appearance while proving to be an entirely new & powerful type on their own.

Set Breakdown:
This set consists of 62 cards, including:
2 Secret Rares
25 Rares
15 Uncommons
20 Commons

Of the 2 Secret Rares, one of them (Efil the Everlasting Empress) can only be found as a fixed box topper in sealed booster boxes and not in packs themselves.
The other Secret Rare (Altered Color Alana the Star Formation) has a packaging ratio of 1 in every 12 boxes, or 1 per case.

Box Toppers
Box Toppers are extra/bonus cards included as incentive when opening an entire booster box or display.
Box Toppers are always Foil.
1 of the 2 Box Toppers in every box is "fixed", meaning it is the same card in every box.
The 2nd Box Topper is a random Foil from the booster set.

Sneak Peek Creature Types
Starting with this first booster set, the creators have placed a hidden pattern in each booster set that identify which new creature types the next expansion will focus on. The pattern is 1 of that creature type in each main Rarity tier (Common, Uncommon & Rare) within the set (excluding dual-types). For Galaxy Tides, the new preview types are Treefolk & Shardfolk.

Creature Types
This set introduces the following creature types:
Order
Mountain
Treefolk
Leviathan

Alternate Artwork Cards
This set includes 2 Altered Art cards:
Dimensional Dragon
Dimensional Desperado
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Ninja 1987 Card Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

This is a solo PnP ninja card game.
Game can be played in easy and normal mode.
Easy mode is created to be accessible for the younger players (6+) and this can be a good way to keep your offspring occupied if you need 15 minutes to do something else.
On normal difficulty this game should be challenging enough to trouble even younger players born in 1987 or before it.

Player uses Hero Cards in order to break through the horde of minions and sidekicks, trying to eliminate two villains. No book keeping, dice or counters needed.

Game is monochrome for the ease of printing. Game contains 4 sheets of card + 4 pages long rule-book.

name: Shaun het schaap: Pizzaspel
description:
Shaun the Sheep has returned in a co-operative children's game.
The farmer ordered a delicious pizza but the naughty pigs surprised the delivery man and stole it from him! They almost ate the entire pizza and hid the leftovers slices in the bushes. Shaun and his friends have decided to find the leftover slices and share them equally together. However, the farmer has sent Bitzer to capture them, therefore the sheep have to be watchful!

Introduction
The game starts when a player has chosen to play as Bitzer, which results in the other players to play as a sheep. The sheep have to work together in order to find every single pizza slice while being careful for muddle pools, Bitzer's traps and Bitzer himself. They win the game when all pizza slices have been found before Bitzer captures them. If Bitzer captures the sheep first, then he'll win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory

name: Polemos
description:
Polemos is a wargame played on a gridded map printed on cloth. Cardboard terrain is added to the map. Cardboard hills in different sizes are included in the game, placed under the cloth.

The game is deterministic with no randomness, but has some hidden information regarding how many more losses each enemy unit can take before it is eliminated.

The game was patented and published first in 1883, and sold as a package with the rulebook and pre-painted playing pieces for two generic unnamed armies. Each army is controlled by 1-3 players. The first two editions of the game used miniature soldiers. The third edition instead used painted blocks.

name: Battlestations!
description:
Sirens split the black... BATTLESTATIONS! Control mighty battlecruisers facing off against each other in deep space. Use programmed actions to launch fighters and torpedos, fire lasers, and even unleash your railgun! Every move counts when the cold embrace of space awaits outside...

Players control two battlecruisers fighting across an imaginary grid of 3x2 cards. Weapons are played into the columns and move over to the opponent's cruiser in an attempt to cause damage. Each player has a command queue that they load cards into the back of and execute from the front of. This queue is played face up so your opponent has an idea of what you intend to do, but each card has two options so you are never sure what is going to happen.

It works like a two-player space invaders, with weapon cards moving across the space between cruisers and causing damage if they reach the other side. With only three hit points for each cruiser, it is intended to be a quick dueling game.

name: Human Interface: Be a Better Human – Blood on the Floor
description: First expansion to Human Interface: Be a Better Human. Contains 3 new player characters, room tiles, missions, weapons, gear, secret agendas, and enemy characters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Spring
description:
Spring, a game of flowers and growing gardens, is a 18 cards microgame.

In Spring each player takes turn placing a card on other previously played cards. Each card shows four groups of flowers and, in order to play it, you should place it overlapping other cards in play, parallel to them, never perpendicular, and covering at least one symbol that do need to match the one(s) on your card. The goal is being the player with the largest garden (area of orthogonally connected groups of flowers) at the end of the game.

name: Joe Connaissant: Gars vs Filles
description: A trivia game where the more you know, the more you score points. Each team has 2 minutes to anwser the most question possible. The less clues you get, the more point you gain. Each time you pass a card, you lose one point though.

name: Lovable Monster Match Memory Game
description:
This can be played either as a memory game where players turn over cards to match identical pictures of lovable and friendly monsters and the player with the most cards wins.
It can also be played as a card game where like crazy-eights where you are collecting sets of matched cards.

For 1 or More Little Monsters Ages 4 and Up. Contains 72 Match-up Monster Cards. No reading required.

name: POOP: Kawaii
description: An English / Japanese Dual Language Version of POOP! A fresh version of the hit game, where your goal is to lay a card, but don’t clog the toilet!

name: The Gallows (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The player may elect to deploy a follower to the city instead of hanging a follower. If he wishes to do this he uses the tile as a regular tile and according to the usual rules of deployment. A deployed follower in this case must be placed on the tile but outside of the gallows area and on the city segment of the tile. This tile with gallows takes no further part in the game, and no player is able hang a follower using this tile with gallows on any subsequent turn. If there is a hanged follower in the gallows area, it is possible to deploy a follower to the city segment of the tile, as a hanged follower cannot control the city.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Robogram
description:
Enter the Cyberspace
Visit Cyburbia, the largest city in virtual space. The city where Robots, AI and computer programs will become reality.

Join your Robot and ready your program cards to compete in the Grand Arena for the ultimate cyber-trophy and become the Robogram Champion!

Robogram is a unique customizable card game designed to teach about programming (it's also proper fun)

It's a game of epic battles where programmers attempt to bring down their opponent's firewall and crash each other's servers.

As cards and damage fly, players will also develop an understanding of how computer systems work. They will write programs and evaluate them together.

The tricks, terms and programs they learn to use in the game, will give them real-life advantages when it comes to understanding programming.

—description from the publisher

name: Skip55
description:
Skip55 is played on a ceramic 4x4 board with ten positive tokens numbered 1-10 and six dark blue tokens numbered -1, -3, -5, -7, -9, and -10 on their hidden face.

To set up a round of the game, place the tokens on the board at random or (for a more strategic game) take turns placing a token on the board. The first player of the round removes one dark blue token at random, looking at the value if desired. Players then take turns in clockwise order. On a turn, you must jump a token over an adjacent token or a line of two adjacent tokens onto an empty space. After jumping, the player claims the firstmost token that they jumped. If a player claims a dark blue token, they take another turn immediately. The round ends once no more jumps can be made, then players tally their score. Once all players have been first player once, the game ends and whoever has the highest score wins.

In solo play, you compete for the highest score possible.

Skip55 also includes arithmetic cards — four each of +, -, ×, and ÷ — that can be used as a variant. Shuffle these cards, then place them face down. After a player claims a token, they draw the top card from the deck, then place it to the right of their token. At game's end, you calculate your score by summing your score from left to right, using the mathematical symbols to combine your numbers. (Use the absolute value of a result following division, e.g., 11÷3 = 3.666, which would be 3.)

name: Monopoly: Roald Dahl Edition
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Welcome to this Roald Dahl edition of MONOPOLY! Meet your favourite characters from Roald Dahl’s much-loved stories as you travel through Giant Country, and inside the giant peach.
Play as one of six brand new character tokens – a pile of Matilda’s books, James’s giant peach, one of Mr. Fox’s chickens, a bubbling pan of George’s marvellous medicine, a mouse from the Witches and one of Willy Wonka’s sweets.
Will you join Centipede and Miss Spider, from James and the giant peach or end up with Mr & Mrs Twit? Will you secure Crunchem Hall, home of the terrible Miss Turnbull, or pay Mr Wormwood for unnecessary car repairs?
Grab your Golden Ticket and get ready for this celebration of Roald Dahl’s phizz-whizzing imagination!
PROPERTIES
BROWN
Mrs Twit / Mr Twit
LIGHT BLUE
Badger / Mrs Fox / Mr Fox
PINK
The Grand High Witch / Grandmother / Boy
ORANGE
Miss Spider / Centipede / James Henry Trotter
RED
Mr Killy Kranky / Grandma / George Kranky
YELLOW
Matilda / Miss Honey / Miss Trunchbull
GREEN
Oompla-Loompa / Mr Will Wonka / Charlie Bucket
DARK BLUE
The BFG / Sophie
STATIONS
Crunchem Hall / Inside the Peach / Giant Country / Inside Wonka's Factory
UTILITIES
Electric Company / Water Works
TAXES
The Witches RSPCC / Wormwood Motors
COMMUNITY CHEST / CHANCE
Golden Ticket / Wonka Bar
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Exodus: Moses vs. Pharaoh
description:
In Exodus: Moses vs Pharaoh: will you like Moses lead your people out of slavery and into freedom? Will the Hebrew Elders support your leadership? Will a decades old murder charge be brought against you? Will Pharaoh relent and “Let My People Go!” Will Joseph’s Bones be transported for re-burial? Will you plunder the Egyptians to make up for 400 years of slavery? Will Aaron and Hur be at your right and left hand?

As Pharaoh, will you keep the Hebrew slaves in order? Will your building programs proceed on schedule? Will your magicians defeat Moses at his own game? Will the gods of the Egyptians protect Egypt from the great I Am? How will the supernatural plagues be dealt with? Will your chariots crush the slave revolt before they escape across the Red Sea? Will you succeed where your historical counterpart failed?

Exodus is a card driven game of ten turns. Moses must lead the Hebrew people out of Egypt and across the Red Sea to freedom. If Moses fails then Pharaoh wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Loaded Questions: Adult Version
description:
The hilarious adult party version of the classic ‘who said what’ game.

Features 308 new and classic Adult Loaded Questions, all new design, and added game play features/components for a laughter-filled Game Night

Questions include: What is an instant mood killer? / What word sounds dirty…but isn’t? / What TV show would you watch if it included full nudity

Let’s Say It’s Your Turn…


Flick the spinner, pick the next card, and read aloud the corresponding question. (Let’s say the question is “What would you NOT want to find in your partner’s bedside drawer?)
All other players write a personal answer for the question on their answer sheets, which are then collected and read aloud by the player to your right.
After hearing all of the answers, choose your favorite and match which player wrote which answer. Match correctly and pick one of the highly desirable VIP cards. The player who wrote your favorite answer also wins one of these cards. The first lucky player to collect 8 VIP cards wins the game!


2017 UPDATE: How To Win and VIP cards are updated in this version

—description from the publisher

name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Hanover
description:
June 30th, 1863: During Lee's invasion of Pennsylvania, Stuart and the cavalry were trying to link up with Ewell's corp believed to be near York PA. On the way there, they ran into Kilpatrick's division of Union cavalry.

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game of the Battle of Hanover, the forth game in the LFM series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 240 2-sided counters.

The map measures 23" x 27" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Kal-If-Fee
description:
Kal-If-Fee is a prize given to players who won in the Turret Turmoil Organized Play Event.

The card is a talent, that allows the owner to target a crew on an enemy ship and has to target one on the ship this card is equipped to. Both players must roll attack dice, the one who rolls more hits and crits must discard the crew. The card has to be disabled to use the action of this card.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Christmas Gifts
description:
Memory, balance and dexterity game from 2 up to 4 players. Build the Christmas Tree and don't fix the base, in order to make it swinging. Take the game box and place the cover below it. Shuffle and place the letter cards vertically between the box and the cover, gift picture hidden. Place the gift tiles inside the box and shuffle them.

The player takes a letter card, then they search for the corresponding gifts among those in the box, taking a gift tile: if right, the player places the gift tile on the Christmas Tree and then takes the corresponding letter card, representing a point; if wrong, the player puts the gift tile back in the box face down. The next player will try to guess the correct gift tile, and so on, until one finds the correct tile. The game continues with the next player clockwise: taking a new letter card trying to find the corresponding gift in the box. The game ends when the players match all gift tiles with corresponding letter cards. The winner is the one who collected the highest number of letter cards.

Which are the available places on the Christmas Tree? Each level of the tree is divided in 4 sectors: players should place gift tiles of the same colours on each sector of the levels. The colour is determined by the Christmas Ball picture on each sector. Furthermore, each sector of the lowest level can have max. 3 gift tiles, in the middle level max. 2 gift tiles and in the highest level just 1.
Attention: If a player, while placing a gift tile on the Christmas Tree, makes one or more tiles fall down, they loose the just gained letter card, which has to be given to another played (they can choose whom). Fallen gift tiles should be placed back in the box with remaining tiles: increasing the difficulty of the game.

name: Holidays: Buying Game
description:
The holiday club is full of crazy activities, and the holidaymakers are going to have to spend wisely! Enjoy the most holiday activities to win the game

Aim: buy the most activities that your budget allows from the 5 main themes.
Before starting: each player receives 100 "Suns" (2 banknotes worth 20 Suns + 3 notes worth 10 Suns + 6 notes worth 5 Suns). Place the remaining banknotes next to the draw pile. Turn over 5 theme cards: these are the 5 main themes in the game. Place the deck of cards face down in the middle.
Rules: the youngest player turns over a card from the draw pile. If it is an activity card, the player can:

Buy: the player pays the bank the amount shown on the card and keeps the card face up. The game continues with the next player.
Not buy: the game continues with the next player, who turns over a card from the draw pile


End of the game: the game ends when a player has the 5 main activities and more activities than the other players.

name: Smong
description:
Smong is coming! Run to the hill and save yourself.

The peaceful island of Simeuleu is being threatened by Smong, a gigantic water dragon awakened by an earthquake. Make the right decisions to save as many turtles as possible, while waiting for Nabang, The Whale Rider to arrive and turn Smong back to sleep. Be careful for each step you take will also trigger the movement of Smong. At the end of the game, be the bravest and help Nabang in pushing Smong back to the ocean and gain the most victory points to win the game.

Smong is inspired by a folklore from Simeuleu island that warns the natives about the danger of tsunami. By learning about the story since their childhood, the local people of Simeuleu learned about tsunami and the necessary steps to take during an earthquake and incoming tsunami.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: After School Curse Club
description:
As an avid member of Ito High School’s After School Curse Club, a group of girls who enjoy getting together to tell ghost stories, you’ve always dreamed of encountering a real Yūrei (A vengeful Japanese spirit). Unfortunately, after participating in a childish game meant to summon spirits, you get your wish.

Now, trapped in the high school after dark, it’s up to you and your fellow club members to search the school and find six Talismans to stop the blood thirsty Yūrei you summoned from killing you all.

After School Curse Club is a roll and write style role playng game that is easy and fast to play. It is suitable for up to four players but works best solo.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Super Dungeon: Dark Kitsune
description:
The Dark Kitsune is a mini-boss for your games of Super Dungeon.

Some Kitsune are ill-suited for life beneath their clan's shadowed trees. Dark Kitsune dream of a wider world, and long to see its wonders. They take their clan's skills in herbalism and magic with them, of course, and most parlay these talents into lucrative employment. All too often these skills are employed by villainous clans and dungeons bosses under the sway of the Dark Consul!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Dungeon: Clan Tanchyo Warband
description:
Clan Tanchyo makes it way to the realm of Crystalia as a new warband for Super Dungeon! Clan boxes feature dynamic and unique sculpts for players' favorite characters. These powerful teams are now playable in Super Dungeon as warbands, Heroes, mini-bosses, and minions! All the cards to play your new favorite are included.

The Tanchyo have close ties to the many spirits of the air and earth that inhabit their forests. They view it as their sacred duty to defend the deep forest from the encroachment of human culture, keeping it pristine for later generations.

Tanchyo longbows are the finest in kagejima, and their ingenious climbing gear allows them to move through the canopy as though they were born to it. Every man, woman, and child is trained and ready to take up a bow, elevating its use to artistry while preparing to rain death on any threats to clan or forest.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Dungeon: Clan Kitsune Warband
description:
Clan Kitsune makes it way to the realm of Crystalia as a new warband for Super Dungeon! Clan boxes feature dynamic and unique sculpts for players' favorite characters. These powerful teams are now playable in Super Dungeon as warbands, Heroes, mini-bosses, and minions! All the cards to play your new favorite are included.

Clan Kitsune are the mercurial mystics and expert herbalists of the hallowed spirits trees of Kagejima. With access to an abundance of herbs and fungi found nowhere else in the world, they create and trade their remedies and poisons for the wares of other clans. Yet, in their cunning, they are keen to keep the most potent and arcane of their creations for themselves. Due to their whimsical and often wayward nature, many of the more stoic clans view the Kitsune as unreliable rogues, but their friends simply see them as wise tricksters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: プーさん ハニーコレクション (Winnie-the-Pooh Honey Collection)
description:
User summary
プーさん ハニーコレクション (Winnie-the-Pooh Honey Collection) is a Japanese game on the Disney licensed properties. In the game, you take cards from the three card piles to collect “honey”. You can take as many cards as you like on your turn.

However, if you get a “bee”, all the “honey” you collected on that turn is taken away.

Whoever collects 4 points worth of “honey” is the winner.

3つのカード山から札をめくって「はちみつ集め」をします。
一度に何枚めくってもOK!
ただし「ハチ」がでるとそのターンのはちみつは没収となります。
はやく4点分の「はちみつ集め」をできた人が「勝ち」となります。
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Llamas in Pyjamas
description:
In Llamas in Pyjamas, players take turns to take a card from the pile and try to match llama pyjama tops with pyjama bottoms. Collect more pyjama bottoms, match a pyjama top to existing pyjama bottoms, and complete as many llamas as possible before all of the “bedtime scene” cards are revealed.

Watch out for those “a-llama clock” cards which can send half of a completed llama to the discard pile.

The winner is the player with the greatest number of complete llamas at bedtime.

name: Caveman
description:
Do you speak caveman? No? Well, here's your chance to learn!

There are four pictures in the cards, with four possible background colour. Distribute the cards evenly between players, and if everybody is ready the game begins!

There is no taking turns, you have to find a match as quick as possible! It's a rapid race to get rid of your cards before your megalithic mates!

For example: if a player laid a card and called out "mamu" (that means mammoth), and in his card played the mamu was with blue background, all players would search through their cards looking for a mamu with blue surround. Once a player finds this combination, he can place the card on top of the pile and can call out the next word! Shout out one of the caveman words so that everyone knows what to look for next...

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game!

name: Blanc-Manger Coco: Pot de départ
description:
Pot de départ is a work-themed Blanc-Manger Coco deck.
It contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Clumsy Thief in the Candy Shop
description:
From the creators of the original, award-winning Clumsy Thief game, this hilarious version has players snatching candy stacks that add to 20. All candy is up for grabs in this fast-paced card game. Strategy, addition skills, luck and a great sense of humor are required.

HOW TO PLAY: Players make candy stacks from their dealt cards. Take a players' stack if you have a card that makes 20 when added to the top card of their stack. But that's just the beginning! Thief cards steal candy cards. Jail cards stop thief cards. In the end, the player with the most candy cards wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Pyrami
description:
Two to four players participate in constructing the pyramid. Each player builds on his side, always in the row determined by the dice. The bottom row counts as a 6, the one on top of this as a 5, and so on. The top of the pyramid requires a triangular piece.

A player also can deconstruct: If he can't use a number he has rolled, he may remove a piece from another player's construction.

The first player to complete his side of the pyramid wins.

—user summary

name: Obchod Hra o nakupování
description:
Goal of the game is to have a good time during shopping. Buy as fast as possible all commodities that you need for your chosen food and get back home. Players have random starting amount of money and they can get more (or lose) through random events. They can earn a bit by voluntarily drawing real life homework (e.g. water a plant, sort three books in library) to earn a bit more. Once they get to the shop (via short route and dice-rolling) each turn they roll to either have a chance to buy one thing of their list or draw aforementioned event card. Whoever gets home first with all ingredients will win.

Obchod - Hra o nakupování je unikátní dětská hra od Kvída. Naučí děti od 4 let, jak hospodařit s penězi, správnému rozhodování, sociálním dovednostem, ale i například řazení potravin do druhů (např. ovoce, zelenina, mléčné výrobky, atd.).
Goal of the game is to have a good time during shopping. Buy as fast as possible all commodities that you need for your chosen food and get back home. Players have random starting amount of money and they can get more (or lose) through random events. They can earn a bit by voluntarily drawing real life homework (eg. water a plant, sort three books in library) to earn a bit more. Once they get to the shop (via short route and dice-rolling) each turn they roll to either have a chance to buy one thing of their list or draw aformentioned event card. Whoever gets home first with alk ingrediants will win.
Hráči se po cestě do Kvído obchodu musí umět správně rozhodovat, s trochou štěstí získají část peněz na svůj nákup a zbytek si mohou vydělat vylosovanou domácí prací (úklid, mytí nádobí, apod.), kterou musí vykonat. V obchodě nakupují zboží dle svého nákupního seznamu a neustále sledují, zda mají dostatek peněz na zaplacení.
Při nakupování se mohou setkat i s nečekanými výhodami a nevýhodami, které ze hry dělají ještě větší zábavu.
Vyhrává ten, kdo má jako první dostatek peněz na zaplacení na pokladně a vrátí se domů s celým nákupem.

name: Seize the Imperium the Card Game
description:
2-6 players compete to be the next Emperor or Empress of the galaxy using pre-constructed decks with 3 sub-decks (Asset Deck of 50 cards, System Deck of 10 World cards and Character Deck of 10 cards) and a pool of Color-coded counters, Resource counters, and Throne World token. Players win by accumulating 20 points of World cards through buying them or conquest.

Each player's Turn will be compromised of 5 Phases:
1. Resupply Phase - They will undeplete (ready) cards from the last Turn, draw a card from an their Asset Deck and Character Decks, generate Resource counters from each World card they control and pay to flip up World card from their Face Down System Card area.

2. Allocation Phase - They will use Resource counters to allocate Artifact cards and Character cards and deplete (unready) World cards to allocate the Unit cards of the game (Fleets, Troops, Installations and Orbitals) to your World cards.

3. Reallocation Phase - Move your Units card first between your World cards, and then to other player's World cards that you intend to attack.

4. Conquest Phase - You resolve the Conquest Actions at each World card that you reallocated Fleets or Troops to.

5. Victory Phase - Determine the spoils of your Conquest Actions, liberate World cards, pay for more face down World cards, determine if you have enough Victory points to win, and draw back to hand size.

The game is meant to be won through conquest, as purchasing World cards from your System Deck gets incrementally expensive, and you'll use Tactics cards in battle. Character cards also will tip the balance of power by affecting Conquest Actions, altering allocations and other game mechanics including neutralizing other Characters!

-description from designer

name: Action!: O jogo de Cinema!
description:
Looking for big talents for his new movie, the renowned horror director, Steve Scream, holds auditions a little bit... Unusual.

On this party game everyone plays as actors testing his interpreting skills. Bluff, act and deceive your friends in this funny game. Only one can be the next Hollywood star.

Every character that you can interpret in the game makes a homage to an iconic horror movie and they perform different actions. Your go is having seven cheers before the other actors. You Will have a secret character in front of you, but you may choose to bluff and perform the action of another character, but you have to convince the other players, otherwise you'll getting caught and loose the cheers you where given before.
—user summary

Nesse party game, todos são atores, e a sua habilidade de interpretar será colocada à prova. Blefe, interprete e engane seus amigos nesse divertido jogo aonde somente um será o próximo grande astro de hollywood.
—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Black Stories Junior: Ghost Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior". The colors represent the locations where the junior mystery stories play.

Black Stories Junior: Ghost Stories are spooky riddles for young ghost chaser. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Black Stories Junior: Ghost Stories includes the cards of both sets: Black Stories Junior: White Stories and Black Stories Junior: Purple Stories. So instead of fifty cards, there are a hundred riddles for you to puzzle out.

name: SLASHR
description:
The Slasher Movie can be scary, ridiculous, gory, trashy, witty social commentary or just dumb fun. SLASHR is a fast playing, free wheeling Slasher Movie emulator captured in 9 simple playing cards.

Before starting play, make sure that you set the rating for this movie (a PG-13 game is very different than the Hard R version). If we are okay with our movie getting a hard R Rating, make sure that the players are all comfortable with that. You may want to check out some standard RPG safety mechanics - such as an X-CARD.

Have everyone sit around a circle. Take your SLASHR deck, shuffle it, and put it in the middle of the area you are playing, in easy reach for all the players. If you really want to get in the mood, service some greasy popcorn, turn the lights down and sing "Let's All Go to the Lobby".

As a group, come up with a setting for a 1980s-style exploitation flick. Once you have a setting, settle on a title for the film. The setting and title are going to really lock down what the players do over the course of the movie.

The first player is the last person to have seen a horror movie. They begin the game by introducing themselves (their actual self) as starring as a character in the movie. So, for instance, let's say that we are playing a movie called Unholy Pigskin (a PG-13 slasher about a High School Football team full of vampires. You would say something like, "Starring Chris O'Neill as Head Coach N. Romancer". Then have the next player in the circule introduce themselves and so on, until everyone has been introduced.

Each player will then take a turn creating a scene in the Movie. The most important thing to remember is that you are SETTING UP A SCENE - not resolving it. To properly set up a scene, it should involve your character, at least one other character, and a location. These two players should both want something, or need an answer to a question. This simple mechanic should drive us immediately into action. "Okay, so the Cheerleader and I are having a fight in the parking lot about leaving town."

When the scene starts, the players can start role-playing their characters, or narrating activity in the scene. Anyone that is not directly involved in the scene acts as additional "uncredited" characters and background effects.

When one of the following happens, ANY PLAYER should yell CUT!

A Character is about to get the thing they want.
A Character is about to get the answer to a question.
Anything stupid, weird, or dangerous occurs.
Things are getting slow or boring in any way.


Whenever someone yells CUT! the active player takes the SLASHR deck, cuts it, and flips over the top card. Depending on the card, the scene is then resolved in a specific way. After resolving the scene, shuffle the deck and play passes to the next player clockwise.

FEAR, LUST, LIES, GREED, or STUPIDITY(THE RED CARDS) If the player cuts to a RED CARD, they resolve the scene in their favor using the prompt on the card, then return that card to the deck.

MURDERED (BLACK CARDS)
When you pull a BLACK CARD, you got Murdered. In the game, this means that this scene - no matter what it was about - ends in your grisly murder at the hands of the SLASHR KILLR. Only the ACTIVE PLAYER dies, and they always get to narrate their own death! If the Slasher has not been revealed yet, the death should be laden with mystery.

When you die, you flip over the remaining cards in the SLASHR deck and take one of the 5 RED CARDS out (Fear, Lust, Lies, Greed, and Stupidity) and plays it face up in front of them.

When your character has been eliminated, you are still playing. If it becomes your turn again, instead of setting up a scene with your character - you set up and narrate a quick scene using your prompt as inspiration. You are encouraged to be the unnamed people in the other player's scenes in the movie, to add narration, to make sound effects, and to shout encouragement from your theater seats.

Don't forget to put the BLACK CARD back into the deck.

DON'T TURN AROUND
If the player cuts to DON'T TURN AROUND, they have a brush with Death, but don't die. Early on in the game, when this happens - the player should narrate their "jump scare" or "cheap heat" moment - cats jumping out, car crashes, kids pretending to be the murderer, etc.

After the SLASHR is in play, this card should always result in a near death experience with the SLASHR KILLR. Put the card back in the deck.

SLASHR
When you flip the SLASHR card - you are the SLASHR. You should resolve the scene as the SLASHR, revealing your identity and motive. You get to resolve the scene in your favor - but as your can only die when you are the active player, your opponent in the scene does not get killed.

YOUR INEVITABLE GRISLY DEATH
As you play, you will be removing cards form the deck, and making it MORE LIKELY that the next player is going to die. With either (a) the deck runs out of RED Cards, or (b) there is only the SLASHR. and one other person alive; the game ends. Each player that was eliminated during the game gets a chance to "pitch" the ending of the movie to the remaining player(s). The ending should involved the survivors defeating the SLASHR or getting away. Afterwards, the SLASHRget to add a "sequel clause" scene where they show how they actually survived for the next movie.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
