name: Emil i Lönneberga
description:
A card game with a bluffing element based on one of author Astrid Lindgren's characters, published in the late 70s or early 80s.

Each player is trying to get rid of an initial hand containing mischief cards and good behaviour cards among others. Mischief cards can be played face up at the risk of gaining penalty points, or face down. If a player plays a father card, each other player must show the top card of their play pile if it's face down, risking even more penalty points if it's a mischief card.

—user summary

Note: Not to be confused with another Alga game with the same name and the same theme, Emil i Lönneberga.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based

name: One Key: Card 902
description:
This is a promo card for One Key, distributed by the publisher at conventions.

Works like any other card and is just added to the other cards.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition

name: Poklad
description:
Risk and adventure are what you will find in this game. A famous hero seeks a golden treasure. He must overcome many obstacles to difficulties, snatch it and then get it out of the jungle.

Poklad is a 2-4 player game where you roll dice and move your hero across the board trying to avoid traps that slows you down. You can also choose to put obstacles for other players and slow them down thanks to that. The goal of the game is to get to the center of the board, get the treasure and then get back to the start avoiding other player who might steal your treasure.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Core Runner
description:
In the not too distant future World War III has obliterated civilization into ruins. Devastated cities fester as pits of technological decay. Violent tribalism is the new world order. Yet even outcasts can survive... if they provide a service. In Core Runner you are one such outcast, and you've just gotten wind of a very lucrative proposition. Now you'll traverse an extremely harsh district, seeking an unusual bounty for a high payoff. But your run will constantly be threatened by rivals, cybernetic hazards, and old world perils. Can YOU survive the danger of Rise City's insidious Industrial District? Many have tried, many have died. And you've never had a run like this.

Core Runner is a free single player non-linear cyberpunk adventure. Its exploratory gameplay consists of variable interactive fiction implementing unique dice mechanics. Core Runner offers very high replayability; 36 special events offer a total of over 120 different outcomes leading into 11 unique endings.

To play Core Runner you will need the Rule Book PDF, Event Book PDF, and Tracking Sheet PDF, all available from the Files download area below.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Mature / Adult, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Tongue Twister
description:
Word twisting fun to tease your tongue!

Can you say . . . "She says she shall sew a sheet"?

Now can you say it three times while patting your head and rubbing your tummy? That's the hilarious idea behind Tongue Twister.

The faster you can say a Tongue Twister, the further you move around the gameboard.

But wait a second. There's an extra "Twist". Just as you near the finish line one of your opponents can challenge you, sending you back a few spaces. But that's Tongue Twister the tongue-twisting, fast-paced, unpredictable and outrageously funny board game that will really tie an evening together!

—description from the publisher

name: Memofant
description:
Only those who can memorize the symbols and positions of twelve different images within a minute and don't get confused when they change places, prove to be true masters of memory.

The memory of elephants is legendary, who remember the location of watering holes and feeding grounds for years, even at great distances. This pronounced spatial memory has been scientifically proven many times. This is followed by Memofant; here, too, are thinking and cleverness indispensable to succeed as the winner.

On the board are the most diverse tasks to solve, with the players trying to remember the covered image tiles and to name them correctly.

If you are smart, think up little stories to remember things as well as the Memofant!
It requires special attention, when according to the instruction two picture tiles are exchanged and also the best memory artists have to re-orient themselves... False answers are thus bound to happen and unfortunately everyone, whose memory fails them, loses a life! Luckily, all players get several lives at the beginning, so the game dies not end prematurely.

Suitable for two to four players, ages seven and up, Memofant promotes concentration and memory in a playful way. As with the well-known memory artists, mnemonics or small stories can help to memorize the symbols and get the player's brain racing.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: JadedAid
description:
JadedAid is a card game for world-weary development workers to be the cynicism they want to see in the world.

The idea is simple: take the everyday frustrations of working for the Development Industrial Complex (the DIC) and turn them into a prescription for fun! JadedAid contains 100 cards that can be played alone or used in combination with similarly formatted games such as Cards Against Humanity to make the fun last longer than Mugabe’s rule.

The “Donor” player will read out a red Indicator Card posing a question and “Implementer” players will submit their white Outcomes Cards with potential answers.

The Donor picks the winner they like the best, damn the evidence (or lack thereof). The winner then becomes the Donor for the next round. You win by amassing useless Indicator Cards, just like in real life!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Kimble Twist
description:
Kimble Twist presents a new take on the children's game Trouble (known as Kimble in Northern Europe). The game features a new, game board with moving parts and a new Pop-o-Matic with two dice. The goal is still same as in the original game: being the first to move all your four pieces from START to FINISH.

The difference to original comes from the special die, which can either make you twist the center of the board 1/4 of a round or turn a different part of the route half a round. This can make the FINISH-zone escape from you or take your game piece temporarily out of the board all together. Conclusively, Kimble Twist brings new strategies and even more randomness to the traditional Kimble.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Agents of Mayhem: Gremlin Tech Deck 1
description:
Dice Tower KS Promo 2019.

A pack of seven Gremlin Tech Cards for Agents of Mayhem!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Vom kleinen Maulwurf, der wissen wollte, wer ihm auf den Kopf gemacht hat. Das Spiel.
description:
A roll-and move game about a mole that wants to find who did a dump on its head. It features the Little Mole, the butchers dog Hans-Heinerich, and other animals from the childrens book classic.

In turn, the player rolls a die and moves his pawn forward, according to the result. There are some animal spaces; landing on them provides a shortcut. Other spaces contain dog droppings; if you collect two of them, you have to skip a turn to clean your feet.

The first player who reachs the dog at the end of the track wins the game.

—user summary

name: DC Spyfall: Swamp Thing Location Card Promo Cards
description:
A new location for DC Spyfall.

This pack includes eight copies of the Swamp location cards, one of which is labeled as the Joker.

It is sold at BGG Store.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Zeds Zone
description:
ZEDS ZONE is a roll & write game with a length of 15-30 minutes for 1+ players. They will try to escape from an area infested with zombies, kill all they can along the way, and rescue survivors.

COMPONENTS: Each player needs a game sheet, a black pencil, and two others of different colors. Also, two six-sided dice of different colors are used (one light and one dark). Two dice are enough for all players.

OBJECTIVE: Draw a passable area from the entrance of the Z Zone to the exit and activate the generator to open the door. If there are several players, they must also try to get the most Victory Points to win. If you play solo, try to beat your own score.

Game Play:

1. Roll the dice. Every player must cross out the rolled sector in his or her Sector Table. If the rolled sector is already crossed out, the player must select the previous or the next available sector in the row. If there are no available sectors in the row, you can select the last available sector of the rows above or the first available sector of the rows below. If you want to use a shelter, you can do it now.

2. All players draw the sector they crossed out on their Z Zone, then they color it. You can draw it on any free square (it does not have to be adjacent to other drawn square), but it must be drawn just as shown in the Sector Table, i.e., you cannot rotate it. If the new sector is added to the passable area, color it with the appropriate color.

3. If a zombie is activated, circle it. If you cannot kill all the activated zombies (by crossing out as many guns as the number of activated zombies), you lose immediately.

4. You can activate the grenade if it is in the passable area.

The game ends at the 20th turn, i.e., when you have drawn 20 sectors in all the 20 squares of your Z Zone. If you draw a passable area from the entrance to the exit and it has a generator within before the 20th turn, you do not win yet. If the 20th turn begins and you have not drawn a generator in your Z Zone yet, ignore the rolled sector and draw one of the two sectors which have the generator within. At the end of the 20th turn, surviving players must check if they have activated the generator and drawn a passable area from the entrance to the exit. Those who succeeded, count their Victory Points —the player with the most Victory Points is the winner. If no one succeeded, everybody loses the game.

name: Wybory 1919
description:
January 1919. Poland returned to the map of Europe only two months earlier. Now the Republic desperately needs reforms which can be carried out only by Sejm. Even though the country doesn't even have its borders set up, the Chief of State calls for democratic election which will allow to choose the Representatives of the whole society. It's time for the first election campaign of the Second Polish Republic!

"Wybory 1919" is a dynamic boardgame in which the players are the leaders of four main political forces in the interwar Poland. They try to lead their parties to victory in the upcoming elections. By playing action cards, they compete for support in four main social groups: peasantry, city dwellers, workers and the minorities. They can increase their own popularity and place a supporter meeple in their color in one of the groups, decrease others' support, manipulate the regional elections' order or even cancel elections in some constituencies by calling in the military actions in the region. Each player gets an identical deck of 9 action cards at the start of the game, but draws up to the limit of three cards at random in their turn - reshuffling the discard pile if the draw pile runs out. Players need to strategize based on their current hand and pay attention to the cards that their opponents have already used.

Whoever gets the majority in each of the three groups favoured in the current round's constituency, wins the seat for their representative in that round of elections. The party that gets more representatives than any of the others after the last round is resolved, wins the game and assists in writing the Second Polish Republic's history!

The game was commissioned by the Social Communication Bureau at Chancellery of the Sejm of the Republic of Poland for the 100th anniversary of the first elections in Second Polish Republic. It's meant as an educational tool in teaching history and promotional item for the Sejm. As such, it hasn't been available in retail. The instructions booklet contains more detailed historical background on the elections of 1919-1920 in Poland. The action cards provide some basic information on the leaders of each political side as well as flavor texts in the form of newspaper quotes from that time.
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Area Majority / Influence, Command Cards, Turn Order: Progressive
publishers: Biuro Komunikacji Społecznej Kancelarii Sejmu RP

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Goemon
description:
Few people have actually met Ishikawa Goemon, but almost everyone knows his name, either from fireside tales or wanted posters. Though a hunted man, Goeman has fought in the last three Moonlight Tournaments, daring authorities to arrest him. None have tried, and this has only emboldened him.

CONTENTS:
1x Goemon Masterclass Miniature
1x Goemon Hero Card
1x 25mm Black Base

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Gears: The Deck-builder
description:
"In the before time, darkness ruled our lands. But evil was conquered and colors started to shine upon our city. We became adventures and took to the skies. We became adventures and took to the skies."

"Play the cards to your advantage, hinder your opponents and use your special abilities at the right momement."

Gears is an aggressive push-your-luck deck-builder for two players. Every turn, you can either activate actions, gain power or give despair.

Shuffle the gear-cards together and deal 5 cards to the middle of the table to form the market row. From here, you can buy or gain new cards throughout the game. Deal 10 starter cards to each player and draw 5 cards into your hand. The best fixer at the table, is the starting player. Play cards each turn to activate actions, gain power or give despair to your opponents. Push your luck and resolve for dominance. When a player has 2 dominance, that player is the winner.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Advance
description: Be the first player to line up three of your pieces in a row. Easy, right? There’s a catch: You can only move your pieces in numerical order, which turns a game of all-to-easy Tic-Tac-Toe into a challenging game that forces you to think like a chess master.

name: Magic Tree
description:
In the mysterious enchanted forest, there is a Magic Tree with various fruits.
Animals such as monkeys, koalas, and squirrels come together to get some fruits from the Magic tree.
Go up the ladder and put fruits in the basket. And if you are lucky, you will find the fairy hiding in the tree!

After rolling dice, players will check which tile to take from tree trunks!
Quickly check and choose where to put your basket.
But be careful! If you miss the timing, your basket might land on the wrong level of the ladder.
Players earn points depending on the picture tiles they collected.

—description from the publisher

name: Fabulous Fred
description:
A small electronic game with 9 colored buttons, a number of score/notepads, a few boards, and a box of chips and tokens. Contains 10 games to try; electronic organ, the music machine, what's that song?, memory game, mindbender, space attack, submarine hunt, catch the comet, baseball, and roulette.

—user summary

name: Planet Apocalypse: Nightmare Pack
description:
This expansion to Planet Apocalypse contains:

2 Lords (Tuchulcha and Mezu)
2 Heroes (Scott Delrich and Eva Noel)
3 Fourth Circle Demons (Imp Swarm, Wraith Swarm, Killakee Swarm)

Maps:
2 Maps (The Wave and The Last Redoubt)

Cards:
3 Legion Cards (Youdu, Xibalba, Drakulu)
2 Region Cards (Republic of China and People's Republic of China)
2 Trooper Cards Types (Reservist, Air Strike)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Fort Boyard: Escape Box
description:
Live the Fort Boyard experience at home with this escape box!

Take part in the great Fort Boyard game with your friends! Solve the puzzles, collect the clues and the keys to open the treasure room!
Can you find the correct code word within 45 minutes?
Let's go for the adventure!
Always higher, always further, always stronger!

Included: a poster and a 45-minute soundtrack with the official credits of the show to immerse you in the atmosphere!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Vis l'expérience Fort Boyard chez toi grâce à cette escape box !

Participe au grand jeu Fort Boyard avec tes amis !
Résous les énigmes, récupère les indices et les clés pour ouvrir la salle du trésor !
Trouverez-vous le bon mot code dans les 45 minutes imparties ? C'est parti pour l'aventure !
Toujours plus haut, toujours plus loin, toujours plus fort !

Inclus : un poster et une bande son de 45 minutes avec le générique officiel de l'émission pour t'immerger dans l'ambiance !

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Real-time
publishers: France 2, Les Livres du Dragon d'Or

name: I Am… Alias
description:
Party game, where the players put on a headband and pick a card from a deck. Everyone attaches their card on the the headband and one person at a time tries to explain the word to another player (who cannot see their card). Right guess grants points and the player gets to move their pawn forward.

—user summary

Slap on a headband and get ready to explain! Tell the other players who they are, but don’t say the word on the card!
This time you can never be sure who you are, but you’re guaranteed to have a great time, aka lots of fun!

The player, who gets the furthest during a set number of rounds, wins the game!
Everyone plays at the same time!
The game is full of hilarious characters and funny moments.
A fast-moving, rib-tickling word explaining game!
—description from the publisher

name: The Cuboids' Proud Christmas
description:
15 year old Dylan Cuboid was about to decorate the Christmas tree.
It was his turn this year and he had decided to make it something extra special for this year! His two older siblings, „the Twins" Brenda and Brandon, have had their "coming out" this year. Duh... Literally everybody knew about it, but these two needed there special piece of pie of course... :D So Dylan decided to decorate the Christmas tree in rainbow colors from top to bottom to celebrate with them once more in pride!
But there was an obstacle.
You know, the Cuboid family, they have a tradition. Whoever took down the decorations last year has to decorate the tree this year. That's how he had gotten his assignment. But back then he had not been the forward thinking and well organized Dylan of today. He was a kid, who wanted to get things over with to play with the toys he had been gifted. And so the boxes were not cleanly sorted like he would have liked them to be now...
So he needs a little help!

The gameplay consists of dice manipulation by using the powers of said dice. The tree decorating part is RnR

The Cuboids' Proud Christmas was an entry to the 10th Anniversary Christmas PnP contest. It's WIP-Thread can be found here:
[WIP] The Cuboids' Proud Christmas - 10th anniversary Christmas Print and Play Game contest!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Галичина 1918-1919
description: Board Game about Polish-Ukrainian war in 1918—1919. It is a war game on the hexagonal board with historical card engine.
categories: Educational, Political, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: Deutschland Reise
description: Discover Germany by playing, what can be done faster? First visit Winnetou in Bad Segeberg and then visit the largest wine barrel in the world in Heidelberg? Or first to the cathedral in Cologne? The players from Deutschlandreise go on an exciting and informative journey across Germany. The goal: Visit eight cities and be the first to return to the pre-determined starting point. The players plan an ideal travel route for this. You can expect over two hundred sights such as the Brandenburg Gate or interesting towns such as Rothenburg ob der Tauber. These are presented to you in words and pictures. With interesting action cards your own journey can be accelerated or that of the other players slowed down! With good planning, a bit of luck with the dice and the clever use of your action cards, you will be the first to end the exciting journey through Germany.

name: Pipsa Possu: Kuralätäkkö
description:
It's time for a mudbath! Drop Peppa into the puddle and try to splash mud on characters around the puddle. You will get a prize token for every succesful splash. First to splash mud on every character is the winner of the game!

Includes a challenging game for more experienced gamers.

name: Mini Ratzfatz: Zählen und Rechnen
description: The cards with the images are put face up on the table. One player tells a story which contain some of the numbers or sets shown on the cards. The player who is the first one to recognize the number resp. set, gets the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Robogem Deluxe
description:
Plan the best route for your robot and collect most gems and return to your base before other players. Game for learning basics of programming.

The robot takes three commands: move forward, turn left and turn right. Players string these commands to guide the robots. Advanced games include functions that can contain many moves which can then be repeated when wanted.

First player to collect three gems and return them to their home base wins the game.

This game combines Robogem (2015) and Robogem: lisäkortit (2016)

name: Black Stories: Berlin
description:
Why did Maurice shudder when he arrived at Ku'damm? Why were onlookers singing when Lennart was attacked by a polar bear in Friedrichshain? And why did Laura have a panic attack every time she looked through the windows of the Berlin subway? The "black stories Berlin" collect 50 pitch-black riddles around the cosmopolitan city on the Spree. From Pankow to Schöneberg and from Spandau to Köpenick: plenty of macabre stories and criminal cases about blackmailers and serial killers. Berlin from its darkest side ... suspense, fun and scurrility!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Trivia

name: Formula BoardGame
description:
Formula Board Game is a competitive, strategic / management board game for 2-5 players, which allows you to take part in a race of the highest car competition, reliving all the emotions of a Grand Prix.

The game simulates all aspects of a car race, acceleration and deceleration of the car, race strategy, pit stops, overtaking, variable weather, tire choice, crashes and of course damage.
In addition, the player through tokens has additional abilities such as sudden braking, instinct and additional gear changes, while through action cards that he can play during the turn, he adds attacks such as, risky overtaking, slipstreaming and delayed braking.

The game includes both the main cars of the players and the BotCars (cars that move independently during the race through special cards), each player controls an entire team during the race, then 2 cars, the main player car, which moves with its gear cards and the corresponding BotCar which moves autonomously, but which the player can help with additional movements through action cards.

Before starting the race, players will have to qualify for their main car, these are done through an application for Android smartphones, this is an absolute novelty in car racing themed board games, because it allows the player to actively interact , as the latter has to show his reaction skills to make the best qualifying time.

Subsequently, the team consisting of the 2 cars is purchased through an auction.
Subsequently the players, always through the Android application, will have to carry out a skill test to make the first movement of the departure, also this absolute novelty, which allows the player to simulate in a realistic way the emotion of the departure when the traffic light goes off.

The game takes place in several rounds, each round consists of 3 rounds, where the players must simultaneously place 3 marching cards in front of them in a secret way, respecting the acceleration and deceleration movement rules based on the weather. For example, with the sun weather the acceleration is maximum +3 and the deceleration is maximum -2, with rain weather it is maximum +2 and the deceleration is maximum -2, but they must also pay attention to the entry and exit limits. always turns according to the weather.

During the race the BotCar cars are always in play, even if you play with 2 players, so you will always have a minimum of 7 cars in the race and a maximum of 10 cars if you play with 5.

The game is a simulation, luck is totally non-existent, the 10 moving gear cards that the player has in his hand are the same for all players, so only the player's strategic skill can lead to victory.

The race ends when all the cars in the last round have crossed the finish line, the winner will be established according to the sum of the points scored by the 2 cars of the team calculated based on the finish position.


Formula Board Game è un gioco da tavolo competitivo, strategico/gestionale per 2-5 giocatori, che permette di prendere parte ad una gara della massima competizione automobilistica, rivivendo tutte le emozioni di un Gran Premio.
Il gioco simula tutti gli aspetti di una gara automobilistica, accelerazione e decelerazione della macchina, la strategia di gara, i pit stop, i sorpassi, il meteo variabile, la scelta degli pneumatici, incidenti e ovviamente i danni.
Inoltre il giocatore attraverso dei token ha delle abilità aggiuntive come frenata improvvisa, istinto e cambi marcia aggiuntivi, mentre attraverso delle carte azione che può giocare durante il turno, aggiunge attacchi come, sorpassi azzardati, la scia e la staccata ritardata.
Il gioco comprende sia le auto principali dei giocatori, sia le BotCar (auto che si muovono autonomamente durante la gara attraverso delle carte apposite), ogni giocatore controlla durante la gara un team intero, quindi 2 auto, l'auto principale giocatore, che muove con le sue carte marcia e la BotCar corrispondente che si muove autonomamente, ma che il giocatore può aiutare con dei movimenti aggiuntivi attraverso le carte azione.
Prima di iniziare la gara i giocatori dovranno effettuare le qualifiche per la propria auto principale, queste vengono effettuate attraverso un'applicazione per smartphone Android, questa è un'assoluta novità nei giochi da tavolo a tema corse automobilistiche, perché permette al giocatore di interagire attivamente, in quanto quest'ultimo deve dare prova delle sue abilità di reazione per effettuare il miglior tempo di qualifica.
Successivamente si procede all'acquisto del team composto dalle 2 auto attraverso un'asta.
Successivamente i giocatori, dovranno effettuare sempre attraverso l'applicazione Android, una prova di abilità per effettuare il primo movimento della partenza, anche questa assoluta novità, che permette al giocatore di simulare in modo realistico l'emozione della partenza allo spegnimento del semaforo.
Il gioco si svolge in vari round, ogni round è formato da 3 turni, dove i giocatori contemporaneamente devono posizionare davanti a se 3 carte marcia in maniera segreta, rispettando le regole movimento di accelerazione e decelerazione in base al meteo. Ad esempio con il meteo sole l'accelerazione è di massimo +3 e la decelerazione e di massimo -2, con meteo pioggia è di massimo +2 e la decelerazione di massimo -2, ma devono fare anche attenzione ai limiti di entrata e uscita curva sempre in base al meteo.
Durante la gara le auto BotCar sono sempre in gioco, anche se si gioca in 2 giocatori, quindi in gara si avranno sempre un minimo di 7 auto e un massimo di 10 auto se si gioca in 5.
Il gioco è una simulazione, la fortuna è totalmente inesistente, le 10 carte marcia movimento che il giocatore ha in mano sono uguali per tutti i giocatori, quindi solo la bravura strategica del giocatore può portare alla vittoria.
La gara termina quando tutte le auto nell'ultimo round hanno attraversato il traguardo, il vincitore verrà stabilito secondo la somma dei punti effettuati dalle 2 auto del team calcolati in base alla posizione di arrivo.

name: Foul Play: The Manor House Murder
description:
Welcome to Edwardian England. The Lord of the Manor is dead! The servants are our lead suspects and it's up to you to unearth the evidence, seek out the suspects and catch the culprit in order to scupper the other sleuths, and win this game of murder! There's more than one way to catch a killer though. So what's it gonna be? Good Cop or Bad Cop? These two game versions come with their own set of rules and tactics to crack the case and finger your suspect, but will you use fair play or FOUL PLAY?

The Game is Afoot! Playing as detective, you’ll need to find the three evidence cards that point to a specific suspect in order to catch a killer in this crazy criminal caper. Will you uncover them in the crime scene? Could the other detectives be willing to collaborate and share their findings? Or will you resort to more tricky tactics, and plunder the proof you need to solve this crime?

Detectives (players) have to deduce information from the Evidence Locker and Crime Scene to solve the murder.

The game has Two Playing Variants:

Good Cop (Catch A Killer) - set-up by placing the Evidence cards face down according to color and shuffle each pile. The remaining cards form the Evidence Locker. Add one card from each Evidence pile into the Evidence Locker and discard the rest. Shuffle the Evidence Locker and 9 cards into a 3x3 grid (The Crime Scene) in the center of the playing area. Deal 5 cards face down to each player. Then place the remaining Evidence Locker, face down, to one side of the Crime Scene.

Bad Cop (Frame a suspect) All cards are in play - so shuffle the full deck and then follow the same set up as Good Cop, deal 7 cards to each player and you're ready to go.

Detectives play the game by discarding or playing cards on their turn, choosing between fair and foul play cards. The winner is the Detective who determines who the murderer is and has the killer in their hand when making an accusation.
publishers: After Dark Murder Mystery, Foul Play Games

name: Goat Yoga Party Game
description:
In this hilarious party game, players perform real yoga poses while completing ridiculous challenges with an inflatable goat. From balancing the goat on your head to batting it in the air, to bleating the tune to a song...your game night is sure to be filled with positive vibes and laugh-out-loud fun! Show us your moves! Share your pics and tag #GoatYogaPartyGame!

—description from the publisher

name: 7 Wonders: Leaders – Cédrick & Thomas Promo Card
description:
At the end of the Age when this card enters play, before the Resolution of Military Conflicts phase, choose one of the two following effects:

Either the Military Conflict phase doesn’t happen at all and no players take any Military Victory or Defeat tokens.
Or all players complete the Military Conflict phase twice.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: Disparity Trap
description:
Disparity Trap: The Socially Conscious Board Game is a game where player can learn how race as a system impacts those of us who live within the United States. Disparity Trap can bring conversations about race to effective levels whether played at home with friends and family, in professional settings, or in junior high through college-level classrooms.

The game play is like many of its kind, where your individual goal is to accrue as much wealth as possible. But where it differs is that you can play competitvely or cooperatively where you work with your fellow players to dismantle the Disparity Traps seeking to keep everyone in poverty. Within this game you also step into someone else’s shoes; to experience the disparities within an identity different from your own. Throughout the game, the dice roll correlates your identity in the game to real life statistics. So like life, the dice are in your “hands,” but the odds are not.

In the competitive version, the first play around the board wins. In the cooperative version, all players must make it to Tier 3 and obtain 3 or more wealth tiles. If, however, any 2 players are separated by more than 1 tier, the game is lost.

A print-n-play workbook is available for educators and cards have QR codes for more learning opportunities. A simplified version of the rules was released in 2024.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Adsumudi
description:
Your task is simple: Find a way to make Adsumudi's answer (the number in the center of each card) by using the other numbers on the card and any combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. To make Adsumudi's answer, you can use any two numbers (that’s easy mode), three numbers (medium mode), four numbers (getting harder!), or for true math masters, you can use all five numbers (we call that monstrously hard mode).

Each card can be played at different levels simultaneously or gradually. Work together to solve each level as you go, from easy mode all the way up to monstrously hard. Or for a little family-friendly competition, let kids of different ages play at their own level within the same game.

When a card is revealed, everyone simultaneously tries to come up with the answer displayed in the middle of the card by adding, subtracting, multiplying, or dividing a combination of the five numbers displayed around the answer number. The first person to figure out a solution says, "Adsumudi!" They then share the solution they found. If it checks out they take the card.

The first player to collect five cards wins.

—description from the publisher

name: High Noon: Marketplace Expansion Set
description:
Up the ante on the carnage and speed up the pace of the game with the Marketplace expansion! Did your enemy loot the last crate? One shot left in your shotgun? Now you can use your hard-earned gold to purchase more loot and keep your posse armed to the teeth! For the best experience, play with the starting tiles that come with Monco & McAtte, The Jenkins Brothers and The Abernathy Gang.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Player Elimination

name: Starmine Rummy Pocket
description:
Starmine Rummy Pocket is a card game from Japan for one or two players. The players are trying to set off fireworks all at once until the finale with a Starmine. This is a firework trick which is made by arranging the sections.

Starmine Rummy Pocket is part of a series of pocket games for 1-2 players, produced by the publisher JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ). Currently, there is no plan to produce a larger game of Starmine Rummy.
user summary

A lot of fireworks are shot off incessantly. The sound of the whistle and the smoke and the light and the roar which roars far above the expectation.

A starmine is a firework display that features a series of fireworks that are connected together. As a pyrotechnist, you aim to create the most memorable starmine of all.

The starmine consists of three columns (opening, main and finale). Place the firework card combinations in all three rows to complete the starmine. It is important to take your time to collect all the cards in order to create the best starmine, but the highlight of the starmine is the continuous firing! You can't just sit back and collect fireworks, because your rivals will be setting them off one after another. Try to complete your fireworks before the deck runs out and all the fireworks are set up.

フィナーレまで一気に花火を打ち上げろ。 役を揃えてつくる仕掛け花火。

多数の花火を絶え間なく打ち上げる。
鳴り続ける笛の音と立ち込める煙。そして予想よりもはるか上空に轟く光と轟音。

スターマインは、複数の花火を連結して打ち上げる、連射が特徴の仕掛け花火です。
あなたは花火職人として、誰よりも心に残るスターマインの打ち上げを目指します。

スターマインは、３つの列（オープニング、メイン、フィナーレ）で構成されます。
３つ全ての列に花火カードを組み合わせを配置してスターマインを完成させましょう。

より良いスターマインを完成させるには、じっくりカードを集めることが大切ですが、スターマインは連射が見どころ！ライバルも次々に花火を設置していくため、ゆっくりと花火を集めてばかりはいられません。 山札が尽き、全ての花火が設置されてしまう前に花火を完成させ、ライバルよりも印象的なスターマインを打ち上げましょう。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Joy
description:
Bring on the dice! Joy is a turbulent running game for the whole family, in which you compete against each other in 2 teams and collect valuable elements in the form of cubes to be the fastest to bring them back to the common starting field.

Use run cards to skillfully move your pieces across the board and collect the coveted cubes. Beating the figures of your fellow players is explicitly allowed!
Joy cards give you a variety of tactical actions to give your team an advantage or to slow down your opponents.

Thanks to the numerous possible combinations and the random arrangement of the elements at the beginning of the game, no two games will ever be the same.

The team that is the first to deliver all the elements it is looking for wins the game.
But beware: collusion is forbidden!

What are you waiting for? On your mark, get set - Joy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Movement Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: Slaget om Amager
description:
Now you have the chance!
To own, dominate and rule Amager! Complete missions as Amagercan, Rocker or Rich Scholar, and set the rules for those who control Amager.

Hand out amagerkys and land at Flyvergrillen
You can land on special fields such as Amagerkys, Demolition (tear down a building), The Airport, Christiania and Flyvergrillen, e.g.

The game contains fun and recognizable Destiny cards from everyday situations at Amager, and there is plenty of action when Amagercans fight for power against Rockers and Rich Scholars.

You can win the game by owning property, get the other player bankrupt or by completing the missions on the mission cards.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

name: Boom Again
description:
A pop culture trivia game that takes players on a nostalgic road trip through the memories from the Baby Boom era: from poodle skirts to mini skirts; The Twist to Disco; I Love Lucy to SNL; and hopscotch to protest marches.

How to Play Boom Again
Divide the players into two teams.
Put one token on each center section of the game board.
Pick a category – any category.
Someone from the other team will read you a question.
If you get it right, “tug” the token for that category one step closer to your team’s side of the board.
If the other team chooses the same category, they can “tug” that same token back one space toward their side.
Play tug-of-war trying to pull tokens off the board.
The first team to collect three tokens WINS!

Game Contents
Two card boxes filled with 2,244 questions
6 Boomer tokens:
Metal Skate Key
“Students For Kennedy” Button
45-RPM Record Insert
Vietnam Era Dog Tag
Roach Clip
Milk Bottle Cap

name: Mint Bid: Kickstarter Exclusive Promo Cards
description: This promo pack was included as an exclusive extra for backers who supported the Kickstarter for Mint Bid. It contains two new location cards: Candy Shop, whose mints count as all colors for matching with adjacent locations; and Seating Shift, which causes players to change places around the table.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Betting and Bluffing

name: Defending Ruins: Pavlov's House
description:
Get the game at wargame vault:https://www.wargamevault.com/product/386322/Defending-Ruins-Pavlovs-house?fbclid=IwAR2TX18VDh3WD2Txc1Zn8ZwAexKyW3EfM0YUggDlRrqdjCJFSuowYVDZKAY

This is a single player Roll And Write mechanics game with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

The German invasion of Stalingrad absorbed a great deal of military and human material for the defense of this city stationed on the Volga, defense is vital and it will be fought in any corner. Pavlov´s house or the lighthouse is an important point on the of January 9 square, if you miss this point you will probably miss a large part of the city. Defend her to the death.

name: Pikti
description: Pikti is a fast, funny and reflexive game! Get rid of your deck as quickly as possible by matching the pictures on the cards to the indicated categories, and stay ahead of the others on your way to victory! Many variations of the game guarantee hours of fun. A fast-paced game with pictures in the lead role.

name: I Would Destroy The Ring
description:
A nerdy expansion deck. From space odysseys to long walks through magical lands, this deck brings you 200 exclusive cards that you won't find anywhere else and can be played as a stand-alone.

—description from the publisher

name: Risk & Reward
description:
Place your bet. Roll the dice. Correctly guess your opponent's chances and reap the rewards. Otherwise, it's your loss. Can you balance Risk & Reward?

—description from the publisher

name: Looney Tunes: Looney Boom
description:
Each player takes the role of a Looney Tunes character in a game of hot potato where the potato is an ACME bomb.
In these funny game, there is no winner, only one loser: the one who explode the bomb.
Every player takes turns trying to pass the bomb ahead without exploding, using several character abilities and, obviously, the ACME products.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Matricás Laci: Kapj el!
description:
Matricás Laci quietly sneaks around. No one’s s looking. Perfect. Time to steal some sweets and cakes. Only that funny haired Sárika wouldnt have eyes everywhere. She always informs the police about Laci’s mischieves.

This is a hidden role bluffing game in which you take the role of either Laci or Sárika. The goal is to collect the most sweets for your team. You play cards secretly then resolve the actions after shuffling. A policeman takes out one Laci. One Laci can carry two sweets. The rest of the sweets go to Sárika’s team. Later you can put in special cards to make the game more exciting.

Based on the Matricás Laci stories by Adrienn Vadadi

name: Tick Tack Bumm Pocket
description:
As with the other editions of Tick Tack Bumm (aka Pass the bomb), speed is the most important factor in the pocket version. Here, however, no bomb goes from hand to hand, but everyone always plays at the same time! The bomb at Tick Tack Bumm Pocket can be found on some of the cards to be turned on: In this category it is important to find a word as quickly as possible that contains the letter combination you are looking for. Poetry fans have the advantage of looking for a suitable rhyme word. And with the magnifying glass symbol, a word that matches the respective category is required. If you play fast-paced and with brains, you quickly get closer to the goal of first discarding all cards and thus winning the game.

—description from the publisher

name: X-Ceter-O x X
description: This game is a mash up between X-ceter-O and Tic Tac Toe times ten; it's played on a grid of nine Tic Tac Toes (like Tic Tac Toe times Ten) and requires winning three games of Tic Tac Toe in a row, but using the rules of X-ceter-O on each of the Tic Tac Toe fields.

name: Bingo Dice Game
description:
Roll 7 dice, then each player in turn picks one or two dice to cross off the boxes on their player sheet, following restrictions for the different colours (eg blue scores go in descending order).
Play til one player has filled in all the boxes of one colour.
Each colour scores differently and awards different bonuses.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2020 Planeswalker Deck: Chandra, Flame's Fury
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

No matter who she's fighting, Chandra definitely has a favorite tool: fire! Blaze away your opponent's life total and swarm them with creatures before they can recover.

Contents: 1 ready-to-play 60-card deck featuring a foil Planeswalker card, 1 Core Set 2020 booster pack, 1 strategy insert, 1 Magic reference guide, 1 MTG Arena code card, 1 tuck box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: The Kraken
description:
Welcome to 1538, in the middle of the 16th century in Holland, where the Empire needs to explore new lands in order to find new trade routes. All the interests of the crown are now in your hands with your decisions in this adventure through the seas, where you can find treasures in other confines, but beware that the sea has many dangers and fears such as meeting the terrible monster of the Kraken.

In an adventure and decision-making game, you must get the highest number of stars in the fewest number of moves presented in 3 independent adventures in different years, 1538, 1542, and 1548 in print and play format.

In order to move about the map, throw the dice. Next, find ‘Start’ in the top row (on the navigation bar around the map) and count the number of cells you’ve thrown. For example, if you find yourself on cell 5L this will mean that you can move 5 cells to the left and 2 cells to the right. The L in 5L stands for left, you can move in the opposite direction, but only half of the cells are specified by the number. When you are moving about on the map, you may encounter a question mark ‘?’. If you happen to land on it, you will partake in a random event. Take notice that the map contains Krakens, fish, and ships. They have damage and hp number written next to them. When you land on a cell with one of those things, you will have to battle what’s on it. The battle will be decided by throwing the dice. The purpose of the game is to collect more stars in fewer moves. You will earn the number of stars as written next to it. Keep in mind, that if the star is within a red square, you’ll have to fight the boss guarding that terrain first.

The game comes in 6 different languages, something that makes it reach more patrons and is not limited by language, as well as low ink and color versions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Exploration, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Random Production

name: Zauberberg: Die gute Fee
description:
The fairy godmother (Die gute Fee) is a postcard-sized promotional giveaway for the game Magic Mountain to cut out.

Once per turn, the active player can place the fairy on any intersection that is not the same color as the drawn wisp. In this way, the will-o'-the-wisp can be directed more easily.

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series III – Scenario 14: Save the Spacewhales
description:
Two cosmic adventurers are in a tricky scenario and must work together. By rolling and manipulating dice for special abilities and combos, you can be the one that guides them to victory.

Save the Spacewhales is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.


This scenario was released as part of the Numbsters Kickstarter.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: フルーツ＆フルーツ ホリディ （Fruit & Fruit Holiday）
description: In this game, tricks win the prior trick. The trump suit changes whenever a “7” is played. Each card has either a positive point value, negative point value, multiplier, or special star (which increases the chances of winning the last trick).

name: People Friendly Game
description:
“Kampo Therapy” is a Kampo medicine brand sold at pharmacies and drugstores. As health consciousness increases and self-medication is emphasized, we are developing brands with the desire to use Kampo medicine as a gentle companion to your precious daily life. Kampo medicines have an image of being difficult to understand, but we have devised easy-to-understand packages so that customers can pick them up according to their symptoms and concerns.

"Kampo Therapy", which was born in 2006, will celebrate its 15th anniversary this year. In the midst of rapid changes in lifestyles and values, we plan the first card game for Kracie Yakuhin, "A game that makes you kind to people," with the desire to create a society where everyone can live their own way.・Developed. It is a content that thinks about the "symptoms" and "worries" of the body, which have not been the subject of communication so far. In this game, the players are divided into "people who are unwell" and "people around them", and the "people who are unwell" who are unaware of their physical condition are called by the "people around them". This is a game that aims to become aware of your symptoms using the therapy word as a hint.

Especially for women, there are many cases where it is difficult for them to confide in their health concerns, even to close people, and they do not understand well. Depending on the group you play this game with, such as family, friends, and partners, different discoveries and new understandings may be born. We hope that by having people enjoy "being gentle", many people will deepen their understanding of each other, and that it will be an opportunity for a "diversity society" where everyone can live in their own way.

"People who are unwell" draw one from 45 types of "symptom cards" with various symptoms and hit it on the forehead so that it can be seen by all players other than yourself. Let the "people around you" look at the "symptom card" of the "unwell person" and apply the [therapy word] according to the method written on the "approach card" to have them notice the symptoms.

Let's say kind words according to the approach card

"People around you" apply [therapy words] to "people who are unwell" in a method based on 9 types of approach cards. In addition to “experience/empathy,” “onomatopoeia,” and “concern,” the approach cards also include “Narikiri” cards that let you pretend to be your boss, child, or lover. Let's look at. However, when using [Therapy Words], please be aware that words that include the name of the symptom cannot be used.

It's good to cooperate with everyone, it's good to compete, let's find your own way to play!

"People who are not feeling well" use the "therapy words" given by "people around" as hints, and while looking at the symptom list, answer what the "symptom card" they have is. You can only answer once. It is a success if the "person with poor physical condition" can guess their own "symptom card". Regardless of success or failure, "a person who is unwell" will give a therapy chip to a person who thinks, "This person's words were kind" and "He made me notice my symptoms well." increase. Repeat this while alternating the role of "the unwell person". The game has a pattern where everyone cooperates and a pattern where you win or lose, so play with your favorite rules.

name: Captivade
description:
Four notorious prisoners may have escapes from London's Pentonville Prison. A selection of highly-skilled MI6 agents have been tasked with getting them back behind bars...

In Captivade, each player plays as both an escapee and an agent simultaneously. As an escapee, the objective is to avoid being caught for the duration of he game. As an agent, the objective is the re-capture the other escapees within the allotted number of weeks. You may work with your fellow agents to do this, but note that each agent believes that a different escapee was imprisoned unfairly and will wish to help them evade re-capture.

---

Played over 6-10 weeks (rounds), travel around the globe, help your allied escapee evade recapture by opponents' Agents, while also trying to track down opponents' Escapees. You can work with other players to track down Escapees, but be careful as each Agent is secretly helping one Escapee to evade capture! Agents can only travel along sanctioned routes and must always show where they are. Escapees travel hidden, along all routes, including flights if they can afford it, but might be seen moving and have to reveal their previous locations.

Capture all other players' Escapees before the end of the allotted number of weeks to win the game!

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Musse & Helium
description:
This game utilizes essentially a roll and move mechanism, but some differently for four separate stages of the game. The first stage allows you to collect friend tokens which can be used later for aid.
The second stage is an area where you have to roll 4-6 on the dice or lose your turn.
The third stage has two paths, where the short path has a bigger risk of drawing a card that might send you to jail.
To escape the jail or to find the cheese in stage 4, there is a stone scissor paper mini-game you must win.
The Golden Cheese is hidden in a memory like mini-game, where your friend tokens allow you to look at more tiles.

—user summary

The author Camilla Brincks world of Musse and Helium is now a board game. Enter this fantastic world and help them in the battle against the mean pidgeon hunters. It takes guts, cunning and a little bit of luck with the dice to find the Golden Cheese. A lovely and exciting game that requires the kids attention and focus. Fun for all treasure seekers of all ages!

—description from the back of box (translation)

name: 7 Wonders: Societas Pictorium Guild Promo Card
description:
At the end of the game, gain 1 victory point for each different card color in your city.
First distributed at the Festival international des jeux (FIJ) 2023, in Cannes.

name: Romance
description:
Are you nostalgic for the days when romance meant making a mix-tape for someone? Feelings could be shown through only music and the decorations on a cassette tape.

Romance (ロマンス) is a reverse butting game. In most butting games, players try to avoid making choices that match those of other players, but in Romance, you try to match with exactly one other player. The game includes 56 cards with 8 different scenes or situations, and each card has a combination of scenes printed on both sides. The creates 28 possible combinations, and there are two of each combination in the deck. There are also cassette player cards where players will stack their scored cards. If you wish to play a 2-player game, the game includes rules for a dummy player.

Following the draw each turn, all players choose a card from their public hands and simultaneously play it. Any matching cards with the same situation showing are stacked together, and cards are drawn until there are as many situations on the table as there are players. Players then simultaneously select a situation. If exactly one player choose a situation, the card or cards go in their reserve. If three or more players have a matching choice, those cards remain in the play area. But if exactly two players choose a situation, they will score those cards. Once players have finished these steps, they may flip their entire public hand over so that the other side is now visible or return their hand to the deck and redraw.

Players place any scored situation cards on the cassette player cards that include both of their player colors. They score any cards from the stack in the center of the table, any visible matching cards from the players' hands, up to one card with a hidden matching side from each player, and any matching cards from their reserve. Each card will be worth one point. Once any cassette player has 10 cards stacked on it or the draw deck runs out of cards, players will add up their points from all cassette players that match their color. The player with the highest score wins.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Snowcrest
description:
Deep in the remote mountains of a snowy land, holy ones seek to rediscover powerful knowledge that has been lost for centuries. Not only are the ancient scrolls hidden, but they are said to be protected by magical beasts. Through offerings, meditation, and cultural development, they believe the knowledge may be revealed, then peace and prosperity will be restored throughout the land.

In Snowcrest, you lead your village and its monastery towards enlightenment. Control a unique faction of priests, farmers, and laborers. Build structures, tend the barley fields, harvest juniper from the forest, present offerings, become lost in meditation, and uncover the secrets of a bygone age. Overcome the monstrous guardians of this knowledge and bring peace and prosperity to the snowfields.

At the end of the game, players tally up points to determine the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Monopoly: Roblox 2022 Edition
description:
The imaginative worlds of Roblox meet the Monopoly board game! In this edition, players get to buy, sell, and trade some of their favorite Roblox experiences. Instead of properties, players collect Games, Dev Teams, and Game Promotions in their quest to outlast their opponents. Collect Robux for a daily login bonus, sell limited items, deck out avatars, or get bloxxed by noobs. There's no telling what the next roll of the dice will bring

Players move around the board as some of their favorite Roblox Icons - Bloxy Award, Classic Noob, Domino Crown, Mr. Robot, Builderman's Construction Hat, or Dominus.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: The Secret of Eldorado: The print & play escape game
description: The Secret of Eldorado is a 90 minutes long printable escape room to play with your friends. Follow the progress of the expedition through the companion app, solve puzzles, and help the expedition reach the lost Eldorado before it is too late.

name: Modrá kráva
description:
Modrá kráva (Blue Cow) is an reaction party game where nothing is certain and words do not reflect reality. Basically, it's simple - just turn over a card and say what's on the card. Is there a blue cow? But what if blue is actually green and the cow is actually a dog?

Players take turns flipping over animal cards from the deck and saying what animal is shown on the card and what colour it is, taking into account all the rules in the game - for example:

If the following rules are in play and a player draws a card with a BLUE DOG on it, he must say RED COW:
DOG = COW
BLUE = RED

If any other player feels that the active player has made a mistake, they will announce it and then they proceed to check all active rules. If the player actually made a mistake, he loses a life. If everything was correct, the player who announced the mistake loses a life. When a player looses his last life, they are eliminated from the game.

There are also special cards in the deck, that will force you to either make additional combinations of the rules or change the existing ones.

After all cards from the deck has been flipped over, the round is over. Shuffle the discard pile to make a new deck so the new round can begin.
The game ends when there is only one player left or after four rounds.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Word Drop
description: A social party game where you are assigned a word that you must drop during a 3 minute conversation with the other players. But be careful! At the end of the conversation if the other players are able to guess what the word was within three guesses, you lose! Luckily you have one partner who can guide the conversation the right way.

name: Nut Nut Squirrel!
description:
Those pesky squirrels are after your hard earned stash of nuts, seeds, and pinecones! Be the lucky person with the most cards at the end of the round to win this game of choice, chance, and strategy.

Shuffle the deck of stash cards with 8 squirrels. The first player begins flipping over as many cards as he/she dares from the deck (each player MUST flip at least one card on each turn). The player may choose when to stop flipping and pass to the next player at any time. The object is to flip over as many cards as possible without unearthing a squirrel which will steal your stash! If any of the other players have accumulated stash cards during a round where someone flips over a squirrel, they get the reward of banking their nuts, seeds, and pinecones. After the deck is depleted, players count their cards to determine the winner. For more challenging play, add more squirrels! We've included 15 total squirrels to amp up the fun, or should we say frustration!

—description from the publisher

name: Tapsi, Flo & Co
description:
Run, jump - bring toys!
The dog children Flo and Flocke romp in the garden with the cat children Tapsi and Tine. They hop around wildly and jump over each other. The children help them with this. There is a toy reward for each animal skipped. Whoever collects the most toys wins.

name: Puzzle Quick
description:
More sea in a row
Great jigsaw fun in a compact gift format: Puzzlefix from HABA – the colorful puzzle for the whole family. A close look is required for the detailed puzzle game from 4 years. If you keep an overview and show nerves of steel, you have a good hand. Because fast puzzles bring many wooden fish. And whoever collects the most fish wins the maritime children's game from HABA.


The name says it all: Puzzlefix from HABA
Fast-paced puzzle game for 2 to 4 children aged 4+
simple rules, fast game rounds
Placement game with a great picture of the ocean and cute wooden fish


—description from the publisher

name: Pac-Man Card Game
description:
The PAC-MAN card game is a fun twist on the classic arcade game. Take control by bidding for turn order and playing PAC-MAN cards to claim the MAZE and BONUS cards. Each one you claim earns you points. The player with the most points after all BONUS cards have been revealed, wins the game!

—description from the back of the box

name: You're Cancelled
description:
You're Cancelled is a party game that creates hilarious moments when culture and context collide. The goal of the game is to get yourself cancelled three times.

The game is played in the same format as Apples to Apples or Cards Against Humanity. Each round one player will be the judge or "The Offended." The Offended will select one card from each of the following piles: Background, Status, and Occupation. Together these cards will form the role that the Offended must use to judge the phrases submitted by other players.

Each player will have a hand of 6 phrase cards. From their hand they will pick the phrase that they believe will be most offensive to The Offended, and pass it, face down, to The Offended. Once all players have submitted a card, The Offended will shuffle the cards then read each one aloud. Next, The Offended picks the card that most offends the role they have selected and then says "You're Cancelled" to whoever submitted that phrase.

After the round, all players who submitted a phrase card will draw a new card. The player to the left of The Offended becomes the The Offended for the next round. Play continues until one player gets cancelled three times.

—description from the designer

name: The Sackson Legacy Collection (Blue)
description:
A collection of three games pulled from the design notebooks and older releases of designer Sid Sackson.

I'm the Boss: The Dice Game sees players negotiating deals with each other in order to earn the most money. Players will be rolling dice to attempt to become experts in various subject fields and to become the Boss of deals for increasing values of cash. Experts can offer their services to complete a deal for whatever fee they can negotiate with the current Boss, or play cards to affect the outcome of a deal. Whenever a deal is reached, the Boss pays out their agreed-upon money to all who contributed to the deal, and the game ends after 8 deals have been completed. The richest player wins!

Banana Blitz is a trick-taking card game similar to Hearts where players are working to avoid taking Banana cards, but must be careful not to let any one player collect too many in a single hand, lest everyone else suffer a penalty. In addition a small set of Trump cards (that count as Bananas for the purposes of scoring) and two special cards mix up gameplay and force players to think on their feet.

Scope is a game where players compete to try and cross off the most boxes on a grid of numbers, with each player getting an identical grid and using the same set of cards to cross them off. A deck of 20 cards numbered 1-20 are shuffled and five removed at random, and each time a card is flipped players can cross off either a single box matching the number of the card or multiple boxes that sum up to the number, provided they are all vertically/horizontally adjacent. The player who has crossed off the most boxes after all 15 cards have been flipped wins!

name: Dying Message
description:
You've been murdered! Well, almost, you're not dead yet, so you want to communicate the identity of who the killer is, but you have a limited number of tools to make that happen: a small number of cards with obscure marks on them and...yourself. Yes, your dying body. Maybe you can arrange the cards in some manner to convey information. Maybe your still fingers can point to — or obscure — parts of the cards to increase the clarity of your dying thought.

If the clues are easy to understand, they will be destroyed by the culprit; if they are difficult, they will not be communicated to anyone, and your death will not be avenged, so leave an exquisite dying message.

The other players in Dying Message are detectives, and they make inferences based on the limited information available. Detectives can co-operate or confront one another, and whether the deduction turns out to be good or bad will depend upon their discussion.

name: Famous Zombies
description:
Taken from Kickstarter page

The dead have risen from their graves and their only desire is to devour brains of the living. Sure, it's fun to tell your friends you killed a zombie. But it's even better to add "Oh, you may have heard of him." That's why these zombies are famous. Will they keep coming back? Most definitely. Will humanity survive? Not even close. But if you can take out a few of the better know walking dead along the way, then you could win.

Game Play:

Players use cards to place player tokens on different spaces. Placing them on the main board allows players to search for and use weapons to kill and drive back zombies. The trap area allows your tokens to electrocute or blow up zombies that wander across the board. Intel spaces allow players to draw additional cards. The more cards that are drawn, the faster the zombies come.

Zombies are constantly springing up and slowly moving toward the brains on the main board. When they reach them, players lose player tokens. Players may regain player tokens by using cards to recruit new allies from the "Eaten" space.

Zombies will come in waves. Sometimes they give you time to set up your strategy, and sometimes they emerge so quickly and in such large numbers that you must take action immediately.

Famous Zombies is a victory point based game that can be learned quickly and has enough choices to make strategy the most important factor in winning.

name: A Nightmare on Elm Street: The Freddy Game
description:
A game where you use your wildest imagination . You put cards together to make up a story that moves you through Freddy's house. You have to get Freddy before he gets you...the problem is you don't know which player is Freddy! Collect weapons and special cards & see if you can do away with Freddy! 3 or more players. Ages 8 and up.

A complete game includes: Gameboard, 3 Walls, 8 cardboard Character playing pieces, cardboard Freddy playing piece, 52 black-backed Cards, 58 white-backed Cards, die & instructions.

name: Shaboom!
description:
Face off against your opponents in a series of challenges sure to test your speed and agility. Actions that anyone can do-it all comes down to who can do it first. Flip It, Stack It, Spell It, Roll It - SHABOOM!.

To play, flip over a card. If it's an Event card, follow the instructions on the card. The illustration on the card shows you which pieces to use and how to use them. The first player to successfully complete the challenge gets to keep the card.

Last Out cards play the same as Event cards, but you simply don't want to be the last player to complete the event, otherwise you have to return one of your collected cards to the deck.

Boom Laws cards don't require any competition, but they do put a restriction on the next Event or Last Out card to be drawn. For instance, you might have to put your right hand on your neighbor's shoulder while trying to roll even numbers using all five of your dice.

The first player to collect 10 cards wins.

name: Star Fighter
description: Players try to escort their star transport across the board to their waiting space port while preventing their opponents from doing the same. Players have a star fighter and star cruiser to provide escort cover and attack capability.

name: Kenakalan
description:
Kenakalan is a unique set collection family game. It features themed tour cards showing photographs of Bali, wild cards and wise and wicked monkey cards. Kenakalan means 'mischief' in Indonesian. There are 98 cards total. The number of cards in play is adjusted to suit the number of players. Play time is between 15 and 30 minutes.

Each player has a different-colored shop front on which to collect finished sets (tours). The tours must be different in number and theme. The first player to complete all of their sets is the winner.

Players can take one action during their turn. At the beginning of the game, their choices are rearranging or taking cards from a central display of five cards or taking the top card off the deck. Finished sets can be laid down at the end of a player’s turn. As the game progresses, players can use their action to pick up a completed tour. On a subsequent turn they can lay it back down with additional cards to increase the size of that tour.

Wise monkeys, drawn from the deck, allow players to take two different actions in their turn, such as rearranging and then taking from the display. Wise monkeys can be used immediately or kept for a more convenient time. Wicked monkeys can also appear from the deck but cause immediate havoc, for example by stealing a wild card from a player’s shop front. Holding fewer cards protects players from certain wicked monkey effects, in which case the monkey is passed to the first eligible player. However, to win you often have to take the risk of holding a large hand.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Travel
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: True or False
description: Card came with two true or false questions per card. Questioner reads both, decides which is less likely to be answered correctly and asks that question. If the answerer answers correctly the point and card go to the answerer. If the answer is incorrect the card/point stays with the questioner.

name: Sumo Arena
description: Sumo Arena is a tongue-in-cheek multi-player simulation of Sumo wrestling. Each turn players simultaneously reveal a card that moves their wrestler on a circular-shaped hex board. If another wrestler is in your way, they get pushed back. If they are pushed out of the ring, they are out. Last man standing wins. There are also ways to "charge", and "rest".
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Survivor Trading Card Game
description:
Strategy game based on the original "Survivor" TV Series

The Upper Deck's Survivor Trading Card Game is a game for two players.There is a 60 cards deck from which players choose their castaways and then they pit them in direct competition. Only one can capture the Immunity Idol and stay on the island during each test.
Players compete in immunity Challenge mini-games and have to manage and appoint their Food and Alliance cards.
You have to Outwit, outplay and outlast your opponent in order to manage to survive and win.

During each of the immunity chalenge mini games, players have the opportunity to vote off an opponent's Castaway. Nothing is certain though since Fortune and Item cards come into play and the fate of any survivor is uncertain until each game round is over.
Strength, wits, endurance, speed, accuracy, balance, swimming, and politics are all elements the Castaways must use in their quest to become the reigning survivor.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Office Scandal
description:
Office Scandal!

The Game of Office Politics

Office Scandal is an easy-to-learn strategy game where you and the other players are coworkers competing to become the boss of your incredibly immoral office environment. In order to succeed at your workplace, you need to do whatever it takes. You may end up dating the boss's daughter, getting another player demoted for using the office equipment inappropriately, or busting someone for embezzling. During each round, anyone who is your boss gets to boss you around. The player who earns the most money wins.

Includes 52 High Quality Playing Cards.

Add a second deck for 7-12 players.

name: Six-Word Memoirs
description:
In Six-Word Memoirs, teams use SMITH Magazine's famous storytelling form to guess the names of famous people, places, and pop culture icons. Teams use imagination and quick word-writing wit to create and identify six-word descriptions on more than 1000 different topics.

Can you describe George Washington, Lindsay Lohan or the City of San Francisco in exactly six words? You will need to if you want to win Six-Word Memoirs by University Games. The game invites teams of players to battle for excellence in defining and deciphering famous topics of people and places in exactly six words. For example, do you know who, “Julie’s mom, wife of Tricky Dicky” would be? If you guessed Pat Nixon, then you’ve got it.

Six-Word Memoirs is the creation of Larry Smith’s online storytelling community, SMITH Magazine. Smith first introduced the concept of describing a person in just six words on his web community and in one of the first Twitter feeds in 2006. He called the form the “Six-Word Memoir” and this simple way to define a life went on to become New York Times bestselling book, Not Quite What I Was Planning in 2008. Now the wildly popular concept jumps to life in a competitive team-based game.

name: Age of Steam Express
description:
Want to enjoy a game of Age of Steam, but don't have the time? Try this dice variant, which plays in about 30 minutes, instead!

This takes the main elements of Age of Steam (the special actions, building track, and delivering goods) and distills them down to a Yahtzee-type game playable by 2-4 people. There is no board, there are no auctions, and there's no permanent track built. Instead, you just get 10 dice and 3 rolls each turn.

This is a work in progress, so all feedback is welcome.

name: Gameshop Express
description:
2 players, 5-10 minutes

This game will be a featured giveaway promo at Games Unlimited in Pittsburgh during the 2011 Holiday Season.

Object: As employees of Games Unlimited, it is your job to get the hot new eurogames delivered to the store in time for the holidays and into the hands of waiting gamers. The first player to ship one of their packages from Europe to Games Unlimited wins the game and gains all the gamer glory.

Play: Players take turns shipping either of their 2 packages from Europe to Pittsburgh. Each player rolls the 3 dice up to 3 times. Any die/dice may be set aside each roll, but once set aside, may not be re-rolled. Players are trying to roll combinations of particular dice to match the next transportation type shown on the path: means you must roll three airplanes (6) on the dice to move one package on to that space on the shipment path. Players may choose which shipment path they start on when first shipping a package. After all 3 rolls, the values on the dice may be used to move one or more spaces as long as the number on the space equals the dice rolled. Packages may not be placed on an occupied space.

Wild/Blocker Markers: Players may use the wildcard/blocker markers to do one of two things in the game:
1. As a wildcard, substituting for one of the required dice values desired at any time during the 3 rolls. If you use a wildcard you must give the marker to the other player who then places it on their Transport Track on the space matching the wildcard value (ex. Player 1 uses a wildcard marker sitting on their airplane (6) transport type. They give this marker to Player 2 who then places it on their (6) space. If the transportation space is occupied that player may place it on another transportation type of their choice.
2. As a blocker, placing the marker on any space along any shipment path as long as it matches the color of the transportation type on the shipment path. Any player may remove a blocker by rolling any 3 of a kind and not moving any of their packages.
