If successful, they place the marker on their Transport Track or (if occupied) on another transportation type of their choice.

If at any time the shipment path splits into several paths, players may choose which path to continue along.

Win: The first player to reach (GU), the Games Unlimited store space in Pittsburgh, with one of their packages, wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Electronic Sea Battle
description:
Each player has a fleet of ships which they may position both horizontally and vertically on their own playing grid. The players then take turns trying to sink their opponent's ships by firing missiles at them. The player who successfully sinks their opponent's fleet first, wins the game.

The Radio Shack SEA BATTLE game is the modern electronic successor to the well-known Sea Battle game. Two people can play against each other or one player can play against the computer. Play the Traditional Game as well as several exciting new variations such as:

Live Action Game with scoring: Quickest to the draw wins the right to fire.

Salvo Game: Each side fires 5 shots in a row.

Advanced Game: Players get to choose their fleet size.

Solo Game: Play against the computer!

name: Trivial Pursuit: DVD for Kids
description:
From the publisher:

Join your hosts, Brad, Bobby, Mitch and Lewis for 12 hysterical episodes of head-to-head question-and-answer fun. Test your knowledge in 6 different categories. Answer the questions correctly and you collect a wedge. If you have the most wedges at the end of the game you win! Hurray!
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game, Trivia

name: Knock Down, Drag Out: The Wild West Fighting Game
description:
from the back cover:

Let Loose in Cowskull Gulch!
It seems another free-for-all has erupted in The Thirsty Cactus, Cowskull Gulch’s only saloon. Knock Down, Drag Out lets you join the hectic melee of a Wild West bar fight. The rules are brutally simple and the action is fast-paced!
Punch, kick, and club your opponents-- be the last patron standing to win!

Components: 54 cards, a six sided die

In this game, each player has a character card with two sides: Healthy and Hurt. Each player starts out Healthy, with the Healthy side of the character card face up in front of them.

Each player draws three cards from the deck to form a starting hand. These cards describe various attacks (e.g. Punch, Kick, Uppercut), actions (e.g. Duck, Play Possum), or items (Firewater Bottle, Broken Chair Leg). As the game progresses, players may opt to spend their turn drawing more cards. The goal of the game is to be the last character standing in the saloon.

Players take turns attacking each other as the game proceeds. A punch, for instance, will injure the target on a d6 roll of 5+, while a kick will injure the target on a roll of 4+. If your target is injured, they flip their character card over to the "Hurt" side. If they are injured twice (before being healed), then they are knocked out.

A KO'd character falls to the floor (i.e. they push their character card into the center of the table). KO'd characters are in danger of being Tossed Out of the saloon (i.e. out of the game), if they cannot manage to get healed before this happens.
categories: American West, Card Game, Fighting, Humor

name: Pictionary Pocket
description:
As a boiled down version of it's bigger brother Pictionary Pocket has the same basic game play.
One player draws pictures, inspired by cards with different categories on them, and their team mates need to guess what has been drawn. If they do in a minute, they can go again, otherwise the other team has a go. Different categories score differently, whichever team reaches 10 points first, wins. Different to other versions of Pictionary, in this games a card draw decides which category is used by the player, not a die throw.

—user summary
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Mattel, Inc., Rewe

name: Carpathes
description:
From the publisher's page

All men and women shiver as the vampires start hunting.

Carpathes is a card game where every player is a Master Vampire, aiming to dominate all other vampires in play and turn them down into slavery.

Therefore, one has to hunt humans in order to gain enough of their precious blood which allows you to attack your opponents, because if you don't, they certainly will attack you.

Spend well the precious blood you have, (ab)use your slaves well, prevent them from freeing themselves and of course: show absolutely no remorse, because you will only regret it.

Are you ready to change into a vampire? Then do not hesitate any longer and try Carpathes, a game with many unexpected twists and turns.

name: Zero Zap
description:
The object of this game is to score Sets and Runs of cards and trying to go out first. First to score 50 wins.

Each player is dealt 7 of the 108 cards. On your turn, you either draw 1 or 2 cards, or pick up one or more cards from the playing area (more on this later). Then you play your sets (3 or 4 cards of same color and value) and runs (3 to 7 consecutive cards of the same color) or increase already played sets and runs. Finally, you must discard a card; special cards are truly discarded once their effects are resolved; the other cards are discarded to the playing area, slightly overlapping each other in sequence. When you pick up a card from the playing area, it must be used to play a run or set and you must pick up any cards that follow it (were discarded after it).

Going out scores a 5-point bonus and ends the round. All played sets and runs score (sets are worth 2 per card; runs are worth 1 per card); cards left in hand penalize you 1 point per card.

The number cards (84) come in 3 colors and run from 1 to 7 (there are four of each). Wild cards (6) can replace any number card but cannot be played to form their own sets or runs. Double cards (3) are used to double the value of all of your sets and runs of a given color. The Special cards (14) do various things such as reshuffling the draw and discard decks, stealing a set, run or double, giving a card away, etc. The Zero Zap card (1), if left in your hand when someone goes out, zaps your score for that round to zero (Yikes!). However, if played as a Special to go out, it zaps someone else's (of your choosing) round score!

name: Monopoly: Fifa World Cup 2006 Germany
description: The 2006 World Cup edition of Monopoly. All the national soccer teams that participated in this sporting event are represented on the board.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, The Op Games

name: Bastion
description:
Bastion is a children's game where the aim is to be the first hero to reach the top of the tower, defeat the dark knight and rescue the maiden.
Each turn the hero climbs on step up the ladder, rolls the dice and moves the black knight the corresponding number of steps around the top of the tower pushing off the ladder on the square he lands on, causing the corresponding hero to fall down and begin his climb up the ladder anew.

name: Country Club Golf Game
description: Country Club Golf Game - The Board Game (Deluxe Edition) is a simulation of an 18-hole golf game. It utilizes a double sided write-on/wipe-off game board, showing 9 "holes" on each side. Players use a direction indicator template and a club selector table to figure out where their ball lands, then mark that spot on the board with a grease pencil.

name: Camelot
description:
From the box:

(The Family Board Game for the over 10s with a touch of merlin's magic.)

Similar to snakes and ladders, but with card drawing, money and set collection.

The Objective of the game is race around the board and collect enough jester tokens and money before reaching the exit.

Players take turns to roll dice and move around the board, landing on spaces can have good or bad effects. Players continue moving around until they have collected enough jester cards, jester tokens and money to win the game, however jester cards and money are often needed to pass special spaces, to help you or to hinder your opponents.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Street Rod: the card game
description:
The game's being funded now on Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/117402901/street-rod-bu...

It's the summer of 1963 and it's time to race some hot rods. With the few bucks you have you buy yourself a simple car. By racing against other drivers you win some bucks, buy parts, and customize your car -- until you're good enough to race 'The King.'

Street Rod: the card game is based on the Street Rod video game series launched in 1989.

Each round, a player may choose one of the following actions: buy cars or car parts, race opponents from the deck, or race other players.

By buying cars or parts, a player improves the cards in his hand. The hand cards are used when racing against opponents (in the form of car cards) or other players.

When racing, first you pick the track to race on (drag race, Mulholland Drive, or Aqueduct Race). Next, determine your score on the chosen track based on the cards in your hand. The player with the highest score has the best chance to win -- but luck factors into the equation. Draw the next card from the deck and check the Bad Luck number to see whether you won the race or not.

The player who beats The King, the best opponent in the deck, wins the game!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: そういうお前はどうなんだ？(Surprise Ending)
description:
Surprise Ending simulates a murder investigation. After a party in a mansion, one character turns up dead. Everyone at the table is a suspect, and the incompetent police does not care whether they catch the murderer, as long as they can arrest someone.

The game consists entirely of cards. Each player gets a character card and a character trait card. One of the unused characters is flipped open - that's the murder victim. Some details about the victim and the way they were murdered are also randomly assigned. Each player has four face-down "exposed" cards in front of them. On a turn, flip one card in front of another player open. This reveals some information about that player which is somehow suspicious. The entire group now has 30 seconds to discuss why this player is clearly the murderer. Then the accused player has 30 seconds to defend themselves. Afterwards, they flip another player's card up, etc. Once everyone was exposed once, more information about the victim is revealed, and another round starts (with 3 players, a third round as well).
Afterwards, everyone points their finger at the most suspicious player at the table. The player(s) with the most fingers pointing at them will be arrested, draw an ending card and read out the ending of the story.
Players who pointed at an arrested player and were not arrested themselves, win the game.

name: Monkey Madness
description:
"The Crazy Coconut Grabbing Game"

An Action/Dexterity game for two players; best played on the floor. Special mallets are used to whack the base of a coconut tree. The monkey "gets mad" and throws down coconuts. Players rush to collect the coconuts by bashing them with the mallets. When struck correctly, the coconut is sucked into the mallet. The player with the most coconuts at the end is the winner. Purple coconuts are worth double.

Contents:
16 coconuts, 2 mallets, coconut tree.

For ages 3+
Some assembly required.
publishers: MB Giochi, MB Jeux, MB Juegos, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Perfect Crime
description:
This game was crowdfunded but Grublin Games dissolved before the game was published.
__________________________________________________________________________

Perfect Crime is an asymmetrical, modern day, tower defense-style bank robbery game with hidden information and tons of tension that's based on heists both real and imagined.

To set up, one player builds the perfect bank using a double-sided modular game board that's designed to give the banker maximum control over how they want to play. Aside from building the bank itself, they set up patrol routes for guards to ensure that the robbers never face the same bank twice. Once the bank blueprint is set, it needs a state-of-the-art security system that will prove impossible to defeat...or so the bank hopes.

The robber's job is to pick apart those carefully planned defenses by assembling a crew of specialists and equipping them with the tools and weapons they'll need. Robbers can choose to scout out the bank's security or go straight in for a quick smash-and-grab heist. Robbers choose which game mode to play: co-op (working together against the bank), semi co-op (kind of working together against the bank), or competitively (pretending to work together, but shooting each other in the back).
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Storytelling

name: Die Druiden
description:
Moon & Sun Druids select a new leader by moving around the circles of stones. A mix of cards and dice and symbols.

The Druids start from the Grove, in the centre of the Stone Circle. When a player begins his turn, he must move his druid, firstly, onto one of the 6 stones showing a Pentagram. This is the only space that may be moved to, from the centre area. The player throws both dice. At the beginning of the game each player has only one piece available (his Druid), therefore only one of the dice is used to determine movement. The second dice is unused until such time as the player has other game-pieces available for him to move. The meaning of the symbols on the dice dictate the type of movement allowed.
The space on which a Druid lands also affects further events. After the player has carried out all necessary actions then his turn is over. If a Druid lands on a blank stone then his turn is immediately ended and play passes to the next player.
Once a player has taken control of two or more pieces then he may apply the dice to their full potential. In this case a player can, for example, move two Spirits or one Spirit and one Druid. Naturally he will choose the optimum moves, considering the symbols on the stones and the location of other game pieces, which each piece can land on.
The player with the most points, overall, wins the game and is proclaimed the new High-Druid.

name: Philanthropist: A Window on the World of Painting
description:
Philanthropist offers people the opportunity to enjoy and learn about important paintings in Western European and American History.

The object of the game is to be the first philanthropist to perform 3 philanthropic acts.

The game contains a board (in which each space is a photograph of a famous museum), 200 cards with reproductions of paintings on them/questions on the reverse side, 20 jewels of knowledge, 36 philanthropist cards, the Art Reference Guide, 15 index cards, four player tokens, and 1 die. The components are extremely beautiful.

There are several levels of play. The questions on the art cards can be answered by multiple choice or on the "Expert" level in which the player answers the question without choices. Answering a question correctly wins a jewel token/incorrectly loses one for multiple choice, or two for Expert level. Once a player has 5 jewels they draw a philanthropist card and follow the instructions on the card.

name: You Don't Say
description:
Based on the classic game show which ran from 1963-69, the object is to guess the name of a person, place, or thing by means of incomplete sentences in which the missing last word is the clue...and that is the word you don't say!

The first team to get three points wins $100 and plays the Bonus Board, where the player has to guess the subject based on clues hidden under three lines. $300 is awarded for only using one line, $200 for two lines, and $100 for three lines.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Peg Baseball
description: Peg Baseball is a vintage game for players Ages 8 and up. Players take turns rolling the dice and then moving their pegs to the bases and on towards home plate. The game consists a pair of dice, two sets of six pegs, a shaker, and a rules pamphlet. The game was originally released in 1915, and published fairly continuously until the early 1960s.

name: Sofia the First: Magical Tea Time
description:
From the publisher

It’s time for tea with Princess Sofia! As the magical teapot blows on your tea, the color in your teacup changes! There are so many pretty treats for tea time. When the color in your teacup changes, you earn the treats on the plate of the matching color! Along the way, Sofia and the Good Fairies reward you for your proper tea time manners!

name: Black Stories: Christmas Edition 2
description:
50 black stories: crimes, corpses, murders, suicides... How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults.

One player reads the introduction (written on the front of the card) aloud. The other players try to reconstruct the whole scene (written on the back of the card) by asking yes-no questions, guessing and fiddling about.

A spooky card game just right for any party.

This is the second box of Black Stories dedicated to Christmas.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Sea-Life
description:
This is an underwater game for two to six players.
Each player has his own deck which consists of marine life and a fisherman.
Each marine life card has a set of stripes that allow players to know which fish can eat which.
A board is created using food(prey) cards.The board consists of prey giving either possitive or negative points.
The food cards are shuffled and placed in a stack in the middle of the table. Each player draws eight Food cards and adds them to his hand.
The starting player begins and sets a card face down in the middle of the table. In turn then the other players follow in clockwise and insert their card played face down on the left of the previous card. This generates a hidden row of cards.
During the second phase of the game, the first player begins again and sets this time one of his cards to food underneath a hidden playing card.
A food card must not be discarded under our own card. EAch player does the same until we have two complete rows with hidden cards on the table.
The next phase is scoring.The map tiles are successively uncovered, without changing their position. Initially the food map is resolved
When all cards have been detected and analyzed, they come back in the box. The game continues anti-clockwise.
Once all hole cards have been played and scored, the game ends. The player with the highest total wins.

name: Gute Nacht
description:
The Dream Brownie accompanies the children when it is time to go to sleep. Will everybody be in bed when the moon shines above the houses?

The Dream Brownie's star and the moons glow in the dark.

There are several games for various ages of children. The simplest one has the child find rooms matching descriptions of bedtime activities, others involve dice rolling. The object is generally to insert all the pieces in the board.

For ages 2-8.

name: Click
description:
Described on the box as ‘a gripping new dice game’ this is Waddington’s take on Yahtzee. The object of the game is to secure the highest score with eleven turns of rolling five dice.

Players first try for six combinations (straight, full, high, etc.). If they fail to score a combination they will add up the matching numbers and enter the most advantageous of them in the left hand numbers column on one of the scorecards. Players may re-roll the dice three times on their turn. On each throw the dice needed are put aside.

Combinations are only scored once each. If you fail to get a combination but have already filled in the number boxes then a zero must be entered in one of the score boxes. The ‘Click’ of the title is a combination of all five numbers the same.

name: Weißt du eigentlich, wie lieb ich dich hab?
description:
After the well-known children's book "Guess how much I love you" by Sam McBratney and Anita Jeram, Kosmos now also presents the matching game to the children's book. Just like in the book, it has to be estimated how much the little rabbit loves the big rabbit.

Before the game starts, the hare figure is assembled and placed in front of the oldest player. The cords are placed in front of the oldest players. The bunny cards come in the middle of the board and the game can start.

The game is played in rounds. First of all, all players - except for the player who is just the "little rabbit" - close their eyes. The "little bunny" then pulls a string and attaches it to the rabbit figure. In the first round, the oldest player is the "little rabbit", then always the next player in a clockwise direction. If the "little bunny" has attached the string, he calls "Guess how much I love you" and all players are allowed to open their eyes.

Players now need to assess the length of the string that the "little rabbit" has chosen. The players grab as quickly as possible one of the rabbit cards from the middle, on which always a string is shown. Of course, each string on each rabbit card has a different length, of course, if possible, you should choose the rabbit card with the right string length.

Once each player has taken a card, the "little rabbit" now determines which player has taken the right one. He takes the cord and places it on the respective cards. If a player chooses the right rabbit card, he gets a chip for it. If no player has chosen a correct card, the "little bunny" himself gets the chip. The cards come back to the middle of the table, as well as the string. Then the player to the left of the previous "little rabbit" is the new "little rabbit" and the next round begins.

The game ends as soon as a player has collected three chips. This player then automatically wins the game.

A variant suggests that players can earn an extra chip once they get the right string length and then ask, "Do you really know how much I love you?" as original as possible. As another alternative, the chip can only be awarded for the correct string length if the player brings an original explanation that no other player had before.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Novel-based

name: Bakugan Attack
description:
Unleash the power of Bakugan in a fun, fast-paced card game for the whole family!

Challenge your friends and family to a fast-paced game of Bakugan Attack! This easy to learn card game has all the heroes and action of the Bakugan Battle Brawlers tv show. Roll the dice to determine how many Bakugan to catch. Use your strategy and special cards at the right time to knock out your opponents. Use the power of your cards wisely to change the game around to your advantage. Get the correct amount of Bakugan cards to win. The power is in your hands!

name: Massacre Chess
description: Massacre chess is a variation on the game of chess in which each player plays with 8 queens, 8 rooks, 8 bishops and 8 knights. All pieces are placed randomly on the board, filling up every space, and players take turns moving their pieces according to their standard chess movements. The twist is that each player must capture a piece every turn, and to fail to do so is to lose the game.

name: Run, Run, as Fast as You Can!
description:
You can't catch me, I'm the Gingerbread Man!
Run as fast as you can through the village and over the river to safety, but be careful - everyone wants to take a bite out of you!

A race game for preschoolers, where they race gingerbread men to the finish line while being pursued.

name: Bones
description:
BoneGames produces a number of do-it-yourself free games. You download a PDF containing rules and components, and print out what is required for play.

Bones is a two player strategy game in which each player tries to be the first to get 5 squares of his colour in a vertical or horizontal row. It may seem similar to other games, but Bones has a unique aspect that makes game play very different from what you might expect! Can you deal with the overlapping of pieces better than your opponent?

The game is played on a 9x12 grid, with pieces that measure 1x2; each player gets a set of 18 pieces, but more can be made if necessary. The first tile must be played so it occupies part of the middle; later tiles can be played anywhere as long as they're entirely within the playing area and as long as it does not cover up an already played tile in one move (in other words, it's OK to cover a tile completely, but this must be done in two turns).

name: Sting
description:
This is a 'press your luck' kind of dice game...

Each person is given two dice (with numbers 1 to 4, two sides have 1's, two sides have 2's), and some chips to begin. Some chips are left in the center to form the 'pot'.

On a person's turn, he/she begins by rolling the 2 dice, examining the sum of the two numbers.

If they add up to 2, that person has been 'stung', and a chip is given to the pot, and play passes to the next player.

If they add up to 8, that person has rolled a 'sting', and gets to take 2 chips from the pot, and play passes to the next player.

If they add up to anything else, that person MUST roll again and try to roll a number equal to, or higher, than the sum of the first roll. At this point ANYONE else playing can also try to roll a sum equal to or higher. Anyone who succeeds gets 2 chips from the pot, anyone who fails loses one. If the active player ends up going it alone, and succeeds, his/her winnings are doubled. Losings are never doubled.

Play ends at a specific number of chips or when the pot is exhausted.

name: WH1CH GAM3
description:
WH1CH GAM3, a.k.a. W3LCH35 5P13L, is a small card game that can be used to determine which game your group should play next.

Each person chooses one game they wish to play, with the player who finished last in the previous game (or the host) choosing a second game. Place all of these games on the table. Each person draws a card at random, face down. The person with the lowest numbered card removes a game, then the person with the next lowest card removes a game, etc., until only one game remains on the table. Now it's time to play!

Multiple versions of WH1CH GAM3 have been published, all of which play the same and all of which have different sets of numbers in them. Shuffle one or more sets together to determine what to play when you have more than eight players on hand...

name: Chat Rat-Bia
description:
Test your deduction spirit in this wacky guessing game! Take a good look at the illustrations and be the first player to grab the rubber cat to give the word that contains the Cat or Rat sounds ... The player or the team that ends the game with the highest score wins!
—description from the publisher (translated)

Testez votre esprit de déduction dans ce jeu de devinettes loufoques! Observez bien les illustrations et soyez le premier joueur à vous emparer du chat de caoutchouc pour donner le mot qui contient les sons Chat ou Rat... Le joueur ou l’équipe qui termine la partie avec le plus haut pointage gagne!
—description from the publisher

name: The Alamo: Final Assault
description:
Can you defend the Alamo against the overwhelming Mexican forces? Use your Crockett cards wisely to defeat the attackers! Hold the Alamo and become a hero of the Mexican war.

Background:

(February 23 – March 6, 1836) The Battle of the Alamo. This was a pivotal event in the Texas Revolution. Mexican troops under President General Antonio López de Santa Anna started a 13-day siege, reclaiming the Alamo Mission near San Antonio de Béxar (modern-day San Antonio, Texas, United States), Santa Anna's refusal to take prisoners during the battle, killing most of the occupants inside, inspired many Texians and Tejanos to join the Texian Army. Motivated by their written desire to preserve a border open to immigration, and a desire for revenge, the Texians defeated the Mexican Army at the Battle of San Jacinto, on April 21, 1836, ending the rebellion in favor of the newly formed Republic of Texas.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Super Blockbusters
description:
Based on the ITV Quiz Game

Super Blockbusters
2+ Players
Ages 16 and up

Players/Teams must make an unbroken connection between their two outside colors. White plays vertically, Blue plays horizontally.
Tiles can be placed by correctly answering questions and filing in the letter hexes with the players color.

The game also includes the Gold Run which is played by the winner.

Contents
Blockbusters Playing Screen
2400 Block busters Questions; 200 question cards, 120 Questions for each letter (20 Letters)
2000 Gold Run Questions; 100 Questions Cards, 10 Questions per Gold Run
5 Yellow Letter Strips
51 Hexagonal Playing Pieces, 17 Blue, 17 White, 17 Yellow
1 Sand Timer
1 Die

name: Pictureka! Kubes Game
description:
Pictureka! rolls into 9 changeable cubes and 3 great games! The find it fast, find it first cube game!

Contents include 18 interchangeable cube halves (9 blue, 9 white), 1 game grid, 40 cards and instructions.

Each mission card tells you what to look for on the cubes.
Game 1: Split up the cubes and search for pictures on your own set.
Game 2: Everyone search all visible sides of the cubes, but don't lay a finger on them.
Game 3: Pick blue or red cubes. Spot the pictures and move all your team's cubes to the other side of the game grid first!

-Includes a 4th game--great for younger kids

name: Harem Wars
description:
Description from the publisher:

Arise as a Divine God of Lust and build the Ultimate Harem, in this competitive card game, inspired by harem style anime shows and visual novel games.

Featuring a range of Anime Tropes, your aim during play is to lay down Harem Girls in front of you to create sets of cards to make the highest total lust score and beat your opponents.

The game has easy to understand rules to allow for easy pick up and play, with 2-3 players, plus add-on sets can be included to increase variety of play or number of players in a game.

name: Spirit
description:
from the translation:

In a distant time, when magic was still on the earth, there was a ritual among the great wizards by which they measures their power. They each sent a precious gem. With the power of their mind, they raced the stone over the three continents. Ice had to be navigated, and lava chasms has to be crossed. Wizardry would allow them to change the size of the stone. The winner was the first to get his gem around the course.

The square tiles with the small gem are the game pieces. For each gem there are 4 different sizes. Each player has only one of the stones on the board at a time.

On a turn, a player moves his stone according to the size of the stone. The tile moves as many space in one direction as the size of the stone. Players can change the size of their stones during their turns. Stones that meet bump each other. The chasm is impassable, so players must build bridges across the chasm. 12 bridge pieces in 2 colors are included.

Spell cards can change or move the bridges. Bridges are also the start and ending spaces for each stone.

name: War to the Death
description:
War to the Death is a simulation of the French attempt to subjugate the Iberian Peninsula in the period 1810-1813.The game highlights the special problems that the imperial armies encountered in their conflict with the Anglo Portuguese Army, the Spanish Regular Army forces and the Spanish Patriot guerrillas.
The game also accentuates the particular supply and replacement difficulties that plagued French forces operating for an extended period of time in a hostile country defending its freedom.
Finally,the game focuses on the special command and control problems which Napoleon encountered trying to wage a remote control war in the Iberian Peninsula from París, Moscow and Germany against the Spanish people and the combined forces of Spanish Army and Guerrilas and the Anglo Portuguese (Peninsular) Army under the command of the Duke of Wellington.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Ta-Ka-Radi
description:
A balancing tower building game. Apparently based on an African game. It is very similar to Jenga, but predates it.

You build a tower out of the narrow edges of 50 wooden blocks. Each level has three blocks, and the next level is built at right angles to the previous level. Each player takes a block from below the top and transfers it to the top level. Players can use two hands, but no physical interaction between the players is allowed. The player who makes the tower fall loses. Everyone else wins.

name: Action Attraction
description:
Action Attraction is a game played with 42 magnetic marbles on a circular, 11" diameter, playing board with 31 indentations in it.

The idea of the game is very simple, each player in turn places a marble onto one of the indentations on the playing board. The first player to get rid of all his marbles is the winner.

The catch is, that because the marbles are unevenly magnetic, if you are not careful when you put a marble on the board, sometimes you will cause some (or even many) of the marbles to become attracted to each other. Any marbles that suffer this fate have to removed by the player causing the attraction, and added to his pool of marbles.

The game comes with suggestions for various alternative versions of the game.

Action Attraction can be played solo.

The game has two different skill levels which are switched between by movement of a lever on the underside of the board.

French title: MAGNET'O'BILLES
Dutch title: Actie Attractie

name: Warbeast
description:
Warbeast is first self-produced game created and illustrated by Angelo Porazzi in 1998.
The game is an alternative system of play of Warangel, 1st edition in Italy in 1996 as collectible issues.
Warbeast System is more suitable for multi-player and beginners, designed to be an easy and fast Family Game.
Warbeast Box includes the 4th Generation of Warangel, a rulebook split into 3 levels to allow children and beginners to easily approach this universe.
In the box you have a complete game compatible with Warangel, which includes nine warrior races plus the Warbeasts, which are deadly creatures that you may fight or control.
On 2006, with Warangel 10 Years Edition, 100 compatible warriors races are available and two systems of play: Warangel and Warbeast. Choose your race and the system you prefer and you'll experience fantastic matches with warriors and battlefields always new.
In Warangel 10 Years Edition find all adaptations and the pre-cut laminated counters of all these warriors as a bonus, exactly with the shape of standard Warangel counters.

Integrates with:

Warangel

name: COSMIC Super Business
description:
This game published in Poland in the years of economic crisis (last years of real socialism in central-eastern Europe) is clearly a somewhat modified clone of Monopoly. The players buy rights to colonize planets (streets) and build their bases (houses) and planetary colonies (hotels).

The differences between this game and Monopoly are:
- There are 9 not 10 areas in a row of the board thus there are 2 systems with 3 planets and 6 systems with 2 planets;
- There is no auction if a player does not want to buy a planet;
- There are no parallels to railway stations and power plants. Instead there are mining licenses (for magnetites, platinum, diamonds and uranium) and players may build mines on appropriate areas.There are also 3 transportation bases and players may build communication lines there.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Airport
description:
(Transaleted from the box in Norwegian):

Airports are, in our time, the ports to the great wide world. Hop on for an exiting travel of knowledge to all the countries in the world. Learn about peoples and test your knowledge of languages. Go to gate and experience the world!

Airport is Aschhoug's large trivia game about all the countries and peoples of the world. You may "fly" between the 6 continents and gather continent cards until you have a complete world. New categories about languages, countries, the world and airports make the game a fun and educational challenge for all adventurers.

name: G.I. Joe Card Game
description:
Object of the game is to score most points by winning Plan of Attack cards and avoiding Cobra cards (enemies).

Players must collect differnet combinations of cards according to Plan of Attack cards. f.e. 3 different soldiers, 3 different equipments etc.

The game is over if all Plan of Attack cards are played. The player with the highest score wins the game.

Contents:

108 cards

name: Hoppy Floppy's Happy Hunt
description:
The Hide and Seek Carrot Game!

In this game, 1-4 players try to collect 4 different colored carrots and place them in their basket. The bottom of the box serves as the board where the colored carrots are scattered. Player spin the spinner and use the rabbit-shaped tongs to pick up the corresponding carrot and put it in their basket.

Like the Sneaky, Snacky Squirrel game and Hi Ho Cherry O, there are also places on the spinner to lose carrots from your basket. The first player to collect one of each color of carrots wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Are You the Cultist? Party Edition
description:
It’s the roaring 1920’s. Players take on the role of Investigators into the unknown, who have travelled up into the nearby mountains to a remote mansion said to hold a terrible secret. Unfortunately, a vicious storm has blown in, trapping the investigators and knocking out both electricity and telephone. They are trapped.
Worse yet, there are those among them who have fallen prey to the worship of the dark gods they once sought to stop. These Cultists have been quietly biding their time until they could strike - and that time is now!
The Party Edition requires from 8 to 24 players, and is based on the popular party game from the USSR known as Mafia (also as Werewolf or Assassin), with its own new twists. It’s Role Madness – there are no “vanilla” characters!
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Voting

name: Royal Marriage
description:
Royal Marriage is a solitaire game played with a standard 52-card poker deck, dating from the 19th century or earlier. Players seek to reunite the Queen of Hearts, at one end of the deck, with her King, at the other, by eliminating all other cards.

To set up a game, the King and Queen of Hearts are removed from a deck, which is then shuffled. Afterwards, the King is placed on the bottom and the Queen placed on top. Cards are dealt, one by one, from the top of the deck and played next to the Queen, forming a row that allows all cards to be seen at once.

Cards can be removed one or two at a time, but only when they are bookended by two cards of either the same suit or rank. If all cards save the Queen and King are eliminated, the game is won; if cards remain and no further moves can be made, the game is lost.

Strategy comes in the form of hand management, deciding which cards to eliminate and when. Immediately discarding cards whenever possible is likely to lead to a loss; rather, cards that can easily be eliminated later -- such as those of the same suit as the King and Queen -- are often better to keep, in case they can be paired up later with other cards to eliminate some stubborn holdouts. Success or failure often depends on which cards the player can manage to hold on to for later use.

Royal Marriage can be played on a table or entirely in-hand. To play the latter, the King is placed on the top of the deck face-down, while the Queen is placed on top of the King face-up. Cards are then dealt from the bottom of the deck onto the Queen, and fanned out to show available moves.

—user summary

name: XXung
description:
RULES:
1. The first player starts the game by placing one piece anywhere on the board.
2. Players take turns placing a piece horizontally or vertically in line with the last placed piece in the game. There must not be intervening pieces of either color between the last placed piece and the newly placed piece.
3. A player wins in one of two ways: by placing five pieces consecutively in a row horizontally, vertically or diagonally, or forcing the opponent into a position where he is unable to place a piece on the board. (blocking them in with intervening pieces).

name: Mon premier 1000 Bornes
description:
"My first Mille Bornes" in English
Multiple rules for different ages.

A simple scenario speaks to all children the road to school!
The whole family moves the car to go from home to school. But beware, you must arrive before the school principal, if not the school doors will close before you even have time to enter the yard!
Game introduces for children the world of the road: signs, traffic lights etc.

name: The Addams Family Card Game
description:
This card game, based on the 60s TV show, is similar to the card game "War". The difference is that the cards have a rock-paper-scissors relationship to each other: Gomez takes Morticia...Morticia takes the children...the children take Gomez. The Lurch and Uncle Fester (Wild) cards take any other cards.

The entire deck is dealt out evenly to the players. Players take their top card and place it face up on the table. The player who turned over the highest value card wins both the cards. If cards have equal value, then each player continues playing cards face up until only one player turns over a card that matches the original cards. This player wins all the cards played.

The player who takes all the cards in the deck wins. For more than 2 players the game is played in a series of "round robin" duels.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dr. Seuss: Oh the Places You'll Go! Game
description:
Your future is full of exciting possibilities! What will you do?

Take a wild adventure through life's twisty-turns and tough choices to discover a world of future possibilities. Along the way, try to guess what future your friends and family will choose!

The wise and whimsical book by Dr. Seuss comes to life in this playful game for all ages. The perfect gift for someone celebrating an important milestone—like graduating from grade school or moving to a new town—this game gets the whole family thinking about the future and all its wondrous possibilities.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Smiley Dice Game
description:
The cards in Smiley Dice Game show 1-4 smileys in five different colors, while the five dice show six different smileys (with the red smiley not being on any card).

During your turn, first secure any cards in front of you that weren't stolen, then roll the dice and place at least one die on an open card, either one in front of an opponent or one from the cards in the general play area. (Fifteen of the thirty cards are used in a single game.) Then either take those cards and place them in front of you — if enough corresponding dice are on the card — and end your turn, or roll again; if you cannot place at least one die on your turn, don't take any cards and give the dice to your left neighbor.

Once all the cards have been claimed, whoever has the most smileys wins.

name: Nice Middle
description: Nice Middle (ナイスミドル) is Japan-glish shorthand for "Nice Middle-Aged Person". This trick-taking game exclusively for three challenges players to secretly select a numbered card between those chosen by their opponents. The cards include caricatures of well-known celebrities. Like other games in the genre, there will also be hands where you try to avoid tricks.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Japon Brand, Ohta Publishing (太田出版), Saikikaku

name: Mini-MIG
description: Travel version of M.I.G. with 380 questions in five categories (Present & Past, Entertainment & Culture, Near & Far, Sports & Other, Nature & Science).

name: Head to Head Perfection
description:
Head To Head Perfection Family Action Game
2 Players compete in a race against time!

For 2 players age 8 and up (no batteries needed)

Equipment:
Game console with timer, start/stop switch, 2 pop-up trays and 2 pop bars, and 50 geometric shapes (25 each color).

The Object:
To be the first to place your 25 shapes over their matching forms on the pop-up tray before time runs out.

First one done hits the pop-up bar to pop the other's tray!

name: Dice Club
description:
First rule of Dice Club – you do not talk about Dice Club
Second rule of Dice Club – you do not talk about Dice Club
Third rule of Dice Club – if it is your first night at Dice Club, you have to roll.

Dice Club is a board / card / dice game of bluff, fighting and mischief. Players become the members of elite Dice Club, a place where you can participate in dice games for the highest stakes. Regular frequenters, however, are accustomed to the fact that gambling brings out emotions and not only dice are being thrown there but also bottles and chairs. This is why it is not only mind and strategy that count in Dice Club but also the strength of muscles.

The game involves 3 to 6 players. The players play 2 rounds. Each round is divided into 2 phases – a poker phase and a fighting (brawl) phase. In the first phase, you should get the best possible set consisting of 6 dice. In the second phase, fists are flying and there is a clash at the arena (ring). A player who will get the highest score after 2 rounds wins. The players will have to bluff, seek temporary allies and “stab in the back” to achieve their desired goal.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Null Bock!
description: Null Bock is the game of deer mating rituals. Cards include Bucks and Does which are played to a central "arena" or to peripheral areas by each player. Those in the center must constantly better the previous buck or doe, while there are separate rules for the periphery. Points are scored by collecting doe cards. The "null bock" (zero buck) is too cool to fight and has special abilities to overcome the strongest buck.

name: Boundary
description: Abstract war/strategy game. Each player has one row of pieces deployed at one side of an 8x9 grid. An elastic band divides the board. Pieces move vertically and horizontally with the objective of placing one piece in the opponents back row. The gimmick is pieces can be eliminated by stretching the elastic band (the boundary) around an opponents piece(s) which eliminates that piece and causes the boundary to change (as that piece is removed from play).

name: Keyword
description:
Each player plays his letter blocks to the cross-word layout on the board, trying to spell the Keyword or other words or plays his letters on the squares that give him the highest score. Players should try to play out all their letters before his opponents do, for letters left in a player's hand at the end of play are counted against them.

The highest score wins the game.
publishers: Carlit, John Waddington Ltd., Juegos Crone, Miro Company, Parker Brothers

name: Schlaubär lernt zählen
description:
Part of the "LernSpiel" (English = Learning Game) series from Haba, this is a series of counting games for young children using a very cute counting string with wooden bear, 4 sets of 1-10 counting tiles (marked with dice faces, numbers, fingers & cubes) and three different dice (marked with numbers, dice faces & fingers).

The name, btw, means "Clever Bear Learns To Count".

Example of one of the 4 versions of Gameplay:

Game 1: Clever Bear's Memory

Who finds as many cards as possible showing the same number (i.e. four
fingers and four dots)? A game for any number of Clever Bears.

Game Material Needed: All cards

Preparation of the Game
The cards are shuffled face down and arranged on the table in eight rows
of five cards.

How to Play
Play in a clockwise direction. The oldest player starts and tries to find a
matching pair of numbers.
Uncover two cards one by one and announce the number represented.
• Both cards show a matching pair of numbers?
Well done! Take the cards. Then uncover two more cards.
• The two cards don't show a matching pair of numbers:
Pity! Let the others see the cards and turn them back over again. Then
it's the turn of the next player to turn over two cards.

End of the Game

The game ends as soon as all the matching pairs of numbers have been
collected. Pile up your cards: whoever has the highest pile, wins the
game.
Variation for younger children
• Select any two sets of cards with ten cards each and play Clever Bear
Memory.
• Select all cards of a specific range of numbers: for example all cards
representing the numbers One to Five.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Math, Memory, Number

name: Piraten-Duell
description: A push your luck game that is thick on theme. Game comes in a plastic bottle, which is used to not only contain the game, but to receive directions for the boat. Also features a working compass and a cute little boat with cloth sails. Colored balls are rattled around and brought to the transparent cap; these dictate ship movements and will allow a player to pick up a card. Thats the gist of the game -- pushing your luck for booty.

name: Mammut Mambo
description:
Prehistoric man was best known for hunting and gathering and not much else. No radio show hosting, no paragliding, no unicycle riding: the lives of our ancient ancestors were utilitarian and boring – or were they?

Designer Roberto Fraga doesn't think so, as in Mammut Mambo he introduces (or reintroduces?) gamers to a caveman dance craze. Each round card after card is added to the playing area, introducing more quirky gestures and moves to those already in play, creating a dance that all players must perform simultaneously. If you fail to keep the beat, you receive all the cards in play as punishment. What's more, the best mammoth-hunting clan chief gets to push his cards on another player. Whoever can best keep their head – and their rhythm – in all the confusion will win.

name: Monopoly: Aston Villa FC Edition
description:
Edition of Monopoly based on the English football team Aston Villa FC. The traditional Monopoly properties are replaced by footballers past and present.

From the publisher:
This new edition of Aston Villa FC Monopoly celebrates the historic figures of Villa's glorious past and the stars from Gerard Houllier’s modern-day squad.

With Marc Albrighton, Stephen Ireland and James Collins taking their place alongside greats like Ron Saunders, Dwight Yorke and Tony Morley.

This is a must-have for any fan of the Villans.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Clue: 24 Edition
description:
6 Suspects, 1 Traitor, 9 Weapons. . .

Intelligence has revealed an imminent attack on the U.S. that will occur within 24 hours. CTU is ordered to Lock Down. Six agents are left inside and one is the Traitor who is planning the attack. It is up to you and Jack Bauer to reveal. . .


Who the Traitor is
What attack is planned
Where inside CTU it will be launched.


Do you have what it takes to expose the Traitor and save the country?

Clue: 24 Edition the traditional Clue game with a small twist. As in regular Clue, players travel around the board to visit places to make suggestions of who might be the killer (traitor), weapon (attack-type), and place that was secretly stored in the envelope before the game began. In addition, every person has a once per game power. There is a deck of cards you get throughout the game that give you special actions and act as a timer. When the 8th clock card is drawn you lose.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: What's Missing?
description:
What's Missing? is both the name of the game and what players are trying to figure out.

To set up the game, players lay out on the table the forty objects (four each of ten different objects) in the box, and each player takes four raven tokens. While all the other players close their eyes, the active player for the round removes one object from play, hiding it in her hands under the table, for example. All of the other players then search the table to try to decipher what's missing, yelling out the answer as soon as they think they know. If correct, that player places a raven token in the box; if not, the player receives another raven token, but can continue to play that round and guess again.

Whoever runs out of raven tokens first wins! A variant for younger players reduces the number of objects on the table to thirty, that is, three of each object instead of four.
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: Bookmark Verlag, Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburger

name: Terrain Game
description: Using magnificent wooden hex-cylinders of varying sizes, player construct the board each time it is played, and the playing surface ends up being a mountainous terrain. Players use dice to determine movement points as well as weather, which makes the movement points more or less efficient. The object of the game is to move your little mountain climbing pawn through either one or two points, which are placed by your opponents. You can only go up or down a certain number of levels in one step, and each hex only has three points from which to exit to the next hex.

name: Blazing Camels
description: Blazing Camels is a racing game, in which 3-7 players race their camels to the finish line by playing cards. Each player has a set of cards labeled one to nine. During each round, each player chooses a card and after putting it face down, they reveal their choices simultaneously. The highest untied played card stays on the table while the others are placed into their players' discard pile. If the winning card is a 1, 2, or 3, the player's camel spits, allowing its owner to remove the top face-up card from any other player. If a player runs out of cards to play, he or she picks up his or her discard pile and continues playing. The first player to accumulate 40 points from his or her face-up cards wins the game.

name: Maul of America: Raid on the Mall
description:
This is an illustrated, 24-page supplement for Maul of America. Raid contains advanced and reworked rules for Maul, plus four new games for the Maul components. Raid is set in a world where the dead have risen from their graves, hungry for living flesh, and civilization is fast collapsing before their assault. Raid was designed specifically for the zombie movie fan.

In Raid, you and your friends play survivors of the rising chaos. Raid the mall for luxury goods before fleeing to the countryside! Try to take the zombie-infested mall for
yourselves! Now defend your prize against all comers, living or dead!

Expands:

Maul of America
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies

name: Transformation
description: A typical small Sid Sackson game. Players must create patterns out of colored markers, while preventing their opponent from doing the same.
publishers: Hoyle Products, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Heroes of Asfar
description:
Heroes of Asfar is a fairly simple card game of fantasy combat (for no stated reason). Character cards each show an illustration, name, point value, usable weapon, and special abilities (such as spell casting, thievery, immunities, or bonuses).

Each player begins with 6 random character cards, arranged into two ranks, and a hand of 5 weapon cards. Players take turns hacking at each other's characters with weapon cards usable by their own characters. The fray continues until one player has slain 150 points of opponents' characters.

Spells, ranged weapons (reaching the second rank), and special attacks add spice to the game. A "Cast" booklet is included, containing a paragraph of flavor text for each of the 60 characters.

Expanded by:

Heroes of Asfar: The College of Magi
Heroes of Asfar: The Finieous Fingers Expansion Set
Heroes of Asfar: The Bag of Chaos

name: Sssnake
description: Players each try to be the first to build a complete snake, connecting the head and tail of the snake printed on their large start tiles. On a player's turn he rolls a special die and plays one or more small tiles showing snake body parts to either his own snake or to his left-hand neighbor's snake. How many tiles he plays and to which snake he plays the tiles depends on the roll of the special die. The body tiles can contain turns, crossovers, and twists which can extend the distance your neighbor needs to cover to complete his snake. But if the tile you select to play on your neighbor can't fit, it comes back to you!

name: Timestream: The Remnant
description:
Timestream: The Remnant is a new collectible card game which features high-quality components and packaging. The game takes place in the year 3026, where religion has been outlawed and a small band of underground patriots called "The Remnant" discover the secrets of time travel. Players must play cards to travel back in time to the "Age of Apostles", visit a Biblical city, record an event on a data cell, and return to the future.

You play Advance and Event Chain cards on a colorful game board which details your progress. Your opponent tries to stop you by playing Obstacle cards. Both players have access to power cells and other enhancement cards which of course have a variety of special abilities that change the course of the game. The first one to complete your three Event Chains and play the TIMESTREAM card wins the game!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction

name: Swordplay
description:
Swordplay is a man-to-man duel in medieval times. Each player has a small board depicting the body of their warrior as viewed by a face-to-face opponent. A hex grid is printed over the warrior's body. In the course of the duel, players will position their shield over some hexes (a portion of their warrior's body). Depending on the action they select for the turn, they may also position their sword over hexes on their own warrior's body (for a parry) or may point it at some part of the opponent's warrior to make an attack. The actions and positions chosen will result in various outcomes, which may include inflicting damage to the opposing warrior.

The game includes plastic swords of the same sort that are used as swizzle sticks in mixed drinks.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: UNO: National Parks
description:
Another UNO themed edition.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: BEAR ALERT. When the BEAR ALERT card is played, the player playing it must call out a new color. The remaining players in turn must draw from the DRAW pile until they draw the called color. Players must show the cards as they draw them.

name: Waarom? Daarom!
description:
On your turn you draw a card and read the question out loud. The correct answer is also printed on the card. Questions range from absurd to very difficult. eg : "Why is a carrot orange and a tomato red?" or "What happens to the caffeine that 's extracted to create caffeine free coffee?"
Each player writes an answer in secret on a piece of paper. The player who read the question writes down the correct answer in his own words. Answers are gathered, shuffled and numbered. The answers are read out loud and every player votes on what he thinks is the correct answer. The other players get a point if they guess the correct answer or if someone thought his or her wrong answer was right.
The first player who reaches the end of the 20 step score track wins the game.

name: Jabberwacky
description:
A game for two teams. The teams take turns forming a word chain. Words are recorded into the electronic unit before the time runs out. Points are scored for the team having the last word in a chain. The words are then played back in reverse order and the teams are given opportunities to recall the preceding words for extra points.

Recording the words in wacky ways is encouraged, to add humor to the game. Rules on word-linking are lenient, and players can challenge words, but risk points doing so.

An example word chain: Game…Play…Stage…Coach…Football…Sport…Poor…Rich…Aristocratic…Hereditary nobility…etc.
categories: Electronic, Memory, Party Game, Word Game

name: Upp till bevis!
description:
Swedish game. Each team is given a set of tasks. The players then wager how many of those tasks they can complete in 30 seconds.
The tasks vary from word puzzles and trivia to talking backwards and performing athletic stunts.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Bingory
description:
Part Bingo, part Memory. Be the first to complete your Bingo card by collecting matching pairs and you win. Contents: 16 wooden matching pairs, 4 wooden Bingo cards, and a cotton pouch.

For Ages 4 and up.

name: Air Traffic Controller
description: Air traffic controller is a logic based game in which you must manage an airport. Each turn you can make one command to an aircraft. Each aircraft then follows that command until another one is issued. Throughout the game new aircraft are taking off or landing, so managing the space on the tarmac is extremely important.

name: Story Chasers
description:
Each player assumes the role of a Bible hero. Each hero has five cards that tell their story. If you can collect all five cards, you win.

At the start of the game, the story cards are placed face down in a circle which acts as a game board that your character cards move around on. On your turn, you draw a card and move as the card says to do. If you stop on a face down card, flip it over. If it is one of your character's story cards, you keep it and replace it with the movement card; if not, discard the movement card.

name: Bac à la Carte
description: A French party word game in which players try to identify words related to a theme on the cards. The title of the game is a pun on the "baccalauréat" examination.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Yakari: Das Kooperative Brettspiel
description:
Yakari and his friends are playing in the woods, but they have lost track of time! Now, the sun is setting, and they need to get back to the village.

The board shows a track of different locations. Yakari and his friends start at the location furthest away from the village.

Each turn, the a player may perform a single action. Which action he may perform is determined by throwing/shoving/dropping a wooden disk on a grid of available actions. Before taking his action, the player rolls a die; the outcome of the roll determines how the disk should be moved on the grid. After the disk has been placed, the player performs the action, which most of the time is moving on of the friends forward on the track.

The players have when the friends safely reach the village. However, they need to be quick. On the track, starting several space behind the friends, there is a sandtimer. Each time the timer runs out, it advances one space. If the time enters the same space as one of the friends, the players lose the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Купи Слона
description:
"Kupi Slona" - translates "Do You Want to Buy an Elephant?". It is a version of a climbing game (a famous game mechanics).

See: Cheat

name: 1 Minute
description:
1 Minute is a fun and fast-pacing party game. You're playing in two teams who will: drawing, portray and describe words to their team members. The opposing team will distribute the points across the different categories. Oh, one little problem: before you know the seconds start ticking away.

What are you waiting for, you only have 1 minute!

name: Prophet's Gambit
description:
Prophet's Gambit is a game that is played using the Curse of Strahd Tarokka Deck. The Tarokka Deck, inspired by Tarot cards, is a supplement for The Curse of Strahd, an adventure supplement for Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition).

Prophet's Gambit has similarities to Texas Hold'em where players build the best hand of five cards using personal cards as well as a common card available to all players. The game is played over two rounds, and each round players may discard a card to draw a "high card" which provides special effects such drawing extra cards or trading cards with another player.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Push Your Luck
publishers: Gale Force Nine, LLC, Wizards of the Coast

name: Xángano
description:
Two players try to move their four pieces over a board to the opposite corner. The pieces may not lose contact with each other; there are various difficulty levels, in some of them they need to stay in touch in numerical order as well (they are numbered 1-4).
A die determines the number of pieces that can be played on the turn of a player.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Devil Bunny versus the Entire Galaxy
description:
You are intrepid actuaries collecting butterflies of a specific color at a circus. Devil Bunny loves butterflies, and whenever he sees a big enough stack of them, he jumps on that stack, scattering them everywhere. Who will be the first to save enough butterflies, before Devil Bunny destroys the Galaxy?

Each player chooses a color of butterflies to catch. Now you roll the dice. 1-5 and you’re in the clear. You can add more butterflies to the map, or guide the ones already there back to your circus tent. The color of the top token of each stack determines who guides the rest on the path back, and you can only move as far as there are tokens in the stack. But be careful! Roll a 6 and Devil Bunny hops on your stack and scatters your butterflies to the winds! First to collect three wins!

name: Zobmondo Lite: The Prequel
description:
From the back of the box...

More of the same outrageous, mind-blowing content that made the original Would You Rather...? so successful...only now it's not just for adults. Find out what someone is really like by discussing the imaginary hypotheticals of Zobmondo Lite. Plus this version has all new questions.

Object of the game: Above all, to simulate entertaining, ridiculous conversation. More precisely, to advance to the middle of the game board, by predicting how friends will answer outrageous, gross, thought-provoking and hilarious Zobmondo "would you rather" questions.

name: Frenzi
description:
Frenzi is the craziest, fastest, flipping card game you'll ever play. Simple rules, quick to play, very exciting and totally addictive for both adults and kids.


Each player gets a base card with 3 unique characteristics (colour, number and shape).
All 64 Frenzi cards are laid out in the middle and then everyone races together at high speed, flipping cards over so they match a characteristic of their base card.
Frenzi cards are double sided, with different characteristics on the front from the back, so keep your eyes peeled as cards are constantly getting flipped back over by other players, looking for a match.
After 30 seconds the flipping stops, players pick up the cards that match their base card characteristic and count them to score.


Play takes place over nine 30 second Frenzi rounds, each with a different objective (e.g. match colour, match shape or no match) and a game takes just 30 minutes.

It's a lively party game that tests your observation, speed and reactions, and gets everyone out of their seats!

name: The Portable Galactic Empire
description:
Build an Empire.

Take command of an empire and rule the galaxy. A fast paced card game for 3 to 6 players.

Each box contains 164 color cards, two 6-sided dice, 6 resource tracking cards and an instruction sheet.

The Limited Edition boxed set comes in a 5x7 wooden box.

The Standard Edition set comes in a top/bottom card stock box which is bright orange, and easily distinguishable from the Limited Edition.
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building

name: Akumulate
description:
A mathematical family strategy game, requiring spatial and numerical thinking.

Players place pieces strategically on the game board, joining up with other pieces already on the board. "Point accelerators" (bonus point squares) are located in different parts of the board.

The player that aKumulates the highest score wins.
publishers: Dr. Wood Challenge Centre, University Games

name: Se Busca Presidente
description:
A game about the presidential elections in Chile. Four candidates try to get to "La Moneda" (chilean equivalent to the White House).

There are four types of cards. Some will move the candidates back and forward, while others can be use as shield to prevent attacks.Each player represents a candidate, and will have use his cards in a very smart way to gain more popularity than his rivals.

The first player whose candidate reaches a 100% in popularity will be the winner.

name: Shelter
description:
From the publisher:

Shelter is a hybrid of card-duelling games and the castle defence genre. Can you survive against the zombie hordes?

Fight for your life against wave after wave of zombies. Place, modify and use guns! Reinforce your defences! Fight hand to hand! Shelter combines that strategic gameplay of card-duelling games with a simple dice roll based enemy to create a unique single-player experience.

Based on the hugely popular Android, iOS and Windows Phone game, Shelter will provide you with hours of exciting play.

From the developer's website:

Shelter is a single player game where you build a deck of duelling cards and take them into battle against a zombie deck that “plays itself”. The zombie deck is not controlled by a hideously complex AI, but plays based on a simple set of rules and dice rolls for that element of chance. You must fight off the waves of zombies before they smash your shelter’s barricades and start munching on your brains.

You choose your survival strategy when you build your deck. Do you pack as many guns into your deck as you can? Do you use traps and reinforce your defences? Do you stun stronger zombies and pick off the weak ones? You have the freedom to play as you want.

As you win duels, you will be rewarded with new cards to work into your deck and streamline your play style.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Outnumbered!
description:
Outnumbered is a question and answer game that requires quick thinking and a little bit of luck!

What year did the Berlin Wall come down? Number of Van Gogh’s ears? Not only do you have to be the first person to answer the question correctly but you must have the dice to match! Players take turns reading and answering questions. Each player rolls their own set of dice using the numbers rolled to answer the questions. Correctly answered questions earn points; some are harder and award more points than others. Be the player with the most points to win!

With 750 questions and 60 dice

(from Manufacturer's site)

name: Hold Your Horses
description:
A horse is a horse... of course. Of course?

A very silly 9-card party game about horses and unicorns, where you spend 15 seconds second-, third- and fourth-guessing yourself.

name: Bulánci: Speciální jednotky
description:
Bulánci is the original Czech freeware game for Microsoft Windows from 2001, in which Bulánci - known as E.A.P. (extremely aggressive pillows) fight against each other. The game is 2D with an overhead view. It was created by the Czech company SleepTeam Labs.

In 2021 Bulánci 2.0 was announced commercially for PC/Mac/Linux and game console Playstation/Switch/Xbox. The port was funded on Czech crowdfunding site Startovač. During the crowdfunding campaign, SleepTeam released a standalone card game Bulánci: Speciální jednotky.

The second pillow war is coming to a head. Soon it will become clear which pillow is the toughest.

In the game, you play the role of an officer tasked with assembling the best possible special unit of soldiers. Each unit has only 4 members in the form of cards lying in front of the player. The strongest unit wins the battle, but the war is not over yet. You need to build more and more units until you get 5 buttons and reach the rank of general...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Piratengold
description:
Translated from German spielbox.de:

An exciting board and card game for adventuresome sailors. The fantastic island world of Nyria: Since ancient times sunken treasures and valuable artifacts lie on the bottom of the Nyrian Sea. Adventurous sailors look for lost treasures, in order to attain fame and fortune. They must brave the elements of nature with their sailing boats and their magic powers. They are incessantly provoked by wind and waves and must resist other ambitious treasure hunters. Only under the wise employment of their magic and their sailing abilities will the adventurers succeed in raising the treasures and bringing them into their home port safely.

name: Mr. Bean The Game
description:
You might have to act it out.....or draw a picture of it....or mime it.
It is the Secret Clue on the Mr. Bean QUIZ card - a person, a thing, a famous expression, a funny situation. And you, as Mr. Bean, have to get your team to guess what it is.
It gets very funny! You might have to say it - but without using your voice! Or write it - upside down, with the paper on someone's back - while they're walking away!

If your team guesses the Clue in time, you keep your place on the board. If not, back you go.

Even the rules are fun to read !! Tsk ! Tsk !
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hullabaloo
description:
HULLABALOO - The Classic game of Noisy Charades.

From the box:

"Welcome to the loudest, most frantic, most hilarious game you'll ever play! That's because in HULLABALOO you can only use the "language" of noise to make yourself understood ... and all in just 30 seconds.

You'll have you team mates in stitches guessing your "noise", whether it's a One Armed bandit, a Fun Fair or laying an Egg!

Does your team have the skill to reach the ON square before your opponents? There is only one way to find out - play HULLABALOO and discover for yourself why it's the game everyone's making such a noise about."

name: Kort Alfapet
description: KortAlfapet is a card variant of ALGAs Alfapet. Try to lay out as long words as you can with the cards in your hand, to get as many points as possible.

name: Monopoly: My MLB Edition
description:
Inroducing the first ever Monopoly game you customize! Choose 22 of the 30 Major League Baseball teams and place them on the board.

Then . . . buy, sell and trade your favorite teams in an effort to control Major League Baseball, a baseball fan's fantasy. The team labels are removeable and reusable so, if you choose, you can play a different game each time.

Create It . . . Play It . . . Own It All!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Battleship: G.I. JOE The Rise of Cobra Edition
description: The battle between G.I. Joe™ and Cobra™ is about to begin! In this edition of BATTLESHIP, fall in with the heroic G.I. Joe team or suit up and fight for the cold-blooded Cobra. Call out coordinates and mark your hits and misses against your opponent. Once a fleet is destroyed, remove the mission sheet from the command unit to reveal the battlefield. For the first time ever, you’ll seek and destroy your enemy on land, at sea, and in the air- it’s the most versatile BATTLESHIP game yet!

name: Tornado Alert!
description:
From the back of the game box:

Calling all fearless photographers!
We are today heading for Oklahoma City where the first ever Tornado Spotting World Championships are about to begin. Extreme weather is expected, accompanied by even more extreme photographers. Speed, split-second timing, calculated risk-taking and outsmarting the competition are your tickets to victory!

Original version: Object of the game from the first page of rulebook:

The players compete for three rounds then see who, on average, has taken the best tornado photos. The higher the number of points from the photos, the better. The higher the number of card, the more dangerous the photographer's location depicted, so it's important to make the right decisions during the game. At the end of each round, the players determine their average score of the photos taken in their points pile using the averages table. Each round ends when the Game Over card is picked up. After the third round, each player's lowest average score of the three is selected and the player with the highest of these lowest scores is the winner.

Second Edition changes game as follows:

Players no more try to get highest average during three rounds. Instead, they try to get as much points as possible during each round and players can play any number of rounds as well. This makes averages table obsolete in second edition. Some card functions are also streamlined to make game play faster and more intuitive. Rules of the second edition are only in english and finnish.

The game box contains:

75 cards (21 different types of)
15 +1/-1 markers
1 two-sided score table
1 score pad (50 pages)
Includes German, French, English, Dutch, Swedish and Finnish rules.

name: Quanzy
description: Each of 28 hex tiles displays one of three shapes in one of three colors and one of three sizes. Players take turns placing a tile from their hand next to a previously-placed tile on the board that shares at least one attribute (shape, size, or color)with the new tile. The object is to be the first player to form a row of four adjacent tiles.

name: Munchkin Koethulhu
description: A compilation of Munchkin Cthulhu, Munchkin Cthulhu 2 and Munchkin Cthulhu 3, along with 4 unique Dutch cards.

name: Can of Squirms
description:
Welcome to our seriously awkward adult party game.

Can of Squirms is the first game we pack when we head to the bar.

It goes like this: facing some questions designed to make everyone squirm, two players go head-to-head. They have to decide which of them best fits the answer to question — without conferring.

Meanwhile, the other teams are placing side bets: will the pair in the hot seat agree, or disagree?


Aim of the game:

To be the First team to reach 10 points. Win points by:

1) Silently agreeing with your teammate when the two of you are faced with an awkward question.

2) Second-guessing the decisions made by other teams.

name: The Battle of Waterloo
description:
