Each player is dealt fare evaders who are a fun collection of characters inspired by our fellow commuters. Players are also dealt inspectors who come in two different forms. Authorised inspectors are easier to spot but will still slap you with a hefty fine. Then there's undercover inspectors -They're the ones you need to keep an eye out for as they'll pop up in the most unlikely of places.

Things can get out of hand when power cards come into play which are randomly drawn throughout the game. They'll give you abilities like switching the game to any lane or protecting yourself from the next player's move. How far can you push your luck? Can you spot the undercover inspector among the crowd? Can you ride the tram to safety? You never know what's around that tram track, Ben, so make sure you've touched on.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Fang den Hut: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Fang den Hut: Das Kartenspiel is a card game version of Trap the Cap. Players can either claim a stack or play a card. A card can be played on a stack if it is the same number or if it shares a color with the top card and is higher. A stack can be claimed if it is a player's turn and his card is on top of stack. After all cards have been played, points are scored based on the number of cards players have claimed. The player with the most points wins.
____________
This is not a separately sold game . These 33 cards are an addition to the Classic edition of Fang den Hut!. They only were included in this special 2005 version !

name: International Soccer Board Game
description:
ISBG is an action/dexterity-based sports board game that emulates the action, skill and strategy of a conventional soccer match. The board game includes a game board having markings of a conventional soccer pitch. Circular player pieces are utilized to manipulate a ball piece and impart a sliding or a flipping motion in the ball piece. The players may pass, shoot, or to throw the ball in to emulate the play of a conventional soccer match.

Players each control a soccer team that consists of discs representing soccer players. A small disc representing the soccer ball is flicked into the opposing player's goal to score points.

The main mechanic used in ISBG requires players to flick a soccer ball token around the field by pressing the edges of the discs that represent soccer players down on it, thus causing it to move.

The rules of regular soccer a followed when it comes to offsides, corner kicks, etc.

The game is designed to allow for several modes of play.

name: Biatlonmánie
description: A boardgame published together with Czech biathlon union. It simulates biathlon races. Players roll the dice to move their pawns. Another dice is used for shooting simulation. There are more variant of races. Players can also use some of biathlonist card (best czech racers are included in second revised edition) to improve their skills. The track on board copies the areal in Nové Město - one of the most popular tracks in biathlon world cup.

name: Porca Vacca!
description:
The game revolves around a single Deck (and the Discard Pile) from which, at turn, each player draws a card. The aim is not to end your turn with more than 4 cards in your hand, but at the same time to keep some to attack your opponents or defend yourself.
—description from the designer

Il gioco si sviluppa attorno a un singolo mazzo (e alla pila degli scarti) da cui tutti i giocatori, a turno, pescano una carta. Lo scopo è non arrivare mai alla fine del proprio turno con più di 4 carte in mano, ma contemporaneamente tenerne qualcuna da poter giocare per ostacolare gli avversari e difendersi dai loro attacchi.
—description from the designer (translated)

name: Not Your Ma's Jong
description:
When our grandmothers met for the first time, they didn’t speak the same language but quickly discovered their shared love of mahjong. We had each seen them play growing up, but realized that we never play with our friends. It’s tough to learn, and games can be pretty slow.

We reimagined this ancient pastime and created a brand new card game, based on mahjong and memories of growing up with our grandmothers!

Not Your Ma's Jong re-envisions the classic game with card drafting mechanics, and simplifies win conditions. Players take turns being "Ma" over a series of rounds. The player to first achieve 3 sets and 1 pair wins a round, and receives tokens from the other players. Winner has the most tokens at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

name: Clue: Alien Vs. Predator
description:
As the Predator Rite of Ritual draws nearer, an Alien Queen must be captured and bred in order that unblooded Predators can face off against her offspring and achieve the rank of blooded Yautjas.

It is up to you and your Predator comrades to question everything. Discover where the Alien Queen's lair lies hidden, and determine whom amongst you possesses the unique combination of tools and skills to subdue her.

Contents:
Custom Game Board
6 Suspect Movers
6 Personality Cards
21 Rumor Cards
21 Hunt Cards
Custom Score Pad
Envelope
6 Weapons
2 Dice
Game Guide
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Speed Colors TEAM
description:
Speed Colors TEAM is a co-operative sequel to the well-known boardgame Speed Colors! Color the drawings on the image cards simultaneously while performing funny team tasks. Help each other to find the necessary markers and manage to color as many cards as possible within 5 minutes! Sure that your team is the best? Invite your friends and play team vs. team!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Game Factory, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Christmas Dice
description:
A free print&play dice game for 2-5 players where players compete to get their Christmas trees filled.

The crux of the game is that a player rolls 2 D6 first and decides which of the results is going to be the target number and which the number of rolls he gets. This is obvious at first, but then becomes a bit tricky later in the game.

Required components : 8 D6, a printout of the sheet provided and a pen for every player.

The first player to fill their tree, wins.

name: Disney Trivia
description:
Trivia Game with Disney and Pixar theme. 140 question cards with 4 multiple choice options. It's for you to decide the difficulty level: difficult (ask the question only), medium (ask the question with all 4 choice options) or easy (ask the question with just the 50:50 choices).

The team with more points at the end wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Microbes
description:
Microbes is a simple family game that entertains both the youngest and the parents. The goal: to stay sick by guarding against large microbes or by catching those of others.

Players receive a microbe card (value 1-10) and three more are placed in front of the card shuffler (brewer). Starting with the player to the left of the brewer, the latter will secretly look at his card and may be able to keep it, or exchange with the next player. The exchange is automatically accepted, unless the player under a Atchoum! of value 10, which means that the exchange is refused and that both players must keep their original card. When the turn of the brewer comes, he can keep his card, or else, having no one left with whom to trade, replace it with one of the three in front of him.

When the round ends, the player(s) with the lowest value card loses the round and a box of tissues.

Microbes est un jeu familial simple qui amuse tant les plus jeunes que les parents.
Le but : rester malade en garde pour soi les gros microbes ou en attrapant ceux des autres.
Deroulement: Après avoir pris leurs jetons boîtes de mouchoirs, chaque joueur reçoit une carte microbe (d'une valeur de 1 à 10) et trois autres sont placés devant le brasseur de cartes. En commançant par le joueur à gauche du brasseur, celui-ci regardera secrètement sa carte et pourra être la conserver, soit l'échange avec le joueur suivant. L'échange est automatiquement accepté, sauf si le joueur sous une carte microbe Atchoum ! de valeur 10, ce qui fait en sorte que l'échange est refusé et que les deux joueurs doivent conserver leur carte d'origine. Quand vient le tour du brasseur, il peut être conservé sa carte, ou bien, n'ayant plus personne avec qui fait d'échange, la remplacer par l'une des trois qui se trouvent devant lui. Lorsque le tour se termine, le ou les joueur(s) avec la carte de la plus faible valeur perd la manche et une boîte de mouchoirs.

name: Tangled Twistmas Card Game
description: A licensed tie-in with the Elf on the Shelf franchise, Twisted Twistmas is a game based on getting rid of all your cards, with an underlying theme of connecting a collection of strings of Christmas lights. That is combined with a couple attack cards to make another player skip their next turn or draw a card.

name: Doctor Who
description:
“Players take the role of Renegade Time Lords working for the Celestial Intervention Agency. Players must work cooperatively to foil the plots of Temporal Marauders. The goals of Temporal Marauders are the destruction or conquest of Gallifrey, Nexus point Earth, or the Universe.”

“There are two decks in the game: The Time Lord Deck, and the Temporal Marauder Deck. All players share both decks.”

“If the players go completely through the Temporal Marauder Deck and defeat all the Marauders, they share a combined win. The player with the most lives + cards in his Victory pile is the first place winner. The next is the second place winner, and so on.”

“If any Marauder Card ever gets 4 plot tokens on it, the time line is irreversibly disrupted, resulting in universal disaster. Time and Space unravel. All players lose. Game over.”
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Sagrada Reset Card Game
description:
Sagrada is a city where people of extraordinary powers live. You seek an item that can control all the powers - The MacGuffin.
Get the item by using the powers of characters.

Every turn, you start with a card, then you draw a card, and then play a card- following the text on the card. If you manage to play 9 cards, or you have the MacGuffin out at the beginning of your turn, you win.
categories: Book, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Lexogon
description: Find words of four or more letters in which three-letter clues from the Lexogon clue card deck occur in the order required by the seven category rules' stipulations.

name: The Daring & The Doomed
description:
Kingdom-building, monster-fighting, food-vending, gold-stealing PIXEL fun for everyone!!

The Daring & The Doomed is a fast-playing, easy to learn card game for the whole family. The print quality and fun pixel art have been a huge hit where we go to play! Now, we need your help to get this cool little game out for more people to enjoy! The game basics can be learned in a minute or so, with rules cards included right in the box. There’s even some special kids rules and drinking game rules to make things even crazier for your table. The starter deck is 144 cards strong! This means you can play 3 or 4 complete games with no repeats! All you need is a few six-sided dice and something to track gold like pennies, M&M’s or tiny plastic goats. Your boxed, shrink-wrapped starter set includes Heroes, Monsters, and Kingdom cards.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Winx Club Magical Fairy Game
description: A collectible card game with a manga theme, aimed at teenage girls.

name: Smog
description: Smog is an educational game illustrating the complex problem of air pollution. Each player attempts to manage his city better than the other players by growing his city (with families and industry), keeping his city out of debt, and improving (or not worsening) the air quality of his city. Players' cities are all adjacent, so the industries of one city may affect the air quality of an adjacent city as well.
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Economic, Environmental

name: The Witch's Cauldron
description: The witch has visited the bedroom, bathroom, sitting room, kitchen, garden, and street. The state of confusion she has left behind is shown on the six collecting (scene) boards. The aim of the game is to collect the nine small cards which will restore order to each scene.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Memory

name: Step To It
description:
From the back of the box:

Here's a game that will have you walking, jumping, and hopping all around the house! Ask a player to give you a card with a specific number of steps to take. Then choose an object that you think you can reach in exactly that number. Can you walk to the fridge in 9 steps? How about hop to something that starts with the letter A in 15? Reach your goal and walk away with a win!

Ages 5 and up.

Kids learn estimating distance and spacial relations.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: 8 Dragons
description:
8 Dragons is basically a memory game. At the start of the game the 42 cards are laid out in a 6x7 tableau. The goal of the game is not to find as many pairs as possible. In each turn you will turn over two cards. If they match either on form or on color you can take them in your hand. As an extra bonus for matching form you can take another turn.

Since a player has a hand limit of 4 cards you will most likely need to place cards back in the tableau in order to collect a full set of 4 cards which form a dragon. Different color dragons are of different rarity and also score a different amount of points. Add to that a few cards which either give you a bonus or a penalty when you turn them over and you have the game 8 Dragons.

name: The Dirt Game
description:
Get the Dirt on Your Friends

What do you really know about your friends? This party game gets everyone airing their dirty laundry. But to win, it’s not enough just to come clean — you’ve got to guess how the other players will answer when the truth is on the line!

The Dirt has five different question categories full of deep penetrating questions; you’ll be digging up and dishing out the dirt all night long.

Sample Questions:

Which player at the table is most likely to have ridden a mechanical bull?
Is your favorite guilty pleasure in the fridge, the TV Guide, or the drawer by your bed?
Have you ever posted a video of yourself on YouTube?


Dial in your answers on the secret voter wheel, then 1-2-3...everyone reveal... Who was right? Who did you match? Who came clean?

Game Components:

Over 500 Question Cards
8 Clothespin Movers
8 Voting Dials
Gameboard
Nametag Sheets
Pencil
Rules

name: DOOM ON YOU
description:
DOOM ON YOU is a family-friendly game of strategy, bribery, and destruction.

In the PREP ROUND, you draw cards and get your animals ready for battle. In the ATTACK ROUND, you use your animals and special battle cards to attack and defend.

• When it's your turn, all of the other players will work together to attack you
• Destructive DOOM cards will kill your animals and take your food
• You will probably need to bribe others to stay alive

The world is ending, and everyone wants your food. Good luck.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Bribery, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That, Trading

name: Koopvaart
description:
Game about merchant fleets in the 17th century.
Merchant ships and privateers battle it out on the high seas.
Trade goods, build forts and get rich!
publishers: Amro Bank, van der Laken B.V.

name: Borogove
description:
From the designer and Kickstarter project page:

"Borogove is a card game based off Lewis Carroll's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking Glass, And What Alice Found There. It was first seen in the pages of Skin Deep, with a Jub Jub Bird and a Bandersnatch playing the card game. At the time I just threw some words from Jabberwocky into the dialog to make it seem like a weird, fun game. Many readers expressed interest in actually playing Borogove, so I sat down and started to create a game. Now I want to print it so everyone can play and enjoy!"

The game comprises a deck of 52 cards of 13 suits, each suit having 4 cards each. Players play cards in an attempt to match either the suit of a card or a value of a card (Uno-like).

name: Push
description:
Contents:
small plastic board with relief
13 yellow + 13 black plastic balls

"Players compete against each other by moving the balls a row at a time. Form a square of 3x3 balls of your color to win"

A player can keep pushing rows as long as the ball that comes out belongs to that same player. Therefore, there are two things to worry about, the 3x3 square to be made, and to try to keep your turn for a few pushes.

It comes with instructions for solo game.

name: The Sneaky Snacky Squirrel Card Game
description:
Your furry forest friends are hungry and they need your help! Race the other players to squirrel away the most acorn cards and you win this nutty, fast-action, color-matching game for preschoolers.

Reinforces color learning
Develops matching, sorting, and strategic thinking skills
Encourages social skills and turn-taking
Practices memory and attention skills

Preschool color matching game
Fast-play fun
Based on The Sneaky, Snacky Squirrel game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational

name: UNO: Elvis Presley
description:
112 Special Edition Elvis Cards. A collectible UNO Elvis tin for storage.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: "Vegas" Command Card. ???

name: 1860: I Mille
description: "1860: I Mille" is a wargame, published on the Italian wargaming magazine "Alea Jacta Est", on the "Expedition of the Thousand", the Garibaldi's campaign against the Kingdom of Two Sicilies.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Minimap Resolution, Simulation

name: The Margaret & David At The Movies Boardgame
description:
From the back of the box:

The Margaret & David At The Movies Boardgame takes the world's most popular pastime - watching movies - and turns it into a trivia battle supreme!

Inside this box you'll find 3600 questions about everything from Alien to Zoolander - with a few classics thrown into the mix.

You don't need to be a film buff to win. The clever gameplay means that everyone is kept in the picture and no-one ends up on the cutting room floor.

In fact, if your expertise only stretches to Dumb & Dumber you could still beat a player who has a PhD in the films of Martin Scorsese.

The game is a box-office smash that simply demands encore after encore!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Fondue
description:
To become the cheese chasing champion you must be the first to find and collect four cheeses for your fondue in the network of constantly changing cheese passages.

Sounds easy! However, this game of fun and excitement requires tactics and sneakiness - not only will you want to collect your cheeses; you will want to stop your opponents from getting theirs first.

And just when you think that you are tantalizingly close to your fondue, your opponents may invite you to join them on their tile, steal your cheese, change your path or set the cheese thieves on you.

Landing on the stars may help you on your quest to collect cheeses or send you on a wild cheese chase.
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Tile Placement

name: Thomas' Great Race Game
description:
Thomas has challenged James, Molly and Percy to a great race! Learn numbers as you earn coal to shovel into your engine and power it up and over the hill. Develop sorting, counting and color matching skills as you race to the finish.

Contents: Great race track (2 sections), track connector, 4 racing engines, 24 question cards, 30 coal blocks, game rules.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Number, Trains

name: Pirates Versus Ninjas
description:
This is a card game based on battles in an epic war between two factions, Ninjas and Pirates. Players choose a side at the beginning of the game, with at least 1 player representing each faction. Players have a hand of 5 cards featuring fighter cards (depicting famous Pirates or Ninjas), weapon cards, ability cards, and ambush cards.

After sides have been selected, players initiate a "draw" round where each player draws two cards and may then take two actions, including playing a fighter from their faction, a weapon on a fighter already in play on their side, an ability on a fighter, or they may discard up to two cards and draw replacements. Play passes to the left.

After all players have drawn and played cards, a "battle" round begins where all fighters enter into a battle for supremacy. The total number of fighters for each player is determined by the lowest number that player controls. After fighters have been selected the first player may choose to activate an ability or play an ambush card from his or her hand affecting the battle. This continues until all players have decided to pass. All players total their attack value for all fighters involved in battle the highest total earns that player a victory point (6 are needed to win). Then all players roll a die to determine casualties. If a die roll matches an opponent's fighter, that fighter is discarded from play and the die roller earns a victory point.

After battle, a draw phase starts again.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Math, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Logo!
description:
An exciting journey of discovery through the world of news.
Game is based on children's news show "logo!" as public refreshing mix of entertainment, news, sports and brains.
The selected mix of light and serious questions guaranteed entertainment and fun for the whole family.

The players form two teams of reporters in the contest for the most important news around the world.

name: Heebie Jeebies
description:
Heebie Jeebies: The Game of Unusual Notions

How well do you know your friends and family? How well do you really know them? Find out what really pushes their buttons by playing Heebie Jeebies.

The game plays where one person starts as "The Subject" flips over four cards and reads them out loud. The rest of the players then secretly vote on which one of those cards gives The Subject the Heebies Jeebies. Once all votes are in,
The Subject tells everyone which card gives him/her the Heebie Jeebies. If the players guess correctly they get a point. Then the board gets passed to the next person and they become The Subject and play continues. The first one to ten points wins!

name: JaLink!
description: A board features 16 circles onto which picture cards are placed face up. A category card is read, and players race to find two pictures that share something in that category. Players keep the picture cards they use, and those cards are replenished. After two minutes, another category card is turned over, and the process repeats. Play until all the picture cards have been revealed. The winner possesses the most picture cards.

name: Speedcatch Doraemon
description:
Doraemon is a robotic cat featured in a Japanese comic/animation series of the same title. The game comes with 5 Doraemon figures and 6 sets of 5 cards of the same color.

When you play, you take Doraemon figures, one less then there are players, and put them in the middle where everybody can reach them. You take as many sets of colored cards as there are players. You shuffle all these cards and give each player 5. Then everybody passes one of his cards at the same moment to his right hand neighbor. When a player has a set of 5 cards of the same color, he grabs a Doraemon figure and calls out 'Doraemon'. Then the remaining player have to grab one of the remaining Doraemon figures as fast as possible. The player who wasn't able to grab one, gets 1 minus point.

As soon as 1 player has 3 minus points, he loses, while all the other players win.

name: Sunny Day Pond: A Puzzle Game
description:
Work as a team to build the three animal puzzles before the rain comes. Players take turns spinning the spinner and adding puzzle pieces. Finish the puzzles before all of the rain drops are on the board and everyone wins!

Unlike most games, Sunny Day Pond encourages kids to work together to build their puzzles. This way, kids work together, learn together and they help each other! A cooperative game eliminates stress, builds self-esteem, and teaches kids that playing together can be fun!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crowdfunding: El Juego
description:
Crowdfunding is a game for all ages where you must get backers for your project by going to the press, events, social networks... While contingencies and Forum trolls act against you.

COMPONENTS
1 Board, 1 Turn token, 10 counters X player', 30 event cards, 6 character cards, Rulebook (Spanish, English, Catalan...)

THE BOARD HAS 4 AREAS:

Calendar: 40 slots, one for each campaign day. In some slots we can find modifiers to our actions that we will apply once we have the result of these. Also we can see a few special slots marked in red.
Card's Slot: Place for event cards
Pledge's Track: In this space you will place your player's colour tokens to indicate the amount of collected money for your campaign. If anytime you lack counters you will have to reorganize them and it is possible that you lose some contributions.
Press Track: Indicate the quantity and contacts of mass media and press been interested in our campaign.


WEEKLY PLANNING
The game runs through 40 days divided in weeks. Every player will choose an action to play in every day marked in white applying the pertinent modifiers. The slots marked in red indicate bank holidays and weekends, in each one we will reveal a card that affects all players and will.

At the beginning of every week (slots 1,8,15,22,29 and 36) Baker and Press counters are placed in the initial position that indicates the character's card of every player.

THE ACTIONS

Backers Search: Raise a space in your Backer's track if it is possible.
Contact Press: Raise a space in your Press track if it is possible.
Lucky card: Reveals the first event card and solve it (only affects the player who makes the action)
Do cash: Add in your Pledge's track 25 € x Backer (or use your character's card cash action)


WINNERS
All the players who finish the campaign with the fulfilled aim wins the game.

name: Das Geheimnis der Zahleninsel
description:
Solve the math problems and collect the treasure chests on this mysterious island with TIPTOI interactive learningsystem.

The treasure chests on this island are guarded by a parrot, a mermaid, a dolphin and a pirate. They teach simple math problems to the players during their turn. If the player solves the problem he can keep the treasure chest. The player who collects the most treasures wins the game.

The game contains four difficulty levels.

name: Rome: Rise to Power – Revolt!
description: Rome: Rise to Power – Revolt! is a five-card mini-expansion that introduces new province cards and has a new set of rules for solitaire mode.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Hubywoky Le commencement
description:
Hubywoky Le commencement is the first card game that integrate “continuous gaming” concept, i.e. which encourage you to play physically with your friends then to earn points online when you are alone, then to go back to your friends…and so on!

Hubywoky is an evolutive strategic 2 or 3 players card game where all cards are double-sided and uniques.

Each player has to strategically built 3 stacks of 4 cards (2 stacks of 4 cards for 3 players), thinking about sequences (Bonus and monsters) and above all remembering it when playing to counter his opponent’s plans and empty his stacks!

You can play at the board game only, or participate to the worldwide competition with the "Hubywoky Challenge" app.

Description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: American Trivia: Family Edition
description:
Description from the Publisher's Website

Have you ever wanted to just play games rather than study for your history or geography test? Well now you can do both at the same time!

Outset Media is proud to introduce the Junior Edition of the best-selling All American Trivia Board Game. Designed specifically for younger players, the Junior Edition allows youth to have a blast, challenging each other’s knowledge on 100% American content in a fun, social atmosphere.

The game is easy to learn, with three categories -- geography, history, and general. It’s a race around the game board. With over 1,080 questions, the game includes questions such as "Who is famous for his ‘I have a dream’ speech?" And "What is the largest state in America?"

name: Obalistig
description: This is a game like set. There are different symbols on each cards, but there are always 3 cards that matches. They look only a little bit different and is hard to see. You get points for all sets you collect if they match. There is also a junior version on the same cards. The back of the cards have easier animal symbols for the junior edition.

name: Gammelgäddan
description: Swedish children's game. The object for each player is to catch the Ol' pike that lurks somewhere in the pond. There are plenty of other fish and objects to be found as well.

name: Fundomino
description:
Wild Action Dominoes!

Fundomino combines the best of fun and the best of domino. Are you ready for the action?
Place an action tile at the end of the chain and it immediately comes into effect. Who will get to
have another turn, draw extra tiles, reverse the order or gain extra points?
Arrow Symbol = Play Again!
Plus Symbol = Draw!
Star Symbol = Wild!
Be the first to play all your Fundominoes to win. Fundomino is the best domino party game to gather family and friends together for hours of fun!

The game comes with 32 fundominoes, 4 pawns, and a scoring track.

name: Wereldsteden
description:
In Wereldsteden, players travel across a world map, buying and selling souvenirs in various cities. Players win by being the first to collect six different souvenirs.

To travel across the board, players each have a similar hand of red, green and blue cards, as well as some action cards. The colors of the cards match connecting lines between cities on the board.

In each of his turns, a player either plays one or more cards from his hand, trying to travel as efficiently as possible and block other players were needed, or the player rests, taking back his discard pile.

Souvenirs can be bought in fixed locations (e.g. a Taj Mahal keychain, available in New Delhi). Souvenirs can be sold in selected cities. Once a souvenir is sold, a random tile is selected to indicate the next souvenir that is requested by that city. This introduces some randomness to the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Die wilden Fussballkerle: Das dampfhammerharte Fussball-Spiel
description:
"First a wild master, then a world master".

Die Wilden Fussball Kerle now have a full sized soccer board game. Full teams of eleven players maneuver it out rolling dice and moving their players to get into position to score.

Simple rules and low complexity gear this towards younger players and those not seeking an in depth soccer simulation.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Lingo
description:
Lingo is a 5 or 6 letter word guess game. The first letter is given. A little like Mastermind, after a word is given, the correct letters are marked. A different mark is given for letters on the correct position.

Each correct word will given you numbers, which you can then remove from you bingo-card. The first to have a line with 5 crosses on its bingo-card wins the game.

Note: This game is based on a Dutch TV-show.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Word Game
publishers: Game Line, Imagination Games, Nathan, Toys & Games Express

name: Snack Attack!
description: In this fast-paced, picture matching, token-stacking game, players race to identify and collect the most food items to place on their snack plates. During the game, one player acts as the "chef" and rotates the spinner around the platter dispensing seven food items. All players then compete to call out items matching those on their individual snack plates, flipping the tokens that are won to reveal new snacks to match. At the end of the game, the player with the most snacks on their plate wins!

name: Hokuspokus Krötenfuß!
description:
There are 5 different ingredients and the raven cards what count as a jokers in this game.
The object of the game is to collect the most cards in one type of ingredient.

In start each player gets 3 cards and the rest of the cards are placed to 5 pile. Put the frog aside to any pile.

In his turn player rolls the dice to move the frog as many steps as the dice indicates. The player takes top card from that pile.
Now he asks any ingredient from any player and also announces the ingredient he must give back. If that player has the ingredient he must give all cards with this ingredient with the current player.
Game ends if one of the five piles is exhausted:
The player with the most cards with one type of ingredient is the winner.

name: Musta Maija
description:
A traditional Finnish card game, based on Russian Durak. The goal of the game is to shed cards. On each turn, the active player ("attacker") plays any number of cards in one suit to next player ("defender"). The defender may beat them by playing cards from her hand, either higher cards in the same suit or any cards in the trump suit.

Queen of Spades (aka Musta Maija or Black Mary) cannot be beaten or used to beat anything. As long as there's talon left, players fill their cards to five cards after each turn. Once the talon runs out, the players who get rid of their cards exit the game. The player who is left with the Queen of Spades is the loser.

name: Star Wars Simon
description:
Description from the publisher:

Jedi must use the Force to defeat Darth Vader in the Star Wars Simon game! Remember the flashing light sequences on this unique game unit designed like Darth Vader's mask and repeat the pattern back correctly to play to the beats of the iconic Imperial March. Do, or do not; there is no try against the Star Wars Simon game!

name: Knope for President
description:
Master the spin and pull your campaign out of the pit with the Knope for President game inspired by the hit series, Parks and Recreation. Pawnee's reporters keep uncovering controversies and players try to defend their reputation to stay in the race. The reporter reads a scandal based on the show, and you choose your best Spin card quote, and really try to sell it. Add your own drama and details so that the reporter will choose yours as the best. And if you're a true Pawnee Insider, you can do it in character. Harness the enthusiasm of Chris Traeger or the passion of Leslie Knope – or whomever you're quoting. The reporter awards the best one a Vote token and the first player to earn 3 tokens wins the nomination…and the game.

PARKS AND RECREATION THEME: It's time to catch your dream and shackle it to your heart as you play this party game inspired by the hit TV show, Parks and Recreation

SPIN THE SCANDALS: The reporter reads a Scandal card and candidates respond with a Spin card. The hilarious and wacky scandals, scenarios, and quotes are all inspired by the Parks and Rec television series

GET VOTE TOKENS WITH THE BEST SPIN: When candidates present their Spin response they can embellish, add drama, or say very little as long as they incorporate the exact character quote on the card

PAWNEE SCANDALS: Candidates respond to headlines from The Pawnee Journal or the Pawnee Sun, a prompt from Ya Heard? With Perd's Perd Hapley, or a citizen write-in

PARTY GAME: Fans of Parks and Rec will love this party game about the pitfalls of politics. It captures the essence of the show's quirky characters and scenarios.

• Includes 300 cards (200 Spin cards, 94 Scandal cards, 6 Leslie Knope's Official Candidate Debate Tips cards), 18 cardboard Vote tokens, and instructions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Political

name: Call It!
description:
(From the game box)

The exciting game of instant decisions... Decide what your strategy will be... Make the call, throw the special dice and hope they roll your way. That's "Call It"!

Predict your dice throw and CALL IT, in this wild race game. You can Advance yourself, Setback your opponents, or do both if you CALL IT right. With the right calls, you'll be the first to reach the Finish Line. SO get ready, get set, and CALL IT!

name: Pic Flip
description:
Pic Flip is a card game from 7 years and up, which provides rapid fun when turning the cards over quickly.
The game principle is so easy to understand that even the youngest can play independently.
Children especially like the rapid hunt for matching cards. Whoever is the first player or first player to turn all cards over and down the fastest wins.
Develops concentration, identification and dexterity and is lots of fun.

name: DICEcapades! Quick Play Edition
description:
DICEcapades! Quick Play Edition is a smaller version of DICEcapades that can be either played in half the time as a standalone game or used as an expansion for the original game. At the start of a player's turn, he draws a card from one of the decks, then tries out perform the challenge on the card, possibly with the assistance of others. The three categories of cards are:


Actionland cards are generally physical or dexterity challenges, such as drawing a picture, stacking the dice before time runs out, or doing 1d20 jumping jacks.
Thinkingtown cards are generally memory, logic, or math exercises, such as naming a certain number of items in a category, gaining/losing a point if the product of the numbers of the dice is even or odd, or rolling letter dice to spell a person's name within thirty seconds.
Triviaville cards present trivia questions, with an opponent rolling a color die, then asking the corresponding question. (Black = reader's choice.)


The player(s) performing the challenge score one or more points (if they succeed), and the first player to score twenty points wins. (The rules suggest playing in teams, so the maximum player count could be considered twelve.)

name: Conquistador
description:
A simple card game of empire-building rivalry.

There are some 15 territory cards rated 1 through 3, some of which are dealt out to the players at the start (each gets a 1 and a 2 territory). There are Revolt and Cannon cards. The remaining cards are Development cards, each rated from 1 to 6. On your turn, you draw a card and play or discard one. The deck of a little over a hundred cards is played through and then everyone scores. Once the deck is exhausted, play continues until everyone's hand is also exhausted. Once your hand drops below four cards, there are some limitations on card play that come into effect.

When developing a Territory you own, you ideally would play a 1, then a 2, and so on up to a 6. The developments must be played in increasing numerical sequence, but they need not be consecutive. At the end of the game, a territory scores the number of development cards on it times its basic multiplier (1×, 2× or 3×) - so an undeveloped territory is worthless. If you managed to have a sequence of at least four consecutive developments on the territory, you score a sizable bonus.

Revolt cards prevent a territory from being developed or attacked; they also cancel an existing revolt card (there are only 8 of those in the deck). It is sometimes good strategy to play a revolt on a territory of your own to prevent it from being attacked.

Cannon cards are used to attack other players' territories; you play a cannon face down, and so does the defender. Both reveal their cards and add a die roll. The attacker's total must beat the defender's for the attack to succeed. When it does, you roll a die and this indicates how many cards you plunder from that territory. If that roll is high enough, you can even steal the territory itself. Plundered cards must be allocated to your territories right away or discarded.

Cannon can also be used, if rated four or better, to empty one of your territories from its development cards so as to redeploy them - in effect, you are raiding yourself.

A number of small variant rules are supplied in the rule book. The cards are printed in French, English and Dutch.

It is good strategy to build your hand for the end game, so you can, for example, protect a territory with a Revolt, then unprotect it, redeploy Development cards with a strong Cannon, and complete the territory's development with your last few card plays.

Awards

Card Game As d'Or 2001

name: Agent of Change
description: Agent of Change is the rail game of West Virginia, pitting the players against the mountains and each other. The object of the game is to link the Great East Coast Cities to the Ohio River and amass $250 million first. This game is very similar to the standard Mayfair Empire Builder games except that it was a limited edition game for the Huntington Museum of Art as part of their exhibit entitled "Agent of Change: The Railroad in West Virginia". Aspects of this game that makes it different than the other Mayfair crayon games is the use of the load sheet, the ability to build coal mines, and the extremely mountainous terrain. Instead of load cards, the game uses two dice and a load sheet where the player rolls dice and reference the master load sheet to determine the available contracts. Building coal mines involves building rails through coal mine spaces which causes a load of coal to be available at the nearest coal city. Since West Virginia is naturally mountainous, the competition for the best routes is extremely competitive, even in a two-player game.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Mein Lieber Biber
description: In this game, the players try to earn wooden sticks by advancing colored beavers on spaces of matching color. The board is set on balance on a wooden piece. When moving a beaver, you have to carefully choose the right one, so as to not let the board fall.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Racing

name: Sunken Treasure
description: Be the player with the most money at the end of the game. Players play diving cards to obtain riches. They try to pick up treasure from the ocean floor without touching the sides of the openings (like operation).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Nautical
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Deutschland unter Geld
description:
War economy is the biggest factor that determines the outcome of modern war. Deutschland Unter Geld (Germany "under money") is a strategic game that simply and coldly looks at the reality of war economy. Operations only exhaust the nation, but the pursuit of efficiency alone cannot win the war. For six years from Poland to Berlin, are you ready for an adventure ?

Number of counters: about 50
Map size: 1 half map
Game period: 8 turns
Unit size: army-army group
Number of players: 2 people
Difficulty (5 levels, 5 is the highest): 1

(translated & adapted from GJ website)


This is a strategic treatment of WW2 in Europe like "The Third Reich" in microgames format.
Units are moved after resource spending.
publishers: Game Journal, Hobby Japan, Kuro Neko Design Workshop

name: Seals of Satan
description:
Seals of Satan is a two-player game pitting possessed seals against the International Brotherhood of Seal Hunters, hired by President Gore to protect humanity. The game first appeared in White Wolf magazine #42.

The game progresses through three scenarios, each played out on different boards. The first involves humans escaping off of an ice floe in an attempt to flee the seals. The seal hunters must save Atlantic City beach goers from the seals in the second scenario, and the third scenario pits the seal hunters against the seals in the oval office.

Three scenario boards are included, as well as chits for people like Al Gore, Tipper, Rambo, Flipper, Lassie, Hank the seal hunter, Revolted mimes, seal pups, etc. Winning involves collecting victory points which are very much dependent on the scenario.

Game was translated into polish as "Foki Szatana" and published in the "Magia i Miecz" magazine.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid
publishers: White Wolf Entertainment AB, Wydawnictwo MAG

name: Trepido
description: Card version of scissors rock paper including a color tie breaker of red orange green. Looks like a get rid of your cards first Uno style by topping the previous card.

name: Scene it? FIFA Edition
description: Scene it? -This time with scenes and questions around the Football World cup.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on Misty Island
description:
A quick switch from The Big Chill to A Tan and Sandy Silence. This class reunion lacked class and reunion. Eight loving “friends” arrived on their college housemother’s island for some rest and relaxation. Twelve hours later, Stephanie Stephens was dead, and they were suspects in her murder. No escape, no assistance, no TV. Solve the murder of attorney Stephanie Stephens before these college chums get you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Real-time

name: Monopoly: Chicago Cubs
description: The MONOPOLY game partners with Major League Baseball® to bring you the ultimate collector’s edition of the MONOPOLY game featuring the Chicago Cubs™. Compete to own the Cubs greatest assets including Hall of Famers like Billy Williams and Hack Wilson, all-time greats like Fergie Jenkins, Carlos Zambrano, Aramis Ramirez and the 1907 World Series Championship. Current stars like Alfonso Soriano, Derrek Lee, Michael Barrett, Ted Lilly and pieces of Wrigley Field™ including the Marquee, the Scoreboard and the Ivy are up for grabs! Includes six collectible pewter tokens for the true baseball fan - Cubs baseball cap, pitcher, batter, hotdog, ball in glove and catcher's mask. This game, like no other, encompasses the best of the Cubs.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hit The Habitat Trail
description: Learn about animals and their environments as you follow the stone trail through the world's habitats. Draw a "Wisdom & Consequence" card to learn about environmental hazards and to discover ways in which you can help improve the environment. With every correct answer to an animal or habitat question on the "Knowledge" cards, you collect one "Habitat" card. Collect two cards from each habitat to become an "Earth Steward" and win the game. It's a fun expedition around the world for family and friends when you "HIT THE HABITAT TRAIL!"

name: Raiding Parties: Brethren Of The Coast
description:
Raiding Parties: Brethren Of The Coast is an expansion for Raiding Parties (AKA Raiding Parties: The Golden Age of Piracy). It includes 51 game cards, 3 Party List cards and a rule book. The expansion introduces two new card types :"Land" cards, which work similarly to fort cards; and One Timers, which may be used at any time.

The cards included are:

Pirate* (5)
Brethren* (5)
Swashbuckler* (5)
Privateer* (3)
Pirateer* (3)
Lucky Parrot (3)
Lookout (3)
Master Gunner (3)
Pirate Chief (3)
Coastlands (2)
Dueling grounds (1)
Jolly Roger (2)
Lieutenant (2)
Skipper (2)
Raiders (2)
Flotilla (2)
Quicksilver (1)
Liberty (1)
Schooner (1)
Pirate Ship (1)
Captaine Redd (1)
Parly List (3)


Cards marked with an asterisk are duplicates of cards from the base game.

name: Starship Battles
description:
In Starship Battles, each player commands a starship and seeks to destroy his opponents. The game ends after one player has completely destroyed all of his opponents’ ship compartments.

Ships are customized at the start of the game, then face off against each other. The compartments each ship has are up to the players, who must strike a balance between offense, defense, repairability, and command.

Players start the game by drawing ship compartment cards from the deck. Each ship compartment can take a certain amount of damage before it is destroyed. When a ship compartment is destroyed, it is discarded. Part of the strategy of Starship Battles lies in how one chooses to manage battle damage.

As the turns progress, players attack one another using their weapons, defend themselves using their shields, change their attacks or defends using command points, and repair damage using engineering capability.
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Huida de Silver City: La Feria de los Monstruos
description:
En esta ampliación, los jugadores se encontrarán con nuevas opciones para el mapa de la feria. Recuerda que este mapa viene en el reverso del nuevo mapa básico de la reedición de HSC.
En la expansión se incluyen las nuevas Cartas de Saqueo para utilizar en los edificios de la zona de la feria, así como las nuevas armas que encontraréis en las cajas de dichos edificios y las nuevas fichas de exploración que habrá por el tablero.

Además se incluyen nuevos modos de juego para Huida de Silver City, con misiones espontáneas durante la partida, que harán que huir sea más complicado.

---

This expansion offers the players new options for the Fair map. Please remember that this map is featured on the back side of the new basic map of ESC's reprint.
The expansion includes new Loot Cards that you can use for the Fair's locations, new weapons that you will find in those locations' boxes, and new Exploration Tokens that will appear all over the board.
It also includes new game modes for Escape from Silver City, with spontaneous missions that will hinder your escape.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Go Bong!
description:
Like its predecessor Last Mouse Lost, the playing area of Go Bong! consists of a rubber grid with raised "bumps" that can be pushed down with your fingers. Once all of the bumps have been pressed, you can flip the board over and play again on the other side.

To play, two players alternate turns pressing down one or more bumps in the grid, with these bumps needing to be in the same horizontal, vertical or diagonal row. Whoever pushes down the final bump loses.

Go Bong! includes solitaire challenges.

name: Stoned: A Stone Snatching Game
description:
STONED: A Stone Snatching Game is a card based game where the players pretend to be Cave people and try to collect more Stones than any of the other players.

On each turn a player can do only one of the following:

Take a Card (from the deck)
Take a Stone (from the bank)
Play a card (from their hand)
Throw a Stone (from their pile)

These simple but various options keeps the game fast and fun.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Take That

name: An Unnecessarily Long Story (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
This is a fan made expansion for T.I.M.E Stories.

It is a fantasy style, a bit similar to PoD but quite different in terms of era and feelings. It is more of fairy tales settings.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Эмоциональный интеллект
description:
Playing Emotional Intelligence in a fun way will help you learn to understand human emotions. And how do you think how many emotions are inherent in man? More than 100 are guaranteed, and even psychiatrists cannot give an exact answer, because there are certain types of emotions that only certain nations have. Interesting? And “interest” is also an innate emotion that you have already shown for this game.

Why do you need this game?
In order to describe the ability of a person to recognize and understand emotions, as well as to control them, scientists have come up with such a thing as Emotional Intelligence. The more developed he is with a person, the more successful his possessor is in his career and in life, the more charming he looks to others. The game "Emotional Intelligence" in a fun relaxed manner allows you to:
- increase your emotional intelligence;
- learn more about the people around them and "see through them";
- to liberate any company.

Interesting facts about the game
The game "Emotional Intelligence" was invented by a professional clown, so the characters on the game chips and cards with 105 emotions contain an image of clowns.
In life, people express emotions, often performing some actions, and in the game you will have to perform some tasks - to drum on the table, crouch, or touch your partner.
Two ways to achieve the pinnacle of gaming success is to use phrase maps or talk in gibberish language.
Guaranteed test of emotions: enthusiasm, joy, carelessness, fun, enthusiasm, and many others.
The game is packed in the original box, as if made by own hands and tied with a gift bow.

name: Dinosaur Bingo
description: A variant of bingo, each player has a board with a 4x4 grid of 16 dinosaurs. The caller randomly picks one of 48 different dinosaur tiles for the players to match. The first player to fill their card of 16 is the winner.

name: Beer Nerd
description: The Beer Nerd™ game is a beer tasting game from the creators of the Winerd® game. Taste 3 beers at the start then answer trivia questions and take blind tastes to advance. Think you know your beers? Then Put Your Beer Where Your Mouth Is!

name: KABOOM!
description:
The old man stepped into the arena, inhaled one last time on his cigar and flicked it onto the ground, grinding it into the dust with his heel. He looked up, squinting as the setting sun glinted in his eyes. Seven other figures stood in a wide circle, each armed with an array of weaponry - a sniper, a famous action hero, a modern day samurai, a no-nonsense paid assassin, a post-apocalyptic survivor, a huge musclebound powerhouse, an anti-terrorist soldier.....All armed to the teeth and ready to fight to the death.

The retired spec-ops Colonel flicked the latch of the sturdy missile launcher that was slung across his shoulders, checked the magazine of the machine gun hanging across his chest, andd fiddled one last time with the sights of the sniper rifle in his hands.

Overkill was underrated.

KABOOM! is a party game for all ages for 4-8 players. Each player receives one of 8 characters and, using dice, chooses weapons with which to attack their opponents, wearing away their life points until they are the last one left standing. Each round of KABOOM! can be played in a matter of minutes, especially if played at a high tempo, and so although players are eliminated, they never have to wait long for a new round to start! Players are encouraged to hold grudges, get into character, mock, cajole, beg and target the player who keeps winning!

While the game is about shooting eachother, it's abstract enough that it's suitable for children, in fact much of the playtesting was carried out on children aged between 7 and 14....But is also fun and suitable for adults, especially adults who are letting their hair down!

name: Them & Us
description:
A deliberately provocative game that pitches men against women. Each team takes turns to shout out responses to stereotypical topics. It could be "Brands of Make-Up", "Fast Cars", or "Annoying Male Habits". But only answers matching those on the card score points!

Frantic, funny and frequently outspoken, this game pitches brawn against beauty in a contest to determine the superior sex!

name: Trouble in Templetown
description:
This was a Kickstarter SCAM - They took the money of the backers and never delivered... just ghosted everyone!

Become heroic White Cell Agents and dive into Templetown, the body-wide city thriving inside Stanley Hasselhoff.
Arm yourself with potent medicine, navigate the bustling streets toward infected areas, and keep his body safe from nasty, invading germs.

Trouble in Templetown is an immersive cooperative & competitive game (1-4 players) wherein you take the role of White Cell Agents, fighting against assaulting germs and viruses. Your mission is to keep the germs in check while building enough immunity walls to insulate Stanley from the spreading infection.
Fail at that, and you'll have one last shot at saving his life by taking on the virus behind this whole thing in an all-or-nothing face-off…"

In Trouble in Templetown, your goal is to prevent parasites, bacteria, and other nasty invaders from taking over the city. As a cooperative game, you’ll need to work together with other players to secure Districts by building Immunity Walls or take the Enemies down in one fell swoop by defeating Frankie Bola, the dangerous kingpin Virus threatening Templetown.

Defeat the Enemies by either building Immunity Walls in Districts equal to the number of players OR by defeating Frankie Bola, the deadly virus boss.
There are 3 types of Enemies you’ll face in Templetown:

Lazy Parasites spawn and stay in a single Zone, laying Eggs in adjacent Intersections.
Wandering Bacteria move between Zones and leave Eggs behind as they go.
And Frankie Bola moves secretly, leaving special Eggs until cornered and revealed.

Each round, you are dealt up to 6 Action Cards and by combining them you can optimize your actions: move around the city, construct an Immunity Wall or Cure a Bacteria or a Parasite.
Action cards are used to generate action points (AP), which you’ll use on your turn to complete various actions. There are 3 types of AP: (add visual for the 4 action symbols)

Move AP (blue) are used to move between Districts, Intersections, and Zones.
Build AP (green) are used to construct Immunity Blocks and Defense Towers.
And Cure AP (red) are used to remove Enemies.

On Action cards, there are 2 symbols, each with a number. These indicate the type and quantity of AP that the card generates. You may use either of the 2 symbols, but not both.

Action cards with a “wild” symbol may be used as any type of AP.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: BataPuzzle
description:
Aim: be the first to build your vehicle with the puzzle cards.

Rules of the game:
Each player chooses 2 vehicle cards and has to win all 6 puzzle cards needed to build one of the vehicles. The vehicle cards stay in front of the players during the game.
All the puzzle cards are dealt out to the players.
The players put their cards face down in a stack in front of them.

BataPuzzle
The players all turn over their top card at the same time. The player whose card has the highest number wins the hand and takes from it any cards that can be used to build his chosen vehicles.
If two or more cards have the highest number, the winner is decided by a round of War: the players each place another card face up on top of their stack, and the player with the highest card wins all the cards in the hand.
The winner is the first player to complete one of his puzzles. A player can also win a two-player game by taking all of his opponent’s cards.

name: Nannon
description:
Nannon is a reduction of Backgammon to a super-quick game. Nannon reduces the basic concepts of Backgammon to the smallest feasible combination that still retains the idea of Backgammon.

For instance:

Rather than having "stacks" of men on each position, Nannon allows only one man per spot.
Since you can't "stack" men, contiguous groups of 2 or all 3 men of the same team can't be hit.
Each player has only three men, as opposed to the 15 of Backgammon.
Each player gets one die, rather than getting to use two. (Nannon makes use of the fact that each player has her own die.)
The board only has six positions, instead of 24.

Nannon does, however, still provide a doubling cube, which is rather relevant since the individual games of Nannon are so much shorter than those of Backgammon.

name: Rattlesnake Jake
description: Rattlesnake Jake has stolen your gold! Watch out for his rattle, and carefully sneak the gold back. One wrong move… and he strikes! His ominous rattle builds the suspense for the ultimate jump! If Rattlesnake Jake strikes on your turn, you must return half of your nuggets to him. The player with the most gold when the last nugget has been taken wins the game.

name: Gundam M.S.War Trading Card Game
description:
Gundam M.S.War Trading Card Game is based on the popular Japanese anime series based on giant robots. Gundam first started in 1979 and continues to this day with various series, movies, models, and toys and now a collectible card game. The particular gundam series it is based on is Gundam Wing, although they were going to release other expansions to add more series to the game.

To play the game, you need two opposed decks. In this case you need the Wing Gundam starter Set and the Oz Corps Starter Decks. You play cards depicting giant robots and can equip them with character cards to increase the attack strength. The cards are played by playing their cost points. The cost if discarding a certain number of cards. Then the robots battle and the loser loses a certain number of cards from his draw pile, when the draw pile is empty, the game is over.
categories: Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Queensland
description:
A Free Cheapass Game:
Queensland is a game for two players that uses a checkers set and a pad of paper to keep score. You play by optionally moving a piece which was previously placed and then placing a piece. The goal is to score points by counting the number of open squares between two of your pieces. Played in two rounds. The player with the higher score is the winner.

name: Goosebumps: Storytelling Card Game
description:
A simple set of 54 playing cards each with a gruesome Goosebumps picture and word on it. Words include Chains, Mask, Screaming, Howling Horrible Smell, Cracked Mirror, Creaking Stairs and such ...

The first player starts the story by playing a card and stating a phrase that contains the word(s) on the card. The card is played face down. The next player plays a card but repeats the first players phrase, then adds their own. Each player follows suite, repeating the whole story form the beginning, and adding a phrase. The cards are always played face down on top of one another, the object being to remember the story thus far and add to it. After adding to it, the face down cards are revealed and your story is checked for errors. If you slip up, you're eliminated, and it plays thus until one person is left.

Very simple memory based story telling game for Ages 7 and up.

name: Operation Walküre
description:
"Operation Walküre" is a mini solitaire game about the 1944 plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler. The goal of the conspirators was to kill Hitler in his East Prussian headquarters, the 'Die Wolfsschanze' (the Wolf’s Lair) and then seize power in Germany.

The game recreates the difficulties in getting close to Hitler while avoiding Hitler’s suspicions and being arrested by the Gestapo.

name: Buzzword Junior
description:
Let’s say the Buzzword is “Butter.” Can your team solve these five clues? Remember that “Butter” is in all the answers, and you’ll press the buzzer for every right answer.


The PB of PB&J


answer: Peanut butter


Talk nicely so someone likes you


answer: Butter up


A monarch, not a moth


answer: Butterfly


An ice cream sundae topping


answer: Butterscotch


A crunchy candy bar


answer: Butterfinger

With clues for all ages, Buzzword Junior is the perfect family game. It is played in teams with 4 or more players, ages 7 and up, and includes a fun buzzer.

name: Kot w worku
description:
People say it is better to knw what is hiding in the bag. It is better to know whether it is a cat or something else. Sarkany Samu would not want you to get dissappointed so this boardgame calls you to practice on the Funny Bag.
The players pull out the cardboard characters, feeel them with their hands and if they can guess which character they have in hand then they find the matching picture on the board and put their pawn to its place.

Components:
- 9 two sided board
- 27 pictures
- 30 pawns
- bag
- rulebook

name: Yoink!
description:
In Yoink! players must close their eyes or wear sleep shades and quickly pass tactile cards. Players are not allowed to use their eyes so all players, blind or sighted, are on an equal playing field.

Players must feel the cards to determine when they have cards with all the same or different attributes. In the center of the table there are totems (we use dice) enough for all the players except one. When a player has a set that is all the same(or all different) number of shape, type of shape and background fill they will reach for the totems at the center of the table.

Once the first player has their trio they declare 'Yoink!' and the remaining players scramble to get the remaining totems. Players who don't get a totem are eliminated and play continues.

name: Derivation
description:
A board game released late in 2002 and is a multi-game in one with an emphasis on creative wordplay, phrase guessing and a whole lot of fabrication.

Half of the game features the theme which is where the players hear a common word of phrase used on popular culture such as "cut to the chase" or "spam" and then fabricate the origins of those phrases to fool the other players into guessing their false derivation. The other half is split into three different mini games all built around the same key phrases. Two involve trying to guess the popular word or phrase by either charades/drawing or talking about the phrase but not using any of the words in the actual question.

The last part involves pure chance where a random event migh help or hinder the current player slightly. Winning the round in these various activities will earn cards with an individual letter which eventually spells out "D-E-R-I-V-A-T-I-O-N."

The first player to do this wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Sea Devils
description: American Civil War naval game with individual ships rated for gunnery, defense, and movement.
categories: American Civil War, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Wimpy Kid: 10-Second Challenge
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Who can throw up Balla Balla and clap his hands five times before catching it once again? Who can place Balla Balla on his left foot, then hop three times without it falling off? Who can name four things you'd find in a garage? And who can do each of these challenges in only ten seconds?!

Gregs Tagebuch: 10 Sekunden Balla Balla includes more than ninety challenges for those waiting to be presented with a dare — or who want to dare others...

name: Whatchamacallit
description: Object is to get the most words relating to objects on the board. Select a category square, spin the spinner, be the first to think of a word with the letter indicated by the spinner.
publishers: Berwick's Toy Co. Ltd., Cadaco, Gay-Play, Piatnik, Schmidt Spiele

name: Kermit the Frog Card Game
description: A fun, fast-action game with special cards that picture Kermit the Frog performing some mighty entertaining acts, everything from flying high on a trapeze to making magic. The cards are numbered 1 to 9 in four color suits which are dealt out into face-down piles in front of each player. Players on their turns try to get rid of their cards by playing them on an opponent's pile or on the piles in the center of the playing area. The first player to get rid of all his or her cards, wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Zoom-in!
description: The game contains one round board, many cards and a countdown timer. On the board there are hundreds of black-and-white drawings of objects like; animals, buildings, tools, persons etc. Each card contains one drawing. The cards are shuffled and one card is placed on the table, so that everybody can see it. The countdown timer is started and the active player has 45 seconds to find the object, that the card shows, on the board. He may move the board clockwise/counterclockwise. If he finds the drawing, he stops the countdown timer and points to the place on the board, where he found it. A new card is drawn. If the countdown timer expires, the next player has to search for the same object. (He may look at the board and search, even if it is not his/her turn, but only the active player may solve.)

name: Hummmzinger
description:
Can You Hum...
Hound Dog? Love Potion #9? La Bamba? Duke of Earl?

Think you could guess this Rock'n Roll classis from the clue: "In what song did the Beach Boys make a lot of sheepish noise?"

Well that's what HUMMMZINGER is all about. It's about Rock'n Roll music. All those great songs from the 50's, 60's, 70's and today.

You get points for humming songs, mimicking guitar sounds, imitating the mannerisms of an artist or group while your teammates try to guess the titles of the songs. And if you can't hum a song, you're still in the game. You can get points by using the clues.

So for a Rockin' good time, invite some friends over and play HUMMMZINGER. It's the game that'll have everyone a-Rockin' and a-Rollin', and a HUMMMZINGING.

name: The Green Earth
description:
From the box:

Buy countries, develop regions, wheel and deal on the money market, care for the environment, and suffer or gain your fate in the hands of chance. A GAME OF GLOBAL STRATEGY, SKILL AND A TOUCH OF CHANCE!
Ever dreamed of ruling the world?
Test your skills and strategy with The Green Earth game!
Buy countries, develop regions, wheel and deal on the money market,
care for the environment, and suffer or gain from your fate in the hands of chance.
Will drought kill your trees, will winds close your airports,
will pollution control bring you dollars, will a camel rescue you from the dessert?
Every roll of the dice brings excitement, fun and a better understanding of our global village.
The Green Earth is a unique game that can be played by all.
Some will enjoy going around the board buying and selling, others will love the strategy and intrigue.

name: Waku Waku maar mee
description:
Game based on a Dutch TV Quiz Show by broadcaster KRO during the years 1989 through 2001.

Players must answer questions about all kinds of animals. For each correctly answered set of questions the players are rewarded with 'monkeys'. The first player who has collected two monkeys in each category wins the game.

A version with a VHS tape also exists.
categories: Animals, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
publishers: TFL Spellen, Toys & Games Express, Videofilm Express

name: Hogopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Alarm Clock, #2 Pencil, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Bud Walton Arena, Hper Building, Arkansas Union, Old Main

Cards:
Arkansas vs Texas. Advance to Razorback Stadium. Wooo, Pig, Sooieeee!

All Campus Party! All tokens advance to Fraternity Row.

Road trip to Little Rock! Collect $10 from every player.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Henne Berta
description: In Henne Berta (Hen Berta in English) the player feeds a hen with grain and in return gathers eggs to a little basket. The first player that gets 3 eggs to basket is the winner. The game contains a wooden board, large wooden pieces and little baskets for every player.

name: Clou
description:
Make-Shift / Clou is an abstract game that looks a lot like Tic-Tac-Toe. The board is a 3x3 grid with 8 tiles that can slide inside the board with spaces on top for player pieces, which are colored plastic disks.

The object of the game is to complete a row, column or diagonal of three of your own pieces. However each player only has 3 pieces and the 3 x 3 grid is occupied by only 8 sliding tiles where player pieces can be played. So, although it looks like Tic-Tac-Toe, the game play is completely different.

On your turn you can either play a piece onto an empty tile, move a piece from one tile onto an empty tile, or slide a tile into the empty space. The other player is not allowed to slide a just-moved tile back to where it came from, thus preventing game lock up.

If you get 3 in a row, you win the round and the first player to win 6 rounds wins the game.

name: Cranium Letter Line-Up
description:
The game includes a deck of cards with a hint on one side, and a word or phrase to guess on the other. It has 6 letter dice, and a 5 minute timer.

You are all working together as a team against the timer.

Some cards are laid face down in the middle of the table. Each player takes a turn by rolling the dice and trying to get the other players to guess the word on the card by describing it using ONLY words that begin with the letters showing on the dice.

If all the cards are solved before the timer runs out, everyone wins!

name: San Guo Sha: Tomb of Cao Cao
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




Scattered artifacts of the Legends of the Three Kingdoms lay hidden in Cao Cao's tomb. Find and reassemble the artifact fragments to unlock the power stored within for a millennium!
What secret is hidden in the tomb? Who can master the hidden power in the artifacts?

After Cao Cao's tomb was discovered, the explorers delve into the tomb to unlock Cao Cao's secret . The players will look for artifacts in the tomb through exploration of the debris, excavation or exchange with other explorers. The artifacts wield special power, and will aid in further exploration of the tomb. The first player to complete five artifacts wins the game.

Though this takes place in the San Guo Sha game setting, this is a stand-alone game of drawing tiles. Treasure and junk tiles will be placed face down in the middle of the table. Players will draw two tiles, and keep one. Then players will trade one of their own face-down tiles with the face-down tile of another player. The object is to be the first to collect the right tiles that will assemble the lost treasures.

The game comes with:
60 artifact tiles
4 character tiles
1 drawstring bag

name: ZOMBIEPOX
description:
A brand new evolution of Pox: Save the People, ZOMBIEPOX challenges 1-4 players to stop an approaching zombie apocalypse by vaccinating humans against the ZOMBIEPOX. Cure those in the most dire situations and protect the vulnerable who cannot be immunized. (No one wants zombie babies!) Win the game if the deadly ZOMBIEPOX can no longer spread. Lose if too many people become full-blown zombies.

Not only is the game fun, but through play and the zombie themed narrative, players gain an understanding of group immunity, the need to vaccinate, and systems thinking. Casual and hardcore gamers from 12-65 and have enjoyed ZOMBIEPOX.

Players alternate drawing cards. Each card specifies how the ZOMBIEPOX spreads, and then which resources the player has to combat the outbreak. It's important to protect the vulnerable people on the board, because if they become infected, they immediately succumb to zombification.

name: Pipifax
description:
In Pipifax, players need to find animals in the wild, and the first player to find an animal in all four sections of the wilds wins the game.

To set up, take the 24 animal tiles – which come in four colors with six animals appearing in each color – shuffle them face down, then place them in groups by color. On a turn, the player rolls the die, then turns over a tile of any color to try to find the animal that matches what's shown on the die. If she fails to do so, her turn ends; if she does find the animal, she rolls the die again and tries to find the matching animal in a different color group. This process continues until either she fails to find an animal, thereby ending her turn, or she finds one animal in each of the four color groups, in which case she wins!

name: Cards Against Humanity: Cards For Hope!
description:
A reward for the Desert Bus for Hope: The Documentary kickstarter.

LoadingReadyRun and Cards Against Humanity are going to team-up to write a 15-card pack, entirely Desert Bus themed! This one-off pack will only be available through this campaign.
– from the Kickstarter campaign
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Coffee Break
description:
Get ready to add some spice to your game night with Spicy Games! Each of the spice bottles hold all of the pieces you need to play a game. Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play. For ages 8 and up.

Players roll dice, try to spot the right combination of coffee cups and shout it out first. The winner is rewarded coffee beans according to a game instructions.
publishers: Goliath Games, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: トゥーヴァイ (Two Wei)
description:
There will be a new king in this country. The firstborn prince was scheduled to become king, but has dies just before taking the throne. It seems the second born has cheated his way to the throne. The king, who gave preferential treatment to his recently lost firstborn issues a decree!

“This is outrageous! I will instead reward the person who comes second in five essential skills!”

So, will you be able to come second, as the king prefers?

This is a tricktaking game. Players put out cards one by one and wins a group of cards called a “trick” by following the rules. You will receive points from the King depending on the number of cards you have won, but remember the King will only reward those in second place.

The number of rounds played is equal to the number of players. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.
publishers: 758 Board Game Circle (758ボードゲーム会)

name: Take it or leave it?
description:
A trivia game with the twist that the players sometimes get to hand a question to another player.

On your turn, you roll the die.
If you roll a color, you decide if you want to answer the corresponding question or pass it on to another player.
If you roll "Take it" or "Leave it", you get to choose which color question to either answer or pass on, but you have to make this decision before you see the card.

A correct answer gives a point. First to five points wins.

—user summary

name: Eresia: Secret of Eden
description:
​"Eresia" is a beautiful world where desires and tricks swirl.

Please enjoy the pleasure of surpassing others while the right and wrong roads compete with each other.

Players compete to gain 10 grade points, the first to do so wins OR the first player to use a key in the hidden ruins first will win.
