On their turn players will either Play a card, Plan, use a location action, or pass. After this, the player then may move their player pawn to an adjacent location space.

Be careful using forbidden items will rose suspicions of other players and they may report you and in doing so reduce the amount of cards in your hand!

Do you play by the Rules and get your defining grade or break the rules and unlock the ruins of hidden knowledge ... the choice is yours.

name: The Goonies Game
description:
You're on the hunt for One-Eyed Willy's fabled treasure with the Fratellis close behind in this immersive cooperative family strategy game! Maneuver your way through the tunnels and around challenges like the Bone Piano to discover the "Rich Stuff" at the end of the journey but only if you can stay ahead of the Fratellis! Bring back your best childhood memories and watch your kids fall in love with this classic adventure movie.

The Goonies Game is here to bring you into the thrilling world of the Fratellis, the Bone Piano, the Goon Docks, and more. Work together to discover the rich stuff at the end of the journey! One-Eyed Willy has his hands on the treasure you are searching for. Solve the challenges with the silver doubloon and the copper bones key to unlock the secrets and find the treasure.

In this game, you work together with the other players to run away from the Fratellis and clear challenges (dice rolls and blind guessing) before they reach you. All 4 groups of Goonies are always in play so these will need to be divided over the number of players. Players play cards on their turn to move (mandatory) and can optionally try challenges (if they're on a challenge space), try to break free from the clutches of the Fratellis (die roll) and play a quote (a one time effect played, unique per card).

The Goonies need to reach the end of the board to win the game, they will also need to have at least 25 'rich stuff' which are found at the end of the board and mostly comes down to blindly taking the correct ones.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Move Through Deck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivial Pursuit: Family Edition – Bite-Size
description:
This is another in the "Bite-Size" range of Trivial Pursuit games. It is intended as a portable travel game. The game is packaged in a wedge ("piece-of-pie") shaped box.

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.

Is a stand-alone game, or may be used to add questions to Trivial Pursuit: Family Edition.
publishers: Hasbro, Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers

name: Magus
description:
A game of light-hearted acquisition and conquest for 2-6 players. Each player represents a powerful wizard -- a Magus -- and attempts to acquire various Power Zones represented on the game board. By skillful use of his acquisitions and cards, each player then attempts to gain control of the Towers of all other players, or else gain all Power Zones on the game board.

Published in Dragon Magazine #147. Artwork by Tom Wham.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That, Track Movement

name: Big Boss
description: A super variation on the popular card game "President" (See also "Scum: The Food Chain Game "). Your goal is to become the Big Boss, replacing bigger face-up cards on the table with value from 1 to 13. Special cards added to the challenge. They will either help you or hurt you!

name: Red Dog, Blue Dog
description:
From the publisher:

A first colour lotto.
An award-winning first lotto game for very young players. Try to be the first to match all the coloured pictures on your playing board.

name: Airline
description:
Airline is a very simple 'roll and move' game with a few twists.

Players are competing airlines trying to collect money for 'landing rights' at various cities around the world. You can only collect this money if you have a "route" (either direct or indirect) from your home city. Players start with $100,000,000.

Money collected for landing rights varies depending on the size of your airline, indicated by the playing piece (prop, jet, or SST) that you have in play. Once paid, the landing rights to a city may be challenged by paying the owner an additional $20,000,000 and then rolling the dice... high dice wins (ties go to the current owner). If a player cannot pay a debt, he is bankrupt and out of the game.

Play continues until only one player is left and is declared the winner.
publishers: Gamma Two Games, MPH Games Co.

name: Constellation: The Space Race Game
description:
Constellation is an exciting space adventure game. The year is 3001 and you are a finalist in the great Constellation Space Race. As a spaceship captain you are dealt three of the 88 constellation cards at random. Now the race begins...choose a pewter spaceship and roll the die. To travel through space you either have to answer questions or follow actions. By quickly docking on your constellations and being the first to return to the starting point you will be crowned "Space Race Champion!".

Game contains 1 double sided game board, 168 Playing cards, 4 English pewter spaceships, 2 Wooden alien spaceships, 12 wooden pawns 1 wooden die and 1 rules leaflet.

name: Tips Ahoy
description: A stacking/balancing game with unique kinetic action. Draw a card to tell you which pirate to pile onto the ship and which water tile to use, then pull the water tile under the ship to make the boat rock on the waves. Try not to let your pirates fall overboard, but you might try to knock off your opponent's! Each player gets one coin for each of her pirates remaining on the ship after movement of the water tile.

name: Super Aggravation
description:
The object of Super Aggravation is to move your four markers from your Base to Home. Each turn you roll a die and move a marker the number rolled. A 1 or 6 allows you to start a marker. Land on another player's marker and you aggravate that marker back to it's base. The first player to get all four markers home wins.

Basically, Super Aggravation plays the same as Aggravation except for the addition of the red and blue deck of cards. In Super Aggravation there are 20 Red cards and 20 Blue cards. If a marker lands on a red star, draw a Red card. Red cards usually hinder you. Land on a gold/blue star and you have the choice to draw a Blue card. Blues cards are normally helpful. However, sometimes a Red card can be helpful and sometimes a Blue card can slow you down.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Knowbody Knows
description:
From the publisher's website...

Do YOU Know?

How many times did you laugh out loud last year?
How many hours a month does your dad spend "on the can"?
On a scale between 1 and 1000, how "flirtatious" is your sister?
How much did your best friend spend on alcohol last year?

There are NO right answers! The idea is to be the one who didn't guess too high or too low, in comparison to the group playing.

Knowbody Knows - The revealing game of wild guesses.

name: Een Reis Door Nederland
description:
Players race, using the shortest routes possible, through more than 100 cities of The Netherlands and adjacent areas in Germany and France. The first player to return to his starting point wins the game.

Contents (1985 edition):

1 board, 1 six-sided die, 6 flags, 6 pawns, 74 place cards, 55 numbered cards for places with attractions, 18 luck cards, 3 reserve cards, rules with information on the 55 tourist attractions
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tontine
description:
A card game for 4 Players, Tontine is a game of Victorian murder and backstabbing. Years after a group of long time friends had pooled their money into a tontine, it is down to the last four surviving members. The former friends have become poor and desperate. Who be the last alive to claim the cash?

Players take turns trying to stabilize their position and forcing opponents to discard cards. Players may play "accidents", which if a player has no cards in hand, will be their undoing.

Components: 60 card deck

Card Types:

Accident - forces your victim to discard
Scheme - remains in play, grants various effects
Action - gives card advantage or information
Setting - current sociopolitical environment; affects all players and remains in play

name: Blood & Fortune
description:
Blood & Fortune is a tense, competitive card game of negotiation, deduction, and betrayal. You must offer influence in order to gain influence while trying to deduce who is winning and avoid helping them further. Giving too much influence too early, or withholding it too long, might cost you the game. More importantly, only the strongest and most recent alliances will triumph.

Optional role cards and special actions provide variety, depth, and a touch of misfortune. Now, bring your friends close and your enemies closer to see who will prevail through Blood & Fortune!

name: Bowling Dice Game
description:
Bowling Dice Game is a simple "push your luck" game based on Bowling.

Roll 1 normal dice and count the pips.
If you roll a 6 then it's an instant Strike or spare regardless of previous counted pips.

You can stop rerolling whenever you want and enter the score in the scoresheet.

After a Strike or spare you get bounspoints from the next rounds

Highest score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Klong! Boing! Autsch!
description: A card game where players attempt to turn over and find colored sets of jungle animal cards in order to win the monkey card associated with that color. Each monkey card is worth a certain amount of coconuts. But players need to beware of the Tiger card which speeds up the game considerably. The player with the most coconuts on his or her cards at the end of four rounds is the winner.

name: Rychlé šípy: Duel
description:
A bunch of good guys and their old rivals, the Brotherhood of the Cat's Paw, compete for valuable artifacts from the city's mysterious district. In a card duel, you can try playing for both sides, as each offers different strategic options.

The game is played in three rounds, in which you add your own cards to selected stacks of mystery cards to compete for them. You alternate turns until one player completes a round. Then the round is evaluated.

Once the round is over, evaluate the three duels for the mystery card piles in turn. The player who has attached their own cards to the pile with a higher value than their opponent wins the pile of grey cards.

At the end of the third round, players add up the values of all the secret cards they have received. The player with the higher total is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hidden Victory Points

name: Lemonade Stand: Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
The "Lemonade Stand: Kickstarter Promo Cards" were extra rewards for backing the "Lemonade Stand" game project on Kickstarter. The promo cards include two more special dollar cards:

Soldiers (the little green plastic guys with their feet connected to a base) - You are safe from the effects of other players' dollar cards. (Resolution Number: 0, so will take effect first before any other dollar card.)

Bully - Take any face down dollar card and replace it with this card. (Resolution Number: 13, so will take effect after all other dollar cards.)
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Math
mechanics: Hand Management, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mumbo Jumbo
description:
From the Publisher:

In Mumbo Jumbo, players must get their teammates to answer questions but are limited in how they get those answers. A player may only use one of five “designated methods” to get an answer. For example, they may only give clues by humming, use their hands without speaking or be limited to using only seven words or less.

name: Pouet! Pouet!
description:
A card game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"Mime and sound game.
The players have to guess what is illustrated on the card by sound or mime...
An ideal game for small children as they don't have to be able to read. Mad laughter guaranteed."

name: Commando Pinkelen
description:
Reaction game for large groups.

All players, except the dealer, are tapping on the table with their fingers. If the dealer calls a command, which can be a color or symbol, all players should lay their hand on the right card as soon as possible. But beware, a command is not valid if the leader does not say "command". If you make a mistake or are too late, you get a penalty point. Who will be the last man standing?

The simple rules ensure that everyone can participate directly.

Commando Pinkelen is based on a public domain game with the same name.

name: Sub Shop
description:
In Sub Shop, the game of competitive sandwich construction, use 8 ingredients to build 11 unique sandwiches to fill the picky and particular orders of 9 zany customers! Draw a customer card, read out their order, then lay your ingredient cards onto the real tablecloth game board. When you complete the whole order, ring the kitchen service bell, shout "Order up!" and collect your tip!

When you think you've got the core game down, try the advanced rules and add in the action cards. You can double the tip before claiming a sandwich! Or, if your opponent is close to claiming their own sandwich, you can make theirs moldy! Add an extra sandwich for the chance at extra money, or make a foe fix a broken oven.

name: Traffic Jam
description: Using a hand of tiles, players alternate laying tiles attempting to be the one who blocks off the last road.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Bruce Jenner Decathlon Game
description: Players compete in different events of the decathlon and the player with the most combined points from all the events is the winner.

name: The Napoleonic Wars
description:
The Napoleonic Wars covers the entire period of conflict from 1796 to 1815. Each turn represents 4 months. The map is divided into areas, with terrain in the area (forest, swamp, etc.) and along the area borders (river, mountains, etc.). According to the rules, the pieces represent small corps or oversized divisions. Some units also represent commanders that can command other units. Fortresses are also represented by pieces.

The sequence of play is fairly standard for a wargame -
1) Negotiations
2) Rebuilding Cadres
3) Supply Determination
4) Movement and Combat
5) Reinforcements
6) Adjustment of Revenue
7) Move game turn marker

When playing one of the campaigns (i.e., not the full Napoleonic Wars), skip Negotiations, Rebuilding, and Revenue.

The Movement phase has a unique mechanic that requires units with lower (worse) leadership to move before those with better leadership, regardless of which country controls the unit. Units which don't move when it is their turn may only move later if led by a commander with higher leadership. A player may use his highest rated leader to preempt the movement of another player's lower rated leader.

This game was sold as a stand alone game with a paper map. The game could also be played by combining the pieces and mounted maps from the other three games in the series (Napoleon's Italian Campaigns, Napoleon's Russian Campaign, and Napoleon's Peninsula Campaign) and adding the extra rules and pieces from Expansion Module 2.

name: Adams Ahn
description: In 1907, gravel-pit worker Daniel Hartmann found a human lower jaw bone in the pit at Mauer, east of Heidelberg. However, this was no crime scene - it was a scientific sensation. Hartmann immediately realized the significance and burst into the local pub declaring that he had just found Adam! The jaw was actually from Homo heidelbergensis, about 600,000 years old, so not from Adam but from Adam's Ancestor (Adam's Ahn). Until recently it was the oldest known man or woman. This game has been made to mark the 100th anniversary of the discovery.

name: World of Movies
description:
A trivia game which tests your knowledge of classic and modern film.

Players move around a board answering questions in various categories. The questions themselves come in four well-produced booklets from which questions are selected at random.

Various cards add to the game play, including "Freeze Frame" cards which require players to act out either a movie title or movie character.

name: Feeling & Touching
description:
From Haba's Website:

Various activities about feeling and touching: the beautiful, easy to grasp wooden pieces stimulate free play and foster fine motor skills. The two tactile games introduce first games with rules. A game collection for 1 - 2 players ages 2+.

name: Shiver Game: Electronic
description:
Similar to Jenga. Remove pieces from tower and stack them on top of tower. Player who causes the tower to collapse loses.

This time the pieces are plastic and they are stacked on top of movable tray. Tray is battery-operated and shivers a random time period. This causes the stacking to be even more hazardous and can cause tower to collapse.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic
mechanics: Physical Removal, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Mormon Mouthful
description:
A LDS (Mormon) version that predated the now popular Mad Gab.

The puzzles in Mormon Mouthful consist of a set of unrelated words that, when read aloud, sound familiar, but make no logical sense. For example, the word puzzle "Hair On Ache Pre Stewed" is correctly answered by "Aaronic Priesthood."

name: Larry-Boy's Get Rid of the Fib! Game
description:
Essentially an Old Maid variant where one card - the unmatched "Fib" card - is what you try to pass on to other players.

From the Box

A little fib turns into a big problem for Junior Asparagus, and only one man can help him - Bumblyburg's own superhero - Larry-Boy! Now you can help Larry-Boy get rid of the Fib in this funfilled Veggietales card game based on the classic Old Maid

name: Wörter Würfeln
description:
This is a German word dice game, where the object is to form words from 13 dice with letters on them. Each player simply rolls the dice, turns the sand timer over and tries to use each die in forming a word or separate words. The letters have values and at the end of one's turn, the player scores for letters in words formed and subtracts the value of unused letters. Two of the dice have a blank face (although the rules mention only one) which are treated as Jokers, which can be used to represent any letter.
A variant described in the rules allows words to be formed crossword style and letters that are part of a word vertically and horizontally count double.
Recommended Ages 8 and up
publishers: Carlit, F.X. Schmid, Klee, Ravensburger, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Double Sens 2
description:
63 pictures are on the table. The clue you are given matches none of the pictres... Two pictures has a word sounding like the clue word you are looking for... And that's the answer! So think quickly and find the two matching pictures before everyone else!

The goal of the game is to name the word by pointing two pictures. To win a point you must be the first to point the good pictures.

name: The Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber
description:
武林至尊，寶刀屠龍，號令天下，莫敢不從！倚天不出，誰與爭鋒？

六大派圍攻光明頂，情況危急！玩家扮演倚天屠龍記中各路英雄，誰勝誰敗，就以骰子和技術決勝！

玩家派出弟子，控制門派的跟據地，爭奪寶物，在四輪爭奪完成後，贏得最多寶物價值的，就是贏家！

The Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber

Victory Conditions:
Players play in classic heroes in the famous novel The Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber, after the completion of the first four wins to win the maximum value of the treasures.

name: Bounce-Off Blow-Out! Game
description: Players bounce balls into a game tray. Multiple game mats are provided that change the way the game is played. Seven different methods are provided, some which include rules for partnerships and simultaneous play.

name: Animal Yahtzee
description:
Players in turn try to roll the most valuable animal combinations. During his turn the player has three dice rolls; for the first roll with all five dice; for the second and third roll the players may pick up as many dice as they want and re-roll. Players can also skip the second and third roll, while the value of the combination is noted. When all 12 places are filled, the values are added, the player with the highest total wins.

From the publisher, "Whoever collects many monkeys, tigers or camels can score lots of points in this classic critter game of dice."

name: Snoopy and the Red Baron
description: Snoopy sits on top of his doghouse, clad in his World War I pilot's gear. His arch rival, the Red Baron, bears down on him, firing blue and white marbles. Snoopy maneuvers the roof of the doghouse trying to block the blue marbles from entering and catch the white ones in his house.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Aguila Roja Junior
description:
Aguila Roja is a card game where you can play with characters from the hit television show. In each round, all players try to play the best card to earn as much as possible marvedies (money). They play several games in a row, and the player gets two cards wins the game Red Feather


Águila Roja Junior es un juego de cartas en el que podréis jugar con los personajes de la famosa serie de televisión. En cada turno, todos los jugadores tratan de jugar la mejor carta para ganar la mayor cantidad de maravedís posible. Se juegan varias partidas seguidas, y el jugador que consiga las dos fichas de Pluma Roja gana el juego.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ghost Play
description:
Chinese-themed card game created by QMOND.ME

Now is the chaos of the world, the demons run rampant. Dark smoke two players camp brand camp, representing the main factions of the two channel division: "Peace Avenue","Tianshi" solution based on the moral acceptability of various occasional fight, the King of Ghosts was waiting in the wings seal.
Get rid of the color corresponding with their kid camp extra bonus points; always be some people harbor no deception: "depraved"
Evil ways players will need to try everything to make the other a player possessed by three demons, and then let the King of Ghosts possessed in his own body against other players. However, if the evil ways by three players to their kid possessed, the evil ways of death and the end of the game players, other players are settled scores.

5 Kinds of Cards

Identity X 12
Taoism X 80
Ghost X 40
Ghost king X7
magical power (1 point) X 50
magical power (3 point) X 30

game-play
Round stage players perform the following actions
1. day stage
use of spiritual power, remove license Taoism and use of hand instruments used in the card
2. night stage (playing King of Ghosts of the player draws a card Taoism)
ghost haunt, and open ghost ghost deck will be possessed in accordance with rules to determine which player on the exorcism can then be.

goal
1.King of Ghosts did not show up: public identity of all the players, clearing scores of the two camps scores, scores of high-camp to win (the team victory in the system)
2.King of Ghosts have appeared, and the King of Ghosts was punitive, public identity cards of all players, clearing scores of the two camps scores, scores of high-camp to win the King of Ghosts Ghost not dead deck was exhausted and the players play to win the King of Ghosts.

name: Sick Boardgame of Karma
description:
Try to survive in Sick Boardgame of Karma! Each player starts with a hand of two karma cards, along with a character card that bears a unique power. Two karma cards start face up in play next to the deck.

On a turn, either reveal a card from the deck and place it next to any other face-up cards or take a face-up card into your hand. When you flip a card, if this type of card isn't already in play, then carry out the effect on the card; if another copy of this card is face up, take both cards into your hand. Karma explosion! If you have six or more cards in hand, you're eliminated from the game!

When you draw and reveal a Maheśvara's Judgment card, choose the player to your left or right, then draw a card from their hand and place it on the table. If that card is already visible, then both cards are discarded from play and that player is eliminated from the game! If that card isn't present, then the player now has a smaller hand size and has escaped judgment.

One of the effects on the karma cards is to grant a player Maheśvara's blessing. If a player collects three of these tokens, they win the game instantly! Otherwise the last player still in the game wins.

name: Got You
description:
Kitty plays hide and seek with rats in the house every day. It seems like an interesting game, but it really scares the rats.
To catch rats, Kitty not only sets straps but also pretends to sleep. To protect themselves while looking for the cheeses, the rats have the choice of working together or acting alone.
Kitty or rats, which role do you want to be?

There are 2 groups during game playing: a player plays as Katy and others play as rats. If Katy catches all the rats, Katy wins. If rats get a big cheese together or some selfish rats get cheese alone, rats win.

There are 4 phases in a round: The Sleeping Phase of Kitty, The Running Phase of Rat, The Running Phase of Kitty and The Tool Phase of Rats.

If Katy or Rats get the Goal of the game, they win immediately.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Role Playing

name: Top Trumps Quiz: Marvel
description:
Take another trip aboard the helicarrier and test your knowledge of the Avengers, Guardians of the Galaxy, S.H.I.E.L.D. and the dozens more characters that make up the massive Marvel Cinematic Universe in this special edition of Top Trumps Quiz - Marvel!

With questions on Captain Marvel, Peter Quill, Thor, Valkyrie, Gamora, Thanos and many more, you can revisit all of your favourite characters and places on your quest to prove yourself the ultimate fan!

500 puzzling and captivating questions that will test your knowledge and memory.
publishers: Winning Moves International Ltd, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: The Devil's Level
description:
You had to go to the mall. You can't find your car in the parking lot. You're terrified of elevators. And the mailman just saw your ass.

In The Devil's Level you attempt to balance your Depression, Horny, and Genius levels to achieve a state of Chillin. Then, and only then, will you be on The Devil's Level.

The Devil's Level is a fast-paced, weird card game for 2+ players and contains mature concepts for ages 18+

Players play level cards to achieve a total of 6 for each type of level. "Stuff" cards provide permanent powers, "Effects" are one-time use. "Irony" cards can cancel other cards. Contains 144 cards.

—description from the back of box

name: Het grote Pluk van de Petteflet spel
description:
"Het grote Pluk van de Petteflet spel" is a Dutch children's game. It derives its theme from the well-known (for Dutch and Flemish at least) children's book "Pluk van de Petteflet", also known as "Towtruck Pluck" in English, by Dutch children's book writer Annie M.G. Schmidt. The players relive Pluk's adventures during the game.

In essence it is a roll and move game: each in turn rolls a die and advances his pawn on the track. The winner is the first one to reach the finish. But to be allowed to finish, you must have the game token (Pluk's pigeon friend Dollie). That token is acquired by landing on spaces marked with a pigeon, or by landing next to the owner of the token.
A few spaces on the board allow you to take another player's pawn and put it next to yours.

The board is lavishly illustrated with scenes from the book.

name: Chill Out!
description:
A bevy of freshly-squeezed drinks waits to be served — all they need is ice! Roll the color die, choose a matching tray, scoop up the ice cubes, then drop them one at a time around the board, hoping to land some in your cup. Snag a blueberry for extra points, but watch out for slippery hands trying to snag your cubes! Fill up the frostiest float in Chill Out! and you're the coolest!

—description from the publisher

name: Star Trek III: The Search For Spock
description:
The goal of this game (based on the movie) is to find Spock on the Genesis Planet and beam up with him to your ship. You will choose who you will play from a number of Federation or Klingon characters. Optional rules allow you to create your own character.

While you are searching for Spock and fighting other characters, the Genesis Planet is breaking up, so time is of the essence.
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Hand Circus
description:
In Hand Circus', you look at the mission card and use the components and your hand to perform a show as requested. Whoever performs it last gets a blue ball from the circus master as they need more practice

A flashy circus performs by hand!

Game Setup
(1) Each player takes one of each red, yellow, and green disc, a hat, a tiger, an elephant, and a stick.
(2) Shuffle the cards and make a facedown pile in the center of the table and set the audience pieces as many as one less than the number of players near the card deck.
(3) Set 12 blue discs next to the card deck.

Game Play

The red band is there to indicate the thumb.


(1) Someone reveals a card from the deck, and then everyone starts to perform the show which is shown on the card.
(2) Fulfill the mission and take the audience. When all the audiences are gone, check if players have performed correctly.

If a player incorrectly performed a show, the player has to return the audience piece. Then the players who have no audience perform again to win the audience.


(3) When a round ends, the player with no audience piece gets a blue disc.

End of the Game
Each blue disc is -1 point. Anytime during the game, if a player gets the specific amount of the blue discs, the player is eliminated from the game. (For a 4-player game: 4 discs, 3-player: 5 discs, 2-player: 6 discs)

Remove the audience piece as the player gets eliminated.


Play until one player remains. The player wins the game.

name: La tumba del rey Pakal
description:
On the mythical archaeological zone of Palenque, located in the Chiapas State, Mexico, there is a pyramid known as "The Temple of inscriptions", built by the Mayans to shelter king Pakal's tomb. The tomb was discovered on June 1952 and it represents one of the most important archaeological discoveries of history.

In this game the players collaborate with the pyramid construction and each player tries to accumulate the biggest treasure in order to win the game. The treasure is formed by the treasure tiles that are obtained during the construction stages, and the jewel cards that can be accumulated till the end of the game.

The rounds are composed by 3 phases. Each phase concludes when all the players have performed their play for that phase.

PHASE 1: CARDS DRAW
Each player draws 2 cards from the top of the pile. If a player draws a card of a level that has been already constructed, this card is sent to the discard pile and the player can draw a new card.

PHASE 2: CARDS SWAP
Each player can swap one of their cards with one card at the swap zone; players must leave the cards face up. Cards of already constructed levels cannot be used.

PHASE 3: CONSTRUCTION
Each player decides if he summons to the construction of the pyramid's level, if he chooses not to, then the player must mention that he passes the opportunity to the next player.
If no player summons to the construction, then is the end of the phase 3 and the round concludes.
When a player summons to the construction he must pay 1 point (with his treasure tiles) and place the tile over the gameboard, this gives him the right to be the first to set cards for construction.

CONSTRUCTION RULES
-Pyramid levels must be constructed in ascending order.
-Each pyramid level is completed with 5 construction cards of the corresponding level.
-Jewel cards can be used as wild cards. Two jewel cards will be considered as one construction card, so they must be used in pairs for this purpose.
-A player can set a máximum of 3 construction cards.

If a player summons to the construction but the 5 necessary consturction cards (required for the corresponding level) are not completed, then players take back the set cards and the player that has summoned to the construction loses the point that he has paid. In this case is also the end of phase 3 and the round concludes.

In case that the construction of the corresponding level is completed:
-The corresponding pyramid tile is placed over the gameboard.
-The players that have collaborated in the construction take the corresponding points from the treasure tiles at the gameboard (see the scoring rules).
-Cards used for the construction are sent to the discard pile.
-If any player has cards left of the consturcted level, then he must place them on the discard pile (players have no right to recover these cards).
-If there are cards of the constructed level at the swap zone, they are placed on the discard pile as well and replaced with cards from the pile.

END OF GAME
When the construction of level 9 of the pyramid (temple) is completed, the game ends.
The jewel cards that players have accumulated have a value of 1 point each and are added to the value of thier treasure tiles. The winner is the player with the most treasure points.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Beheaded
description:
Beheaded, an exciting party game in which players use clues from a teammate to guess "beheadable" words. Take train, for instance, and behead it to get rain. Teams compete to see who can guess the most word combinations before time runs out.

Each game card includes single Beheaded (snow/now), Double Beheaded (state/ate), Triple Beheaded (hemlock/lock) and Beheaded Trio (swallow/wallow/allow) word combinations. Players spin to see where to start, and then the fun begins as the clue giver's team tries to guess each word combination. Trying to guess all four combinations in a minute or less creates an exciting, addictive, and always hilarious game. As an added bonus, nearly everyone learns a few new words each time they play.

name: Casablanca
description:
Players move around the board, trying to reach a symbol that corresponds with the symbol on the currently revealed card. If a player reaches that symbol, he gains the card. The bigger the amount of cards with the same symbol the player has, the more money is gained.

The twist: movement is done by selecting chit, checking the back for a number, and moving however far you want to move, without revealing the actual number to the opponents. The opponents then have to accept your move or challenge the number on your chit.

If they challenge the number, the player may either confess to cheating and pay a nominal fine or start a poker like bidding system in which the challenger must match his bid before he can see the chit.

name: How Much for the Camel?
description:
Components:
Twenty-eight cards
An A4 sheet of rules
a piece of cardboard
You have to provide your own money and 'Spit' tokens.
packaged in an envelope

"The end of the world is nigh. The only commodity left is ... camels!
The Future. Camels. Space Bucks. You."

A dangerous combination. Can you assemble the most impressive herd of camels?
It's the future, and camels are more valuable than gold or any other commodity for that matter. You've got money to burn and camels to buy in this quick bidding game. While quantity is important, it's camel quality that really counts. Will you put your money into the single-hump Arabian or Saharan Dromedary? Or do you prefer the more exotic two-humped Bactrian? Such is the nail biting excitement.
All the other animals have died and all you can buy are camels. There are three types and they come in groups of one to four. The cards are then numbered 1 to 9, the higher the number, the more camels. Your camels are worth more if you have the largest herd (most cards of a type), a train (sequence of three or more) or a 'Big Three' (three cards of the same number). All in all it's difficult to know how much cards are worth - but that's what makes for a good bidding game.

Bidding is just one round, so the last bidder has a big advantage. The only way to counter this is by 'Spitting' . You play your spit token and get an extra bid after the last bid. You can only do this once. Once all the spit tokens are played, you're left calculating how much money players have got left . The player purchasing the last card, bids first in the next round. This player enjoys the title of Space Merchant
The winner is the person who has the most money when the game ends!

name: Weekend in Vegas
description: A cross between Monopoly and just plain casino fun. Buy vegas hotels and win money if players land on them, but also play various games as you move around the board-roulette, craps, poker, red dog, a horse race, and slot machine.
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Boogey Man
description:
In this fun little children's game, there are 60 Monster Mania cards depicting the Boogey Man and other inoccuous objects (scary tree, fraidy cat, coat on a rack...) which are easily confused with it at first glance (sharing colours and shapes). There are one less pillow tokens than players (à la musical chairs), and each player receives flashlight chips at the outset. The cards are dealt out to the players, face down. Every one simultaneously reveals his top card. If you think one of the cards is the Boogey Man, you scream "Boogey Man!" and try to grab a pillow; the other players must first scream, then try to grab a pillow as well. The player left without one (if it *is* the Boogey Man) loses a flashlight chip. You lose a flashlight chip if you caused a false alarm. (You also lose a flashlight if you forwent screaming, or screamed "Boogey Man!" a second time)
The player with the most flashlight chips left once another player runs out wins.

Can be played with up to 9 players when two sets are combined.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Horror, Party Game

name: Talon
description:
http://www.spielarchiv.de/spiel/t/talon/talon.htm

"Recognizing What the Other Has"

The wooden tiles show Dingbats symbols (sort of like playing cards) on their faces. The game play apparently revolves around trying to figure out what the other player has, Mastermind-style.

name: Mr. Bunny's Internet Startup Game
description:
From the publisher/designer:

Missing out on all the stress in today's high-tech industry?

Ready for a sharp stick in the eye?

Well, get out your eye-patch because you're about to become the CTO of a hot new Internet startup. You drank a cup of bad latte and woke up with a billion dollar idea. With a dot-com in your company name and a cool million from a top VC, you're ready to assemble a team of the best programmers that money and free soda can buy.

There's just one problem.

Your fiercest competitor drank the same bad coffee and is after the same programmers. And they're just across the hall.

In this 2-player strategy game, win by being the first to collect and debug a set of package cards with a total of 20 features. Skillfully bid against your competitor for valuable package and programmer cards. Since programmers must work together to remove bugs, your success depends on your ability to assemble the most productive teams.

Home Page: http://www.toylab.com/mrbunny/

name: Fast Freddy's Hong Kong Dice Game
description: There are 6 special dice, red, white and blue chips, score pads, and a very nice dice cup. A die has 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 pips on one side. All the other sides of the dice are blank. Well, that's not exactly true ... The 2 pip die has a Red Dragon on the face opposite the 2 pips. So, we have 36 sides, but only 7 of the sides have pips and the Red Dragon. Each player starts with 20 points worth of chips. (White = 1 point, Red = 5 points, and Blue = 10 points) Play begins with each player putting 5 points in the pot. On your turn, roll the dice and count the pips. The player then takes that many points out of the pot. If there are not enough points in the pot, then the player adds points to the pot until the pot equals the numbers of pips rolled. There are special payment and rewards for rolling all blanks and for when the Red Dragon is rolled. The first time any player does not have enough points to pay the pot, the set has ended. All remaining players total their points and mark them on the score pad (provided with the game) and a new set is started.

name: Schicksack
description: With a board showing various tracks, business, partner, self-discovery & mystic, politics, good life & travel, there are matching cards with German text. This early semi-pro production appears to be a game to spark discussion of your true beliefs or values. The cards have various statements and I think the other players must judge your reaction before you can progress to the finish. Not exactly a party game, I think this is meant to be testing if not disturbing! Lots of German text, unplayable for non-German speakers.

name: Corporation
description: It takes money to make money. Each player will be putting up capital in anticipation of Profits. If you want the Big Bucks, though, you will have to form a Corporation with other players. A Corporation will net you Corporate Rewards if everyone cooperates -- but if any members defect (or if an outsider tries to horn in on the action) it's back to the drawing board.

name: Run Hippy! Run! The Boardgame
description:
Run Hippy! Run!The Boardgame is the game of capitalism let loose on the globe. As a Captain of Industry, you will exploit the people and resources of the world to advance your corporation, all the while plotting to crush any dissent.

Gameplay consists of moving around a board and collecting profitable Corporate Misconduct Cards and costly (but useful) Tactic Cards. Use your Tactic Cards to catch and crush that spirit of dissent, the Hippy.

The entire game is available FREE in 4 PDFs through the Puzzling Evidence website (see link below).
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Environmental, Humor, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mercanauts
description:
The theme is sailing ship trading and warfare in the Caribbean. It is played on a 22 by 23 square board on which are shown 6 home ports (one for each player), and a number of islands. Each player starts with one fast and one slow cargo ship, 5 food cards and one gold.
Islands produce one or more of 6 different valued commodities and players increase their worth by transporting these to their home port. Movement is controlled by three spinners (wind, range, weather) where the weather result modifies that of the range. Ships move orthogonally but never directly into the wind or backwards and players may divide their "range" movement between two or more ships.
With the commodities obtained by shipment to home port the players may buy more cargo ships or warships or Martello towers. The latter two may be used to attack other player's ships or in defence.
The game ends when one player can no longer continue trading and at this point the value of each players ships, towers and commodities is added up and the player with the highest value wins.

From the box:

"Board game of trade and warfare based on the days of sail
The game objective is to accumulate as much wealth within a predetermined time, and to force other players out of the game. Possible strategies and game tactics which could be used to defeat other game players include:

+ monopolizing a strategic commodity

+forcing-up commodity prices

+ erecting martello towers on the commodity islands, or in other player's harbors

+building a warship fleet to capture or sink opponents ships

+ forming partnerships, and setting up cartels

+combining fleets for trade or military operations"

name: The Ultimate Trivia Game Presented by Newsweek
description: If Trivial Pursuit is for the masses, The Ultimate Trivia Game is for the knowledgeable elite. A very challenging trivia game which presents deeper strategy by allowing players to slough off questions to other players, one wins Newsweek's trivia game by correctly answering questions in the following six categories: History, Geography, B.E.A.S.T. (Business, ecology, arithmetic, science, and technology), Books, etc., Show Biz, and Pastimes. Success in the game depends upon a broad education and in-depth knowledge in at least some areas.

name: Quatero
description:
Quatero is the ideal mind game for two players and one that will surely mentally stimulate with shapes, colors, and marks.

Two basic rules govern Quatero during each turn, they are 1) a pattern of all four different solids in at least one row must be made and 2) an alternating end color pattern must be maintained. You have to push out one of 4 cards in the center and replace it with a card from your 3 card hand that will allow all 4 figures to appear atleast once in the 3 rows of each card in the center. Then you accumulate points labelled on the pushed out cards when 2-4 but not 1 [when 1 is on the card from your side, your opponent loses that card as well as the last card taken in the second color, either blue or red. When the deck is exhausted, add up your blue and red points accumulated and see who has won.

Contents:

48 playing cards
1 rule book
All packaged in a black velvet bag


Players: 2
Game running time: about 25 minutes
Ages: 11 and up

name: The Art Game
description:
The aim of the game is to buy a complete collection (of real art masterpieces) through auctions and trade between them.

The players read one action card per turn and have one possible purchase per turn. The trading factor is central in the game, and completely free. Both money and pieces of Art can be use as currency.

In Italian, no longer printed, potentially a "must have" for any collector of boardgames involving Art and trade.
The human interaction factor makes this game very fast and chaotic, and this is the best side of it.

name: On Tour
description:
Starting with $600 and a start-up garage band, each player must equip themselves (with instruments, agents, roadies, etc), go on tour, and return to their garage with a set amount of money ($3,000-$10,000 determined at start).

The first player to do so, wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Turning the Tables
description:
Turning the Tables is a party game about being a waiter.

Players move around a board taking orders from the other players from a variety of menus (Chinese, Italian, etc.), and have to try to repeat them back after getting to the kitchen and back to their sections.

name: 女子高体育祭 (Girls High School Athletic Festival)
description: Try to overcome different difficult athletic events while trying to become the most successful at a high school athletics festival (at least, more successful than the other players). Use items to improve your odds of winning.

name: Revanche: The Battle of Dompaire
description:
This is a 2 player game on the battle which occurred on the 12th & 13th September 1944 around the town of Dompaire in France using the final iteration of the Blood and Steel series rules.

After breaking out of the Normandy Bridgehead in July, the Free French 2nd Armoured, triumphantly entered Paris and advanced across the French country side, intent on liberating the province of Lorraine. Desperate to stop the Allied blitzkrieg and recapture the vital railroad center at Nancy, Hitler placed General Von Rundstedt in command. To support the counter attack, emergency reinforcements were ordered up to the Western Front that included new and improved models of Panther tanks.

The battle saw the Free French 2nd Armoured Division, led by General Jacques Leclerc, pitted against the counter attacking German forces of the 112th Panzer Brigade. The armored clash at Dompaire confirmed that the French had learned the lessons of war well, and that Allied victory in the West was now at hand.
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Schutze Games

name: Hot Company
description:
Players each control a company and try to be the first to earn $100,000. This is accomplished by moving along the game board path and following the instructions for the squares landed on. The game focuses not just on the accumulation of wealth but also on social and environmental responsibility. Three decks of cards add variety to the game:

"Fortune" cards randomly award or penalize money (mostly award).

"Challenge" cards contain trivia questions about business, famous women, and women's issues. Answering the question correctly awards money. There is no penalty for answering incorrectly.

"Situation" cards contain a business-related ethical situation that the player must respond to. Answers are compared to the solutions printed on the card and money is awarded or penalized based on which answer the player's solution most closely matches.

Ages 12 and up.

Independent Means is a provider of products and services for girls' financial independence, and for parents trying to raise financially fit kids.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Taxdodger
description: Taxdodger (warning! Tax evasion is a serious offense) is printed several times on the board and box. This Canadian game pits one player as the taxman trying to accumulate money by performing audits and increasing the tax rate, while the rest of the players are taxpayers trying to accumulate money through legitimate tax shelters and tax evasion.

name: Tribú
description:
Translated from the Italian box:
In ancient times the wise Mother Earth gave birth to the Tribe of Tribes, whose destiny was to dominate the world. This lit the fierce anger of the Big Shadow, that made the world fall into the prison of the eternal alternation between light and darkness, and destroyed the Tribe. But the shaman escaped the vindicative rage and painted on a sacred and inviolable rock, with few primitive signs, the secret to win the dark power of the Big Shadow.
Many and many ages are passed since then. Six glorious Predestined tribes, heirs of the ancient Tribe, decide to face the challenge with the Big Shadow. Their names: Tralon, Orgos, Ab-Diar, Naum, Zark, Groden.
Now, you are the chiefs of those tribes. You have to reach the sacred rock, find the Ancient Sequence, transmit it to your Shaman and defeat the Big Shadow, with great honor. But the path for the sacred rock is long and dangerous. Right outside the village you'll wet yourselves in the Circle of the River of Life, where you can get the gifts of the Language, but you'll have to fight the Salamanders and the Rages, moved by the Big Shadow, to be able to get to the successive Circle, the Land of Chaos. Here you'll be lit with the ancestral frenzy, you'll fight with spears and hatchets the chiefs of the other tribes. Only if you were brave you'll be able to go to the Circle of the Initiation Sea, where you'll learn how to communicate with other tribes. With this you'll finally have completed your Table of the Language and you'll be able to enter the Final Circle: the Knowledge. Here, if you won't get burned by the fire of knowledge, you will be able to read the Ancient Sequence, go back to your village, say the remembered formula and, if it correct, win the game.
But warning: the Big Shadow will try every path to stop you or even win the challenge by covering the whole Circle of Knowledge with its dark presence.

As you have read the game is divided in several parts, each of which has a different objective, that, when reached, will allow players to go to the next part. One of the player is the Big Shadow, and plays against all the others.
Pretty nice but very long game with few standard mechanics and well made components.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Trick-taking

name: Gladiator: Men vs. Men
description:
The Colosseum (sic) squatted like some primeval stone beast in the heart of Rome, its lofty upper arches casting shadows in the late afternoon sun over the sweltering pavement of this, the Emperor's proud capital . . . Dedicated to the Infernal gods, the Roman games proved to be one of the most awesome spectacles of regulated murder ever performed before human audiences . . . The gates of the plutonic kingdom were thronged with the ghosts of the defeated, yet Rome still glutted them in honor of uncaring gods who only reveled in the deaths of strong men . . . Rome has passed into the ages of antiquity, yet still the solemn bulk of the Colosseum presides over the ruins of an ancient city that once enjoyed the grotesque ballet of life and death under the uncaring sun.

The players fight four simultaneous battles between pairs of gladiators. There are four differently equipped gladiators on each team, two armored (Postulat with mace and Secutor with sword) and two unarmored (Dimacher with two daggers and Retarius with net and trident).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Zulu: Isandhlwana
description: "January 22, 1879: Isandhlwana, Zululand. British Army Destroyed! On this date the British Army suffered its greatest defeat in the history of the colonial wars. Six companies of the 24th Regiment were wiped out to a man and nearly a thousand members of the British Army were killed. In addition, the regimental colors were lost and two twelve pounders were captured by the Zulus."

name: Das Campus-Spiel
description:
The game for the academic establishment...

Players are honorable university professors that try to win the Nobel Price.

With the help of their well paid doctors, students and some very strange machines they try to get enough scientific publications to qualify for the various commissions that decide about the academic fate of the players.

The scientific part is mainly driven by drawing one or more of the huge number of event cards - which can be positive or negative (Surprise!!!). But also a bit of negotiating is necessary as you often want to use some scientific machines only another player owns.

Getting in the different commissions requires also some negotiating between the players (Promise everything, but keep nothing..).

Game uses a lot of humor in the card texts, the machine names etc., but I guess all the pseudo-scientific names make the humorous part of the game almost non-translatable.

name: Windigo
description: This is a yacht racing game from the 60's. Sort of like Regatta or Yacht Race. Board is big & very nicely painted. The yachts are in a plastic holder & have a little metal bar for a sail (that wasn't included). There is a wind marker that moves every turn & a die. On the board are "Flier" spaces that give your sails an extra gust of wind for an extra space or two.

name: First Impressions
description:
From the box:

Often we form first impressions of each other based on what someone likes or dislikes, or how they look or speak. This game, in a non-competitive, relaxed and friendly format, allows players to describe these first impressions using the special idea cards provided. The cards are sometimes serious, sometimes playful and humorous. Always thought-provoking.

Some suggested uses:

Ice-breaker & socializer
Focus point for conferences
Classroom aid to nurture communication skills
Seniors recreation time

Get to know each other! Share some laughs. A great resource for groups of young and old. Play quickly or take your time. Easily adapts to all situations. Never worry about being eliminated or losing.

name: Alley-up
description: This is a very simple but challenging game. It consists of a hard plastic board with a zigzag path and a leg that can be placed in the back in different positions. The board is shaped in such a way that it can be rocked from side to side. A steel marble is placed at the bottom of the path and by rocking the board the marble can be maneuvered up to the top. The leg in the back of the board makes it angle up at the top. Each position has a corresponding score, the higher the score the steeper the angle. Players take turns and score points for each successful trip up the board. If a player loses control and allows the marble to come all the way back down his turn is over. The player with the highest score after a pre-determined number of turns wins.

name: Beachhead Invasion Game
description:
This game is a single 3/16 inch thick slab of dense cardboard with a Spinner included. It is 11 inches by 17 inches overall with the Instructions printed on one side, and 7-steps equal to about 2 paragraphs, very concise.
On the reverse side is the playing AREA, which is a rendering of a "Beachhead", on the left side of the Board, which also includes the spinner, and 9 "Invasion" Lanes of varying colors and length, leading from the "Beachhead" to the right side of the board. The length of the Lanes varies from 4, 5, & 6 then jumps up to 11, 12, 13, 14, & 15. The colors of the Lanes are RED 2-4 spaces, Lt. GRAY 1-5 spaces, YELLOW 2-6 & 12 spaces, VIOLET 1-13 spaces, TAN 1-14 spaces, and GREEN 2-11 & 15 spaces.
The playing pieces consist of 9 printed cardboard cut-out LANDING craft and 3 WARSHIPS, all of which can be placed within the GAME board for storage. The SPINNER has numbers and a RETREAT 2 PLACES section and the DEFENDER always spins it. To begin the game, place all 9 Landing Craft at the high number end of each Invasion Lane. Then the Defending player spins the Spinner and if a number is spun/picked, then any Landing Craft on that same number is "SUNK"/removed, otherwise the Landing Craft are advanced one space after each spin. There are 3 "Special" numbers which when spun will "SINK"/remove the Warships and if ALL of them are "SUNK" then the Defender gets to spin TWICE each time. The OBJECT of the game is for the Defender to sink 5-LC or the Invader to LAND 5-LC. NO designer/developer credits or DATE on the GAME but a number-#950-50 & Made in U.S.A. are printed below the instructions.

name: Fabulous Furry Freak Brothers: It's A Raid!
description:
I keep this game in the cardboard box you can make from Jefferson Airplane's "Long John Silver" album cover. It's appropriate, I promise.

I assume it's published by Rip Off Press, who made the comics. In fact, I suspect that the game was bound into a collection of Fabulous Furry Freak Brothers comics. The rule sheet looks like I cut it out of a magazine. Frankly, I don't remember. You may speculate as to why that is. The game dates from about 1979 or earlier, I think.

The game is a roll-and-move extravaganza. Your goal is to get the most points or the least points (your choice). If you reach 86 points, you are out of the game (there is a Eurogame-esque point track around the perimeter). Eighty-sixed, get it? Never mind.

You must supply a movement token for each player, a counter for each player's score, and three six-sided dice. Roll three dice on your turn, and move into one of the rooms. Once you have entered a room, you roll the three dice again and refer to a chart for each room that gives you points or lets you draw a card.

There is a stack of cards for each room, so that Fat Freddy's room can be different from Freewheelin' Franklin's Room, and both are different from the Living Room. Very important to the theme of the game.

Sample card from Fat Freddy's room: "You unwittingly puncture Fat Freddy's water bed, sending a torrent of water into the apartment below, and causing a COMPLAINT and giving you FOUR points."

When three complaints have occurred, a RAID is the result and each player rolls the three dice to reach the exit. Those who do not are busted . It's reminiscent of the mechanic from Escape from Colditz.

There are also three special guests to the party, represented by three special cardboard foldup pawns. The Movie Star, The Famous Author, and the Crashing Bore. You can use leftover movement (once you're in a room) to move these pawns. They block other players.

You can also get three points for loitering in the hallway, which is the kind of thing that proves this was play tested.

Actually, reading the rules now I'm not too sure how it ends or how somebody wins. But the artwork is cool and I remember enjoying it whilst simultaneously enjoying something else, if you know what I mean.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Arabian Horse Game
description: Buy actual farms from which to collect fees from opponents. Players may improve farms by building barns and collecting higher fees or selling farms for a profit. Players try to collect the most money and bankrupt opponents.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Pick-A-Winner Card Game
description:
"Do you have Yak? Oh, joy!" If I ask you for Yak and you have Yak, you have to give me Yak. Or Powdered Toastman, or Hip Boots Filled with Cole Slaw or any of the other crazy things known and loved by those who know and love Ren Hoëk and Stimpy. As you try to collect the most matched pairs of cards, use a Magic Nose Goblin to pick a pair from another player, or Pick Somebody, Pick Everybody, or Peek & Pick to take cards from your opponents. Just be sure you say "Oh, joy!" whenever you get a card you need. If you forget, give back Glazed Ham . . . or Stimpy's Hairball . . . or a Bloated Sack of Protoplasm. You might even have to give back Yak!

It's like a meaner but whimsical version of "Go Fish". The inclusion of the action cards add depth and strategy to what otherwise would be a rather ordinary game. But the theming makes it a tad better, with the requirement to say "Oh joy!" and the "Pick It!" allusion to boogers as that which will keep fans of the series (or just of nosepicking) interested.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Der Kleine König: Rauf & Runter
description:
Rauf & Runter is a small memory/guessing game for children who try to get around the palace garden over objects in the garden, without touching the ground with their feet.

Contents: 5 characters, 5 betting markers, 5 starting tiles and 21 tiles with an item on both the front and back. The items depicted on the 21 tiles can be 1 of 6 different objects, reaching from a mushroom (height 1), mole hill, bucket, dog house, horse and tree (height 6).

At first the 21 tiles are shuffled and placed randomly in a circle. Then each player selects a character and places the corresponding character and starting tile on one of the 21 tiles. He also takes the betting marker in his hand.

Players then take turns in clockwise order. When you correctly guess if the next tile is above, below or at the same height (by using the betting marker) than the one you're standing on, you can move one tile forward. You can guess up to three times correctly before your turn ends. As soon as you've guessed wrong, you are moved one tile backwards and your turn ends.

The player to have moved over all the tiles and returns to his starting tile wins the game.

name: Franklin and the Green Knight Adventure Game
description:
Features three unique games in one.
1. The Green Knight Adventure Game - players relive the adventures of Franklin and Snail and their heroes the green knight and squire boar. Players journey through a medieval setting amongst dragons and gryphons before soaring with eagle to a far off mountain in search of spring.
2. Find the Cherry Blossoms Game - players rely on memory and luck while trying to find the hidden chips.
3. Who's Lost in the Woods Game - one of the Franklin characters is lost, and players work together as a team to find him.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Vídeo Mania
description: Trivia game based in movies then (1989) released in the Brazilian market.

name: Conquistando os Planetas
description: Loosely based in "Risk", this game presents a war for the control of solar system. Players have missiles (to fight) and starships (to occupy spaces), whose movement are based in a combination of dice rolling and card drawing.

name: Roundabout
description:
This abstract game consists of five concentric rings divided into sixteen sectors (bars). Each player has a home sector that is four bars wide. Ten directional playing pieces start in the center bars of the home sector facing outwards. Each turn players roll two dice and use each dice roll to move a piece either in its facing direction or along its bar. When a piece starts a turn outside of it home sector and then is moved within the sector it is removed from the game. The first player to run out of pieces wins the game.

Additional complexity comes from blocking, capturing (freezing pieces while simultaneously preventing other opposing pieces from entering the bar in which the capture occurs), removing pieces from the board through `ringers' and special moves from rolling doubles. Variant rules exist for more cutthroat games and games with more than two players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cartel: The International Oil Game
description:
In CARTEL: The International Oil Game, you try to become the wealthiest player, and therefore, the winner. You will try to invest in oil fields throughout the world, and sell any crude oil that you obtain for the most profit. The first player to obtain ten million petro-dollars in cash is the winner of the game.

Note: This is not the same thing as the Philip Orbanes game Cartel.

name: 3 Blind Mice
description:
An action game where moves are made on the roll the dice. Players must move their mice on a roll of green or stay put on black. Mice are moved off the playing surface by pulling on their tails and the box top, shaped like a wedge of cheese, is used to catch the mice. Chips are awarded for each caught mouse. The first player to win 18 chips wins the game.

Three Blind Mice is essentially Carla Cat.

Object of the Game: First Player to get 18 chips is the winner.

To Start the game each player receives nine chips. First player to roll a green spot is the "Catcher". Other players select a mouse and place mouse on base, holding it by the tail. Catcher rolls color cube by using "Cheese Wedge" as shaker.

Rules of the Game: When a Blue or green spot turns up, the players must pull their mice off the base before the catcher traps them with the "cheese wedge". If the mouse is caught, the player pays the catcher one chip. If his mouse is not caught, the player is not paid a chip by the catcher. If all the mice escape, the catcher exchanges the "Cheese Wedge" for the mouse of the player on his left and this player now becomes the catcher. When a black or white spot turns up, the players must leave their mice on the base. If a player pulls his mouse off the base when black or white turns up, he pays the catcher one chip. However, if the catcher should touch the base with the "cheese wedge" to the player on his left, and pays one chip to each of the mice still on the base. The player on his left now becomes the catcher. When a player has lost all his chips he is out of the game. As soon as one player has 18 chips he is the winner and the game is over.

name: Lam Son
description:
A grand strategic game of the VietNam War.

Includes a 254-turn historical campaign game, along with five, 12-turn scenarios.
categories: Civil War, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Green Alligators
description:
From the publisher...

A descriptive word game with no reading required. Pictures are identified to encourage early readers. Be the first player to guess the picture on the card and win the card!

There are two ways to play Green Alligators: Non-competitively with 2 players, or competitively with 3+ players.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Mary-Kate and Ashley New York Minute The Game
description:
The board game based on the new Mary-Kate and Ashley Olson film, New York Minute.

Players take control of Mary-Kate and Ashley as they race through the busy streets of New York City. They travel from location to location using subway tokens. The twins move faster together than separately, but beware as other players can force you to split you twins at a moments notice. Be the first player to get both their twins to the University and you win!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Q-Blast
description:
The game contains:
- One hexagonal board, divided in 24 equilateral triangles
- 32 pieces, 8 for every color (white, yellow, red, green)

The players take turns placing their pieces on the board. The pieces can be placed on a free triangle, or on the top of another piece.
When three pieces are on the same place, they "blast" on the adjacent spots, even causing other "blasts" in a sort of chain reaction. The player whose piece determined the "blast" chooses where the pieces are driven by the explosions and in which order.

When all the pieces are placed on the board, the game ends and the winner is the player with the most "visible" (uncovered) pieces.

name: Dinner Games: Honky Tonk Homicide
description: Don’t mess with Texas - somebody rubbed out a redneck! The body of Bubba Angus was found in his bar in Cactus, TX. Now the bar regulars and trailer park townies must find the murderer among them. Was it barmaid Crystalline Daniels or bingo addict Twyla Fleetwood? Maybe it was biker Rowdy Lawless. In a town full of double lives, torrid affairs, and alien abductions, everyone’s a suspect. This mystery dinner game has everything you need to host a rip roarin’ night of murder, mystery… and Miracle Whip! Comes with 10 character booklets (8 suspects and 2 non-suspects), 10 party invitations and envelopes, 10 player name tags, 14 crime scene clues, and a party planning booklet that includes decorating and music suggestions along with 2 different dinner menus from appetizer to dessert.

name: Das Isses!
description: All players select a card from their hand, which best matches a left out part of the sentence read by the arbiter. The arbiter then chooses one of there words, without knowing who submitted it. That player gets three points. The role of arbiter goes to the next player every turn. After three (or any agreed upon number) rounds the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

name: The Creature From The Black Lagoon Mystery Game
description: Boardgame based on the movie. Standard spin & move with occasional card drawing. Avoid getting caught by the monster.

name: KISS Trivia Game
description:
KISS...a rock & roll institution! KISS...larger than life! KISS...Legendary!

KISS introduces their first ever trivia game. 1,000 questions about the KISStory, the people and the music!

name: Enix
description:
From the publisher, Murmel:

The world is in turmoil! Gigantic power cuts affect entire continents. Traffic chaos, computer crashes, millions of people blocked in elevators.

What happened ?

We investigated and identified the cause for these mysterious blackouts: ENIX a strange moody being that is at home in the sun, in the wind and the water, in warm springs and old trees or in the wild surfs of the sea.

Plunge yourself into the fabulous world of renewable energies, use the energy points wisely to increase your energy score. But beware of ENIX because a victory close at hand may disappear straight into the next blackout.

Maybe with the help of ENIX you might succeed also to play tricks on the other players ?

An exciting game about energy points for 2 to 6 persons Ages 8 and up.

Contents: 6 game pieces, 6 energy boards, 72 game cards, and the ENIX Blackout-Cap. A brochure with interesting information about renewable energies is contained as well!

name: Fast Attack
description:
WW2 coastal warfare rules

During the Second World War there was a trend away from engagements between conventional battle fleets. No where was this trend more evident than in the field of Coastal Warfare. Each night the stillness of the ocean dark would be shattered by the roar of engines as in every theater Patrol Boats began their deadly game of cat and mouse with their enemy counterparts and Merchant Shipping. This set of rules allows the wargamer to recreate the small scale coastal actions which brought back the swash—buckling era to the seas.

In common with all MOD Games Naval Warfare rules, the percentage dice system is used throughout Fast Attack. The dice — one red (10's) and one white or black (Units) are always thrown in pairs (e.g. an 8 on the red dice and a 2 on the white or black dice represents a throw of 82%). All figures in the tables are basic percentage chance of hits or detection, after this has been amended by the tactical factors which may apply, the final score is arrived at. A throw of this percentage or less is sufficient.
Figure Scale 1 model = 1 vessel
Time Scale 1 move = 10 seconds
Ground Scale 1 cm = 20 yards
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Deployment
description:
Deployment was originally called Tactical Game 10. Its purpose is to show the use and development of small unit tactics during the "flintlock musket" period of warfare (roughly 1670 to 1840).

From the designers notes: (which also listed other games in the tactical game series 1 to 21)

This was a Test Series game published by Simulations Corporation, Poultron Press, Box 4267, Long Island City, NY 11104 - the rules are essentially a photocopy set with very thin unit counters.

name: Murder! The Game
description:
There are murderers on the loose and they mean to kill every last one of you. Civilians need to keep their wits about them, and with the help of the undercover inspector must expose the murderers before it's too late.

Murder! is a game for 5 to 15 players - but can be played with even more. It is an addictive discussion-based game. The rules are easy to learn but its depth derives from the psychological tactics employed by players to discover the murderers and evade conviction.

Murder! is the game where persuasion, cunning and insight are the weapons of choice - not to mention lying, deception and double-crossing. Murder! It's kill or be killed.

name: Capricorn
description:
Players start from Europe and sail to distant countries to collect treasures and transport them back to Europe, in order to sell them.

Contents:

Board with an illustrated map of the world (exluding America) that is overlayed by a grid (for moving). The word CAPRICORN is written on the board and it has also spaces for stack of cards (black, red and yellow).
Three decks of cards:
Black Action cards (e.g. "riot on a ship"),
Red Item cards (e.g. "pumps, rations, compass...")
Yellow Treasure cards (e.g. "gems, spices...")

Game money (banknotes), which is named Rix (in Alga's Swedish edition, however, the currency lacks a name).
A ship and a sailor carrying a gun and barrel (of rhum?) as playing tokens. The sailor represents an entire crew.
Die (Alga's Swedish edition contains two dice.)


This game was owned by Kuvataide Bildkonst and published in Finland; and then licensed to Alga for publication in Sweden; both events took place in the 1960's.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SpongeBob SquarePants Bikini Bottom Beach Party Game
description: In this memory game players move plastic pawns, depicting SpongeBob, Gary, Patrick, and Sandy, around an outer board of face down tiles trying to make matches. They use the board tiles to make matches with an inner circle of shell tiles. For a successful match, a player gets a plastic accessory piece to place on his character. The first player to equip his character with a grass skirt, a hat, a lei, and the ukulele, is the first to reach the Bikini Bottom Luau and wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Derby Day
description: This is an old horse racing game where 6 horses race across a track of 16 spaces. In the basic game each player is represented by a horse. 3 dice are thrown and you move your horse forward 1 space each time your horses number shows up. You would move 2 or 3 spaces if doubles or triples are rolled for your horses number. The first player to reach the finish post space is the winner. The rule book also has optional rules including 2 steeplechase variations.
publishers: Brybelly, National Game Company, Parker Brothers

name: INSURE!
description:
From the rulebook:

"Players represent insurance companies who compete to insure bond issues sold by municipal governments. Just as in real life, one issuer may sell more than one bond issue, each of which might be insured by a different insurance company. The 36 different issuers have different probabilities of default, with riskier issues represented by dice faces with numerically higher values. Riskier issuers pay higher premiums to their insurance company, but also have a greater chance of defaulting and causing the insurer to pay a claim." Most money at the end wins.

The box claims the game is for ages 14 and up, but it's more straightforward than that. And "although knowledge of the market for financial guaranties is not necessary to win INSURE!, some familiarity with it and its specialized terminology may add to your fun."

name: Gambling Sam
description:
This is one of a series of games put out by The Nomad Company that comes in a thick, cardboard cube that holds the contents and unfolds to provide a board.

Contents: Board (which is also the game box), 3 special D6 dice and chips. The board has a treasure map pictured on it. There is a treasure chest in the center and 4 'betting corners' - one with a picture of a pistol, another with a picture of a cannon, another a trumpet and the last a sword. The chips come in white (worth 1 pt.), black (2 pts.) and gold (3 pts.). The die faces for each die show one each of the 4 betting corner items, a treasure chest and a map (which acts as a joker).

Object: To be the last player with chips.

Distribute the chips evenly among the players. Before each player's turn, all players place 1 chip (value 1) on each betting corner. Player keeps rolling until she wins chips or passes. On your turn: Roll the dice. If all three are treasure chests, take all chips on the treasure chest. (This only applies to 3 treasure chests thrown on the first roll.) If all three are the same betting item, take all chips from the corresponding betting corner and your turn is over. If the roll has different betting items, you can set aside one kind and re-roll the rest. You must put one chip (value 1) on each betting corner that corresponds to the face of a die you will re-roll. (ex: You roll a cannon, a sword and a trumpet.
