"John's first thoughts were for the valuable occult Artefacts he had placed around the gardens pathways. He had been planning a tour of the gardens and his Artefacts as after-dinner entertainment. He rushed towards the oncoming fiends calling his friends to help. Suddenly the yelling interlopers fell silent and stepped aside and through their ranks stepped a huge fearsome betentacled thing..."

This is a Print and Play game based on the Cthulhu stories by H.P. Lovecraft. The objective of the game is to collect all three Artefacts -- a player wins when he has all three Artefacts in the Hexs of his own base line.

name: De onderste steen
description:
A trivia game, where the actual question that is going to be asked, is determined by a die roll.

For every correctly answered question, a new (smaller) stone is placed on already placed stones. A 6 gives a free stone.

When an incorrect answer is given the 'tower' is destructed and the turn is given to the next (group of) player(s).

Winner is the one who answers six questions correctly in a row.

name: Löwenstark!
description:
From the manufacturer:

Who is to be the new king of the savannah will be decided by this fierce searching game for 2-4 players. In order to reach the lion temple first the players have to be very observant and quickly spot the animal cards which match the dice.

For ages 5 and up.

name: UNO: High School Musical 2
description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the Disney Channel musical "High School Musical 2." This version of Uno has an additional card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Sharpay" card, which lets a player sabotage his opponents.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: HACK'N'SLASH
description:
HACK'N'SLASH is a competitive fantasy adventure card game for the entire family. You adventure through the ever changing dungeon with characters of different strengths and abilities, scoring points for conquered monsters and gathering treasures. Not only are you battling wits with Dracaena, but also against your opponents.

Can you be the first to escape the labyrinth with the most treasures and fallen foes?
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Action at Carentan!
description:
This expansion contains four tournament style scenarios set on the outskirts of Carentan during the invasion of Normandy. The scenarios follow the 101st 'Screaming Eagles' Parachute Division during the first week of the invasion. In addition to the four scenarios, this expansion pack also includes a small unmounted map which all four scenarios play on.

The four scenarios are:

AaC #1: Cole's Charge - North of Carentan, France, 10 June 1944
AaC #2: The Cabbage Patch - Along the Causeway to Carentan, France, 6 June 1944
AaC #3: Green Devils - Outside Carentan, France, 13 June 1940
AaC #4: Cooperation Reigns - Outside Carentan, France, 13 June 1940


These scenarios are compatible with MMP's ASL System.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Lauf Schnuffi, lauf!
description:
Content:
wooden board, 4 dogs, 1 color die, 1 special die 1-1-2-2-3-blank

The goal of the game is to move as many dogs as possible to the spicey sausage in the finish area.

name: Pound Puppies: Pooch on the Loose Game
description: "Those lovable, huggable Pound Puppies are on the loose, kicking up their heels around town while trying to avoid serving time in the local pound. While the dogcatcher chases the pups, Doc, Chelsea, and Nathan are also hot on their trail...The first player to collar the elusive pups wins the game."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: STORM Operação Tempestade
description: This is a game made in Portugal in 1991 by Fanabri that simulates operation Desert Storm .
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Simulation

name: Tula
description: Tula resembles solitaire & Shanghai. Players use a Piecepack set for the tiles. The tiles are setup in a temple arrangement and can be removed from the temple if they match the stack in either suit or value.

name: Hex Colour Matching Game
description:
This is a simple hand-management and pattern matching game.

The hexes are colored to form "flowers" at the Y shaped intersection of three tiles. Player manage a hand of 5 tiles and play tiles into a growing pattern, trying to complete as many flowers as possible.

name: Raleigh Burner BMX Game
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to get his BMX bike completely over the FINISH line, having got there by luck and skill in the use of Race Cards and dice.
The game board is enhance by "dirt" ramps (jumps and berms), and the playing pieces are actual little BMX bikes.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: D'Jay
description: Swedish music trivia game. A DVD is included in the game.

name: Op zoek naar de gouden cacaoboon met Côte d'Or
description:
A promotional game from chocolate factory Côte d'Or. The mechanics are based on the Game of Goose.

The players try to be the first to reach the golden cacao bean. They do this by rolling the dice and having a lot of luck.

When it is your turn you roll the dice and move your pawn based on your roll towards the golden bean. When you land on a green or red field you take an adventure card. When you land on a blue field you will move backwards in your next turn and when you land on a yellow field you can take a risk. You may roll again and when the result is a 1 or 2 you can move on to the number 28, but when you roll a 3,4,5 or 6 you have to move backwards 3,4,5 or 6 places.

Contents:
game board
pawns in different colors
one die
adventure cards

name: Battle of Manila Bay
description: A free hex and counter boardgame of the Battle of Manila Bay. A light boardgame simulating the battle between Spanish and American Forces in the Philippines. Originally designed as part of the, 'Historical Series of Free War-games for Paperworlds.com"

name: Takeover
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Each player represents a group of investors trying to buy a target Company. Of course they are competing with rival groups."

The game uses a custom deck of cards. There are two types of cards in the deck: Investor Cards and Tactics Cards. The object of the game is to hold the most shares at the end of the game, thereby winning control of the company.

name: Planet der Sinne: Sehen
description:
In 2007, Haba released a game called Planet der Sinne (Sensory Planet) that includes a range of games to teach children about the different senses. This game is an expansion, sort of anyway. It is all about the sense of sight, and some of the games and exercises are used in the original Planet der Sinne but some are new.

The box is jammed with components to play over a dozen games, all using visual clues and observation as the idea. Some are just exercises, while others are fun games that work for the family.

name: Zeppelins Over London: WW I Airships (1916 AD)
description:
“It is now spring of 1916. Improvements in anti-aircraft artillery and airplane performance have begun to threaten the zeppelins’ invulnerability. While British arms manufacturers are busy developing incendiary and explosive ammunition (which would seal the fate of the flammable hydrogen filled zeppelins), the ammunition will not be widely available until the summer. The RAF 39 Squadron, flying the Bristol B.E.2c fighter and established to defend London from zeppelin raids, has just received word that a large formation of zeppelins is approaching the city!”

A simple historical miniatures air combat game designed for classroom use. The game is played by two teams representing the British and German forces. The British players have twenty Bristol fighters divided into five divisions and the German players have twelve airships divided into three divisions. The British players attempt to shoot down as many zeppelins as possible before the airships can move off the end of the board or time runs out.

Designed to be played using models, or print-and-play paper aircraft, on a 7.5x5 foot hex mat with three inch hexes.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Educational, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: The Few: Battle of Britain
description:
A classroom game based on the Battle of Britain. Combat is resolved by drawing cards from a standard card deck. Other components required for play are German and British Flight Rosters, a Battle Board, the Reinforcements schedule, and the Combat Resolution Tables.

“Divide the class into two groups - the RAF (Britain) and Luftwaffe (Germany). Each team must have an air marshal. Air marshals will be in charge of allocating resources and aircraft to targets, and filling in the flight roster. The remaining students will be pilots (German fighter or bomber pilots, British fighter pilots). If necessary, divide the students in small groups and call them ‘wings.’ The German players start with 10 bombers and 10 fighters. The British players start with 6 fighters. This information should be put on the flight rosters.”

“The Battle Board should be drawn on the chalkboard, or someplace else where all the students can see it. On the Battle Board write the three targets: air bases, radar, and London. This is where each turn you will write down the number and type of planes sent by each side to attack or defend each target.”

“Objective: Germany must either destroy London OR both the air bases AND radar. The British win by destroying 15 German planes or preventing the Germans from winning. The battle will last 5 turns or until one side wins a victory.”
categories: Aviation / Flight, Educational, Wargame, World War II

name: Ram or Die! The Battle of Salamis (480 BC)
description:
“The Persian invasion of Greece launched by Darius in 490 BC failed when the Athenians won a great victory at Marathon. After Darius died his son Xerxes resolved to succeed where his father had failed. In 480 BC he bridged the Hellespont and invaded Greece with an enormous army . . . Victorious on land, Xerxes concentrated on defeating the Greek navy. His fleet outnumbered the Greeks by about 3:1, but the Greeks drew him into a trap. His fleet was soundly beaten. The defeat of the Persian navy forced Xerxes and his army to retreat back across the Hellespont bridges, ending the invasion.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played using free print-and-play paper miniatures provided with the rules.

The Greek fleet consists of 25 Trireme figures and the Persian fleet consists of 50 Trireme figures. Combat consists of ramming and boarding attacks. Optional rules provide for playing the game on a hex map having hexes 3” or less across.

name: Battle of Sekigahara (1600 AD)
description:
“The Sengoku or ‘Warring States’ period of Japanese history lasted from 1467 - 1615 AD. During this time warlords and their samurai armies waged civil war. In 1590 Toyotomi Hideyoshi succeeded in uniting Japan under his rule. After his death there was a power struggle between a coalition of Eastern clans led by Tokugawa Ieyasu and a Western coalition led by Ishida Mitsunari."

"Their final showdown occured near the town of Sekigahara in 1600 AD. The armies were evenly matched. Mitsunari deployed his army to block the vital Nakasendo road, with Kobayakawa Hideaki's large clan in position to threaten the Eastern army's left flank. However Hideaki had secretly promised Ieyasu that he would switch sides once the battle started. The Eastern army launched a determined attack and made good progress. Slowly the Western army drove them back and began to counterattack. Mitsunari and Ieyasu both tried to convince Hideaki to intervene on their side. Finally he made his decision and charged down the hill right into the flank of the Western army. His betrayal was decisive, and the Western army was routed.”
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per stand. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

Each army is composed of six clans, plus the Hideaki clan which starts with the Western Army but may switch sides. Units portrayed in the game include samurai, arqubusiers, ashigaru spearmen, cavalry, and commanders.

name: Battle of Breitenfeld (1631 AD)
description:
“The Thirty Years War was a complicated period of military conflict in Europe. The war was fought primarily in Germany as the various German Principalities allied themselves with the Holy Roman Empire or their opponents, France, Sweden, and Denmark. A religious conflict between Protestant and Catholic forces was an important factor early in the war, but later it developed into a struggle for power among the great nations of Europe."

"During the war armies fought in massive, slow moving formations called Tercios. The Tercio consisted of a large oblong formation of pike men with smaller formations of musketeers at the corners. During battle the Tercios would trudge together and battle it out ‘at push of pike’ until one side broke."

"King Gustav of Sweden changed everything, however, by introducing revolutionary tactics that relied on smaller formations and emphasized movement and firepower instead of brute strength. The genius of his innovations was demonstrated in 1631 at the battle of Breitenfeld when his Swedish army handily defeated Tilly's larger old style Imperial army.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per stand. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

Forces portrayed in the game include musketeers, pike men, cavalry, commanders, and cannons. The musketeer and pike men units are grouped into three different types of formations: Imperial Tercio, Commanded Muskets, and Swedish Battalion.
categories: Educational, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Grunge Golem
description:
Truth or dare in a new jacket where hedonism is encouraged. A fun party game that will confront friends with things they didn't (want to) know about each other.

Willingly or not, they will be the tools of 4 Grunge Gods:
-Bacchos: God of gluttony and the digestive system.
-Eros: God of flirting, passion and romance.
-Ludos: God of naivety, games and fun.
-Spiritos: God of dreams and fears.

Opposing these four is Logos, the sober god of discipline, rules and protector of civilization.

Depending on what space the players land on after a roll, they will get tasks from the Grunge Gods, or be left alone of they are lucky enough to land on a space of Logos. These tasks translate in either small assignments or answering a question truthfully.
Every time a task is completed successfully, that player may discard one of the task cards in his hands.

The player that has no cards left can become a Grunge Golem, capable of dealing out more assignments to his fellow players, thereby giving them the chance to discard more of their own task cards.

The game ends when only Grunge Golems remain in the game.

Originally this game was released in Belgium in Dutch. Up till now this is the only available version.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: En chasse, Mister Zap
description:
This game is published by the French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 14 - Apr 1983).
Each player represents the guardian of the temple and its troops.
Two are competing to be the sole guardian of the temple.
Map Din A4, grid and 16 pieces.

name: Ring-a-thing
description:
Dear Parents:
This game contains four variations on which your child can play and learn.
• Free game without rules for very little ones.
• Three simple dice games of different degrees of difficulty

Variation: Free game
Die game 1: “Which colors suit me?”
Die game 2: “Ring up to me!”
Die Game 3: “Colorful ring tower”

Contents:
3 ring-a-thing manikins (in three colors)
3 red wooden rings (in three sizes)
3 blue wooden rings (in three sizes)
3 yellow wooden rings (in three sizes)
1 color die

name: Wyoming Cowboy
description:
A western-themed card game in which players attempt to play card combinations to draw guns (2,2 ; 3,5,7, ; 4,5, ; 3,8) and shoot the cowboys (kings) from other players hands, while trying to shack up their own cowboys with harlots (queens) along the way for extra points. At the end of the game, players gain or lose points for the sets of cards (gangs, posses, harems, orphanages, etc.) that they've managed to collect, during play.

Home Page: http://www.wyomingcowboy.org/

name: Beat the Border
description:
A fun little game from the early 1970s drug culture. The goal of the game is to make money buying and selling "kilos" (of what is left to your imagination).

Simple roll and move mechanics. Start with $1000. Cross the border to buy kilos from various sources (Edwardo, Renaldo, Jose, ...) then attempt to cross the border and sell your recent purchase in various U.S. cities (from Tucson to New York).

If you're carrying kilos you can be busted by various U.S. government agencies. One nice touch if you're not carrying to you can "fly" to the start space for $100 from anywhere on the board. There's even other odds and ends to purchase that can help you out (lawyers, fake id, "heater")

Play to a certain preset goal ($25,000 to $100,000, is suggested, but more or less will work).
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dicer's Secret
description:
A two player (with solo variant) dice game of pushing your luck, and out-guessing your opponent. Players take turns scoring by making runs (1,2,3,4) or matches (2,2,2,2,2) on their die rolls, while trying not to have their points stolen by their opponent's secret number.

Players only need eight six sided dice and the free rules to play this quick game.
A text file of the rules, with scoring examples, is available at http://tinyurl.com/DicersSecret-text

name: Volley
description: Milton Bradley Action Volleyball Game. Advertised on the game box as a "Fast action random shot game". The object is of the game is to hit the ball (attached to a pendulum type device) back and forth over the net. If you fail to return the ball your opponent scores a point.

name: Qelat
description:
A mancala game from Keren. From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Qelat_(Keren)

"Mancala variants are often played in the Keren-Agordat area of western Eritrea. Most players are herdsman taking their cattle to water, newly married couples and their friends, and housewives in their homes.

Qelat is usually played in holes in the ground, but wooden boards are also known. The following game was observed by Richard Pankhurst in 1971 who called it Qelat II (Game 5). It might be related to Um el Banat ("game of women"), a mancala game to be found in northern Sudan.

Rules:

Qelat is played on a two-row board with six playing holes per row called bét in Bilén (literally "house") and two larger holes at the end of the board to store captured balls. Initially there are four balls in each bét. The balls are called til in Bilén, if they are dry goat droppings or shesher, if they are small stones.

The balls are always sown one by one in an anti-clockwise direction.

If the last ball falls into a non-empty hole, its contents including the last dropped ball are picked up and continued to be distributed into the following holes.

The move ends when the last seed falls into an empty hole.

The players try to capture enemy holes by increasing their contents to four with the last sown ball in any hand. Captured holes are known as ekwarna, literally "a child is born to me".

A move may not start from an ekwarna with the result that balls would tend to accumulate in such holes. A player dropping the last ball in any hand into one of his own ekwarna might say lagadi yekura, literally "grow up my children!".

When the last ball falls into an ekwarna captured by his opponent he would "eat" (qunna in Bilén) one of the counters in that hole, and put it, together with the ball effecting this capture, aside as his takings.

A player's ownership of an ekwarna continues even if it becomes empty. Thus balls subsequently entering such a hole, belong to the player who had captured it, while his opponent on dropping the last counter of any lap there would put this counter aside as his takings.

It is not permitted to pass as long as a player has a legal move.

The round comes to an end when all the balls are captured either by being put aside or accumulated in ekwarna. The players then count out their total earnings by placing them back in their holes, four counters per hole. Pankhurst reported:


A player who had captured more than his original number of counters would gain one hole from his enemy for every four balls he captured. Should a player have won three extra counters his opponent, who had an extra counter, was obliged to cede to the player with tree who thus acquired an additional hole. If, on the other hand, the two players were each left at the end oft the round with two extra balls they would draw lots to decide to whom they should belong and who in consequence should gain the hole at issue.


Eventually, the player who gains a monopoly of all the balls and hence of all twelve holes is declared winner.

name: Das Rollo Gebhard-Weltumsegler-Spiel
description:
Rollo Gebhard is a German skipper who sailed round the world in several boats (all named Solveig), with his wife as well as single-handed. He founded the "Gesellschaft zur Rettung der Delfine" (association for saving the dolphins) in 1991, which has nothing to do with the game except that it mentioned on the box.
The game comes with a large (52x80 cm) board, 4 dobbers (representing boats), 2 dice, 120 question and incident cards, 132 fuel cards and a wad of game money.
Players normally start in Lübeck and try to travel round the world, using square spaces that sometimes carry special numbers or symbols. They must make port in every harbour along the route. They have the option to travel under engines, but must spend fuel cards when doing so. They must also manage their money, as harbour fees must be paid (by penalty of losing the game instantly). To move, players roll two dice and may decide which to use first for one straight lap of movement.
Specially marked spaces are incident fields (players must draw an incident card, which may turn out to be a question that must be answered- correct answers are rewarded by an extra move) and log fields where special events take place (like extra cost, restricted movement etc.). Fields with numbers are "storm" areas; on those spaces, the number printed on the board must be subtracted from the die roll or must be paid by extra fuel cards.
The rulebook briefly mentions a couple of possible variants, like choosing different routes, doing away with the engines or using only one die.

name: Goldbärchen-Spiel
description: In this game, players try to collect bear tiles with four different kinds of ribbons. The players move their playing pieces across the board and flip over the face down tile they end their move on. If they don't own the respective color yet, they get to keep it, otherwise they have to place it on the board again. Whoever collects all four colors first, wins.

name: The Terrific Tuatara Trail Game
description: From the publisher: Travel through time and rediscover New Zealand’s rich historical past. Answer questions as you go, and earn points by collecting worms, wetas, millipedes and beetles. The player with the largest collection of delicious tuatara treats at the end of the journey wins the game!

name: Monopoly: Dunkerque
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Dunkerque, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

description:

description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the French soccer club, Paris Saint-Germain (or PSG).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Valenciennes
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the city of Valenciennes, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Way Back When in History 1400-1865
description: Answer a question about the time period you are in to roll the die and move through history to win. Start with the Explorers, move on to the American Colonies, then the American Revolution, the Constitution, and finally the Civil War. Each card has five questions, one for each time period.

name: Pocket Modern Warfare
description:
Pocket Modern Warfare is a free print and play simple table top game using top down paper minis from Junior General website that can be played virtually anywhere. Using the top down paper vehicles and soldiers from Junior General one can use the terrain available from the site or use any other manner of item to represent buildings and terrain on the table top.

The play is also simplified in easy rulers that are printed with the game that take care of movement and firing ranges. So no tape measures to carry around, just some dice and all the paper mini's you've printed.

For more free great minis visit:
http://www.juniorgeneral.org/
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rommel at El Alamein, July & August
description:
The Dogfight Battles of July and August 1942
Rommel's success was inspiring, even to his sworn enemies. Time after time, his panzers swept across the desert like hot sirocco winds in their unrelenting blitzkrieg fashion. The British were nearing their end, so it seemed. Whatever defenses they created did little to halt Rommel. The Germans were also nearing their end logistically speaking as El Alamein was far, far away from their main supply depots. Rommel's own panzers were wearing out from all of the fast advances that had totally kept the British off balance.
The first of the grueling dogfight battles occurred from July 1-4. Hitler was pressing Rommel to go for the kill and reach the Nile. Rommel, himself, felt certain the British were at their end after the unraveling of their defenses in June and their chaotic retreat. But his DAK divisions had suffered and most were really just regimental size. Panzer divisions had a mere 30 tanks. Still, he went forth confident. In this battle, fuel was not an issue, but Rommel attacked without much intelligence as to where the enemy really was. For the British, it was their last stand. They could not afford another Gazala or Tobruk because it would mean Egypt was German.
The second dogfight battle in the same area began August 30th. Rommel would once again try his sweep around the end tactic and block all retreat routes. The battle is also known as Alam Halfa. Rommel had replenished his panzer divisions this time but fuel was a keen issue, as his plan called for them to advance deep into the rear of the British and cut them off. The problem was that his panzers would then have little fuel. By now, Rommel was more hesitant in this offensive and secured guarantees from Hitler that more fuel would arrive. Hitler promised. Reluctant, the order was again given in what was his last attempt to reach the Nile. The British were well prepared this time around and more or less knew of the plan. Their minefields were widened, units were instructed to let the German's come to them, their bombers readied. Dogfight 2 ended on Sept. 3, and the British lost a precious chance to encircle the DAK.

There are two games distinct from one another. Each uses different rules, counters and maps. They are at different scales with dogfight 2 being more tactical and dogfight 1, operational.
Each day turn in dogfight 1 is 8 hrs, 1 mile hexes. In dogfight 2, it is 4 hrs, and most units are company size. AFVs have armor ratings using a new system. Each game has 11x17" map and has 280 counters.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Duck Duck Fishing Game
description:
Each player controls their own duck and tries to catch as many fish swirling around the pond as they can. Whoever catches the most fish wins!

Content:
1 Game Base
20 Fishes of 2 different colors

- Each person chooses a handle and holds onto it.
- Press the button to turn on the game.
- Place all the fish on the playing base.
- As the fish swirl around, move the handle and pull the trigger to make the duck bend down to pick up the fish.
- Then move them back to drop the fish in your "pool".
- The one who catches the most number of fish is the winner.

name: Ticks Tacks Toes
description:
In this expanded twist on the classic Tic-Tac-Toe, players take turns placing sculpted plastic 3D ticks, tacks, and toes on the 6x6 grid. Players try to get strings of three-in-a-row (one tick, one tack, and one toe) to earn tokens.

Other players can score off your moves. Earn the most tokens and win. Includes 36 ticks, tacks, and toes plus a colorful 6x6 square grid gameboard, tokens, and guide. For 2 to 4 players.

name: Rallye
description: This game is played with 2 dice, 45 cards with the numbers 1 to 9 and 11 cars. One players rolls the dice. The numbers on the dice represent the number that all players have to make with one up to three cards out of their hands using calculations. The first player that has played all his cards gets one car. The first player with three cars is the winner.

name: Altitude
description:
The game combine 2 original word games in the same box. The first one is an word-agility game, and the second one a word-rapidity game.

In both games, everyone receive 8 cards at the beginning. On each card there is a letter (a to z). At the beginning of each round, everyone must try to complete a common card with 3 letters placed in the middle of the table.

name: Conquest of the World
description:
(The game cartridge label states "Software Copyright (c)1981 E. Averett".


No country ever lost a war by being too strong"
Field-Marshall Viscount Montgomery of Alamein



CONQUEST OF THE WORLD represents a significant departure from traditional game design. The components have been designed to provide you with a very realistic model of the real world to both electronically and graphically simulate strategic and tactical confrontation between world powers.
Electronic land, sea and air forces can be deployed against each other in any combination and are totally dependent on supplies which are represented by energy units.The game board is a true-to-life model of the relationships between countries of the real world in the early 1980's.

Forty-three countries have been divided into eleven "politectonic" or geo-political zones. Each country has been weighted with a power base figure that reflects its capability to persuade other nations to conform to its wishes - by diplomatic coercion or by direct military force.

These figures are based on the formula created by Ray S. Cline, formerly Deputy Director of Intelligence for the C.I.A.

Pp = (C+E+M)x(S+W)

PERCEIVED POWER = (Critical Mass (Population + Territory) + Economic Capability + Military Capability) x (Strategic Purpose + National Will).

Future shifts in world power and change in governments will - of course - make changes in these numeric weightings appropriate. Players can feel free to sustain realism by changing the numbers assigned to each country as life goes on.

If you play other war games such as those published by Avalon Hill and SPI, you will find that the computer cartridge interfaces very effectively with them. The onscreen combats will generate much more excitement and realism than the usual dice provided to resolve conflicts. Onscreen energy units can be programmed into the computer to reflect the relative strength between different forces. The differential between the onscreen energy units at the end of each battle can also be applied to the combat results tables that come with these games.

Conquest of the World is the first game of its kind, so be ready for many unusual features. Take the rules one step at a time and you will find it to be a fascinating game of endless challenge - which, once learned, is not at all difficult to explain to others.


THE OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME is to lead your Homeland to world domination through negotiations, conquests and alliances. Each successful conquest and alliance you make will strengthen your country's power base. The country with the strongest power base at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Loupežníci
description:
5 soldiers try to catch all highwaymen. These highwaymen endanger the whole country. Every higwayman has a different power and every duel is different.

Box content:
1 game board
31 smaller pieces
5 bigger pieces
31 cards of highwaymem
5 cards of soldiers
1 dice
CZ and SK instructions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Dino Toys s. r. o., Tofa Semily

name: Bible Battles Trading Card Game
description:
Ever wonder what it would be like to have King David defend Jerusalem from a horde of Babylonian Chariots? How about having Emperor Augustus lead massive Roman armies in an assault against the Assyrian Fortress of Assur?

Well...Bible Battles TCG brings the Old Testament to life with over 500 unique cards from 6 of the ancient nations. This original and exiting game offers great family fun, and also provides a unique educational tool to help childeren and adults alike to learn about the amazing people and relive the stories from thousands of years ago.
publishers: Bible Battles Trading Card Game, LLC

name: Hoppla Elefant!
description:
Raja, which is a baby elephant, is in a porcelain shop. He must be very careful not to break porcelain goods.
Some columns are place on the way of the elephant, with porcelain goods on them.
Players must try to avoid these columns while moving the elephant that has a trunk tree in his trunk.
Several difficulty levels are available.

name: Triage
description:
The Healthy Heart Hospital is a very busy place with constant patients coming into the Emergency Room. As the administration, you have to choose the best course of action for keeping the hospital running and healing the patients. Can you make the most efficient hospital?

Players make up the doctors and administration. If the players keep the hospital running in full force and heal enough people, they prove to be a great hospital administration and win the game; if not, they lose.

name: Die Schlange
description: The game contains a very long snake (more than two meters?) which has to be assembled from tiles during the course of the game. Game starts at the tail, then proceeds in a Dominoes fashion (colors have to be matched). But the segments of the snake are not straight, instead the snake coils (overlapping is allowed). When no player can place another tile, the head of the snake is added. The player it points at is the loser and receives one point. The player with least points after a certain number of plays, wins.

name: Pluggspelet
description:
The School Game

A roll and move game, where you move from public school to high school.

name: Senseability
description:
Get ready to touch, time, see, balance, bluff, locate and laugh your way through this outrageous game! Teams race to perform all kinds of fun, easy to play challenges spread over ten sense-ational categories.

Think you've got eyes in the back of yoru head, can smell trouble or know your north from south? Well, get ready to touch, time, see, smell, balance, bluff, listen, locate and laugh your way through this sense-ational and outrageous game that has something for everyone.

Senseability boasts 20 wacky challenges - each one engaging player's senses in a totally different and fun way. The winner is the first player to complete any six challenges correctly.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition
publishers: Pressman Toy Corp., SENSEABILITY GAMES CORP.

name: El Intruso
description:
In this quiz, we will issue a series of clues by which we must discover the intruder. As we go giving correct answers, we will advance the game board, whose squares years will more or less complicated to win the game.

Objective: To make the journey first board correctly answering most questions.

Content:
1 game board
6 pawns
1.000 question cards

name: Darkwing Duck
description: Roll and move around the board with the Disney animated character.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Last Stand at Baku
description: During the summer of 1918, Turkey created its “Army of Islam” con-sisting of the 5th, 15th Divisions, later the 10th also joined. Having been defeated in Palestine, the Turks looked for easier prey and this was the Trancaucasus-Caspian area of Azerbaijan. This newly formed country asked Turkey for protection from the Bolsheviks, which also wanted the area. The Reds were defeated in late June but they remained in control of Baku until mid July. Turkey, like the British, saw Baku’s worth in its oil and ordered its army to march hundreds of miles to seize it despite Germany’s strong protests (who wanted it also through political means). By the end of July, the Turks were fast approaching Baku. This prompted the British to send Dunsterforce, 1000 men, to Baku, all arrived in the nick of time. The situation for the British was dire from the start. In manpower, the odds were 10 to 1 in favor of the Turks!
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Wanna Hang Out?
description:
A game of deduction with a party game feel.

Each player is given 3 cards with various activities their game character likes to participate in. Players take turns asking each other, "Do you like ....?" Once a player is "somewhat" confident that his/her three cards are similar enough to produce the best, or at least a positive score, he/she may ask to hang out with that game character. The first to 15 points wins or the first to -5 points loses!

name: Murder in the City
description:
It's the scandal of the year - Mr X has been found dead in his office and the prime suspects have plenty to hide. Whether you're the murderer covering your trail or the dectectives searching for the truth, you'll love this game with all its twists, turns and mysteries.

Detectives move around the outside of the board, collecting evidence and asking questions to build their case, whilst the murderer tries to halt their progress.

Speed is of the essence for the murderer as they try to make 5 laps of the inside loop and escape before a detective can build their case.

Game Board
6 Playing pieces
20 Murderer Identity Cards
45 Physical Appearance cards
50 Confession Word cards
25 Murderer Chance cards
25 Detective Chance cards
"Yes" Card
"No" Card
"Don't Know" card
Suspect profile sheet
confession keywords sheet
Wrong Turn card
Tainted Evidence card
5 Getaway Mile Tokens
Pads, pencils and a die

name: Ampparin Eskari Eläimet
description: Learning to animals is a fun and simple game where you learn from animals. Game can be played by two different theme, Where the animals live? and What do animals eat?. Playing cards and trying to animal dies with the animal to find the right place to live or food, when the character wins the animal itself. You get to choose what animals you move the chessboard and in which direction. The winner is the player who collects the most chips themselves. The game includes many variations, for example. the memory of the game.

name: Kursk: Taming the Tigers
description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using micro-scale tank miniatures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

"The German invasion of the USSR in 1941 was, at first, a smashing success. However by 1943 the German army was on the brink of disaster . . . Hitler decided to gamble on a massive armored assault designed to force the Soviets out of the war before the Allies could open a new front in Western or Southern Europe . . . The battle of Prokhorovka, near the end of the Kursk campaign, was the largest tank battle in history.

The game's order of battle is simplified, eliminating infantry and anti-tank guns. The Germans have Tiger, Panzer IV, and Panzer III tanks. The Russians have KV-1, T-34, and T-70 tanks.

Concepts covered in the rules include artillery, air attacks, terrain, line of sight, and rear/side armor.

name: Step Lively Shuffleboard
description: Step Lively is a shuffleboard game. Instead of flicking or pushing the pucks. You use the ramp on the end of the playing board to launch your pucks into the scoring areas. Instead of a flat playing surface the gameboard is made up of stepped areas. You can adjust the height of the ramp to adjust the speed, at which your puck will launch and you can also turn the ramp to adjust the angle, to aim your shots more accurately.

name: He & She Travel
description:
From the publisher:
Straight couples game in travel version now. Game is about to find out how well couples know each other. The game can be played by couples against couples or one couple. In order to advance in play the answer sheets must fit together. First couple to reach target wins the game. If a single pair is playing, so the aim is to find out who know their partner best.

name: BrainBox: History
description:
From the publisher:
What can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try and memorise as many pictures and words as you can. After ten seconds, pass the card to another player who asks a quick-fire question.

History How many things can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try to memorise as many of the pictures and words appearing on the beautifully-illustrated cards. After ten seconds, turn the card over, roll the die and answer a quick-fire question to win the card. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins. A fun way to learn history, from Stonehenge to the Channel Tunnel. Age 8 and above.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: ASML Special Edition
description:
ASML Holding N.V. is a Dutch multinational corporation, founded in 1984, specializing in the development and manufacturing of semiconductor chip-making equipment.

The famous Monopoly game with the theme of the company ASML. Try to get a department of the ASML company and build your houses and hotels.

On the back of the box: "ASML wishes you and your family happy holidays in 2007, and a great 2008! We have created this ASML Special Edition of the popular boardgame, MONOPOLY, as a gift to ASML employees and their families this holiday season."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cognes
description:
A game for 2 players (and possibly 3 or 4) requiring only a bunch of coins and a plane, non-slippery surface. Perfect for situations where no other game is at hand!

On their turn, each player tries to flip a coin, while always maintaining it in contact with the table, without it ever touching another coin.

name: Schwere Schritte
description:
User Summary:

Edition Spielbox No. 88. First published in Spielbox 1/2010.

Players are hikers that are trying to cross a bridge. However the bridge is not stable and will collapse if there is ever too much weight on it.

Each player is secretly assigned one of six colours at the start of the game. The players throw the die in turn and make a number of moves with any pawns equal to the value rolled. Each space on the bridge has a weight score and if the sum of the pawns' weight is greater than the stability score of the bridge, it collapses. Pawns at the start and in the middle of the bridge fall into the river and swim back to the start, pawns near the end land on rocks and are eliminated.

If a player wishes to move his pawn to the goal and win, he must declare his intention to do so before rolling. The next player may then try and guess the roller's identity, with a correct guess eliminating that player from the game as well.

name: Geißlein, versteck dich! Das Kartenspiel
description:
The little kids hide from the wolf. But the players can save them if they remember exactly how many kids are hiding underneath the six colorful hiding places! The color die indicates under which hiding place the players should search for the litlle kids. Whoever states the correct number of kids hiding there, receives the little kid card as a reward. The aim of the game is to be the first player to collect six little kids cards.

Source: "Game Idea3 from the ruleset
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Number
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Memory

name: Fancy Nancy Positively Perfect Parfait Game
description:
Fancy Nancy themed game. Players take turns Spinning the spinner to collect at least three different flavors of ice cream in their dish then top it off with a cherry. The spinner has the 4 different ice cream flavors spots, two cherry spots, an Oops! spot, and a Switch a Scoop spot.
Players begin with an empty dish. Play begins with the person wearing pink hearts or the youngest. The player spins the spinner, if it lands on a flavor they do not have they get to put that flavor on their dish, if they already have that flavor, play goes to next player, an Oops! the player must put an ice cream back, a Switch a Scoop lets the player switch a scoop with another player, a cherry lets the player pick a flavor they wish or to put a cherry on their dish if they have 3 different ice cream flavors. The goal is to be the first to have a complete parfait.
Recommended for 2-4 players age 4 and up.
Helps teach turn taking, color recognition and very simple strategy to block another player with the Switch a Scoop. No reading is needed.
Contents:
Spinner
20 scoops of ice cream (cardboard)
4 cherries (cardboard)
4 fancy parfait dishes (cardboard)
1 play mat
-user submitted
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Farbzwerge
description:
The players are dwarves and have to mix colors to color their hats. At the start of the game, each player receives one dwarf card and takes it into his/her hand. The mixing colors are placed face-down on the table.
The active player picks a small (two colors) or large hat (three) and has to name the players who hold the dwarf colors he/she needs to mix the color on the hat. Then he/she also has to find the correct mixing color on the table. If successful, he/she can keep the hat. A player who fails gets a white dwarf and is allowed to use his/her own dwarf in the next move (unless another player makes a mistake and takes the white dwarf from him/her.

The player with most hats at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Social Security Special
description: Social Security Special is similar to Aggravation, in that players must navigate their pawns around a uni-directional track while avoiding their opponent's pieces, to become the first to bring all their pawns safely "home", This game, however, differs in that it is played in teams and that movement is determined by card playing, not dice rolls. Players begin with 5 regular playing cards in their hand, drawing one card and playing one card of their choice per turn. Each card allows specific movement on the board. Landing on an opponent's piece will return it to their "start" space. First team to reach home with all their pawns wins.

name: Het Grote Etiquette Spel
description:
Each player gets a survey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the survey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the survey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

name: Five Men Standing
description:
You're poised on the emerald pitch at Eden Park for the Final of Rugby World Cup 2011. It’s the dying moments of the game. The score is deadlocked and the crowd is screaming. The ball is passed out to the back line: the outcome hinges on what you do next!

Five Men Standing is for both lovers of the glorious game, and those who have never held a Rugby ball in their hands. Fast paced, competitive, and with no sissy turn taking, this is a game of frantic action and fun!
Each player controls a set of 5 Rugby players, drawn from 2 of the teams competing in the 2011 Tournament. How you manipulate, position, and toss these players will determine the ultimate victor.

--- How To Play ---
Each player takes a team of five Rugby player figures in their hand, then yells:

Touch! Players cup their figures in both hands, then reach out and bump hands with their opponent’s
Pause! Players withdraw hands from their opponent’s
Engage! Players release their figures onto the playing surface

The figures will bounce around and land in one of four stances, from best to worst: Standing, On Side, On Back, Face Down in the mud.

Your aim is to yell Stop! when you think you have a combination that will beat your opponent.

If your first throw wasn’t great, don’t just sit there moping. This isn’t your grandma’s tiddly winks, this is Five Men Standing Rugby! Speed and skill count, so grab the figures you want to throw again and see if you can improve your combo. Just remember, you can’t pick up figures that are Face-Down in the mud. Those blokes are out of play.

And be fast, because your opponent will be doing the same and might yell Stop! first...

Combos are based on Poker, with a couple of twists, and are ranked on the provided Score Board.

If you win a round, you take a Rugby ball token. When they're gone, the player with the most tokens wins.

There's also Advanced Scoring Rules for Legends, solitaire rules, and you can add more players by buying more Country Team Packs.

name: Literati Challenge
description:
From the Discovery Bay website:

"In Literati Challenge, tall tales, side splitting yarns and hilarious verse are all part of the fun, but what’s best of all is you’ll be writing it! That’s right Literati Challenge is the new, laugh out loud party game of bluffing and creative chutzpa. Players get five words on cards. Each player must write a story using all the words in 90 seconds. The challenge? You may not know the meaning of the words, but to score points you need to make the other players believe you do. Players are scored during each turn. First player to reach 300 points wins. Literati Challenge is sure to get your creative mojo rising and your family and friends howling!"

This differs from Baffle Gab in that it is targeted for adults (Age 15+) where Baffle Gab is a Family game (Age 7+). The words used would be different and lend to a different experience. The most significant difference between these games is that in Literati Challenge, the cards provide word definitions on the back of the cards, while the cards in Baffle Gab do not.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Word Game

name: Marooned
description:
Here is a reading game that will take kids across the curriculum learning facts in Mathematics, Geography, Biology and Nutrition as they read and draw a conclusion from the information provided.

The setting is a deserted island that players were forced to crash land on when the plane's engine failed. In order to survive, players must roam the island in search of food, water and useful supplies. As they marooned survivors comb the beaches to meet their basic needs, they are collecting Survival Cards related to the 4 curriculums listed above.

When 3 cards in a category/curriculum have been collected, the player is awarded a Raft Card. Four Raft Cards are required to make the escape and win.

name: Prinzessin Lillifee: Das verzauberte Reh
description:
Each player has a deer which was bewitched - it has several pink spots and wants to get rid of them. The spots are chips placed on the deer "boards".
In the center of the table there is a spellbook which contains spell cards. The active player has to cast the spell on the top card. For this, she flips over one of the 13 tiles placed around the book. If the symbol under it matches that on the card, she can remove one of the spots on her deer. Some spells are variations of this basic mechanism. One spell type also brings a punishment if mistake is made - the deer of the erring player gets a new spot.

The first player to get rid of all the pink spots on her deer is the winner.

name: Resan genom Sagoland
description:
This is a roll-and-move game which included pawns and a spinner for movement however in the rules it says that you easily exchange the spinner for a die.

The board is in a fold-out-format and has 113 spaces, some with events connected to them. The events are written on the side of the board and are written in rhymes.

The goal is to get to the end and get the chest with gold.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jitterbugs
description:
Players use the magnetic fishing rod to collect the jittering bugs that dance around the board. Its a fun dexterity game for children that looks easier than what it actually is.

The game requires the use of one "C" battery to power the motor that causes the bugs to dance around the board.

name: The Game of Horoscope
description: Each player competes to collect 12 cards, one for each sign of the horoscope. At the beginning, you choose a date and there is a reference card that tells six different numbers. Your card collection should total one of those six numbers to win. Movement is by dice but a player always has the option to move 1 space and not throw dice. Good Fortune cards can score additional points and there is interaction because players can take horoscope cards from other players.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Shop-Missus
description:
Noisy card game. There are 52 cards, in 13 sets of four identical cards. In addition, there are 8 tradesmen cards.
Players draw a random trade and then try to win tricks. A trick comprises of two or more like cards. The method of winning these tricks is noisily encouraged. Each player has one card, face-down and a trade card exposed. When the face-down cards are turned over simultaneously, each player will look for two or more identical cards. If there are any, the players revealing these cards must be first to demand a recognised quantity of any commodity that the tradesmen involved normally stock (e.g. a pound of butter, a bottle of scent and so on). The first to do this wins the trick (all the identical cards involved) and a new round begins.

name: Kotipihan Kasvit
description:
From the publisher:
In the three games of the Backyard Nature series, the player will be introduced to nature’s creatures by being challenged to recognise them. The attractive picture cards portray common plants in a realistic manner, and the player must name them correctly. The game can also be played outdoors – finding the corresponding plants in nature will help the learning process!

name: The Loon Dice Game
description: Players each take three turns rolling five special dice to try and score the highest point total. Points are scored by rolling matching pairs of loons (the number one on the die) and by rolling fours, the number representing their calls. Players can also score by rolling twos or threes with a loon pair or fives and sixes with two loon pairs.

name: Dept. 13
description:
Dept. 13 is a game in which players use the Steel and Glory System to battle the creatures created by Occult Nazi Forces. Dept. 13 is a secret government agency dedicated to fighting supernatural forces. The game includes super spies (who are identified only by one letter initials), Nazi zombies, ghouls, mad scientists, and themes of occult horror. As with the other games in the S&G system, the battles are very quick and can be fought one-on-one or with players each controlling large groups. Each character has several unique stats, including their fighting ability, and the cost to hire them as a mercenary into your fighting force.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Super Głowa
description:
Super Głowa is a Polish crossword game, not unlike Scrabble, in which words are formed on the board with the use of tiles; these words are awarded points with a special bonus system. The difficulty and intellectual level of this game depends on the players.

This game is targeted at both adults, who will find it an interesting way of spending their free time with their friends and families, and children, for whom it will be both a fun game and a learning opportunity. This game aids the development of intelligence, vocabulary and spelling skills.

Components:
- four wooden tile holders
- one thick cardboard board
- 126 cardboard square letter tiles (Polish characters included)
- 2 blank tiles

name: Shut The Box Advanced version
description:
A math skills and luck game for any number of players.
There is a 48 numbers instead of 9-12 numbers.

The box can be used to play 4 versions of Shut Box:
1-9 using just addition - pre-K to grade 2 (ages 4+)
1-12 using addition multiplication - grades 3 to 5 (ages 9+)
1-24 using addition & multiplication with simple complex equations - grades 4 to 7 (ages 10+)
1-48 using all 4 math operations with complex equations - grades 5 to 10 (ages 11+)

Players roll 4 dice and use any combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division of the numbers on the all 4 dice. The answer to that equation is the tile number that you can flip.

name: Biopolis
description:
Biopolis is a city state where food production is important. In this game, every player is a food producer, importer, and seller. Next to that, every player can influence consumer behavior, and politics.

Every player has an ideal picture of the future norms. Winner of the game is the player, who is able to best realize his future vision!

An educational game about food production, distribution and consumption.

name: Word Crossing
description: The object of Word Crossing game is to be the first player to play all of his/her word strips to win! Using your word strips, match the letters of your favorite Disney characters and match up the pictures from your favorite Disney movies
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Application Crunch
description:
From developer's site:

Want to pursue your dreams at an art school? Want to be a campus sensation at a big state school? Want to work crazy hard for that full ride to a very selective private university? The choice is yours, and the path you take there is entirely up to you.

Application Crunch is a card game for 3-4 players. Each player takes on the role of a high school student and college applicant. Players juggle their time between academics, extracurricular activities, work, and service while competing for college applications and scholarships.

To win, players must get into college, save enough money to pay for tuition and other expenses, and build up the kind of character who can succeed in their chosen school.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Invasion Defense
description:
From the rules:
Space jump technology opened the way for humanity to reach to the stars. But soon, exploration ships began to vanish. Hostile eyes had been drawn to earth, and from the void of space, a fleet of deadly ships emerged, intent on our destruction.

The fleets are closing on Earth. Only a handful of hastily assembled ships stand in their path. They must destroy the invaders, or Earth will perish.

A solo or cooperative card game for 1-4 players.

Game description:

Each turn, cards showing Invaders advance on the Earth across three possible different sectors. Each invader ship will add new upgrades and weapons as it approaches the Earth and new cards are drawn to reveal its abilities.

Players then draw and play cards representing the ships and weapons of the Earth fleets. Each ship has a mix of missles, lasers and shields, and most ships have special abilities. Players play ships to different sectors and use them to play missile and shield cards to attack the invaders.

The players must destroy 6 of the invading ships to win. If two invaders get past the fleet, the Earth is destroyed.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Critical Hit! - Volume 6, No. 2
description:
Volume 6, No. 2 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine, containing articles and scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader

The following articles are included:
- Intro to Stonne 1940 (introduction to the ASL module of the same name)
- The Making of Stonne 1940 (designer notes for the ASL module Stonne 1940)
- Scotland the Brave CG3 (an after action report of Campaign Game 3 played at Mad Vet Con)

The following 12 ASL scenarios are included:
Stonne#7: DOWN ON THE STREETS; 16 May 1940; Stonne, France
Stonne#8: SHATTERED LINES; 17 May 1940; Stonne, France
CH128: A FEW RARE MEN; 23 May 1940; Thulin, Belgium
CH129: ST HOMME SKIRMISH; 23 May 1940; St Homme Crossroads, Belgium
CH130: NO QUARTER AT QUENIAU; 23 May 1940; Le Queniau, Belgium
CH131: BLOOD BROTHERS; 31 May 1940; Burnes, France
CH132: DEFENSE OF ORPHANAGE FARM; 23 May 1940; East of Calais, France
CH133: GROUP IRON; 10 May 1940; Kannes, Belgium
CH134: STURMTRUPPEN; 11 November 1944; Goldap, East Prussia
CH135: THE RIVER DANCE; 1 September 1939; Brahe River, Poland
CH136: DESPERATE STAND; 25 December 1941; Stanley Village, Hong Kong Island
CH137: ASSAULT ON FORNEBU; 9 April 1940; Fornebu, Norway

It also contains two new Campaign Games for the Stonne 1940 game:
CGII: THE CRUSHER; 17 May 1940; Stonne, France
CGIII: INFERNO OF STEEL; 15 - 18 May 1940; Stonne, France
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Englisch für Kinder
description: The question cards in this Quiz/Learning game come from the daily life of a child. The front side shows the german word and a picture. The backside of the card has the english translation and the phonetic writing of the word to teach the correct pronounciation. Furthermore there is a simple sentence which uses the word in and easy context, also with phonetic transcription and the german translation of the whole sentence. The children move their playing pieces through the Inner City of London, at each of the 12 monuments a card is drawn, if the child answers correctly, it receives a knowledge-chip. Who has the most chips at the end of the game, wins.

name: Entdecke die Ritterburg
description: Knights and ghost hold a race on the sides of the box, in the bottom of the box the castle is put over one of the quiz pages, windows of the castle show 4 correct and 4 wrong answers to the question on top of the page. Depending on the roll of the die one may move knight or ghost or put a chip on a correct answer. Can be played by one person alone.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Medieval, Trivia

name: Frag doch mal
description: Each player positions his marker on the start spot and takes one mouse-, duck- and elephant tile each in the same colour. In his move a player takes the top card and reads out the question, mouse, duck and elephant offer one answer each, which is also read out. Then all players decide on the correct answer and place the corresponding animal tile face down. When all have decided, the tiles are turned up, for a correct answer a player moves his marker one spot forward, the active player two spots. The first player to reach the finish, wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Roope-setä Pörssipeli
description:
From the publisher:
Robert's a great businessman, familiar characters take part in a duck Scrooge, organized by the thrill of competition, a businessman, to win a job Scrooge's group - the winner is the one who deserves the first million.
This game is monopoly/go for broke/payday/cashflow like game! The game goes around the board where players need to make decisions and some weird things, like to make a sound of money or what is the most expensive thing you know. Everytime when you get it right or other player think that you got it, then yu get the amount of money written on the card or on the spcae you are standing on!
Win, by getting a million!

In travel edition instead of the game board you have a small notebook for writing up the scores. Cards have modified accordingly. Travel version can be played up to 4 players.
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel

name: Air Show: Circus of the Skies
description:
Every summer, crowds gather in the New Mexico desert for a show like no other. Daring pilots compete in exhibitions of aerobatic skill and bravery. Dogfights, air races, and bombing runs are guaranteed to test the mettle of even the most seasoned veteran. Have you got what it takes?

Air Show is a game and a game system. Take the controls of a stunt plane and put your piloting to the test in a variety of aerial events. Manage your altitude and airspeed, perform cool stunts to turn the tables on your opponents, think fast, shoot straight, fly true, and maybe you'll take home the trophy this year.

This game uses a simultaneous action selection mechanic to program a flight plan three maneuvers in advance. Players have thirty seconds to "lock in" their maneuvers and stake out a position in turn order. When everyone is ready, maneuvers execute in turn order. Planes may dive or climb, turn right or left, accelerate or brake, or perform a stunt at the expense of altitude or airspeed. The goal differs with each event, but strategies emerge from anticipating what other players are doing and planning around that. Unlike other games of this type, such as RoboRally or Wings of War, there are no cards to play. All maneuvers are available to all players at all times, to the limits of what their current altitude and airspeed allow.
publishers: Clockwork Colossus Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Mono Play
description:
The plastic board has two distinct halves. The first half features a spiraling track that leads from the top down to the second half, which is dish-shaped and has 'pockets', each worth a different number of points.

The ball is placed on the spiral and then let go. The ball will go round the spiral and eventually it will reach the second half. It will settle into one of the pockets and that is your score for that ball.

First player to reach a pre-decided score, wins.

name: Scranton-opoly
description:
"It's all fun and games until someone lands in the slammer!"

Another monopoly clone but this time for the Scranton, PA area. The board features notable business such as the Radisson Lackawanna Station Hotel, The University of Scranton and Savvi Formalwear by Sarno & Son.

name: Monopoly: San Diego
description:
Back of Box:

Advance to GO! The MONOPOLY Brand introduces the new San Diego edition showcasing America's Finest City. This game puts San Diego's most valued historical landmarks, cultural treasures and word-class tourist attractions up for sale.

Includes custom board, Golf & Beach cards replace Chance & Community Chest cards, "Sunshine Dollars" from the San Diego County Credit Union, yellow "Ranch Estates", blue "Beach Homes", and 6 custom pewter tokens: Surfer, San Diego Union Tribune, Sunglasses, Sailboat, Beach Cruise Bicycle and Golf Cart.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: WHY?!
description:
From the product page (http://victorypointgames.com/details.php?prodId=189):

For years we've pondered the question: "Why did the chicken cross the road?" Well, never fear, because our very own VPG designer, Nathan Hansen, has the answer! WHY?! is a 1 to 5 player game featuring the perfectly normal, seemingly sane chickens, running headlong into traffic, causing a massive 42 car pileup! We ask you again, WHY?! What could have possibly been so important?

Each turn, players draw a card and follow the instructions to move their chicken, and either move current cars on the board or draw new ones into a random lane! Anything can happen to you as you cross this dangerous road to get to the other side.

A quick, easy to learn game, designed for children but challenging for all players!

Game Data:
Complexity: 1.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 8.5 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each player plays a chicken attempting to cross the road and avoid incoming traffic

Changes from First Edition:

• All components upgraded to Gold Banner standards, including a mounted map, laser-cut counters, and full-sized poker cards.
• Rules booklet reformatted and some rules changed concerning car movement

What's in the Box?:

• One 8.5" x 11" highway game map
• One 4-page, full-color Rules booklet
• 40 thick, multi-shaped, laser-cut game pieces (minor assembly required)
• 25 Event cards
• One 8.5" x 11" mounted, jigsaw-cut game map
• One bright red, 9 1/4" x 5 7/8" Standard cardboard VPG game box
• One beautiful box cover sleeve
• One "Wipes-A-Lot" napkin
• One charcoal dessicant packet

name: Danger Météorites!
description:
Danger Meteorites offers a thrilling adventure in our galaxy.
Each player has four rocket and space probes. The goal is to place these on each of four solar system planets to win .
But there is need to be careful and avoid the crossing meteorites.
Player rolls 1 or 2 dice in his turn. If the wrong face (one of six) appears on dice, he must start at the beginning with all the probes.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: X-Com Incursion
description: 2 Player Deck Building Card Game based on the 1993 PC game. Fan Tribute. One player is X-Com, the other is the aliens. There is no common deck. Each player has their own set of cards to build from. Win by destroying your opponent's main base. As Panic Levels rise X-Com loses resources but gains desperate card trashing options. Depending on what cards players research, strategies can shift from Interception heavy, to Tactical heavy, to Research Heavy.

name: Monopoly: Ostfriesland
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Ostfriesland, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Rostock
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Rostock, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Conquête de la Mer
description:
The goal of the game is to discover the sea during a large rally on the oceans. Each player must complete five missions by moving on the game board of unequal difficulties and bringing the witnesses in its home port.

In his turn, players must correctly answer questions to win the cards and to collect one of each family.

name: Auf Spurensuche am Limes
description:
"Auf Spurensuche am Limes" is a board game with an accompanying book with 48 pages of background information.

The game board shows a excavation site with zones of different depth. At the start of the game, findings and discoveries (tiles connected to one colour) are distributed on the site, face up. In a next step, all findings are covered with the dust of time - terrain tiles on top of them, thus creating multiple layers of tiles. Only after this, colours are assigned to the players - hopefully thy remember some of "their" findings.

Each player plays a team of archaeologists trying to excavate in particular those findings which match his own research assignment (colour). In trying to achieve that, however, fragments of roman documents might be discovered, earning the player additional points.

At a player's turn, he performs each of 4 actions:
- Move his expedition manager 1 - 3 spaces around the border of the site (to more promising sectors). His position determines the spaces of the site which can be reached by archeologists (neutral colour).
- Now the player has 5 movement points to move one or more neutral archeologists, either to the sector determined by his own expedition manager or to some bad position for the opponents.
- The 3rd action the site is explored. Two terrain tiles with archeologists on them are lifted and the things nderneath are now visible. They are (mostly) not directly available.
- Finally, the player can perform an excavation. To get the several findings visible, you need to place one or more archeologists around the space, depending on the depth of the zone.

Findings of your own colour are directly put into the museum, more worthy findings are replacing ones with lesser value.
Findings of an opponent`s colour are not that easily excavated. You need allocated points or some dice luck to get them.

Since mostly a finding is not discovered and excavated in the same turn, players have to be careful not to discover findings, which can be easily "grabbed" by their opponents.

The game ends when one player manages to excavate all of his assigned findings (winner of the game). If nobody manages to do so, the game ends, when a player reaches the end of the "expedition track", where successful excavations and discoveries are registered, and the player with the most allocated points wins the game.

The advanced game offers fences to make it harder for opponents to excavates findings discovered by other players.

name: Octoverso Junior
description:
French word game's Octoverso Junior version. 8 double-sided letters are placed on a rotative rail. Each player must form a word using the letters in front of him. The word has to begin with at least the last 2 letters or end with at least the first 2 letters of the "word" currently on the rail. Since the rail rotates, that effectively gives 4 possibilities.

The first player to get rid of all his letters win.

The letters look more appropriate for young audiences and are marked with colors.

name: Yackety Smack!
description:
The party game Yackety Smack! features a voice recorder called the Sound Smacker and sixty cards divided into four types: singer, slime, karate kid and "Your Choice".

After the cards are shuffled and dealt, the youngest player records two sounds on the Sound Smacker that match the images on two cards, e.g. "Trolololo" and "Squish". The "Your Choice" card allows for, as the name suggests, a sound of your choice.

After this, the players start flipping over their cards in turns. As soon as two face-up cards correspond to the recorded sounds, the first player to smack the Sound Smacker wins and takes all revealed cards and adds these to his face-down pile. The game ends at the end of a round if one or more players have no cards in hand.

The player who collected the most cards wins!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Łakomczuchy
description:
Players play characters called 'Paszcze'. They compete with each other walking on board and draw random cards of food. If they get a collection of the same food they stored it in the fridge. Besides we have in game 'Trolls'. They are horrible creatures that we may find in journey of searching food. When we find such a beast we loudly call "Troll"! Each player get it from board Troll figure (which always minus 1 to number of players) and the player which don't catch the figure lost all content of his fridge.

Family game. With lot of emotions and funny things. Horrible sort of food, like old stinking socks, rats or bucket with dishwater.

The first player which load his fridge up to maximum wins the game.

name: Heute schon geküsst?
description:
Heute schon geküsst? is a co-operative game for 2 players (one couple).
Players alternately draw cards. This card either show questions or tasks.

If it is a question card, one player secretly writes down the answer and the other one has to guess the right answer. The questions are about personal wishes, preferences, ideas, etc., for example "How many children do you want?"
If the answer is correct, the couple sores 3 points (move the pink token), otherwies the game scores 3 points (black heard moves).

If it is a task card, the player has to guess how good he can do this task, for example "Massage your partners neck", the player has to guess secretly who good he can do this. (good or verry good). Than he does the task and the other player rates the efforts. If the rating fits the guess, they score points (1 if it was good, 2 if it was verry good), otherwies the black heard moves.

The game ends as soon as the pink token has reached the final space on the score track. The couples success is determinated by the position of the black heard.
