name: Valgames 21-Zip
description:
Statistical American Football game. Incredibly fast to play, it just uses one or two dice rolls to produce a result. This fast method means that a whole season - every game - can be played in one evening.

Each team has a specific rating based on the statistical data for that season. These are compared in a match-up and the dice does the rest.

Originally designed by Jon H. Wight in 1978, Bob Valvano produced updated ratings and rereleased the game for the 1985 and 1986 seasons.

name: Zoolandia
description:
Players take turns rolling the special die to move their pawns around the board and home to their zoo hut.

The die has images of the different animals and a hut.

name: Flip-O-Potamus
description:
Children's motorized action game. Part of a series of games entitled T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hilarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. This is a hippopotamus themed game with a pop-a-shot mechanic. The goal is to flip all 8 plastic marbles into the hippos mouth before the time stops. The hippos mouth opens and closes while the player attempts to shoot in all the marbles.

From the box: "Flip the hippo a mouthful of marbles!"

Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Real-time

name: Kérdezz ! Felelek: Új kártyák
description:
Expansion for Kérdezz ! Felelek.

Several new cards with new well-known men/women of literature and arts, geographical locations, animals and abstractions can be used with those from the base game.

The game does not contain scoring board and tokens and not change the base game rules.

name: Het Groot Pretparkenspel
description: The Game "Het Groot Pretparkenspel" is about amusement parks in The Netherlands. The aim of the game is that each player buys, builds and manages one or more parks. Everyone gets a working capital to do this. One player controls the Central Bank. Each player buys a site belonging to an amusement park and tries to fill it up with attractions. As in reality this will not all go smoothly. Financial difficulties will arise because attraction prices will fluctuate and because players are forced to conclude transactions with the Central Bank and the other players. The visitors (players which end up at attractions during play) will pay entrance fees to the owner of the park, which will have to manage on it. Moreover, the "Plus-Pech"-cards (Luck-Bad Luck) will provide ups and downs. The game ends when all players except one are bankrupt. Alternative game ends are at a pre-determined time or property limit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Face 2 Face
description:
'Face 2 Face' is a memory style game that consists of 32 tiles. 16 of those tiles show different animal faces. The other 16 tiles have a big hole in the middle and only show the outlines of the same animal faces.

Each set of tiles is laid face down in its own 4x4 grid. The players then take turns flipping over a single tile in each grid and then check whether they match or not. To do so, they put the tile with the hole on top of the tile without the hole. The rest is classic memory: if a matching pair is found, the player gets to keep the set and gets another turn. If a funny face appears, the tiles are put back in the grids and the next player gets a turn. The player having collected the most pairs wins the game.

In addition to this, the game offers three other variants for different age groups:
'Funny Faces' (ages 2+) is a single player puzzle activity where a random tile of each set is chosen and paired up to make fun of the result.
'First face' (ages 5+) is a reaction game where the tiles with a hole are laid face up in a 4x4 grid and the tiles without a hole are stacked face down. The top tile of the stack is then turned over and players try to be the first to put their finger in the hole of the matching tile.
'Peek a boo' (ages 6+) is a multiple level memory game in which all tiles are shuffled together and randomly stacked face up in 4 different piles. The players then take turns moving the top tile of one stack to the top of a different stack. If the top tiles on two stacks show a matching pair, the player takes them and the next player takes his turn.

name: Vie
description:
When scientists found a granite slab at the Malibu Archeological Dig with a single ancient alphabet character on it, they were puzzled. Soon they uncovered another slab and another and another. Some slabs were identical. Most slabs contained several characters. Fifty-four slabs were found in all. Experts were stumped.

Word of this curiosity reached the recreational laboratories at Victory Point Games. Professionals here immediately recognized what the archeologists had found: a word game. Perhaps they had found the first crossword game ever devised. You now hold what we believe is the word game cave people used to play, which we've come to call Vie. The original rules to this game have been lost to antiquity. This version should be more manageable than the original version of the game. (After all, granite is so hard to shuffle.)

At the start of the game, nine starting cards — each with a single letter on them — are laid out in a 3x3 grid. Each turn, you place a new card over an existing card to try to create new words, scoring them based upon the number of letters on the cards that you use to make those words. (Each square card in the draw deck has letters or letter combinations on 1-4 sides. On your turn, you can either choose one of the face-up cards on display or draw the top card of the deck.) You can score multiple words with the same card play — and you score for all letters on a card used in your word, not only the particular letter or letters used — so landing the best-scoring opportunities requires some strategic planning. Play continues for a number of rounds that decreases with more players.

name: Smurfspelet
description: Players are Smurfs and race through the forest. First Smurf to reach the goal wins. Movement is controlled by a die. One side of the die has a picture of a raspberry glass. If you roll the glass, you collect one raspberry juice token from a face down pile. The token shows either a full glass or an empty glass. If you land on a special space on the game board, you will count your full juice glasses and advance that many steps. If you land on a space with Gargamel, you lose a turn.

name: Donald Duck houdt van Nederland
description:
Trivia game with questions of the Netherlands and Disney.

Trow the dice and go forward on the map of The Netherlands. If you hit an orange or white space, trow the colored dice to see what question you will get. If it is wright you may go further, if not, the turn goes the the next player. The first player who hits finish is the winner.

name: Puppy School
description:
A card game for 2-6 dog's best friends.
Every player is a trainer in large and famous agility school with the goal to fill as many training groups as fast as possible.

During player's turn he/she can perform following activities (in order listed below):

1) Fill one training group
2) Select one action from following list:

- Make a personal offer
- Retrieve dogs from common waiting list
- Close the training group
- Pass – do nothing

Game ends after one player has filled 3 training groups. All players count their victory points from filled training groups, player with the most points will be the winner.

Components:
18 training group cards (with 2, 4 or 6 points - 6 each card)
64 dogs cards (8 different breeds - 8 each card)

name: Daytrader: A Financial Board Game
description:
DayTrader is a financial board game that brings you the thrills and chills of investing in the stock market. This is your chance to become a fast thinking, investment-savvy day trader; but first... get a job!

Work at the companies on the board to scrape together some cash so you can make trades in the companies you work for. The more employees a company has, the higher the company's stock price.

Buy a company's stock when it's priced low and sell it when it's high to maximize your gains and create greater wealth. When you have enough cash to retire be the first to get to the bank before the volatile market sets you back. If you can do that, you win!

Bring the trading floor to your dining room table with Daytrader!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: LEGO Chima CHI Battles
description:
Set in the world of LEGO's Legends of Chima theme, the CHI Battles game system involves racing two LEGO vehicles — called "speedorz" — against one another to score "chi." If you win the dexterity part of a round, you then draw a card and select the attribute to use for attack. You can optionally spend one chi to add a sum to your score. Your competitor compares their score to yours and the winner claims two chi. The first player to reach six chi wins.

Different LEGO kits add different characters to the system, with their own speedorz, sets of character cards, and different buildable dexterity challenges.

name: Bad Neighbors
description:
In Bad Neighbors, the goal is to kill all of your neighbors by inflicting various monsters on them, including zombies, vampires, aliens, and demons. Unfortunately, the neighbors are often prepared with weapons (including shotguns, holy water, machetes, stakes, and more). The game's art is humorous, parodying pop-horror icons from TV and movies (e.g. Buffy, Star Trek, Dawn of the Dead, etc).

Game-play: On your turn, you can attack any other player with a monster card. If the defending player has a matching weapon, they equip that weapon by placing it under a living family member card and remain safe. For instance, if you attacked with "hell mutt" (a demon) and they equip "holy water" (an anti-demon weapon), they're safe. Otherwise, the defender must choose one of their family members to perish. Flip that card over, revealing a gravestone.

If you can't or don't attack, you may play an action card or discard to refresh your hand. At the end of your turn, you refill your hand to 4 cards.

There are two ways to win: 1) kill all your neighbors; 2) equip your family with all 4 kinds (suits) of weapon.

name: Roundhouse Kick
description:
It was a plan, as foolproof as it could be for escaping the most secured prison in this country. And it worked – until you decided to rest in an abandoned barn without knowing it was the meeting place for all the nearby villains in their ultimate quest. The battle between you and them was short but fierce. It was a battle with no survivors...only legends.

In Roundhouse Kick, each player is an escaped prisoner who must fight several monsters in an abandoned barn. In each round all players roll the dice and try to kill as many monsters as they can because the monsters are worth points. After the players attack, though, the monsters fight back. The game ends once all the monsters or all the players are dead.

name: ZinZig
description: ZinZig is a wine-themed trivia game designed to both test knowledge and educate players. It requires the addition of two or three bottles of wine for gameplay purposes. Players take turns to roll and move on spaces around the circular board, receiving a wine-related trivia question each turn. A successfully answered question is rewarded with one of the four resources (barrel, grape, bottle, and cork). Some spaces allow for special actions along with the trivia question (including swapping, trading, or stealing resources). A player who has collected all four resources may enter the center of the board, "production," no longer rolling to move but instead progressing through four final stages (crushing, fermenting, aging, and bottling). The first player to complete the production stages is the winner.

name: Zahlen-Mobile
description:
Zahlen-Mobile consists of a set of cards showing "dice mobiles". These consist of a main bar with two additional bars attached. From each of those two bars, two dice hang down, with each of the four dice having a different color. The bars are either straight or slanted left or right.

Each player has a set of dice (one in each color) and a dice cup. Players reveal one card, then simultaneously roll their dice, trying to roll results that would fit the current mobile card. (If all three bars are straight, that would be four of the same number; if the two lower bars are straight, but the top one is slanted to the right, then the two dice hanging from the right side must be higher than the two on the left.)

The first player to roll a "solution" that fits the card gets the card (in a two-player game). With more players, the first player gets two cards and the second one gets one card. After a certain number of rounds, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Goblins: Alternate Realities
description:
In the alternate realities of the Goblins universe, different choices have led to different consequences. Friends have become enemies and mortal adversaries are now trusted allies. Down the different paths of each alternate reality, the iconic characters of Goblins have chosen different classes, found different treasures and joined different parties.

In Goblins: Alternate Realities, you direct a party of characters from the world of Goblins through a series of encounters and challenges to fulfill the individual quests of each of your characters. In each game, each player begins with a different combination of characters in his party and a different deck full of actions that he can perform with his characters. Throughout the game, you have the opportunity to form alliances between your characters and the characters in other parties to claim treasure, gain experience, and fulfill your quests – or if it suits your ends, you can oppose a party and your characters can challenge your enemies to battles of strength, wit, or charm.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Negotiation

name: Matchstix
description:
Matchstix challenges players to assemble matching patterns using "matchstixs". On a players turn they can Turn, move, add, or remove Matchstix trying to match the patterns on their cards. Choose your moves wisely as you only get two per turn -and some of the moves cost a card to do. Score points for each completed card.

There is also a solo puzzle version of the game that can be played.

Box includes
6 Matchstix
48 cards

name: Sense of Identity
description:
‘Sense of Identity’ is a game that provides you with both challenges and laughs in abundance. It generates constant interaction as one minute you will be pitting your intelligence and intuition skills against the rest of the players and in the next you are working with the rest trying to gently outwit the lone player opposite you.

All the players, except one, have to adopt the same characteristic or as we call them traits, which they get from one of the two card deck options. The remaining player has to question each in turn and try to guess what the common trait is from the way in which they respond. For the players that know the trait it produces a great deal of fun and amusement as well as a great deal of satisfaction for the questioner when and if they deduce the trait. Players build up their points to win the game by correctly guessing the trait within the allowed number of rounds.

The game can be played by 3 – 10 players and is suitable for all ages from 12 years and upwards. You can play it either as single players or in teams.

In addition to the full version of the game, we have also devised a ‘Quick-Play’ version which is ideal for more impromptu situations such as travelling.

So, ‘Sense of Identity’ will have families and friends, whether at home, on holiday or even travelling, roaring with laughter!

Sense of Identity
A game you can play anywhere, anytime.

name: Sky Duel 1945
description:
Created in less than a month for the "in a tin" contest.

1-2 player WW2 dogfight card game, scaling from 1 on 1 duel to X amount of squadrons. Oh and from the first person
perspective with 2 sheets of A4. Game time 10-30 mins, will all fit in a baccy size tin.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Free Flight
description:
"Free Flight is a very simple to learn and play, but it can be as intriguing as the player's imagination allows.The game is considered to be a cross between Backgammon and Chess with the added dimension of having three or four players, each using their own ability to combine luck with logic and skill to eliminate the opposition. Since the roll of the dice is involved it assures that each and every game played is totally different than the previous games, creating exciting and unlimited variety."

The die roll determines which pieces move. The six (Free Flight) allows the movement of any piece. The pieces are Omni (Queen), Digon (Bishop), Orthon (Rook), Trax (Pawn). Diaginal taking of pieces, limited movement, and promotion are all part of the game. There are also hazard spaces on the board.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: imagine I Can... Catch a Pirate!
description:
The small games in the imagine I Can... collection of mini-games-in-a-tin are geared at young children 3 and up.

Catch a Pirate! plays 2 to 5. The game contains 27 pirate cards in three colors, a colour die, a pirate die and a pirate die, as well as a wooden pirate captain figure.

After placing the captain in the middle of the table, arrange all 27 pirate cards face up around him to form a square island. Players take turns rolling the three dice. As the dice are rolled, players try to be the first to grab the card or cards that corresponds to the dice roll. If the pirate die shows the pirate captain, players make a grab for the pirate figure. The players that grabs the captain may choose any card of the table, then returns the captain to the center of the table. If the card that corresponds to the dice roll has already been taken for the table, the dice are passed to the next player. Game ends when a player collects 5 cards.

For beginners or very young players, remove the pirate die and wooden captain from play and match cards to the number and colour dice only.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Pirates

name: Monopoly: Only Fools and Horses Edition
description: A version Monopoly themed with the BBC Series, Only Fools and Horses. Travel around the board from series to series, remembering your favourite episodes including Mother Nature’s Son, Yuppy Love, and A Touch of Glass.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Myth: Slaughterfield Supplement Pack
description:
The Myth: Slaughterfield Supplement Pack contains three separate Slaughterfield Decks. These decks can only be used with the Slaughterfield game mode.

The first deck is a 10 card Random Spawn Generator. This allows you to have a completely random game every time. Each session of Slaughterfield consists of 10 waves of terror. The Heroes task is only to survive as long as they can and take as many of them with you as possible. Traps can be turned against the Darkness, but to separate from the rest of the group is certain death.

The second deck is a 15 card Slaughterfield Items deck. These items can only be used in Slaughterfield, but every treasure pick-up is guaranteed to be a good one. This deck greatly increases the survivability past Wave 5.

The third deck is a 15 card Slaughterfield Achievement Deck. This deck contains tasks for the Heroes. These tasks are dealt randomly to each player and are kept secret until turned in for a reward or at the end to supplement victory points awarded for kills and waves survived.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Takuran
description:
Takuran means "Brood Parasite" in Japanese.

Takuran is a game played with 20 illustrated cards. 5 cards can be combined to complete an illustration, and there are 4 sets. The cards are shuffled, and each player receives 5 cards. The players then say how many cards they need to exchange in order to complete their set. The players have to decide who they will exchange their chosen number of cards with. This is done twice.

After the second exchange of cards, the player that completes their set, or has the most complete set, wins.

name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars – Überfall der Droiden
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Jedi have been ambushed by a group of battle droids, and they quickly need to determine which droids to attack first. In Star Wars: The Clone Wars - Überfall der Droiden, the dice determine which enemy is being searched for first among all the droids hiding undercover. Have you found this droid? Then quickly bring an experienced Jedi to defeat the enemy in battle! Whoever first defeats five opponents wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: WWE Trivia Mania
description:
WWE Trivia Mania is a roll and move professional wrestling trivia game for 2 to 4 players. In Trivia Mania, players vie to win 4 different Championship Rings at WrestleMania by answering trivia questions about the wrestlers, events, and history of World Wrestling Entertainment.

On your turn, roll the die, move that many spaces, and answer a question. Certain spaces allow you to win Championship Rings, either from the supply or from other players. First player to win their fourth and final Championship Ring on the WrestleMania space is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Crash
description:
Set Up:
Place the a ring on a flat surface and put a column in each of the recesses. When each recess is occupied place another ring on top and fill in the same way. Alternate the column colours as you complete each ring. Repeat this process until all the columns have been used, you will be left with 4 spare rings.

Game Play:
- The youngest player starts the game, play then continues in a clockwise direction.
- On each go, players throw the coloured die. They then have to remove a column with the same colour as the die, from any ring except the top.
- All removed columns are replaced on the top ring of the tower, when all the recesses to the top ring are full a new ring is added.
- If the topples during a player's turn they are eliminated from the game, the tower is rebuilt and play continues with the remaining players.
- The winner of the game is the last player in play!

Objective:
The object of the game is to be the last player to skilfully remove the columns from the lower levels of the tower to the top, without making the tower topple.

Contents:
11 rings, 60 columns, game die.

name: Finde den Freund
description:
Objective: gain most victory points finding matching cards
- acting by turns -
there are 64 cards with matching qualities regarding: colour (4), animal (4), mood (4); additionally on each card you see a mathematical symbols like (2 arrow; arrow 3..)
8 cards are placed in a circle, hidden. Active player turns one and follows shown symbol e.g. 3 steps to the right, turns appropiate card and follows shown symbol again. If all cards are turned or ending in a vicius cycle player may take up to 3 cards putting them on her/his hand. Matching cards (animal/mood/colour) can be formed and dropped (victory points depending on number and matching items). Handlimit: 5 cards
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Memory

name: Cops & Robbers
description:
Cops & Robbers is a game about stealing loot from the bank (Deck of cards) While you steal loot you need to get away from the cops. The more loot that you steal the more cops you have chasing you. Use dirty tricks to help you get away from the cops and use other dirty tricks to get other caught and sent to the slammer. Make the fastest car that is going to help you escape but beware your other robbers, if your car is too shiny they may want to steal it themselves.

The game is played in turns with players selecting loot and other cards to ensure they have the best chance of getting away and pulling nasty tricks on others, but when a player is trying to get away other players can affect whether the player makes a clean getaway during their turn.

There are 3 decks in the game. The Cop deck, which shows how many cops are chasing you. The Loot deck which is basically your score in the game. The Robber deck which is the main deck that helps you get away, stop others getting away and lets you pull dirty tricks on others.

name: Yoga Spinner
description:
Time to strengthen the body and stimulate the mind with the Yoga Spinner! This fabulously fun game introduces players to the wonders of yoga, improves posture, enhances coordination, and increases flexibility.

Give the spinner a whirl and let the fun begin! Spin the spinner and try to hold the pose it lands on for ten seconds. If you held the pose (without falling down laughing) you can keep the card! Be the first to collect a card of each color to win – or challenge yourself to complete and collect the cards!

name: Action Waterloo
description:
A two player game played on an 18x24 board. Players each place two 2x6"mountains" on the board and then each place 54 soldiers(25mm plastic figures) on the 3 rows nearest them. Each player secretly selects a restricted set of 5 squares on his opponents rear row.
The winner is the first player to get his own soldiers on all five of these squares.
On his turn a plyer takes a card and follows its instructions. He then rolls two dice, one die number represents the number of units he will move and the other die represnts the number of squares units move. He then moves his units and executes capture by replacement, some decided by die roll.
As far as I can tell all the "Action" A-Toys are the same game on the same board but with different figures.

name: Treasure of the Snake
description:
Treasure of the Snake harkens players to the exotic adventures of Indiana Jones or Romancing the Stone. Players compete or join together to capture the forbidden jewel.

Can you capture the jewel without awakening the snake? Players can either take turns or work as a group to capture the jewel on the snake’s basket. When the snake's eyes glow green players can safely move towards the basket, but when the snake’s eyes glow red everyone must FREEZE!! If the snake senses anyone moving, he will jump out of his basket and you must start over again.


Multiple ways to play, compete against your friends or join up as a team
Capture the jewel without waking up the snake
FREEZE when the snake's eyes turn from green to red
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game
publishers: Fotorama USA, Grandi Giochi, Hutter Trade GmbH + Co KG, Megableu

name: Bijen Race
description:
Bijen Race ('Bee Race') is a small boardgame for children of 5 and up. In this game players need to put their tokens in a specific order that is determined by shaken a beehive.

The beehive is shaken and 6 colored balls fall out. Now players need to put the colored tokens in their possesion in the exact order and push the beehive. First player to do so gets a point. As soon as one player collects 3 points they win the game.

name: Shinobi WAT-AAH!: King Pig promo card
description:
King Pig is a promotional boss for Shinobi WAT-AAH!. His reward alternates positive/negative (+30 / −30 / +60 / −60 / +90 / −90).

Before playing the Grand Master Mode, replace a Boss card of the main game by the King Pig card. The card replaced is shown to all the players and put in the box. Finally, prepare the game as explained in the rules.

name: Marchia Orientalis
description:
In Marchia Orientalis, players get the order to develop the eastern territories (latin "Marchia Orientalis") of King Otto's Empire in the 10th Century.

Starting with one single city tile, they buy farms, fund monasteries, and in the end erect the castles to defend themselves against enemies from inside and outside their territory (mark). To put a new tile to your mark, you buy it from the market. If it is from one of your spaces, you pay the money to the bank; if you buy it out of the track of another player, you pay the price to him. The tile may be put to your mark only if you have matching trading symbols on both tiles (supply chain monastery/farm-village-city-castle). If a tile has neighbors all around, you get the according victory points.

As an alternative, you can choose to draw two new tiles from the pile and offer them in your track of the market. Since you are not allowed to buy tiles in such turn, you must decide whether to make them expensive and hope that you can afford them on your next turn — or to make them cheap and take the risk that others buy them before you have the chance to do so.

Final scoring includes bonus points for most tiles of each type of building and money as well as non-finished buildings (half the value).

name: Guspira, el joc dels correfocs
description:
Guspira is a funny, quick and suitable board game for all ages, inspired on the world of fire, devils, beasts and everything related to a ‘correfoc’, one of the most gorgeous and spectacular fests of the Catalan culture. Among the game cards there are some characteristic elements of this celebration as ‘Drac’, ‘Víbria’, ‘Guita’, Devils or ‘Tabalers’, without forgetting ‘correfocaires’, brave people who jump and dance under the fire.

The main objective is to win the maximum number of ‘correfocaires’ playing the pyrotechnic cards from the hand. But it is not always as easy as it seems to be, the dice has also its role…

Besides the playful side, Guspira is expected to be a way of promotion for the Catalan culture. The cards show the most characteristic elements of this celebration and they have no text in order to be played anywhere in the world.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Civility: 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
Clones?! Cthulhu?! ZOMBIES!?! These 3 new cities are here to vie for their places in the new world… and to eat some brains. Choose between a malevolent being, power-hungry schemers, and a flesh-addicted horde of monsters in this 5 to 6 player expansion to Civility!

Cthulhu City manipulates the world, cards, and events; Clone City will take advantage of other city’s powers while exploiting weaknesses; and Zombie City starts out intimidating and dominating but will rot away to nothing if resources are not properly managed. Bring new dynamics and strategy to Civility with this expansion that includes everything needed to play 5 and 6 player games when added to the base game.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Fox Trott': La Guerre des Oeufs
description: Protect your chicken coop by throwing eggs at the fox. If you hit him, he moves closer to your opponent's coop. When the fox reaches one of the coops(the far right or the far left end), the player loses a point. The player who first loses 5 points loses the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Real-time
publishers: Asmodee, Granna, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Logo Grab
description:
Logo Grab is a very different game from the usual brand heavy trivia associated with The Logo Board Game Family.

Instead players are competing to pick up logo cards from a grid which match the dice rolled. Players are collecting sets of cards. The dice grabbing adds an element of speed and dexterity, but players must beware, some of the dice contain bells and if you grab a bell die you do not get to keep the card you just claimed!

name: Die Welt: Wetten, da liegt Manhattan!
description:
Die Welt: Wetten, da liegt Manhatten! features gameplay similar to Die Welt: Singapur, wo liegt das nur? (which is derived from Deutschland: Finden Sie Minden), with players trying to locate places or landmarks on a world map.

To set up, players lay out game boards that feature land masses with no names on them. On a turn, players are confronted with a location, such as Timbuktu or Medina, then they all try to guess where in the world that location is. They can play it safe and choose a large block of land – scoring only a few points in the process if correct – or they can go small and pinpoint the location more precisely on one of the game boards, scoring far more points if correct, but upping their chances of scoring nothing if they miss their mark. In the end, whoever scores the most points wins.

Die Welt: Wetten, da liegt Manhatten! is playable as a standalone game or the ninety locations included in the box can be used with the Die Welt: Singapur, wo liegt das nur? base game.

name: Trzęsienie Danych
description:
Game is about learning how to safety use computer and handle your digital data and personal information.
Players spent "time" to buy available cards that can be used to handle specific bad events.
Example of cards that can be bought:
"Secure Connection"
"Encrypted Emails"
"Privacy settings"
Example of bad events:
"Data leak"
"Stalker"

Good cards help prepare for bad events that will damage players. Player who received the least damage wins the game.

9292 is a card game for 2 to 4 players. You are are a novice cook, who finished the race that more food. Each player uses the dice and cook cards, then select the "make dishes card" to embellish one by one, alternating clockwise roll the dice.

The eyes of the dice representing the fire temperature, because each player turns plus the value rolled the dice continue, as the game progresses the fire temperature is getting higher.

Each card has its cooking dishes needed for completion [temperature] is expressed as a number, (the center of the card number), and the sum of the roll out [Fire Temperature dice, if the number of matching food card, completed its cuisine will be the.

The player rolls the dice so snugly to the number listed on the card can be obtained as a score card that dish, but if the sum of the dice eyes of fire temperatures exceeding written in cooking card, the food is discarded, and the other negative will have to take a penalty.

he game basically ends in the fifth round. Playtime is around about 30 minutes to about 20 minutes. After five rounds of fine cooking all the points in the lower-right corner of each card are counted. Charred food (upside down when imported shown) by calculating the minus 1 point per sheet of subtract points from the finished dish. The biggest sum determines the winner of the game.

name: Pass auf, kleine Krabbe
description: A sandy game for 2 to 4 players aged 4 years and up. Children love sand and enjoy playing with it. They fill their sand moulds and build the loveliest sand figures. So, why wait ages for the next holiday or moan about the rain? After all, there's this super sand game for at home! In Pass auf, kleine Krabbe you have to fill the sand moulds with sand and cleverly place the sand figures onto the game board. However, you have to think carefully about where you build: because the waves wash everything away that is too close to the water! The game ends as soon as all spaces have been covered by sand figures or waves. Now you have to count up, who has the most sand figures on the game board. The player with the most is the winner.

name: Monopoly: Adelaide
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Adelaide, Australia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: SUPER ABDUCTION
description: SUPER ABDUCTION is a solitaire card game in which the alien player tries to use their UFOs to capture as many cattle as possible.

name: 桜 (Sakura)
description:
Players in 桜 (Sakura) want to empty their hand of cards before anyone else. Each player starts with 7-10 cards, and the sakura petal-shaped cards come in four suits with three types of special cards.

On a turn, you can play one card to the table to start a new bloom (with up to three blooms being in play at once), add one or more matching cards to an existing bloom (with no more than five cards in the bloom), play a special card, or (if you can't play anything) discard one card, then draw one. If you place the fifth card in a bloom, remove those cards, then play one standard card to start a new bloom.

The first player to empty their hand of cards wins!

In the advanced game, continue play until two players have emptied their hands, with the first player scoring 2 points and the second player 1 point. Play multiple rounds, and the player who first has 5 points wins!

name: BANE
description:
In the near-distant future, after years of war and famine, a global pandemic kills most of the world’s population. Those that survive are transformed by the virus, unlocking a latent genetic code. Now, the world is ruled by the three original species of planet earth: Vampires, Werewolves and super Humans.

BANE is a three-suited competitive card game, where the suits represent powerful races (humans, vampires and werewolves), each hunting another, locked in a conflict for dominance. The Order of Prey (who hunts who) is similar to rock-paper-scissors:

Humans hunt Werewolves
Werewolves hunt Vampires
Vampires hunt Humans


Cards are played to a board in what is called an engagement. Similar to a trick-taking game, once all players put a card into play one winner is determined using the Order of Prey (described above). Cards also have a ranking, called Speed. Unlike other trick-taking games (such as Spades) a player may not play a card whose speed matches that of a card already in play - thus allowing players to 'speed block' other players. There are eight speeds, represented by numbers in the upper-left corner of each card.

Example: After all cards are played during an engagement, Bob sees that his Pack Alpha (Werewolf, Speed 1) is the fastest. He will thus be able to take a trophy from another player, as long as there is a Vampire in play (because Werewolves hunt Vampires).

Taking a trophy means that the player may choose from a pool of face-down cards in front of another player.

The round (Hunt) ends when one player is out of cards or trophies. At that time, the deck is shuffled and a new Hunt (round) begins.

WINNING THE GAME:
Each player tracks their individual score. A Player wins by reaching the MASTERY space on the score track and having more trophies than opponents also in the MASTERY space.

There are other elements to the game that add flavor (Special Power cards, a BANE token).

name: The Mazins
description:
The Mazin family is traveling in an exciting city to see and do marvellous things. Your job is to help family members find attractions around town to win trophies.

In The Mazins, place at least one city tile in between the family members and the actions. This way, you create a labyrinth. Every family member is connection with one sight-seeing object – but with which one? Role a die to see which family member wants to travel. The first one who takes the right sight-seeing object marker gets a coin, and the first player with five coins wins.

name: Elemental Conflux
description:
Elemental Conflux is a game of dueling elements.

Each player summons elemental creatures to the battlefield to fight for dominance over five elemental nodes. Players create five stacks of creatures that will do battle, with the highest strength totals winning the battle.

Spells and certain powerful entities will make combat interesting and exciting. Summoners conjure additional creatures to their stack, Elemental Lords reduce the strength of the opposing elements' stacks, mighty dragons win no matter how many creatures oppose it (but can be thwarted by a wish from a Djinn) and cunning Wizards will very literally mix things up!

Cast spells to turn the tide of battle. Fires of destruction might rain down, eliminating cards from your opponent's stack, a divination will allow you to peak at your opponents stack before battle is resolved, or a mighty whirlwind might scatter creatures into each others stacks.

Battles commence, and the player with at least three out of five winning stacks takes control of one of five Elemental nodes. The player who takes control of at least three out of five elemental nodes wins the game.

name: Pyrkon: Atak Koziołaków!
description:
Pyrkon: Atak Koziołaków is a modified version of the Mafia, enriching the game with a lot of interesting characters that have a genuine skills.
The action takes place at Multigenre Fan Convention Pyrkon.

name: Die Post ist da
description:
Description from the publisher:

Every day, Mailman Marty has loads of packages to deliver. Sometimes he's not very careful and he makes a mistake. Luckily, Marty has helpful children to make sure all the packages arrive at the right address.

In Die Post ist da, the children need to look very closely in order to recognize the colors and objects, matching them correctly. Each turn, a player receives a package card. He has to select a room to deliver the package to (the correct room is the one with the matching colour). After the player has delivered the package, he can verify if he has selected the correct room by flipping the card: on the back is a picture of an object - if that object is also depicted in the room, the package has been correctly delivered.

The game ends in a (shared) victory when all packages have been delivered.

name: Name That...! Person, Place, Thing...
description:
Name That...! Person, Place, Thing... is a quick thinking name game. Play individually or in teams.

Roll the dice in the dice unit, and write answers in the category shown in the center die that start with each of the letters shown on the outer dice. Only unique answers score points. Multiple word answers starting with the same letter score extra points.

36 categories on 3 category dice, plus 6 letter dice.

Note: This is not the same as Name That...! Person, Place, Thing..., even though it has the same name, and was published in the same year, by the same publisher.

name: Het grote kat en hond spel
description:
In this game, the cats and dogs of the neighbourhood are trying to get home again from their nightly adventures. On your way home, you'll find obstacles like trash cans, traffic lights, ambulances and more. Sometimes you land on a question mark. A question (about cats and dogs) is asked and if you answer correctly, you get to move again!

The game was given away as promo item with Felix, Bonzo and Miauw cat/dog food in The Netherlands.

name: Ukraine (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Crossing borders require extra attention.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.

Ця карта є неофіційним вентилятора зробив розширення. Знаки і графіка Copyright © 2004-2015 Дні Wonder, Inc. Вироблено з дозволу Дні Wonder, тільки для некомерційного використання.

Це випливає принципам основного квитка їздити гру на спеціальній дошці за допомогою спеціальних карт і правил. Об'єкт гри полягає в тому, щоб отримати якомога більше очок, подорожуючи різні маршрути і перехитрити інших гравців. Вам знадобиться поїзд частин і поїзд карти або з базових ігр США чи Європи (або ви можете купити їх від днів Wonder магазині. Ви можете використовувати станції, якщо ви хочете.

Існує додатковий набір карт шанс: деякі для міст, кожен зі значенням, які будуть зароблені, відвідуючи це місто: інші дають вам додаткові зручності, щоб завершити свої квитки. Ці карти здаються / взяв Alongwith квитків в тій же кількості і з тими ж "тримають / розпоряджатися« правил. Перетинаючи кордони вимагає додаткових attention.There також до 9 бонусів для кінця-гри забив.

Плата не має яких-небудь сірих доріжок або паралельні доріжки, хоча є обмежені виборчі варіанти їх.

Є багато нових опцій в правилах: обмін всі карти на початку, але зберегти все нові: відкинути 5 карт і забрати 5 нових, а своєї черги: заробити подвійні або потрійні точки: і багато іншого. Ви також можете зателефонувати час, коли ваш вагон складі досягає 3, якщо ви хочете, даючи вам перевагу зупинки інших гравців комплектуючі квитки.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Ancient Greece (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Crossing borders require extra attention.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - parallel routes are in the hands of the Gods. Thus there are God cards and if you visit Delphi you must consult the Oracle!

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Turkey (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Crossing borders require extra attention.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring. Anti-terrorist device cards are needed to travel to Syria and Iraq!

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.


Bu harita resmi olmayan bir fan genişleme yapılmış. Wonder Semboller ve Grafik Copyright © 2004-2015 Gün, Inc. sadece ticari olmayan kullanım için Wonder Günleri izni ile üretilmiştir.

Bu özel kartları ve kuralları ile özel bir gemide oyun Ride temel Bilet ilkelerini izler. Oyunun amacı, çeşitli yolları seyahat ve diğer oyuncular outwitting tarafından en çok puan elde etmektir. Ya ABD ya da Avrupa baz oyunları tren parçaları ve tren kartları ihtiyacınız olacak (veya Wonder dükkandan Günleri onları satın alabilirsiniz. İsterseniz istasyonları kullanabilirsiniz.

Bazı değerine sahip her o kenti ziyaret ederek elde edeceği, şehirler içindir: Başkalarının size bilet tamamlamak için ekstra imkanlar vermek Şans kartları ekstra seti vardır. Bu kartlar dağıtılır / aynı miktarda ve aynı 'tutmak / atma' kuralları ile bilet alongwith toplanır. Geçiş sınırları ekstra attention.There yukarı-sonu oyun puanlama için 9 ikramiye de vardır gerektirir. Anti-terör cihaz kartları Suriye ve Irak'a seyahat için gerekli!

Bu sınırlı seçici seçenekleri olsa pansiyon, herhangi bir gri parça veya paralel parça yoktur.

Kurallara birçok yeni seçenek vardır: başında tüm kartları alışverişinde ama tüm yenilerini tutmak: 5 kartları atmak ve 5 yenilerini almak, sizde olduğu gibi: ikili ya da üçlü puan kazanmak: ve çok daha fazlası. Eğer isterseniz vagon stoku size bilet tamamlayarak diğer oyuncuları durdurma avantajı vererek, 3 ulaştığında da zaman çağırabilirsiniz.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Jobs
description: Jobs is a betting game that includes eighty dream jobs.

name: BrainSpin
description:
Do you see a brain...
...or a hamburger bun? Quickly start a laughter-filled conversation and get to know folks with this simple card game! Your friends' brains will delight you as the simple shapes on the cards inspire vastly different interpretations.

Instructions
To play, place a card face up on the table. Use a timer to count down a minute as players write lists of all the things they see in the image. A square, for example, becomes sugar cube, a yawning robot’s mouth, and the plan view of an elevator shaft. Repeat for three cards. Players then compare lists and earn points for each unique interpretation.

Uses
BrainSpin is more than just a fun card game. It's great for

a non-campy icebreaker
teaching empathy
encouraging visual thinking
teambuilding
showing the power of collaboration
building a design thinking mindset

name: Play-Doh Monster Smash Game
description:
A space ship full of hungry space monsters are invading your house to steal your food! Work together as a team to squish and smush the little creatures before they reach the fridge! The goofy monsters are molded from the colorful Play-Doh and players use a silly sneaker or boot smasher to mash them. Itès giggly, squishy fun!

In Monster Smash, players mold as many monsters out of Play-Doh as they wish. They will place a monster at each of the flying saucer spaces on the board. Once a piece is moved, they replace it with another monster. To move pieces, players use a spinner and depending on what color it lands on, they move that colored monster to the next space on the board. If the player spins a smush or a double smush, they get to smush monsters on the board and remove them from the game. If players eliminate all of the monsters from the game, they win. If any three monsters reach the fridge space on the board, you lose!

name: SK8 Pro
description:
Welcome to the Intergalactic Skateboard Championship!
Competitors from various ghettos around the universe are gathering in the radical lanes of Drop Flip Zone.
Are you prepared to skateboard in the universe?

Sk8 Pro is a cardgame with dice. In the game, each player will have to be the most radical skater of the universe, trying to carry out their maneuvers and accumulate victories in a thrilling tournament. But be careful! Not everyone plays fair in this competition.

The game is about choose the right moves at the right time that may (or may not) be made by the skater using the dice result, choosing the best sponsorship and style, and the best time to disrupt your opponents.

Wins the game the player who accumulate three wins first.


O campeonato intergalático de skate esta começando!
Competidores de vários guetos do universo estão se reunindo nas pistas radicais em Drop Flip Zone.
Você esta preparado para encara o mundo do skate interestelar?

Sk8 Pro é um jogo de cartas e dados onde cada jogador terá que ser o skatista mais radical do universo, tentando realizar suas manobras e acumular vitórias num torneio empolgante. Mas cuidado! Nem todo mundo joga limpo nesta competição.

O jogo consiste em escolher as manobras certas no momento certo que poderão (ou não) ser realizadas, a partir da rolagem de dados, escolher o melhor patrocínio e a melhor hora de atrapalhar seus oponentes.

Vence o jogador que acumular três vitórias primeiro.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Last Earth
description:
User summary
In the game Last Earth, the planet Earth has been ruled by gorillas, and the humans preserve their positions as gorillas' slaves.

One day, dolphin-like aliens invade the Earth. The Humans have to choose their way. Do they continue to be slaves of gorillas, or welcome dolphins as new rulers? Which would you do?

Publisher's summary
ゴリラに支配された世界。人類は奴隷として生き延びていた。
ある日の事、そんな地球へイルカの姿をした宇宙人が攻めてきた。
人類はゴリラの奴隷として生きる道を選ぶのか、それとも
新たな支配者としてイルカを選ぶのか、
あなたならどちらにつく？

name: Same One!
description:
In the basic rules of Same One!, you're trying to dump your cards as quickly as you can, and whoever goes out first wins. The deck consists of 90 cards, numbered 1-30 in three colors. Cards 1-15 have up arrows while 16-30 have down arrows, and the most recent card played dictates whether the next card must be higher or lower. If you have more than one card of the same number, you can play them together. If you can't play a card, you draw a card, then play it if possible.

The rules for Same One! include four variants, and you can use one or more of them as you choose. In the simplest, you can't go out with a shark card (i.e. #13-18) on your final turn. Another variant requires that you match the color of the card last played, with sets of more than one number allowing you to change the required color.

Another variant has you playing multiple rounds and tracking the points won or lost by each player. When someone goes out, each other player loses as many points as the number of cards still in their hand while the one who went out gains points equal to the sum of points lost that round. If a player goes out with a 1 (the dog), then each player loses 10 points and that player wins 10 points per opponent.

With the final variant, if you have a number in hand that matches the number most recently played, you can play that card out of turn. This clears the pile, then you can play whichever card you want to start a new discard pile.

name: The Greedy Sheep
description:
It’s The Greedy Sheep game… when he bleats, he wants to eat!

This little sheep loves carrots and wants to gobble them all up. Push his head down to take a bite and hear him much and chomp!

Feed him carrots, until he bleats, then it’s time to pass to the next player for their turn.

Keep feeding and passing, but watch out, when his tummy’s full The Greedy Sheep finally goes BAA BAA BOOM and his fleece flies off!

The winner is the player with the least carrots remaining.

name: Dicedoku
description:
Dicedoku is a small game you can even print it on business card.
Each player take a sheet with 6x6 grid.
Each turn,roll a die to decide a tetris shape and roll 4 dice to decide 4 numbers(if 3 or more dice are same number,reroll them).Each player then need to fill in their 6x6 grid using these 4 numbers and this shape.Shape can be rotated or flipped.Shape can overlap on exist numbers or outside of 6x6 grid,then these overlap or outside positions dont need to be write number(old number stay).
The object is,like Sudoku, make as many rows,columns and 3x2 blocks contain all digits of 1~6 as possible.
First player complete a row, a column or a block contain 1~6 will get 3 points of bonus.
At the end of game, each complete rows, columns and blocks give player 3 points.
Each empty space is -1 point.
Player with most points wins!

name: Ley de la graveedad
description:
The game more fun with friends.

Dilemmas related to FRIENDSHIP LIVE, LOVE, THE COUPLE, SEX ... created by psychologists.

Where everybody answer for everyone!

You have to play with friends to pose ...
WHAT DO YOU THINK THAT WOULD MAKE ME IN THIS SITUATION? ...

If I propose sex in public places ?, Do you think you dare?

Would you consider infidelity Cybersex?

Do you think you would be able to dye my hair green a crazy night?

And you'd know WHAT WOULD YOUR FRIENDS? ...

DILEMAS REALES relacionados con LA AMISTAD, EL AMOR, LA PAREJA, EL SEXO...creados por Psicólogos.

Donde ¡ Todos contestan por todos !

Jugando tendréis que plantearos con los amigos...
¿QUÉ CREÉIS QUE HARÍA YO EN ESTA SITUACIÓN?...

¿Si me propusieran sexo en lugares públicos?, ¿Creéis que me atrevería?

¿Consideraría una infidelidad el Cibersexo?

¿Creéis que sería capaz de teñirme el pelo de verde una noche loca?

¿Y TÚ SABRIAS LO QUE HARÍAN TUS AMIGOS?...

name: Arrass
description:
In Arrass, players quickly count how many parts of the parrot are the same on two revealed cards, then lay the appropriate number card down on the table as quickly as possible. The quickest player to lay down the right number card is awarded points, and the player with the most points wins.

Arrass includes rule variants allowing for players as young as four to compete.

name: Glory Gears
description:
Glory Gears is a historically accurate strategy game where 2 to 8 players control a race team of four riders and compete to be the first team to finish in a single or a series of races. The game is inspired by Oscar Winning Movie, 'Breaking Away's' Little 500 Bicycle Race at Indiana University and created by Cutters Little 500 Champion Alex Bishop.

Glory Gears is an action packed, fast paced cycling strategy game with dynamic movement mechanics offering the most realistic gaming experience possible. Besides a game that is incredibly historically accurate and movements that are mathematically correct, Glory Gears offers an amazingly fun play dynamic that evolves as players secretly choose to help others at times while other times breaking their friendships, alliances, and trust as the race draws closer to the end. Added rules let you battle through wrecks, mechanicals, and secret team strategies while you create friends and foes racing your team of 4 riders around the track. However, as the checker flag approaches, there can only be one Glory Gears Champion!

Glory Gears has a multitude of optional rules and ways to play to ensure your gaming experience can be tailored to your liking. Everything from, rider stamina reductions, wrecks, dropping exchanges, mechanicals, playing out secret historical team strategies based off how specific teams won in certain years, to even playing out the entire spring race series events like in real life before the Little 500 event. Players can choose to play out a historically accurate Qualifications run(great for 1 to 8 players), an Individual Time Trial(great for 1 to 8 players), and a Team Pursuit which involves all 4 riders of a team on the track racing against another at the same time (great 2 person game), or a fan and tournament favorite of the race series Miss N' Out, which states the last rider of each lap is eliminated until there is only one left! (great big group game)

More info can be found at www.mindmeltgames.com . Glory Gears just became available April 21st 2017!

Here is a link to the full rules/ game play suggestions and how to video. http://www.mindmeltgames.com/how-torules.html
Here is the page page info found on the how to section of www.mindmeltgames.com

GLORY GEARS RULES AND GAME PLAY SUGGESTIONS - (FROM THE HOW TO SECTION OF WWW.MINDMELTGAMES.COM)

ROOKIES

TO MAXIMIZE YOUR GLORY GEARS ENJOYMENT AND PROPER SKILL BUILDING AS YOU RACE YOUR WAY TO VICTORY, WE RECOMMEND THE FOLLOWING RACE FORMATS AND RULES TO CERTAIN LEVELS OF PLAYERS.......THIS IS A GREAT PLACE TO START FOR BEGINNERS OR THOSE LOOKING FOR MAXIMUM FUN WITH THE BIGGEST GROUP OR THE SMALLEST GROUP OF PEOPLE IN THE SHORTEST AMOUNT OF TIME......

RACES SUITABLE
1. MISS N OUT -location in manual 9.7/complexity level 3/learn time 1 min/play time 10-60mins


this is the best race to learn the fundamentals and strategies of movement, pack dynamics, and stamina usage.
this race is also the best for tournaments, and larger groups who want a strategic, intense, fun game in under an hour


2. INDIVIDUAL TIME TRIAL- location in manual 9.9/complexity level 1/learn time 1 min/play time 10 mins


this is a great race to learn the fundamentals of the importance of pedal card order usage
this race also represents the most basic 2 person game in glory gears, however more can play just not at the same time


3. QUALIFICATIONS - location in manual 9.6/complexity 2/learn time 1 min/play time 5 mins per player


this is a great race to learn the fundamentals of fast efficient pitting and exchanging of team riders
this is a 1 rider on the track at a time game


4. TEAM PURSUIT- location in manual 9.8/complexity 3/learn time 1 min/play time 15mins


this is a great race to learn the fundamentals of strategic, efficient usage of pace movement cards, stamina usage, and strategic order of rider movement
this race represents the most strategic 2 person race in glory gears


5. GLORY GEARS RACE- location in manual 1.0-6.0/complexity 6/learn time 5 mins/play time 20-120mins


this is the traditional format for glory gears. This race is the culmination of all 4 skill sets learned in the 4 previous racing formats.
this race also includes a new 5th skill set of team strategy cards.


SEASONED RACERS

These races and rules are geared toward the more race hardened experienced players. players can start here if they wish, but will find themselves learning a lot each race from all the intricacies and fundamentals of racing and play not gained from the other easier formats. However, some champions are just born, and may do fine here.....

6. GLORY GEARS RACE +DROPPED EXCHANGES- location in manual 6.0/complexity 7/learn time 5 mins/play time 20-120mins


this race is everything of the previous glory gears race with the added ability to drop or botched the exchange of riders in the pit


7. GLORY GEARS RACE W/DROPPED EXCHANGES +MECHANICALS- location in manual 9.5/complexity 8/learn time 5 mins/play time 30-150mins


this race is everything of the previous glory gears race with the added ability to suffer a bike mechanical each lap of the 10 lap race.


8. GLORY GEARS RACE W/DROPPED EXCHANGES, MECHANICALS & WRECKS- location in manual 7.0/complexity 9/learn time 5 mins/play time 30-180mins


this introduces wrecks, the most game changing and time expending rule
this race represents the most realistic and complex of the glory gears race formats
this race is great for those die hard racing and gaming fans, who don't mind a longer game with more steps per turn


ALL STAR RIDERS

This race format is designed for the true die hard racers and those players looking for the most ultimate epic racing experience!

9. THE COMPLETE GLORY GEARS RACE SERIES-location in manual 10.0/complexity 10/learn time 10 mins/play time 3hrs-6hrs


this race format is the complete game in one big race series
players race qualifications, individual time trials, miss n out, team pursuit and finally the glory gears race with all rules
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Circo Delfino
description: In Circo Delfino, players want to find the right combinations of colored dolphins as quickly as possible — sometimes even combining primary-colored dolphins to make secondary-colored ones! — in order to collect more cards than anyone else.

name: Humanity Hates Trump: Expansion One
description:
Description from the publisher:

Humanity Hates Trump: Expansion One is an unofficial expansion pack to other Party Games including Cards Against Humanity and the Humanity Hates Trump Base Set.

This set includes 110 cards (80 White Cards, 30 Black Cards) and 1 Ultimate Trump Card.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political

name: Disney Junior Doc McStuffins Mix Up! Fix Up!
description:
The use-your-smarts guessing game!
Can you cure the mystery boo-boo like Doc McStuffins? Use deduction to figure out what will help Lambie, Stuffy, Chilly, and friends feel all better! Collect the most bandages to win. Put your problem solving skills to the test with this clever guessing game!

The 'patient' picks an X-Ray card and places it in the sleeve to determine the hidden X-Ray picture for the round. The 'Doctor' spins the spinner. Depending on the result the doctor asks a yes or no question about the pictures characteristics (color, pattern, or object type). Based on the answer, the doctor covers up results on the diagnostic board. If the patient spins a bandage the doctor gets a bandage token. After asking a question the doctor may make a guess at what the x-ray pictures is. If they are correct, they get a bandage token. If they are wrong, the doctor gets a bandage token and the roles switch for the next round. When all players have been the patient once, the game ends. The player with the most bandage tokens wins!

name: Disney Junior Mickey and the Roadster Racers Bump 'N' Race Action Game
description:
Ramp up for adventure with Mickey, Minnie, Donald and Goofy for a high-speed race through Hot Dog Hills! You can change the course to your advantage, but be prepared, the race can start at any time! The gravity-powered Rolling Roadsters will Bump and spin past obstacles during each round. The Racer that collects the most trophies after a set wins!

Players who's car can get through the hole at the end of the race track gets a gold cup worth 2 points. A player who's car lands on the parking spot with the blimp gets a silver cup worth 1 point.

name: Space X
description:
Since Neil A. Armstrong conquered the moon, Man has consistently struggled to explore other planets. After numerous studies, the technology has been developed to move to the Mars. Before moving to there, We should select only one person who goes to the planet. For being a first immigrant, we should put our resources to the Worm hole earlier than a person. The player who completes the mission first gets a chance to participate “Space-X” project.

Space X is a board game for playing pocket ball with fingers.
Set the Attack Point randomly and flick the batting piece to the playing pieces on a hexagonal plastic board(636mm x 550mm). If the playing piece enters the worm-hole, pick it up and continue the game to collect targeted resources. The winner is the one who collects all target pieces. Depending on how to collect 5 colored pieces, there are three ways to play this game.

name: Wirtschafts DKT Österreich
description:
DKT, "Das kaufämnnische Talent", is an Austrian pendant for the well-known Monopoly. This version is very similar to "Österreich DKT".
The goal is to get the most money.
Instead of hotels, you can buy Austrian companies in this version of the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Microbz
description:
Alert, attack Microbz! Hurrry, crush them before they spread! Each turn, roll the dice and tap on the corresponding Microbz card to get it. Then lay it in front of you. If the requested card is already in front of an opponent, prick it before he protects it. If the requested card is not present on the table, tap on the deck. The one with the most cards in front of him when the deck is empty, will win the game.
There are 6 different Microbz, each represented 1 time on the 2 dice. Each of the 21 Microbz cards represents a different Microbz duo. Therefore, with one roll of dice, it will always match with a single and unique card.

name: Memo Dice
description:
Description from the publisher:

Memo Dice demands the full attention of players right from the start because they must remember which die faces have been hidden underneath the colorful cups.

The game includes nine six-sided dice that show 54 images across their faces with the sides being colored black, blue, or red. The starting player for the round rolls a die, gives everyone a chance to memorize the topmost face, then covers it with a die cup that matches the color of the face. The next player then rolls a die, and so on. As soon as no die cup remains that matches the face of the current die, the current player covers this die with the gold die cup, ending the round.

This player then has the first chance to guess the first die in the line. If correct, the player scores 1 point, then guesses the next die; if wrong, the next player gets to guess. Whoever guesses the die under the gold die cup scores 2 points. Players play multiple rounds until someone reaches a total of 20 points, winning the game.

name: Gallia Cisalpina
description:
Gallia Cisalpina, a tactics game for 2 players from 10 years, is game No. 8 of the series “Die Kleinen Feinen”.
In 396 BC, the Celts set out to conquer the lands south of the Alps, but the Romans are also fighting for supremacy. Defences are set up in a hurry to protect agriculture and ensure the supply of the warriors. But the enemy is also armed.

Only 12 cards form the landscape, on which the enemy troops stand in the form of dice.
In his turn, each player has three opportunities. He is allowed to recruit up to 3 new warriors in his own capital, he can build (or destroy) defences in occupied areas - for this, the corresponding card is reversed and 2 warriors are reduced to pawns – and, of course, he can move the troops and attack the enemy.

The game principle is straightforward and intuitive and also suitable for casual players as an entry-level tactics game.

name: City
description:
The game is 120 cards depicting buildings, people, cars, trains, airport, river, and other city sites.

"The [12] cards with the river are removed from the game [deck] and placed one against another, to form the right-hand edge. The remaining cards are shuffled and each player is dealt 15 cards. Each player places his cards in front of himself openly. The rest of the cards are placed face down in a deck [draw pile] in the middle of the table.

The player on the left of the one who deals [the dealer] starts the game. The opening player places matching cards to the river cards already lying on the table. If he cannot join a card, he takes one from the covered deck [draw pile] and his left-hand neighbor continues. Each player may join all the matching cards he has [during his turn]. Cards can also be put in between the cards already lying on the table, if they match the others on both sides.

The left side has no limit, so with each game a new colorful city can be built.

The winner is the player who finishes first with his cards. He [or she] is the "greater builder". You cannot always join all the cards. If at the end of the game there are still some cards left, the player with the fewest cards left wins."

The game was co-published by "Spil og Lær", Danish for "Play and Learn".
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, City Building, Educational

name: Team Wordz
description:
Which team has the biggest vocabulary and can find the most words for each category in Team Wordz?

Both team players place their points tablets face-down on that round's categories. Roll the letter-dice: which team can think up two words for each category in 60 seconds? The time is up and the points tablets are revealed; the more categories there are with two dice on them, the more points you get. Whoever has the most points at the end wins.

name: Shuffle Operation
description:
What kind of Surgeon will you be? collect all the skill cards needed or push your luck and hope you don’t get buzzed! get the free app on the Shuffle website to double the fun: use the unique x-ray card included to search for and zap hidden Germ bugs.

-Collect all the skill cards needed to push your luck and hope you don't get buzzed!
-Card game version of the classic family game
-First to collect 10 stars wins
-X ray Card and Free App included

In their turns players:
-draw cards up to 5 in hand
-play skill cards to collect Operation card with stars
-if play less cards or with different symbol than required, they must draw Buzz card to check if his risky move is successful
-if buzzed (red nose or 2 orange noses) next player may complement play with their cards

name: Around the Farm
description: Based on Eric Carle's best-selling book, players spend a fun-filled day Around the Farm helping baby animals find their way home. Help baby pigs locate the pigpen, baby ducks waddle to the pond, baby horses trot to the hayfield, and baby sheep back to their pasture. The game introduces children to counting and identifying baby and adult animals. Counting is especially fun as the players make animal sounds for each animal they move. Everyone wins in this cooperative game when each baby animal has been reunited with its adult animal!
